name: Nitamin

description:
Composition
Each 1 gm contains:
- Colistin (as Colistin sulphate) 500 MIU=16.67 GM

Properties
- Colistin is a polypeptide antibiotic belongs to the class of polymyxins.
- Colistin has a bactericidal action on sensitive bacterial strains, by disorganization of their cytoplasmic membrane, leading to an alteration of cell permeability and thus to a loss of intracellular material.
- Colistin has a bactericidal power against a broad spectrum of Gram-negative bacteria, including enterobacteria and in particular Escherichia coli. Colistin has very little activity against Gram-positive bacteria and fungal organisms.
- Gram-positive bacteria, as well as some species of Gram-negative bacteria such as Proteus and Serratia, are naturally resistant to colistin.
- However, the acquisition of resistance of Gram-negative enteric bacteria to colistin is rare and can be explained by simple mutation.
- Colistin exhibits concentration-dependent activity against Gram-negative bacteria. Following oral administration, high concentrations are observed in the gastrointestinal tract, i.e., the target site, due to the low absorption of the substance.

Indications
- Treatment and metaphylaxis of gastrointestinal infections due to non-invasive colistin-sensitive E. coli.

Target species
Calves, lambs, pigs and chickens

Dosage and Administration
• For calves, lambs and pigs: 2 gm of product (Colistimed 5MIU/gm) / 100 kg body weight daily for 3-7 consecutive days.
• For chickens:
- 1.5 gm of product (Colistimed 5MIU/gm) /10 liter for 3-7consecutive days.
- Duration of treatment should be limited to the minimum time necessary for the treatment of the disease.
- Treatment duration should not exceed 7 days.

Warnings & Precautions
- Colistin exerts concentration-dependent activity against Gram-negative bacteria. Following oral administration high concentrations are achieved in the gastrointestinal tract, i.e. the target site, due to the poor absorption of the substance’ These factors indicate that a longer duration of treatment than the one indicated in dosage section leading to unnecessary exposure is not recommended.

Special warnings
- Do not use colistin as a substitute for good management practices.
- Colistin is a last resort drug in human medicine for treatment of infections caused by certain multi-drug resistant bacteria. ln order to minimize any potential risk associated with widespread use of colistin, its use should be limited to treatment or treatment and metaphylaxis of diseases, and should not be used for prophylaxis.
- Whenever possible, colistin should only be used based on susceptibility testing.
- Use of the product deviating from the instructions given in the insert may lead to treatment failures and increase the prevalence of bacteria resistant to colistin.
- The presence of the disease in the flock must be established before proceeding to metaphylatic treatment.

Contra-Indications
- Do not use in horses, particularly in foals, since colistin, due to a shift in the gastrointestinal microflora balance could lead to the development of antimicrobial associated colitis (Colitis X)m typically associated with clostridium difficile, which may be fatal.

Withdrawal time
• Calves  Meat: 14 days
• Pigs  Meat: 7 days
• Poultry & Lamb
- Meat: 1 day
- Eggs: Zero days
- Not permitted for use in animals producing milk for human consumption

Storage condition
Store at temperature not exceeding 30ºC in a dry place and used after opening for 60 days when stored at temperature not exceeding 30ºC in a dry place and used immediately after reconstitution.

Packaging
LDPE plastic bags inside easy open metal cans containing 25 gm, 50 gm, 100 gm, 150 gm, 200 gm, 250 gm, 500 gm &1 kg powder with all data printed on the metal cans.
name: Colistimed

description:
COMPOSITION
Each ml contains:
- Active vitamin B12 (injectable raw liver, N.F. 2 mcg / ml) eq to Cyanocobalamin   0.2 mcg
- Vitamin C   5 mg
- Vitamin B12  (cyanocobalamin)  500 mcg
- Ferrous citrate (eq to 3.6 mcg iron)  0.02 g
- Panthenol (B5)   3 mg
- Thiamine HCL (B1)   50 mg
- Riboflavin (B2)   0.6 mg
- Pyridoxine HCL (B6)   3 mg
- Niacinamide  (B3)   45 mg
- Choline chlorhydrate   6 mg
- Inositol N.F.  6 mg
- Benzyl alcohol   0.2 %
- Phenol as a preservative   0.5 mg
- Injection grade water q.s   1 ml

SPECIES: Bovines, equines, porcines, ovines, canines, ostriches.

DOSAGE
- Intramuscular or slow intravenous administration.
- Adult bovines and equines: 10 ml
- Porcines and ovines: 3 to 5 ml.
- Calves and colts: 5 ml.
- Canines: 1 ml
- Ostrich chicks 1 day to 3 months old: 0.2 ml to 0.5 ml.
- Ostrich chicks 3 months to 6 months old: 0.6 to 1.5 ml.
- Ostriches (more than 6 months old): 3 ml.
- Twice a week in all cases.

PROPERTIES
• Vitamins are essential components in charge of tissue support. In very small amounts, they act as biocatalysts.
• ANTOPLEX is a polivitaminic complex based on B complex factors, a series of biocatalysts whose physiological action is associated with growth, good skin and antianemic factors.
• It also contains the following hydrosoluble vitamins: thiamine or vitamin B1 (its deficiency produces lack of appetite, gastroenteric function disorders, nervous system conditions and heart conditions) and vitamin C or ascorbic acid, which acts against infections and is beneficial to the actions of other vitamins.
• ANTOPLEX is a very important agent against anemia and chlorosis because it is enriched with ferrous citrate, which is an essential element for the body. Since it is present in red blood cells (hemoglobin), the liver, the spleen and the bone marrow, it serves as a reserve which can be used whenever it is required.
• It must be given to ensure that metabolic functions are maintained during growth. Growth stimulation is achieved through a good diet and the application of ANTOPLEX. It is very useful for a swift recovery after a disease. It combats weakness. ANTOPLEX offers vitality and maximum performance during the competition.

RECOMMENDATIONS
Keep in a dry and cool place. Do not expose to light. Keep out of the reach of children.

PRESENTATION 20, 50 and 100 ml flask.
name: Antoplex

description:
COMPOSITION
Each ml contains:
• Active substance(s):
- Iron (as ammonia citrate)  1.75 mg
- Cyanocobalamin(B12)  0.025 mg
- Nicotinamide(PP*)  20 mg
- Cobalt (as digluconate)  0.0065 mg

*PP stands for pellagra-prevention vitamin aka vitamin B3.

• Excipients
- Benzyl alcohol (E1519)  20.8 mg
- Glycerol
- Water for injections

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
Injectable and drinkable solution.

TARGET SPECIES
Cattle, sheep, goats, horses, pigs, dogs and cats.

INDICATIONS
In cattle, sheep, goats, horses, pigs, dogs and cats: Treatment and prevention of deficiencies in iron, cobalt, vitamin B12 and vitamin PP, particularly during convalescence from debilitating infectious or parasitic diseases, growth disorders, anemia.

CONTRAINDICATIONS
Do not use in case of hypersensitivity to the active substances or any of the excipients.

ADVERSE REACTIONS
Not known.

PREGNANCY, LACTATION OR LAYING
The use of the medication will depend on the assessment of the benefit/risk ratio carried out by the veterinarian.

DRUG INTERACTIONS
None.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
• Intramuscular, subcutaneous and oral routes.
• The administration of the product will be done for 3 to 5 days in a row.
• 0.08 to 0.4 mg of iron, 1 to 5 µg of vitamin B12, 0.8 to 4 mg of vitamin PP and 0.27 to 1.4 µg of cobalt per kg of live weight per day depending on the species, according to the following recommendations:

» Equines and cattle (I.M., S.C. & oral):
- Adults: 20 ml
- Young people: 10 ml

» Sheep and goats (I.M., S.C. & oral routes):
- Adults: 5 ml
- Young people: 1 to 2 ml

» Pigs (I.M., S.C. & oral routes):
- Adults: 10 ml
- at fattening: 5 ml

» Dogs and cats (oral route only): 1 to 2 drops per kg of body weight.

OVERDOSE
Not known.

WITHDRAWAL TIME
» Cattle, sheep, goats, horses:
- Meat and offal: zero days.
- Milk: zero days.

» Pigs:
- Meat and offal: zero days.

PHARMACODYNAMIC PROPERTIES
- The iron provided by ammoniacal iron citrate plays an essential role in oxygen metabolism and energy metabolism.
- Cyanocobalamin (or vitamin B12) is a water-soluble vitamin playing a role in folate metabolism.
- Nicotinamide (or vitamin PP) is also a water-soluble vitamin. This is the active group of two coenzymes which, in conjunction with apoenzymes, intervene at different stages of the degradation or synthesis of carbohydrates, fatty acids and amino acids. This molecule also plays a determining role during the terminal oxidative degradation of substrates in the citric acid cycle, by fixing hydrogen during the terminal phase and transporting it to the flavin enzymes of the respiratory chain.
- Cobalt is a trace element necessary for the activity of the rumen microflora. In ruminants, cobalt is then converted into vitamin B12 which, after absorption, participates in the metabolism of propionic acid, the main source of energy in these animals.

PHARMACOKINETIC PROPERTIES
- The iron provided by ammoniacal iron citrate is absorbed in the duodenum and stored in the intestinal mucosa in the form of ferritin. The liver, spleen, bone marrow and muscles also store part of it.
- Cyanocobalamin (or vitamin B12) is absorbed by the intestinal mucosa. When administered intramuscularly or subcutaneously, peak plasma levels are achieved in less than one hour. Cyanocobalamin is excreted through the bile.
- The absorption of nicotinamide (or vitamin PP) takes place throughout the intestinal wall. It is fast and complete. Distribution occurs rapidly in all tissues. Nicotinamide is transformed into an N-methylated derivative. Urinary elimination occurs in very small quantities in free form and especially in the form of metabolites.
- Cobalt digluconate is poorly absorbed from the digestive tract. The highest concentrations are observed in the liver, adrenal and thyroid. When administered parenterally, 90% of cobalt is eliminated in the urine within 48 hours. After ingestion, elimination is via the feces.

STORAGE PRECAUTIONS
- Store at a temperature not exceeding 25°C.
- Shelf life as packaged: 18 months.
- Shelf life at first opening: 28 days.

DISPOSAL PRECAUTIONS
Empty packaging and any remaining product must be disposed of according to current practices governed by waste regulations.

PACKAGING
Box contains a colored type II glass bottle of 100 ml, chlorobutyl cap aluminum capsule.
name: Fercobsang

description:
Composition
Each 100 ml contains
- Calcium gluconate   23 gm (eq to Ca   2.1 gm)
- Magnesium gluconate   2 gm (eq to Mg  0.12 gm)
- Dextrose   10 gm

Properties
- Calcium is an essential element that is required for normal nerve and musculoskeletal function, cell membrane and capillary permeability and activation of enzymatic reactions. Only free ionized calcium in the blood is biologically active. In case of increased requirement of calcium, e.g. post-partum, hypocalcaemia may develop.
- Magnesium is a cofactor in a number of enzyme systems. It also plays a role in muscular excitement and neurochemical transmission. In the heart magnesium leads to delayed conduction. Magnesium stimulates the secretion of parathyroid hormone and therefore regulates serum calcium levels. In ruminants, especially after intake of protein-rich grass, hypomagnesaemia may develop.
- The product contains calcium is an organic compound and magnesium in form of magnesium gluconate as active substances. By the addition of boric acid, calcium borogluconate is formed, which increases its solubility and tissue tolerability. The addition of magnesium antagonises possible cardiac effects of calcium, especially following overdose or rapid infusion, and helps correct hypomagnesaemia, which frequently occurs in combination with hypocalcaemia.

Indications
- For subcutaneous use in milk fever, and in calcium, magnesium and glucose deficiency in animals

Target species
Horse, cattle, sheep, goat, pig

Dosage instructions
- By S/C injection 1 ml of product / kg bodyweight.
- Cattle & Horse: 250 – 500 ml / head (250 – 500 kg bodyweight).
- Sheep & Goats: 50 – 100 ml / head (50 – 100 kg bodyweight).
- Pigs: 50 – 100 ml / head (50 – 100 kg bodyweight)..

Warnings & Precautions
It should not be used in case of hypersensitivity to any component of the combination.

Contra Indications
- Hypercalcaemia and hypermagnesaemia,
- Idiopathic hypocalcaemia in foals,
- Calcinosis in cattle and small ruminants,
- Septicaemic processes in the course of acute mastitis in cattle,
- Application after high doses of vitamin D3 preparations,
- Chronic renal insufficiency,
- Concomitant or immediately following application of inorganic phosphorous solutions.

Side Effects
Transient hypercalcaemia with the following symptoms may occur:
- Initial bradycardia,
- Restlessness, muscle tremor, salivation,
- Increase in respiratory rate

Storage condition
Store at temperature not exceeding 30ºC.

Packaging
Glass vials: 10, 30 , 50 , 100 , 200 , 250 & 500 ml.
name: Cal-Ma-Dex

description:
Composition:
Every 1 ml contain：
- Calcium gluconate  280 mg
- Magnesium hypophosphite  90 mg
- Boric acid 57.5 mg

Indication:
Cattle, sheep, goats, equidae, pigs, dogs  and cats: preventive and curative treatment of hypocalcemia, hypomagnesia, hypophosphatemia (milk fever, parturient paresis, grass tetany, eclampsia).

Contraindications:
Do not administer to animals with cardiac disorders.

Dosage:
- 12.5 to 25 mg calcium and 26.5 to 52.9 mg magnesium hypophosphite per kg bodyweight per administration, i.e. 0.5 ml to 1 ml per kg bodyweight by slow intravenous, intramuscular and subcutaneous.
- The administration can be renewed, if necessary, every 12 hours for one to two days.

Precautions for use in animals:
- The solution should be warmed to body temperature before administration.
- Intravenous administration should be slow, for example by infusion, and immediately stopped in the event of the appearance of adverse effects.
- During intramuscular or subcutaneous administration, distribute the total dose over several injection sites to limit local reactions.
- The use and reuse of this product must be subject to a benefit/risk assessment according to any previous treatments, in particular those based on calcium.

Side effects:
- When administered intramuscularly or subcutaneously, local tissue reactions at the injection site may be observed.
- Too rapid intravenous administration can cause cardiac arrhythmia and lead to fatal collapse. Symptoms of hypercalcaemia may occur within 30 minutes after administration (tremors, excitement, sweating, hypotonia up to collapse).

Pregnancy and lactation or laying:
- The safety of the specialty has not been evaluated in the target species in the event of pregnancy and lactation. However, the use of the drug during pregnancy and lactation does not cause particular problems.

Withdrawal period: Zero days

Conservation:
- Keep below 25 C
- Use immediately after opening
- Keep out the reach of children

description:

- Sodium hypophosphite monohydrate ... 34.3 mg (eq to 7.4 mg sodium)
- Potassium chloride ... 2 mg (eq to 1.05 mg potassium)
- Dextrose monohydrate ... 250 mg

Properties:
- Canimag-P contains sources of calcium, magnesium, sodium, potassium and dextrose.
- It is a complete therapy for the treatment of simple and complicated cases of parturient paresis and hypomagnesemic tetany in cattle. Calcium and magnesium directly restore cow’s serum levels to avoid muscular and nervous damage. Also, magnesium protects against myocardial irritation caused by calcium administration. Sodium and potassium maintain cell membrane potential and influence nerve transmission and muscle function. Dextrose is a source of energy.

Indications:
For the treatment of simple and complicated cases of parturient paresis ( milk fever ) and hypomagnesemic tetany ( grass tetany ) in cattle.

Dosage and administration:
For I/V and S/C injection only
– 250 – 500 ml Canimag-P per adult cow.
– The solution should be warmed and given slowly ( over 10 – 20 min. )

Warnings:
- Strict asepsis should be applied at injection site.
- Cases of severe toxemia (diffuse peritonitis and coliform mastitis) may die if treatment with calcium and magnesium intravenously.
- Examination of udder and abdomen should be applied before treatment.

Contra-indication:
- Septic toxemia.
- Rapid I/V injection.

Side-effect:
- Calcium injection causes myocardial irritation, pulse should be monitored during therapy and treatment stopped temporarily when increased.

STORAGE:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30ºC and used immediately after opening.

For Veterinary Use Only

Pharma Swede - Egypt
10th of Ramadan City - B3
name: Canimag-P

description:
Composition
Each 100 ml contains:
- Vitamin E (as alpha tocopherol acetate 100%)   15 gm
- Sodium selenite   0.05 gm

Properties
Both vitamin E and selenium are involved with cellular metabolism of sulfur. Vitamin E has antioxidant properties and, with selenium, it protects against red blood cell hemolysis and prevents the action of peroxidase on unsaturated bonds in cell membranes.

Indications
- Pherol-S-Ject is indicated for the treatment or prophylaxis of selenium-tocopherol deficiency (STD) syndromes
- In ewes and lambs (white muscle disease)
- Calves and breeding cows (white muscle disease)
- Horses (myositis associated with STD).

Target species:
Horses, Cattle and Sheep

Dosage instructions
- 1 ml Pherol-S-Ject / 30 kg liveweight once injected may be repeated at weekly intervals if necessary.
• Horses: By intramuscular injection, up to 20 ml Pherol-S- Ject once injected; (Foals: 2 – 5 ml Pherol-S- Ject once injected)
• Cattle: By subcutaneous or intramuscular injection, up to 15 ml Pherol-S- Ject once injected; (Calves: 2 – 5 ml Pherol-S- Ject once injected)
• Sheep: By subcutaneous or intramuscular injection, up to 5 ml Pherol-S- Ject once injected; (Lambs: 0.5 –3.0 ml Pherol-S- Ject once injected)

Warnings & Precautions
- Avoid overdosage of product because selenium is quite toxic in overdose quantities but has a fairly wide safety margin. Cattle have tolerated chronic doses of 0.6 mg/kg/day with no adverse effects (approximate therapeutic dose is 0.06 mg/kg).
- Symptoms of selenium toxicity include depression, ataxia, dyspnea, blindness, diarrhea, muscle weakness, and a Garlic odor on the breath. Horses suffering from selenium toxicity may become blind, paralyzed, slough their hooves, and lose hair from the tail and mane.

Contra Indications
- The product should only be used in species for which they are approved.
- The product must not be used in horses intended for human consumption

Side Effects
- Selenium overdoses can be extremely toxic.
- Anaphylactoid reactions have been reported.
- Intramuscular injections may cause transient muscle soreness.
- Selenium overdoses can cause depression, ataxia, dyspnea, blindness, diarrhea, muscle weakness and garlic odor on the breath

Withdrawal time: Nil

Storage condition
In the original pack, at temperature not exceeding 30°c and keep out reach of children.

Packaging
Glass vials of 10, 20, 30, 50, 100, 250 & 500 ml.

description:
Vitesel is a vitamin emulsion for injection containing Vitamin E and selenium. It is indicated for the prevention and treatment of Vitamin E/selenium deficiency syndrome in piglets, lambs and calves, including the various manifestations of nutritional muscular dystrophy (white muscle disease). Administration to the pregnant ewe may assist in the prevention of the deficiency syndrome in the new born lamb under similar conditions.

Active Ingredient
- Alpha-Tocopheryl Acetate 68 mg/ml
- Selenium (as Potassium Selenate) 1.5 mg/ml

Indications
Indicated for the prevention and treatment of Vitamin E/selenium deficiency syndrome in piglets, lambs and calves, including the various manifestations of nutritional muscular dystrophy (white muscle disease). Administration to the pregnant ewe may assist in the prevention of the deficiency syndrome in the new born lamb under similar conditions.

Dosage
- Administer by intramuscular injection only to piglets and calves.
- Piglets: 1 ml per 25 kg bodyweight Repeat after 2-4 weeks if required.
- Calves: 1-2 ml per 45 kg bodyweight. Repeat after 2-4 weeks if required.
- Administer by subcutaneous or intramuscular injection to lambs and by subcutaneous injection only to ewes.
- Ewes: 2 ml per 45 kg bodyweight after third month of pregnancy. (For protection of lambs against deficiency).
- New born Lambs: 0.5 ml. Repeat after 2-4 weeks if required.
- Older lambs: 0.5-1 ml. Repeat after 2-4 weeks if required.

name: Myogaster-E

description:
Viteselen 15 Injection (Milky emulsion)

Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Vitamin E acetate 15 gm
- Sodium selenite 0.167 gm (Eq to 76.2 mg selenium)

Properties:
It has been demonstrated that selenium and tocopherol exert physiological effects and that these effects are intertwined with sulfur metabolism. Additionally, tocopherol appears to have a significant role in the oxidation process, thus suggesting an interrelationship between selenium and tocopherol in overcoming sulfur-induced depletion and restoring normal metabolism. Although oral ingestion of adequate amounts of selenium and tocopherol would seemingly restore normal metabolism, it is apparent that the presence of sulfur and, perhaps, other factors interfere with the proper utilization of selenium and tocopherol during the digestive process. When selenium and tocopherol are injected, they bypass the digestive process and exert their full metabolic effects promptly on cell metabolism.

Indications:
- For the prevention and treatment of white muscle disease (nutritional myopathy) in calves and lambs.
- Selenium-Tocopherol Deficiency (STD) Syndrome in weanling calves and breeding beef cows, Clinical signs are stiffness and lameness; chronic, persistent diarrhea; unthriftiness; abortions and/or weak premature calves.

Target species:
Calves & lambs.

Dosage & administration:
- Administer the following single doses subcutaneously or intramuscularly.
- Administer by intramuscular injection only to calves.
- Administer by subcutaneous or intramuscular injection to lambs and by subcutaneous injection only to ewes.

» Calves: 1.5 - 3 mg selenium salt + 150 - 300 mg Vitamin E acetate / 45 kg B.wt. (1 - 2 ml / 45 kg body weight). Repeat after 2 - 4 weeks if required.
» Ewes: 3 mg selenium salt + 300 mg Vitamin E acetate / 45 kg B.wt. (2 ml / 45 kg body weight) after third month of pregnancy. For protection of lambs against deficiency.
» New-born Lambs: 0.75 mg selenium salt + 5 mg Vitamin E acetate / 45 kg B.wt. (0.5 ml / 45 kg). Repeat after 2-4 weeks if required.
» Older lambs: 0.75 - 1.5 mg selenium salt + 15 - 150 mg Vitamin E acetate / 45 kg B.wt. (0.5 - 1 ml / 45 kg). Repeat after 24 weeks if required.

Warnings & Precautions:
- Not to be used in recently born pet animals.
- This product contains the toxic substance selenium.
- Do not exceed recommended dosages.
- Administer only to animals that are known to be ingesting sub-normal levels of selenium.

Adverse Reactions:
- Anaphylactic reactions have been reported very rarely, mostly after IM route of administration.
- In case of an anaphylactic reaction, administer epinephrine immediately.

Withdrawal periods:
- Meat: Treated animals must not be slaughtered for use in food for at least 30 days after the latest treatment with this drug.
- Milk: Do not use in lactating dairy cattle

Storage Condition:
- Store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C away from light.
- Used within 3 months after opening when stored at temperature 30°C.
- Shelf life: 2 years.
- Shelf life after fist opening the immediate container: 28 days.
- Do not use after the expiry date stated on the label.

Packing:
Cartoon box containing amber glass vials (Type II) of 25, 50, 100, 250 and 500 ml injectable solution with chlorobutyl rubber stopper (Type I) and aluminum cap + label and insert leaflet.

Manufactured by:
ADWIA Co. S.A.E. 10th of Ramadan City
Made In Egypt
name: Viteselen 15

description:

DESCRIPTION:
• MINARIN® Contains the four most Essential trace minerals for reproduction, immunity and growth in a balanced formulation.
• MINARIN® has been formulated to deliver a balanced ratio of zinc, manganese, copper and selenium that bypasses the rumen for direct uptake through the blood (Highly Bioavailable).
• Chelated trace element administered for beef and dairy cattle deficient in and/or responsive to manganese, zinc, selenium and/or copper supplementation.
• An aqueous formulation minimizes site pain and reactions that are sometimes associated with other trace mineral administration.

DOSAGE:
- MINARIN® is given by S/C at the dose rate recommended below:
• Up to 1 year ... 1 ml / 50 kg
• 1 - 2 years ... 1 ml / 75 kg
• Over 2 years ... 1 ml / 100 kg

WITHHOLDING PERIODS:
• Milk: Nil
• Meat: Nil

STORAGE:
Store below 30°C (room temperature).

TARGET SPECIES:
Cattle, calf, sheep, lamb & goat

PRECAUTION:
• MINARIN should not be administered to cattle suffering conditions that severely affect liver function such as staggers or photosensitization.
• MINARIN highly bio-available trace mineral chelated with sodium EDTA.
• It is recommended that the skin on the side of the neck of cattle is slightly pulled away ("tented") and the recommended dose of MINARIN® is administered from top to bottom.

VALIDITY:
3 years from Manuf. Date.

Liquid: 50 ml

REG. NO.: 9447

Plexo Pharm for pharmaceutical industry

description:
Boviestimul is a powder specially formulated to prevent and correct imbalances in the ruminal flora of ruminants, growth enhancer and stimulate dairy production.

Features:
- It consists of dehydrated live ruminal flora, which continues its life cycle under appropriate environmental conditions, together with substrates, cofactors and buffer substances, which facilitate the germination and implantation of these microorganisms in the rumen.
- Stimulates the growth of anaerobic bacteria, cellulite bacteria and bacteria that use lactic acid.
- It stabilizes ruminal pH, increases fiber digestibility, increases the production of AGV and microbial protein.
- Increases dry matter intake, which leads to higher GMD and higher milk production.
- Composition: Saccharomyces cerevisiae, D, L-Methionine, L-Lysine, Cobalt (cobalt sulfate heptahydrate), disodium phosphate, Monocalcium phosphate (of mineral origin), Dextrose, Casein, Beer yeasts, Starch.

Composition:
Each kg contains:
- Brewer's yeast (Saccharomyces cerevisiae 4X10^11 CFU) 360 gm
- Starch 205 gm
- Casein, 150 gm
- Dextrose 85 gm
- Disodium phosphate (Na: 32.39%, P:21.82%), 50 g:
- Monocalcium phosphate (Ca: 17.21%, P: 26.47%), 36.gm
- Cobalt sulfate heptahydrate (Co: 21%), 2.5 gm
- DL Methionine, 30 g;
- L-Lysine, 5 g;
- Carier (Silica Cotoidal Anhydrous) up to 1 kg.

Dosage:
- In feed: 3 kg of Boviestimul per ton of feed.
- Cattle: 50 - 100 g daily in two doses.
- Sheep: 30 gm daily.
- Should be stored in a dry, cool place in the dark in the original package.

Directions for use:
- Dissolve 1 sachet of Boviestimul in warm water at 40 ° C and give it bottled. Optionally mix with food.
- OPTION A: As an adjunct to acute ruminal dysbiosis (ruminal acidosis, indigestion, meteorism ...) Individual treatment: Dairy cows: 100 g of Boviestimul / day for 3-5 days. Fattening cattle: 50 g of Boviestimul / day for 3-5 days (twice a day).
- OPTION B: To prevent microbial imbalance in cases of treatment with antibiotics, diet changes, when there is suspicion of accidental ingestion of large amounts of easily digestible carbohydrates (cereals, sugar beet, apples, grapes, bread, etc.), at the beginning of grazing, in periods of stress (pre and post weaning, first months of lactation, heat, etc.) and in diets with low quality fiber (straw): Dairy cows: 50 g / day Cattle for fattening: 30 g /day.
name: Boviestimul

Properties
AVISAL is a source of the most important minerals and trace elements needed for the proper biological functions, digestion, and maintenance of osmosis in the animal body.

Indications
- Chloride and other necessary trace minerals such as Zinc, Manganese, Magnesium, Cupper, Cobalt, Minerals and salt deficiency leads to prevented appetite (pica), poor milk production, retarded growth, anemia and other nutritional problems.
- Calcium and phosphorus deficiency leads to rickets and milk fever.
- Free access of cattle, sheep, goats, deers and horses to AVISAL prevents these conditions and improves growth and milk production.

description:
A 10% injectable organic phosphorus solution with vitamin B12 contains 1.73 g phosphorus in 100 mL.

Composition
Each 100 mL contain
• Butaphosphan  10 gm
• Cyanocobalamin (vit B12)  5 mg

Mode of action
Vitamin B12, influences protein, carbohydrate and fat metabolism and promotes formation of red blood cells. Both substances jointly improve the availability of energy and assist in balancing mineral disorders.

Indications
- Disorders caused by poor nutrition and inadequate management.
- Disorders in development and nutrition of young animals.
- Tonic in cases of weakness, secondary anaemia, exhaustion and chilling.
- Improvement of muscular efficiency, especially in working, sports and breeding animals.

Withholding periods: Nil

Directions for use
• injection by intramuscular, intravenous or Subcutaneous routes.
A) To assist in restoration of phosphorus and vitamin B12 after acute diseases
- Horse, cattle: 10 - 25 ml
- Foal, calf: 5 - 12 ml
- Sheep, goat: 2.5 - 5 ml
- Lamb, kid: 1.5 - 2.5 ml
- Pig, Sow: 2.5 - 10 ml
- Piglets: 1 - 2.5 ml
- Dog: 0.5 - 5 ml
- Cat, Fur animals: 0.5 - 2.5 ml
- To be repeated if required

B) To assist in restoration of phosphorus and Vitamin B12, after chronic diseases: half of the above dosage is required repeatedly at intervals of 1 to 2 weeks.

C) In healthy animals: Half of the above dosage.

Storage:
• Do not store above 30°C.
• Shelf-life after first opening: 28 days.

Properties:

description:
Indications:
•  For the use as a supplemental source of nutritional phosphorus in areas where feeding rations are inadequate to supply all phosphorous needs.
•  In case of Vitamin B12 deficiency associated with cobalt deficiency in cattle, horses and sheep.
•  It is used to prevent and treat anemia. (Vitamin B12, Folic Acid is involved in blood cell production).
•  General depression, weakness and fatigue. 

Dosage: I/V only
•  Cattle – horse: 10-25ml
•  Calves – Foals: 5-12ml
•  Sheep – Goat: 2.5-5ml
•  Kids – Lambs: 1.5-2.5ml
•  Small dogs: 0.5-2ml
•  Large dogs: 0.5-5ml
name: Betaphos

description:
COMPOSITION	
Each 100 ml contains:
- Butaphosphan 10 gm
- Cyanocobalamin ( Vit. B12 ) 5 mg

INDICATIONS	
A) Acute diseases and acute metabolic disorders:
– Reduced viability and diseases in newborn.
– Lumbago in horses.
– In addition to calcium therapy.

B) Chronic diseases and chronic metabolic disorders:
– Developmental disturbances in young animals due to rearing diseases (e.g. infections, insufficient care and malnutrition, stunted growth).
– Feather plucking and cannibalism in poultry.

C) General metabolic disorders in domestic animals:
– Metabolic disturbances in cattle as a result of inadequate feeding conditions, with the following clinical symptoms: (Palsy, lack of appetite, chronic indigestion or overloading of the fore-stomach, nutritional disorder, reduced milk yield and nervous symptoms).
– Conditions of weakness in small animals (dogs & cats) due to mismanagement.

D) Secondary anaemia

DOSAGE	
• To be injected I/V, I/M or S/C.
- Horses & Cattle: 5.0 – 12.0 ml.
- Calves & Foals: 2.5 – 5.0 ml.
- Sheep & Goat: 1.5 – 2.5 ml.
- Lamb: 2.5 – 10.0 ml.
- Pig: 1.0 – 2.5 ml.
- Piglet: 0.5 – 5.0 ml.
- Dogs: 0.5 – 2.5 ml.
- Cats : 5.0 – 25.0 ml.

• Dose should be repeated if necessary. In chronic cases, half of the dose should be taken for several times at various intervals from 3 – 5 days.

PACKS	
10, 30, 50, 100, 200, 250, 500 ml. sterile injection bottles
name: Kenozal 10

name: Atophosphan

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Toldimfos sodium  200 mg

Properties:
- Phosphorus is a key component in energy and protein metabolism and also as a structural part of bone.
- Phosphorus deficiency in the lactating cow has been associated with the development of post-parturient haemoglobinuria after the onset of acute haemolysis.
- More commonly, phosphorus deficiency causes chronic hypophosphatemia, which may result in skeletal defects, lameness, and low milk production.

Indications:
1. Treatment and prevention of hypophosphataemia (either acute or chronic hypophosphataemia).
2. Tonic for the treatment of metabolic nutritional disorders, debility and fatigue in large animals, debility in newborn animals.
3. Skeletal defects: rickets, osteomalacia and promotion for rapid healing in bone fractures together with vitamin D preparations.
4. Tetany and pareses (grass tetany, lactation tetany & post parturient pareses).

Target Species:
Ruminants (cattle) & dogs.

Dosage & Administration:
» Acute hypophosphataemia: 1 ml / 15 kg B.Wt, by subcutaneous, intramuscular, or intravenous injection.
- Cattle: 10 - 25 ml
- Dogs: 1 - 3 ml

» Chronic hypophosphataemia: By subcutaneous or intramuscular injection.
- Cattle: 2.5-5.0 ml every 2 days for 5-10 doses.
- Dogs: 1-2 ml every 2 days for 5-10 doses.

Contra-indications:
Hyperphosphataemia

Warnings:
Avoid perivascular injection.

Withdrawal Periods:
Cattle: Meat: zero & Milk: zero

Storage Condition:
- Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C, away from light.
- Used after opening 3 months storing at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Packing:
Carton box contains amber (type II) glass vial containing 10, 25, 50, 100 ml solution closed with a bromobutyl rubber bung secure with flip-off aluminum cap with label + insert leaflet.

Manufactured by:
ADWIA Co. S.A.E. 10th of Ramadan City
Made In Egypt
name: Tono-ject

description:
Composition
Each 100 ml contains:
- Toldimfos sodium trihydrate   20 gm

Properties
- Tolditonic Injectable Solution provides a high level of assimilable phosphorus by the most direct routes of administration.
- In the animal, all forms of phosphorus are oxidised almost exclusively into the +5 state of oxidisation (in the form of phosphate). This oxidisation is necessary for phosphorus to exert its metabolic effects.
- Phosphinates do not escape this phenomenon and the phosphorus supplied by Toldimphos sodium (level of oxidization +1) is oxidised into phosphate.
- The pharmacological properties of Toldimphos sodium are identical to those of phosphates. In its mineral form (notably calcium phosphate), phosphorus plays a part in the formation of bones and teeth.
- Organic derivatives of phosphate are present in high amounts in all cells; they intervene in many metabolic pathways and play an important role in the transfer of cellular energy.

Indications
Tolditonic Injectable Solution supplies organic phosphorus and is indicated in the treatment of disorders of phosphorus metabolism in horses and cattle.

Target species
Cattle & Horses

Dosage & Administration
- Administration is by intravenous and intramuscular routes in several sites.
- The doses recommended may be repeated every 2 or 3 days or daily according to the severity of the case: 5 to 10 injections in chronic affections.

Cattle- Horses
- Adult animals: 10 – 25 ml of Tolditonic
- Calves - Foals: 5 – 10 ml of Tolditonic

Contra Indications
- Do not use in case of hypersensitivity to the active substance.
- Do not use the product in animals suffering from renal failure

Withdrawal time: Zero days

Storage condition
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C and valid to 35 days after opening under storage temperature not exceeding 30°C

Packaging
Glass vials 10 , 20, 30, 50, 100, 250 and 500 ml.
name: Tolditonic

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Toldimfos sodium  20 gm (eq to toldimfos 17.96 gm)

Properties:
- Phosphorus is a key component in energy and protein metabolism and also as a structural part of bone.
- Phosphorus is characterized by rapid distribution in the body & rapid absorption by the tissues.
- Phosphorus is used in Prevention of hypophosphataemia.
- Phosphorus is used as a tonic in case of skeletal defects & tetany and paresis.
- Phosphorus increase milk yield & muscle performance.

Indications
Delfous is used in cattles & dogs for treatment and prevention of acute & chronic hypophosphataemia as:
1. General Tonic: for treatment of metabolic & nutritional disorders, deability and fatigue in large animals after difficult parturition and supportive treatment in sterility.
2. In case of skeletal defects: rickets, osteomalacia and promotion for rapid healing in bone fractures together with vitamin D preparation.
3. In case of tetany and paresis: grass tetany), lactation tetany, post-parturient paresis due to the metabolic disorder of calcium, magnesium and phosphorous in this case phosphorous administrated with calcium preparations.
4. Increase milk yield & muscle performance: in healthy animals like racing horses & working animals.

Dosage & Route of administration:
A) Acute hypophosphataemia: by subcutaneous, intramuscular or intravenous injection
- Cattle: 10 - 25 ml Delfous
- Dogs: 1 - 3 ml Delfous

B) Chronic hypophosphataemia: by subcutaneous or intramuscular injection
- Cattle: 2.5 - 5 ml every 2 days for 5 - 10 doses
- Dogs: 1 - 2 ml every 2 days for 5 - 10 doses.

Warning & Precautions:
Avoid perivascular injection

Contra-indications
Should not to be used in animals suffering from hyperphosphataemia.

Side effects:
NO side effects

Withdrawal time: Nil

Package
10, 30, 50 and 100 ml in glass vials with outer label in carton box and insert leaflet

M.O.H. Reg. No.: 3179/ 2008

Produced by
DELTA PHARMA VETERINARY SECTOR Industrial Zone B4, Area No.: 77/B: 10th of Ramadan City - Egypt
name: Delfous 20%

description:

- Toldimfos sodium, 3H20   200 mg / ml

Indications:
Metaphosol is a tonic or roborans indicated for treatment and proph­ylaxis of general metabolic disorders, weakness and prostation after disease, heavy duty in birth, debility of newborn, maldevelopement and stunting in young animals and general nutritional disturbance. It is recommended for treatment and prophylaxis of tetania and paresis due to disturbances of the Ca/Mg/P Metabolism (concomitantly with Ca/Mg infusions). Disorders in bone development (additionally with vit. D) and for support of sterility therapy. Metaphosol is increasing food intake and muscle performance.

Dosage and Use:
- By intravenous, intramuscular or subcutaneous injection
- Horse, cattle: 15 - 25 ml Metaphosol per animal
- Calf, foal: 5 - 15 ml Metaphosol per animal
- Goat, Sheep: 5 - 15 ml Metaphosol per animal
- Pig: 5 - 15 ml Metaphosol per animal
- Dog, cat: 0.5 - 5 ml Metaphosol per animal

Edible tissues and milk: 0 days

description:
Composition
Each 1 ml contains:
- Toldimphos sodium 200mg

Indications and Usage
Horses, sheep, cattle, goats, dogs:
- As a tonic & restorative for the treatment of general metabolic disorders: states of debility and exhaustion, during convalescence or after difficult parturition, debility of the newborn, developmental and nutritional disorders of young animals.
- To support treatment of sterility.
- Deficiency syndromes in the spring as a result of poor nutrition.
- Stimulation of the defense mechanism of the body.
- In skeletal growth defects such as rickets or osteomalacia and to promote callus formation after bone fractures (together with vitamin D preparations).
- Tetany and paresis due to the disorders of the calcium – magnesium and phosphorus metabolism.
- Normalization of GOT values.

Dosage
In acute cases:
- Large animals: 10-20ml/head
- Small animals: 1-3ml/head according to species and size of the animal.
- Administration by subcutaneous or intramuscular injection
- The dosage should be repeated at intervals of 2-3 days until recovery is evident.

In chronic conditions:
- The administration of a course of 5 to 10 subcutaneous or intramuscular injections using the following dose rate, given every other day.
- Large animals: 2.5-5ml/head
- Small animals: 1-2ml/head

Withdrawal time: Zero days

Pack
Glass vials: 50, 100, or 250ml.

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Toldimfos sodium  20 gm
- Cobalt (Cobalt chloride.6H2O)  1 mg
- Selenium (Sodium selenite)  10 mg
- Zinc (Zinc sulphate)  25 mg
- Molybdenum (Ammonium molibdate 4H2O)  5 mg
- Manganese (Manganese sulphate pure)  25 mg
- Nicotinic acid (nicotinamide)  500 mg

Properties:
» Phosphorus is a key component in energy and protein metabolism and also as a structural part of bone.
» Cobalt is an essential trace element which is a component of cyanocobalamin and hydroxocobalamin, which are forms of vitamin B12.
» Molybdenum containing metalloenzymes which are responsible in part for generation of oxygen free radicals in tissues during information or ischemia.
» Manganese functions as preferred cofactor for glycosyl transferases involved in mucopolysaccharide synthesis fox organic matrix in normal skeletal growth.
» Zinc is important in the hepatic synthesis of protein, and severe zinc deficiency may lead to growth cessation.
» Selenium prevents free radical damage to tissues.
» Nicotinic acid (Niacin) is necessary for the transfer of hydrogen atoms to O2 in oxidative metabolism; and necessary for hydrogen transfer in synthetic reactions, including the reductive steps in lipogenesis.

Indications:
- An organically combined phosphorus preparation for the support of metabolic activity in cattle and dogs.
- Skeletal defects: rickets and osteomalacia or promotion of rapid union in fractures, particularly when associated with Vitamin D therapy.
- Tetany and paresis: caused by disorders of calcium, magnesium and phosphorus metabolism (post-parturient paresis, lactation tetany, grass tetany).
- General metabolic disorders.
- Useful form of therapy in the treatment whether during convalescence or the result of nutritional disorders.
- It may be useful after difficult parturition, in debility of the newborn and in deficiency syndromes in cattle and dogs of all ages.

Target species:
Cattle & dogs.

Dosage Administration:
• Administer by intravenous, intramuscular or subcutaneous injection.
» Cattle: 10 - 25 ml
» Dogs: 1 - 3 ml (Depending on size and weight)

- Dosage to be repeated to clinical effect.
- In severe cases where rapid absorption  the dose may be given as half by intravenous injection and half by intramuscular or subcutaneous injection. Multiple injection sites may be used.
- The stopper should not be punctured more than 25 times.

For chronic conditions: 5 - 10 subcutaneous or intramuscular injections should be given at 48 hour intervals with the following dose 
» Cattle: 2.5 - 5 ml
» Dogs: 1 - 2 ml

Contraindications, warnings:
- Observe aseptic precautions throughout the course of therapy.

Withdrawal periods:
- Meat: Zero days.
- Milk: Zero hours.

Storage:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C, away from light.

Shelf-life:
- Before opening: 3 years that store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C, away from light.
- At first opening: 3 months that store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Packaging:
Carton box containing amber glass vials (Type II) of 50 and 100 injectable solution with chlorobutyl rubber stopper (Type I) and aluminium cap + label and insert leaflet.

Manufactured by:
ADWIA Co. S.A.E. 10th of Ramadan City
Made in Egypt

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Menbutone  10 gm

Properties:
Menbutone is a derivative of the oxy-butyric acid and stimulates the secretion of bile (trypsinogen and pepsinogen). After injection, it causes an increase in the secretion of bile, pancreatic juice and pepsin to the 2 – 5 times the normal values. Thus, it promotes the passage and absorption of food.

Indications:
Hepatonic is indicated for stimulation of digestive activity of the liver with digestive disorders or hepatic insufficiency.

Target species:
Cattle, sheep, goat, horses & pig

Dosage & Administration:
- Calves (up to 6 months), sheep, goats and pigs: 1 ml Hepatonic / 10 kg body weight IV, I/M or deep I/M.

- Cattle: 1 ml Hepatonic / 15 – 20 kg body weight intravenously given slowly.

- Horses: 1 ml Hepatonic / 20 – 40 kg body weight intravenously given slowly.

*If necessary, be repeated after 24 hours of application.

Warnings & Precautions:
- For horses, only the slow intravenous administration is recommended.
- The intravenous application should (faster than 1 minute) performed are not slow to point designated avoid side effects.

Contra Indications:
- Do not use in case of hypersensitivity to the drug or any of the other ingredients.
- Not for use in heart disease or in advanced pregnancy.

Side Effects:
- After intravenous application, salivation, lacrimation, muscle tremors, spontaneous defecation and urine occur.
- After intramuscular injection site reactions (edema, hemorrhage, necrosis) may occur.

Withdrawal time:
No withdrawal time

Storage condition:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C and valid after opening for 50 days at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Packaging:
Carton box containing amber (type II) glass vial containing with 10, 20, 30, 50, 100, 250 and 500 ml solution with red chlorobutyl rubber stopper, capped with flip off aluminum cap with outer label + Insert leaflet.

Manufactured by:
Arab Company For Medical Products (ARABCOMED)
Obour City - Industrial Area - Cairo - Egypt
name: Hepatonic

description:
Composition:
- Menbutone   100 mg / ml

Genabil is recommended in the treatment of primary or secondary indigestion, in which a stimulant of the gastrointestinal tract and the secretion of the digestive glands, especially of the bile secretion, is necessary. It also stimulates the secretion of gastric and pancreatic juice.
Intravenous administration will be slow. Intramuscularly, it is recommended to administer a volume of less than 20 ml in a single injection site. Horses should be administered only slowly intravenously.

Cattle: Unbalanced diet (feed change, food poisoning), rumen congestion, constipation, gastritis, anorexia (stimulation of digestion in case of loss of appetite), liver atrophy and liver degenerative changes, ketosis and tympany.

Sheep: It is recommended in gestational toxemia and other diseases similar to those in cattle.

Horses: Colic due to unbalanced diet, constipation, flatulence. Enteritis followed by constipation.

Dogs: Anorexia (loss of appetite), constipation, degenerative liver disease.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION:
- Administer 1 ml per 10 kg IM or IV. It may be repeated every 24 hours.
- Adult cattle: 20-40 ml.
- Calves: 5-15 ml.
- Ovine: 5-10 ml.
- Intramuscular administration should never exceed 20 ml per injection.

Withdrawal time:
Meat & Milk: 2 days
name: Genabil

description:
Bykahepar Injectable digestive stimulant
A reliable digestive stimulant for cattle, horses, sheep, dogs, goats and cats.
• Single treatment
• Multiple indications
• Used in many species

Composition
Each ml solution contains:
- Clanobutin sodium  100.07 mg

Indications
The preparation can be used for all domestic animals whose digestion and all associated secretory processes need assistance.

1. Cattle, sheep and goats:
» Primary indigestion
- After overfeeding, particularly with easily digestible carbohydrates (ruminal acidosis), with contaminated and spoilt food (ruminal breakdown) and as a result of rapid changes in diet; overloading of the rumen; distension of the rumen; constipation.

» Secondary indigestion
- Post-operative use to restore normal digestion, energy-metabolic disorders (acetonaemia in oWs, toxaemia of pregnancy in ewes).
- Stimulation of hepatic function by promoting bile secretion (therapy aimed at protecting the liver).

Horses:
» Indigestion after overfeeding with high-protein feed or oats, constipation, intestinal atony, gas colic, feed intoxication.
» Stimulation of hepatic function by promoting bile secretion.

Dogs:
» Indigestion of all kinds, constipation, intestinal atony, exocrine pancreatic insufficiency.
» Stimulation of hepatic function by promoting bile secretion.

Contraindications
- Acute pancreatitis, biliary tract occlusion, intestinal occlusion.

Precaution
It is advisable to use magnesium sulphate during the treatment.

Side-effects: None known

Interactions with other drugs: None known.

Dosage and mode of administration
» Unless otherwise prescribed by the veterinary surgeon, generally 10-20 mg / kg (1 to 2 ml/10 kg body weight).
- Cattle: 10 to 40 ml i.v. or i. m.
- Calves: 3 to 15 ml s.c., i.v. or i.m.
- Sheep, goats: 3 to 6 ml s.c., i.v. or i.m.
- Horses: 10 to 30 ml i.v.
- Dogs: 1 to 8 ml s.c. or i.m.

Depending on the progress of the illness,
treatment can be repeated with half the specified dose after 12 hours or with the full dose from 24 hours up to 7 days.

Withdrawal time: None

Mode of action
Following intravenous, intramuscular, subcutaneous or intraduodenal administration to test animals and domestic animals, Bykahepar stimulates the secretory activity of the exocrine digestive glands: there is a substantial increase in the amount of bile secreted and the activity of pepsin, trypsin, chymotrypsin and a-amylase increases considerably. This effect commences immediately after injection of Bykahepar, reaching a maximum after approx. 2 hours and lasting for roughly 10 hours.

Tolerability
Bykahepar displays a wide therapeutic spectrum and is thus tolerated without topical or systemic reactions following single or repeated doses (i.v., s.c. or i.m.).

Pack sizes
100 ml multidose vial with rubber stopper.

Keep out of reach of children.

FOR ANIMAL TREATMENT ONLY

Egypt Reg No: 2274

Imported by: ETS

Product of Intervet International B.V., Boxmeer, The Netherlands
name: Bykahepar

description:
COMPOSITION
- Menbutone  100 mg / ml
- Benzyl alcohol  2 mcL / ml (as preservative excipient)

Pharmacodynamic
- Menbutone, the active ingredient in Bykahepar M, due to its action on the liver, pancreas and stomach, is a stimulant and normalizer of the functions of the digestive system.
- In the liver has a real choleretic effect, with increased bile secretion, both in volume and in contained substances (pigments, dry matter and salts).
- In the pancreas, it increases the secretion of pancreatic juice and, specifically, increasing the percentage of trypsin in the same.
- In the stomach, the amount of gastric juice, and especially pepsin, slightly increased after administration of menbutone.
- Secondarily, it is observed a slight increase in the content of mucin in the saliva. However, total salivation practically does not increase.
- As a consequence of this set of actions, the administration of Bykahepar M in animals with gastrointestinal hypofunctionality, accompanied by secretory insufficiency, determines the regression of symptoms in 24-48 hours.

Pharmacokinetic
- Following parenteral administration, menbutone is rapidly distributed to the target organs (liver, pancreas and stomach).
- One hour after injection intravenous 10 mg/kg p.v. blood concentrations of the order of 20 μg/ml are found, that decrease rapidly over time.
- After 5 hours, only 10% is found of the initial amount administered.
- The highest concentration of menbutone is found in the digestive system and, specifically, in the bile there is 11.6% of the dose at 2-4 hours post-administration, due to enterohepatic circulation of menbutone.
- Excretion is largely through the urine. In the first 24 hours 27% of the dose is excreted and at 48 hours 30% has already been excreted. A small amount is excreted through faeces (4.4% of the dose) and milk.

Indications
Normalizer of gastric, duodenal and biliary functionality, indicated in those situations in which stimulation of digestive secretions is required, such as:
- Bovine: Indigestions. Toxemia. Ketosis. Anorexy. Hepatic and pancreatic insufficiencies.
- Porcine: Indigestions. Anorexy. intoxications. Hepatic and pancreatic insufficiencies.

Routes of administration:
- Slow intravenous in cattle and pigs.
- Deep intramuscular in cattle and pigs.
Posology:
Cattle and pigs: 10 mg of menbutone / kg b.w. (equivalent to 1 ml of Bykahepar M per every 10 kg of live weight and day). If necessary, the dose can be repeated at 24 and 48 hours.

Overdose
Since the safety margin of menbutone is unknown, doses should be strictly respected. In the event of heart block, administer a cardiotonic

Special precautions
- IV administration should be done slowly (over no less than 1 minute) to avoid the occurrence of the adverse reactions.
- It is recommended not to inject more than 20 ml IM at a single application point.
- Do not administer to females in the last third of pregnancy.
- Do not administer to lactating females.
- Do not administer together with solutions containing: Calcium, Penicillin-procaine & Vitamin B complex.
- Do not administer to animals with cardiac disorders, hyperthermia or obstruction in biliary ducts.
- Do not administer to cats in any case.

Adverse reactions
- Following excessively rapid IV administration, tremors, rapid breathing, spontaneous defecation, cough, watery eyes, sneezing and fall of the animal.
- After intramuscular administration, a painful reaction may occur in the animal.

Waiting times
- Cattle: meat: 2 days, milk: 2 days.
- Pig: meat: 2 days.

Shelf life
- As packaged for sale: 3 years
- After first opening: 28 days

Storage
Keep the vial in the outer carton in order to protect from light.
name: Bykahepar M

description:
GUMBOHATCH IBD immune-complex vaccine against Infectious Bursal Disease, in injectable suspension.

COMPOSITION
Each dose of reconstituted vaccine (0.05 ml for an in ovo dose or 0.2 ml for a subcutaneous dose) contains:
- Live attenuated infectious bursal disease virus (IBDV), strain 1052 10^1.48-10^2.63 PU*
*PU: Potency Units

INDICATIONS
- Protection against avian infectious bursal disease virus in chickens.
- The onset of immunity depends on the initial maternally derived antibodies (MDA) level of the batch of chickens and even then will be different for individual chickens.
- Duration of immunity: up to 63 days of age.

CONTRAINDICATIONS
Don't use in flocks without MDAs against IBDV.

ADVERSE REACTIONS
None. If you notice any side effects, even those not already listed in this package leaflet or you think that the medicine has not worked, please inform your veterinary surgeon.

TARGET SPECIES
Chickens and embryonated chicken eggs.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
» For in ovo administration:
• An automated egg injection machine can be used. The instructions for the calibration and use of the equipment should be strictly followed in order to deliver the appropriate dose.
• For the reconstitution and administration of the vaccine, use sterile equipment free from any residues of chemical disinfectants.

Calculate and prepare the required volume of the vaccine as follow:
- Dilutions for in ovo administration (0.05 ml per dose): For 2000-doses ampoule 100 ml solvent is used.

Reconstitution of the vaccine:
1. Withdraw 2 ml of the solvent and inject into the vial containing the lyophilisate. Mix the contents of the vial by gentle agitation until the contents are completely re-suspended, then withdraw the suspension obtained and inject it into the solvent bag.
2. Rinse the vial with another 2 ml of the solvent/lyophilisate suspension obtained in step 1, and inject it back into the solvent bag.
3. Repeat step 2 to ensure that all the lyophilisate has been transferred into the solvent bag.
4. Proceed to administer the vaccine.
*The vaccine (0.05 ml dose) must be injected in 18-day-old embryonated chicken eggs.

» For subcutaneous administration:
An automated syringe can be used. The instructions for the calibration and use of the equipment should be strictly followed in order t the appropriate dose. For the reconstitution and administration of the vaccine, use sterile equipment free from any residues of chemical disinfectants.

Calculate and prepare the required volume of the vaccine as follow:
- Dilutions for subcutaneous administration (0.2 ml per dose): For 2000-doses ampoule 400 ml solvent is used.

Reconstitution of the vaccine:
1. Withdraw 2 ml of the solvent and inject into the vial containing the lyophilisate. Mix the contents of vial agitation until the contents are completely resuspended, then withdraw the suspension obtained and inject it into the solvent bag.
2. Rinse the vial with another 2 ml of the solvent/lyophilisate suspension obtained in step 1, and inject it back into the solvent bag.
3. Repeat step 2 to ensure that all the lyophilisate has been transferred into the solvent bag.
4. Proceed to administer the vaccine.
*The vaccine (0.2 ml dose) must be injected under the skin of the neck of the 1-day-old chicks.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
Zero days

STORAGE PRECAUTIONS
- Keep out of the sight and reach of children.
• Freeze-dried and transport refrigerated (2°C - 8°C). Do not freeze. Protect from light.
• Solvent: do not store above 25°C.
- Shelf life after reconstitution according to directions: 2 hours.
- Do not use this veterinary medicinal product after the expiry date which is stated on the carton and the label.

SPECIAL WARNINGS
• For animals: The vaccine can spread to unvaccinated chickens without any clinical Vaccinate healthy animals only. consequence or reversion to virulence of the vaccine strain. Appropriate veterinary and husbandry measures should be taken to avoid spread of the vaccine strain to susceptible wild and domestic birds. It is recommended to vaccinate all chickens on a site at the same time.

• For the person: Wash and disinfect hands and equipment after use. Wash and disinfect hands after handling vaccinated birds or their litter because the virus is excreted by vaccinated birds. In case of adverse reactions following accidental self-injection, seek medical advice immediately and show the package leaflet or the label to the physician.

• Lay: Do not use in layers and breeders during the production period.

• Interactions: A decision to use this vaccine before or after any other veterinary medicinal product therefore needs to be made on a case by case basis.

• Incompatibilities: None.

DISPOSAL PRECAUTIONS
Any unused veterinary medicinal product or waste materials derived from such veterinary medicinal product should be disposed of in accordance with local requirements.

OTHER INFORMATION:
Package sizes:
- Cardboard box with 10 freeze-dried powder vials of 1,000 doses.
- Cardboard box with 10 freeze-dried powder vials of 2,000 doses.
- Cardboard box with 10 freeze-dried powder vials of 2,500 doses.
- Cardboard box with 10 freeze-dried powder vials of 4,000 doses.
- Cardboard box with 10 freeze-dried powder vials of 5,000 doses.
- Cardboard box with 10 freeze-dried powder vials of 8,000 doses.
- Cardboard box with 10 freeze-dried powder vials of 10,000 doses.
- Cardboard box with 10 bags of 200 ml of solvent.
- Cardboard box with 10 bags of 400 ml of solvent.
- Cardboard box with 10 bags of 500 ml of solvent.
- Cardboard box with 10 bags of 800 ml of solvent.
- Cardboard box with 10 bags of 1000 ml of solvent.
*Not all pack sizes may be marketed.

name: Eradex

description:
Composition:
Each ml contains:
- Sulfadimidine 308.9 mg (as Sulfadimidine sodium 333.3 mg)

Indications:
- Indicated for the treatment of infections caused by or associated with organisms sensitive to sulfadimidine.
- Sulfadimidine has been shown to be effective in vitro against the following bacterial species: Actinobacillus lignieresi, Bordetella bronchiseptica, Escherichia coli, Mannheimia haemolytica, Salmonella Dublin, Salmonella typhimurium. The product has been shown to be effective in the treatment of coccidiosis and foul in the foot.

Dosage:
- Administer by intravenous (preferred) or subcutaneous injection.
- Recommended initial dose rate is 200 mg per kilogram bodyweight, equivalent to 1 ml per 1.5 kg bodyweight.
- This should be followed at 24 hour intervals by a maintenance dose of 100 mg per kilogram bodyweight equivalent to 1 ml per 3 kg bodyweight.
- The maximum period of treatment should be 5 days. Following subcutaneous administration, it is recommended that the dose is divided, administered at separate sites and well massaged.
- The volumes injected per injection site should not exceed 50 ml in the case of cattle and 10 ml in the case of sheep and pigs when given subcutaneously.

description:
COMPOSITION
• Active ingredients (per tablet)
- Amoxicillin 400 mg (as Amoxicillin Trihydrate 460 mg) 
- Clavulanic acid 100 mg (as Potassium Clavulanate 119.2 mg)

• EXCIPIENTS
- Erythrosine Lake (E127) 35 mg/tablet
- Magnesium Stearate
- Sodium Starch Glycollate, Type A (dried)
- Silica Colloidal Anhydrous
- Yeast, Dried Microcrystalline Cellulose (dried) 

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
SYNULOX Palatable Tablets are presented as circular, pink tablets with a break line on one face and “Synulox” engraved on the other. Each tablet contains clavulanic acid as potassium clavulanate and amoxicillin as Amoxicillin Trihydrate. in a palatable base.

TARGET SPECIES
Dogs.

INDICATIONS
In vitro the product is active against a wide range of clinically important aerobic and anaerobic bacteria, including:
- Gram-positive: Staphylococci (including B-lactamase-producing strains) Clostridia; Actinomyces; Peptostreptococcus spp; Streptococci; Enterococci.
- Gram-negative: Bacteroides spp. (including B-lactamase-producing strains); Escherichia coli (including B-lactamase-producing strains); Salmonellae (including B-lactamase-producing strains); Bordetella bronchiseptia; Campylobacter spp; Fusobacterium necrophorum; Klebsiellae; Pasteurellae; Proteus spp.

Clinically, amoxicillin has been shown to be effective in treating a wide range of diseases of dogs including: skin disease (including deep and superficial pyoderma); urinary tract infection; respiratory disease involving upper and lower respiratory tract; enteritis; dental infections (e.g. gingivitis); soft tissue infections (e.g. abscesses and anal sacculitis).

Note: The product is not indicated for cases involving Pseudomonas spp.

CONTRAINDICATIONS
In common with other penicillins, amoxicillin should not be administered orally to rabbits, guinea pigs or gerbils, and should be used with care on other small herbivores.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
For use in animals
- Do not use this product on animals known to be sensitive to 
penicillin.
- Inappropriate use of the product may increase the prevalence 
of bacteria resistant to amoxicillin/clavulanic acid.
- In animals with hepatic and renal failure, the dosing regimen 
should be carefully evaluated.
- Use of the product should be based on susceptibility testing 
and take into account official and local antimicrobial policies. 
- Narrow spectrum antibacterial therapy should be used for first 
line treatment where susceptibility testing suggests likely 
efficacy of this approach.

For the person 
- Penicillins and cephalosporins may cause hypersensitivity (allergy) following injection, inhalation, ingestion or skin contact. Hypersensitivity to penicillins may lead to cross-reactions to cephalosporins and vice versa. Allergic reactions to these substances may occasionally be serious.
1) Do not handle this product if you know you are sensitised, or if you have been advised not to work with such preparations.
2) Handle this product with great care to avoid exposure, taking all recommended precautions.
3) If you develop symptoms following exposure such as a skin rash, you should seek medical advice and show the doctor this warning. Swelling of the face, lips or eyes or difficulty with breathing are more serious symptoms and require urgent medical attention.
4) Wash hands after use.

ADVERSE REACTIONS
• Very rarely hypersensitivity reactions (allergic skin reactions, anaphylaxis) may occasionally occur. If allergic reactions occur, the product should be discontinued immediately. Appropriate symptomatic treatment should be initiated.
• In very rare cases the use of the product may result in instances of gastro-intestinal disorders (vomiting, diarrhoea, anorexia).
• The frequency of adverse reactions is defined using the following convention:
- very common (more than 1 in 10 animals treated displaying adverse reaction(s)) 
- common (more than 1 but less than 10 animals in 100 animals treated)
- uncommon (more than 1 but less than 10 animals in 1,000 animals treated)
- rare (more than 1 but less than 10 animals in 10,000 animals treated)
- very rare (less than 1 animal in 10,000 animals treated, including isolated reports).

PREGNANCY, LACTATION OR LAY
The tablets can be safely used in pregnant and lactating animals.

INTERACTION
- Should not be administered concomitantly with bacteriostatic antibiotics, which are incompatible.
- Chloramphenicol, macrolides, sulfonamides and tetracyclines may inhibit the antibacterial effect of penicillin because of the rapid onset of bacteriostatic action.
- The potential for allergic cross-reactivity with other penicillins should be considered.
- Penicillins may increase the effects of aminoglycoside.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
- Recommended dose rate is 12.5 mg/kg, twice daily.
- For oral administration only. The tablets are often accepted from the hand, even by sick dogs. Alternatively, the tablets may be crushed and added to a small quantity of food.
- The majority of routine cases will respond to between 5 and 7 days therapy. Because of the low toxicity profile, the dose can be doubled if desired in refractory cases.
- In certain indications, for example canine pyoderma and chronic cystitis, bacterial infection may be secondary to other pathology. For such cases long courses of antibacterial therapy may be required, in addition to diagnosis and treatment of the underlying condition. In such circumstances overall treatment length must be at the clinician’s discretion, but should be long enough to ensure complete resolution of the bacterial disease.

OVERDOSE
Amoxicillin is of a low order of toxicity and is well tolerated by the oral route in the dogs. Limited overdose normally produces no adverse effect. If signs do occur, for example of gastro-intestinal disturbance, treatment should be symptomatic.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
Not applicable.

PHARMACOLOGICAL PROPERTIES
- Amoxicillin is a broad-spectrum antibiotic active against a wide range of Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. However, many clinically important bacteria product B-lactamase enzymes, which destroy this antibiotic. Clavulanic acid inactivates these enzymes, making the organisms susceptible to the amoxicillin.
- ATCvet Code: QJ01CR02.

INCOMPATIBILITIES
None known.

SHELF LIFE
- As packaged for sale: 2 years.

STORAGE PRECAUTIONS 
- Do not store above 25°C.
- Store in a dry place.

PACKAGING
Laminated, aluminium foil packs with 2 tablets in each blister card, packed in an outer carton box.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
Any unused veterinary medicinal product or waste materials derived from such veterinary medicinal products should be disposed of in accordance with local requirements.

MARKETING AUTHORISATION HOLDER
Zoetis UK Limited
1st Floor, Birchwood Building
Springfield Drive
Leatherhead
Surrey
KT22 7LP-----COMPOSITION
Each tablet contain:
- Amoxicillin 200 mg (as Amoxicillin trihydrate 229.5 mg)
- Clavulanic Acid 50 mg (as Potassium Clavulanate 59.5 mg)

Target species: Cats and dogs

Indications
The product has been shown to be effective in treating a wide range of diseases of cats and dogs including: Skin disease (including deep and superficial pyodermas); soft tissue infections (abscesses and anal sacculitis); dental infections (e.g. gingivitis); urinary tract infections; respiratory disease (involving upper and lower respiratory tract); enteritis.

Contraindications
The product should not be given to rabbits, guinea pigs, hamsters or gerbils. Caution is advised in their use in any other very small herbivores.

Interaction
- Chloramphenicol, macrolides, sulfonamides and tetracyclines may inhibit the antibacterial effect of penicillin because of the rapid onset of bacteriostatic action.
- The potential for allergic cross-reactivity with other penicillins should be considered.
- Penicillins may increase the effects of aminoglycoside.

Dosage
- Administration: by the oral route.
- Dosage rate: 12.5 mg/kg bodyweight.
- Dosage frequency: The following table is intended as a guide to dispensing at the standard dose rate of 12.5 mg/kg, twice daily.
- For the majority of infections including those of the skin, urinary tract and gastrointestinal tract, the above dosage regime is effective. Refractory cases however particularly of the respiratory tract have shown improved cure rates by doubling the dose to 25mg/kg bodyweight twice daily.

- Duration of therapy: 
-- Routine cases involving all indications: The majority of these cases respond to between 5 and 7 days therapy.
-- Chronic or refractory cases: In these cases, where there is considerable tissue damage, a longer course of therapy maybe required in that it allows sufficient time for damaged tissue to repair. Based on clinical trials, the following durations are suggested as guidelines:
--- Chronic skin disease 10 – 12 days
--- Chronic cystitis 10 – 28 days
--- Respiratory disease 8 – 10 days

- The product is effective against Klebsiella infections found in veterinary practice, but it is not indicated for cases involving Pseudomonas species. Tablets are often accepted from the hand, even by sick dogs and cats. Alternatively, the tablets may be crumbled and added to a little food.

Pregnancy, lactation or lay
The product can be safely used in pregnant and lactating animals.

Withdrawal period
Meat: 9 Days.

Shelf life
-  As packaged for sale: 2 years.

Storage
- Do not store above 25°C.
- Store in a dry place.

Packaging
Tablets are packed in laminated aluminium foil strips containing 5 x 2 tablets. 250 mg tablets are in packs of 100 and 250.-----COMPOSITION

The product has been shown to be effective in treating a wide range of diseases of cats and dogs including: Skin disease (including deep and superficial pyodermas); soft tissue infections (abscesses and anal sacculitis); dental infections (e.g. gingivitis); urinary tract infections; respiratory disease (involving upper and lower respiratory tract); enteritis.

Contraindications
The product should not be given to rabbits, guinea pigs, hamsters or gerbils. Caution is advised in their use in any other very small herbivores.

- The potential for allergic cross-reactivity with other penicillins should be considered.

- Dosage frequency: The following table is intended as a guide to dispensing at the standard dose rate of 12.5 mg/kg, twice daily.
- For the majority of infections including those of the skin, urinary tract and gastrointestinal tract, the above dosage regime is effective. Refractory cases however particularly of the respiratory tract have shown improved cure rates by doubling the dose to 25mg/kg bodyweight twice daily.

- Duration of therapy: 
-- Routine cases involving all indications: The majority of these cases respond to between 5 and 7 days therapy.
-- Chronic or refractory cases: In these cases, where there is considerable tissue damage, a longer course of therapy maybe required in that it allows sufficient time for damaged tissue to repair. Based on clinical trials, the following durations are suggested as guidelines:
--- Chronic skin disease 10 – 12 days
--- Chronic cystitis 10 – 28 days
--- Respiratory disease 8 – 10 days

- The product is effective against Klebsiella infections found in veterinary practice, but it is not indicated for cases involving Pseudomonas species. Tablets are often accepted from the hand, even by sick dogs and cats. Alternatively, the tablets may be crumbled and added to a little food.

Pregnancy, lactation or lay
The product can be safely used in pregnant and lactating animals.

Withdrawal period
Meat: 9 Days.

Storage

name: Calf Aid

description:
COMPOSITION
- Meloxicam 30 mg / ml

PROPERTIES
Meloxicam is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) of the oxicam class which acts by inhibition of prostaglandin synthesis, thereby exerting anti-inflammatory, anti-exudative, analgesic and antipyretic effects. It reduces leukocyte infiltration into the inflamed tissue. To a minor extent it also inhibits collagen-induced thrombocyte aggregation. Meloxicam also has anti-endotoxic properties because it has bean shown to inhibit production of thromboxane B2 induced by E. coli endotoxin administration in calves, lactating cows.

INDICATIONS
» Cattle
- for use in acute respiratory infections with appropriate antibiotic therapy to reduce clinical signs;
- for adjunctive therapy in the treatment of acute mastitis, in combination with antibiotic therapy;
- for use in diarrhoea in combination with oral re-hydration therapy to reduce clinical signs;
- for the relief of post-operative pain following dehorning.

» Horses
- for use in the alleviation of inflammation and relief of pain in both acute and chronic musculoskeletal disorders and soft tissue lesions;
- for the relief of pain associated with equine colic.

» Sheep, goats
- for use in acute respiratory infections with appropriate antibiotic therapy to reduce clinical signs;
- for adjunctive therapy in the treatment of a cute mastitis, in combination with antibiotic therapy.

» Camels
- for inhibition of endotoxin-induced fever and prostaglandin production.

TARGET SPECIES
Cattle, horses sheep, goats and camels

CONTRA-INDICATIONS
- Do not use in animals suffering from impaired hepatic, cardiac or renal function and haemorrhagic disorders, or where there is evidence of ulcerogenic gastrointestinal lesions.
- Do not use in case of hypersensitivity to the active substance or to any of the excipients.
- For the treatment of diarrhoea in cattle, do not use in animals of less than one week of age.

SIDE EFFECTS
In cattle, subcutaneous as well as intramuscular administration is well tolerated; only a slight transient swelling at the injection site following subcutaneous administration was observed in less than 10% of the cattle treated in clinical studies. In very rare cases anaphylactoid reactions, which may be serious (including fatal), may occur and should be treated symptomatically.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
• Particular care should be taken with regard to the accuracy of dosing including the use of an appropriate dosing device and careful estimation of body weight.
• Avoid introduction of contamination during use.

» Cattle, goats: single dose of 2.5 ml / 150 kg body weight IV or SC.
» Horses: single dose of 3 ml / 150 kg body weight IV.
» Sheep, camels: single dose of 2.5 ml /150 kg body weight IV.

WITHDRAWAL TIME
Meat:
- cattle, sheep, goats: 15 days
- horses: 5 days

Milk: 5 days

REMARK: in camels meloxicam can be detected in body fluids during 14 days after administration.

STORAGE
- Shelf life before opening: 30 months.
- Shelf life after opening: 28 days.
- Before opening: do not store above 30°C.
- After opening: do not store above 25°C.

WARNING AND PRECAUTIONS
- Treatment of calves with Melovem 20 minutes before dehorning reduces post-operative pain. Melovem alone will not provide adequate pain relief during the dehorning procedure. To obtain adequate pain relief during surgery co-medication with an appropriate analgesic is needed.

» Precautions for use in animals
- If adverse reactions occur, treatment should be discontinued and the advice of a veterinarian should be sought. Avoid use in very severely dehydrated, hypovolaemic or hypotensive animals which require parenteral rehydration, as there may be a potential risk of renal toxicity. In case of inadequate relief of pain when used in the treatment of equine colic, careful re-evaluation of the diagnosis should be made as this could indicate the need for surgical intervention.

» Precautions for the person
- The galenical form (solution for injection) prevents the product being in contact with its user. Accidental self-injection may give rise to pain. People with known hypersensitivity to Non-Steroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drugs (NSAIDS) should avoid contact with the veterinary medicinal product. In case of accidental self-injection, seek medical advice immediately and show this package leaflet or the label to the physician.

» Pregnancy and lactation
- Can be used during pregnancy and lactation.

» Interactions
- Do not administer concurrently with glucocorticosteroids, other non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs or with anti-coagulant agents.

» Overdose
- In the case of overdose, symptomatic treatment should be initiated.
- Do not use in new-born domestic animals.

PACKAGE
Cardboard box with 1 colourless, type I glass injection vial (50 ml & 100 ml) dosed with a bromobutyl rubber stopper and sealed with an aluminium cap with an outer label and insert.

Reg no.: 4689/2020

FOR VETERINARY USE ONLY

Dopharma Research B.V.
Zalmweg 24 - 4941 VX Raamsdonksveer - the Netherlands

MANUFACTURER
Dopharma B.V.
Zalmweg 24 - 4941 VX Raamsdonksveer - the Netherlands

EgyEuro Animal Health
