name: Ivomec

description:
Composition
Each 1 ml contains:
- Ivermectin  10 mg
- Clorsulon 100 mg

Properties:
- Ivermectin is an endectocide with activity against a wide range of internal and external parasites. It enhances the release of gamma amino butyric acid (GABA) at presynaptic neurons. GABA acts as an inhibitory neurotransmitter and blocks the post-synaptic stimulation of the adjacent neuron in nematodes or the muscle fiber in arthropods. By stimulating the release of GABA, ivermectin causes paralysis of the parasite and eventual death.

- Clorsulon is a compound belonging to the benzenesulphonamide family which is recommended for the treatment and control of adult liver flukes it's inhibits the glycolytic enzymes 3-phosphoglycerate kinase and phosphoglyceromutase, thereby blocking the Emden-Myerhof glycolytic pathway. The fluke is deprived of its main metabolic energy source and dies.

Indications:
Following parasites in cattle.
- Liver Fluke: Adult Fasciola hepatica
- Gastrointestinal roundworms:
–– Adult and fourth stage larvae of Ostertagia spp., Haemonchus placei, Trichostrongylus spp., Cooperia spp., Oesophagostomum spp., Chabertia ovina.
–– Adult stages of Strongyloides papillosus, Nematodirus spp. and Trichuris spp.
- Lungworms (Adult and fourth stage larvae): Dictyocaulus viviparus.
- Eye Worms (Adult): Thelazia spp.
- Warbles: Hypoderma bovis, Hypoderma lineatum.
- Lice: Linognathus vituli, Haematopinus eurysternus and Solenopotes capillatus.
- Mange Mites: Sarcoptes scabiei var. bovis and Psoroptes bovis.

Target species: Cattle

Dose:
- 1 ml of Paramectin Super per 50 kg body weight as a single dose by subcutaneous injection.

Side effects:
- Discomfort may be observed in animals following subcutaneous administration.
- Swelling at the injection site may be occurring.

Contra-indication:
- Not to be used in animals producing milk for human consumption.
- Not to be used in animals with hypersensitivity to ivermectin.
- Not for intravenous or intramuscular use.

Warnings & Precautions:
Care should be taken to avoid the too frequent and repeated use of anthelmintics from the same class and underdosing because they increase the risk of development of resistance.

Withdrawal Time: Meat 66 days.

Storage: Store at temperature not exceeding 30ºC, and use immediately after opening.
name: Paramectin super

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Ivermectin 1 gm
- Clorsulon 10 gm

Properties:
- Ivermectin is a member of the macrocyclic lactone class of endectocides which have a unique mode of action. Compounds of the class bind selectively and with high affinity to glutamate-gatedchloride ion channels which occur in invertebrate nerve and muscle cells. This leads to an increase in the permeability of the cell membrane to chloride ions with hyperpolarization of the nerve or muscle cell, resulting in paralysis and death of the parasite. Compounds of this class may also interact with other ligand-gated chloride channels, such as those gated by the neurotransmitter gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA). The margin of safety for compounds of this class is attributable to the fact that mammals do not have glutamate-gated chloride channels, the macrocyclic lactones have a low affinity for other mammalian ligand-gated chloride channels and they do not readily cross the blood-brain barrier.
- Clorsulon is rapidly absorbed into the circulating blood. Erythrocytes with bound drug as well as plasma are ingested by Fasciola hepatica. Adult Fasciola hepatica are killed by clorsulon because of inhibition of enzymes in the glycolytic pathway, which is their primary source of energy.

Indications:
Cattle:
- Gastrointestinal Roundworms (adults and fourth-stage larvae): Ostertagia ostertagi (including inhibited O. ostertagi), O. lyrate, Haemonchus placei, Trichostrongylus axei, T. colubriformis, Cooperiaoncophora, C. punctata, C. pectinate, Bunostomum phlebotomum, Nematodirus helvetianus (adults only), N. spathiger (adults only) and Oesophagostomum radiatum.
- Lungworms (adults and fourth-stage larvae): Dictyocaulus viviparus.
- Liver Flukes: Fasciola hepatica (adults only).
- Cattle Grubs (parasitic stages): Hypoderma bovis and H. lineatum.
- Sucking Lice: Linognathus vituli, Haematopinus eurysternus and Solenopotes capillatus.
- Mange Mites (cattle scab): Psoroptes ovis (syn. P. communis var. bovis) and Sarcoptes scabiei var. bovis.

Persistent Activity:
Iveen plus Injection has been proved to effectively control infections and to protect cattle from reinfection with Dictyocaulus a viviparus and Oesophagostomum radiatum for 28 days after treatment; Ostertagia ostertagi, Trichostrongylus axei and Cooperia punctata for 21 days after treatment; Haemonchus placei, and Cooperia oncophora for 14 days after treatment.

Target species: cattle.

Dosage and administration:
- Should be given only by subcutaneous injection.
- Cattle: 1 ml / 50 kg body weight.

Warnings and Precautions:
Care should be taken to avoid the following practices because they increase the risk of development of resistance and could ultimately result in ineffective therapy:
- Too frequent and repeated use of anthelmintics from the same class, over an extended period of time.
- Under dosing, which may be due to underestimation of bodyweight, misadministration of the product, or lack of calibration of the dosing device.
- Divide doses in excess of 10 ml between different injection sites and use different sites to those used for other parenteral.
- Use dry sterile needle and syringe.
- Not to be used in recently born pet animals.

Contraindications:
- This product is not to be used intramuscularly or intravenously.
- This product is registered for use in cattle only.
- Do not use in other species as severe adverse reactions, including fatalities, may occur.
- Do not use in animals with known hypersensitivity to the active ingredients.

Adverse reactions:
Transitory discomfort has been observed in some cattle following subcutaneous administration. A low incidence of soft tissue swelling at the injection site has been observed. These reactions disappeared without treatment.

Withdrawal time:
Cattle:
- Meat: 49 days.
- Milk: Not permitted for use in animals producing milk for human consumption, including pregnant animals intended to produce milk for human consumption.

Storage Condition:
- Store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C away from light.
- Used within 3 months after opening when stored at temperature 30°C.

Packing:
Carton box contains glass vials of 10 ml, 20 ml, 30 ml, 50 ml, 100 ml, 250 ml, and 500 ml + outer label & insert leaflet.

Manufactured by:
ADWIA Co. S.A.E. 10th of Ramadan City
Made in Egypt

description:
Properties:
- Ivermectin is an endectocide with activity against a wide range of internal and external parasites. It enhances the release of gamma amino butyric acid (GABA) at presynaptic neurons. GABA acts as an inhibitory neurotransmitter and blocks the post-synaptic stimulation of the adjacent neuron in nematodes or the muscle fiber in arthropods. By stimulating the release of GABA, ivermectin causes paralysis of the parasite and eventual death.

- Clorsulon is a compound belonging to the benzenesulphonamide family which is recommended for the treatment and control of adult liver flukes it's inhibits the glycolytic enzymes 3-phosphoglycerate kinase and phosphoglyceromutase, thereby blocking the Emden-Myerhof glycolytic pathway. The fluke is deprived of its main metabolic energy source and dies.

Indications:
Liver Fluke: Adult Fasciola hepatica.

Gastrointestinal roundworms:
– Adult and fourth stage larvae of Ostertagia spp., Haemonchus placei, Trichostrongylus spp., Cooperia spp., Oesophagostomum spp., Chabertia ovina.
– Adult stages of Strongyloides papillosus, Nematodirus spp. and Trichuris spp.

Lungworms (Adult and fourth stage larvae): Dictyocaulus viviparus.

Eye Worms (Adult): Thelazia spp.

Warbles: Hypoderma bovis, Hypoderma lineatum.

Lice: Linognathus vituli, Haematopinus eurysternus and Solenopotes capillatus.

Mange Mites: Sarcoptes scabiei var. bovis and Psoroptes bovis.

Target Species: Cattle.

Dosage and Administration: S/C only 
•  Cattle, Buffaloes, Sheep, Goat and Camel
1 ml/50 kg
Cattle: Inject under the loose skin in front of or behind the shoulder.

Sheep: Inject under the loose skin behind the shoulder, the axilla or on the inside of the thigh. Ensure that the needle is carefully inserted and that the solution does not leak from the injection site. Make certain that needle has penetrated the wool and skin before delivering the dose.

Withdrawal period:
•  Meat: 35 days 

Contraindications and Precautions:
•  Not to be administered for lactating animals nor 28 
days before delivery.
•  Do not administer intravenously or intramuscularly.

Warnings:
Transitory discomfort and a swelling at the site of 
injection have been observed in some cattle and sheep.
name: Ivermectin super

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Ivermectin  10 mg
- Clorsulon  100 mg

Properties & Indications:
Avimec Super is a broad spectrum endectocide for cattle & sheep.
-  It is indicated for the treatment & control of roundworms, parafilaria, adult liver fluke, lice, mange mites, sandtampans, blue-ticks, screwworm, eye worm in cattle.
- In sheep for the treatment & control of roundworms, nasal worm, adult liver fluke, Australian itch mite and scab mite.

Doses & Administration:
» Cattle:
- 1 ml per 50 kg body weight.
- Heavier animals (e.g. Mature bulls) should receive an additional 1 ml for each 50 kg over 600 kg body weight.

» Sheep:
- 0.5 ml per 25 kg b. wt.
- Heavier animals should receive an additional 0.5 ml for each 25 kg.
- In sever scab cases, two treatments 7 days apart is needed to eliminate all living mites, and control reinfestation.

Administration:
» Cattle: Inject under the loose skin in front of or behind the shoulder. The recommended use level had no adverse effect on the breeding performance of cattle.

» Sheep: Inject under the loose skin behind the shoulder, the axilla or on the inside of the thigh. Ensure that the needle is carefully inserted and that the solution does not leak from the injection site. Make certain that the needle has penetrated the wool and skin before delivering the dose. The recommended use level had no adverse effects on the breeding performance of sheep.

Withdrawal period:
- Meat: Cattle and sheep must not be slaughtered for human consumption within 35 days of last treatment.
- Milk: not for use in lactating animals.

Contraindications and Precautions:
- Not for use in Case of immature liver flukes (fasciola hepatica and fasciola gigantica).
• Do not administer intravenously or intramuscularly.
• Keep out of reach of children, uninformed persons and animals.

Note for users:
Transitory discomfort and a swelling at the site of injection have been observed in some cattle and sheep following subcutaneous administration. These reactions have disappeared without treatment few days later. When dose greater than 10 ml should be administered, then the dose must be divided and injected into two different sites.

Storage:
Store in a dark place at a temperature below 30° C.

Presentation:
10 ml, 20 ml, 50 ml & 100 ml amber glass injection bottles and plastic injection bottles.

For Veterinary Use Only

"AVIMEC SUPER INJ." is another product of:
ARAB VETERINARY INDUSTRIAL Co. (AVICO)

Made in Jordan
name: Avimec super

description:

Each 1 ml contains:
- Ivermectin ( Active ) 10 mg
- Clorsulon 100 mg

INDICATIONS	
• KEMEC SUPER provides broad spectrum efficacy against both Internal & External parasites of cattle and sheep
• KEMEC SUPER Indicated for treatment and control of:
- Cattle and Buffaloes: Liver flukes, Gastrointestinal round worms, Lung worms, Cattle Grubs, Mites, Lice and Cattle Ticks.
- Sheep and Goats: Liver flukes, Gastrointestinal round worms, Lung worms, Nasal Bot and Mange mites.

• In case of mange it is recommended to repeat the dose after 7 days.

PACKS	
10, 30, 50, 100, 200, 250 & 500 ml. sterile injection bottles

description:
Composition
Each 100ml contains: 
- 1 gm ivermectin
- 10 gm clorsulon

Indications and Usage
Major internal parasites including: mature liver flukes (Fasciola hepatica and Fasciola gigantica); gastrointestinal nematodes including immature and inhibited larvae, lung worms, ascarids, tricuris, eye worms: thelaziasis, filarial nematodes (Parafilariasis and Onchoceriasis), kidney worms (Stephanurosis) and Strongyloides; major external parasites including mites responsible for sarcoptic, chorioptic and psoroptic mange, biting and sucking lice, ticks, grubs, and myiasis.

Milk: 7 days

Pack
Glass vials: 100, 250, or 500ml.

name: Ivomec Super

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Ivermectin  1 gm
- Clorsulon  10 gm

Properties:
» Ivermectin is a macrocyclic lactone class of endectocides and acts by binding with glutamate-gated chloride ion channels in the invertebrate nerve and muscles cell lead to increase the permeability of the cell membrane to chloride ion with hyperpolarization of the nerve or muscle cell resulting in paralysis and death of parasite. Compounds of this class may interact with other ligand-ligated chloride channels such as those gated by the neurotransmitter gamma amino-butyric acid (GABA).

» Clorsulon is sulphonamides and competitive inhibitors of enzymes important for energy metabolism in flukes, it is used in cattle for control of liver fluke.

Indications:
» Beef and non-lactating dairy cattle:
• Gastrointestinal Roundworms (adult and fourth-stage larvae): Ostertagia spp. (including inhibited O. ostertagi), Haemonchus placei, Trichostrongylus axei, Trichostrongyls colubriformis, Cooperia spp., Bunastomum phicbotomum Oesophagostomum radiatum, Strongyloides papillostus (adult only), Nematodirus helvetianus (adult only), Nematodirus spathiger (adult only), Toxocara vitulorum, Trichuris spp. (adult only).
• Lungworm (adult and fourth-stage larvae): Dictyocaulus viviparous.
• Liver Fluke (adult): Fasciola hepatica (Adult & immature [1-12 weeks]), Fasciola gigantica.
• Eyeworms (adult):Thelazia spp.
• Warbles (parasitic stages): Hypoderma bovis, H. lineatum.
• Mange mites: Psoroptes bovis, Sarcoptes scabiei var. bovis.
• Sucking Lice: Linognathus vituli, Haematopinus eursternus, Solenopotes capillatus.
• Biting lice (Damalinia bovis).

» Sheep:
• Gastrointestinal round worm (adult and immatures): as Ostertagia circumcicta, Trichostrongylus colubriformis, Cooperia curticei, Oesophagostomum columbianum, Trichostrongiyus axei, Oesophagostomum venlosum, Chabertia ovina adults, Trichuris ovis.
• Lung worm: Dictyocaulus fiaria (adults & immature).
• Nasal Bot: oestrus ovis (all larval stages)
• Liver fluke: Fasciola magna

Target species: Cattle, Sheep

Dosage & Administration:
- Should be given subcutaneous injection only once and repeated after 3 weeks.
- Cattle & Sheep: 1 ml of Delmectin Super / 50 kg body weight.

Warnings & Precautions:
1- In cattle; doses greater than 10 ml should be given in two injection sites.
2- It should not be used in dairy cows producing milk for human consumption or in dairy cows including pregnant heifer within 60 days before calving.
3- Do not administer to newly born pets / domestic animals.

Contra-indication:
1- Do not use intramuscularly or intravenously.
2- Not for use in lactating dairy cattle.

Adverse effects:
- In very rare cases transitory discomfort has been observed in some cattle following subcutaneous administration.
- In very rare cases soft tissue swellings may occur at the site of injection. These reactions resolve over time without treatment.

Withdrawal time:
Cattle: 35 days

Storage conditions:
- Stored at temperature not exceeding 30°C.
- After opening: use within 30 days & stored at room temperature.

Packaging:
Carton box containing amber glass type II vial containing 50 ml solution covered with chlorobutyl rubber stopper & Al flip off & Plastic Cap (HDPE) with outer label & inner Leaflet.

Manufactured by:
El-Delta For Pharmaceutical Industries
DELTA PHARMA VETERINARY SECTOR Industrial Zone B4, Area No.: 77/B 10th of Ramadan City - Egypt
name: Delmectin super

description:
Anthelmintic (Avermectin)

Dectomax (brand of doramectin) Injectable Solution for Cattle and Sheep.

PRODUCT CHARACTERISTICS:
- DECTOMAX an injectable, broad-spectrum parasiticide for cattle and sheep.
- One low-volume injection effectively controls a wide range of nematode and arthropod parasites that impair the health and productivity of those animal species.
- DECTOMAX injectable solution has a wide margin of safety, is exceptionally well-tolerated and has an axe excellent syringeability, making it particularly suitable for controlling parasites in cattle and sheep.

PRODUCT DESCRIPTION:
- DECTOMAX injectable solution contains doramectin, an avermectin discovered by Pfizer.
- Doramectin a novel, fermentation-derived product of the avermectin class of highly active, broad-spectrum antiparasitic agents.
- Doramectin is isolated from fermentations of a genetically altered strain of Streptomyces avermitilis.
- DECTOMAX is a ready-to-use, pale yellow, sterile injectable solution containing 1% w/v doramectin.
- It is formulated to deliver the recommended dosage of 200 µg/kg body weight when given by either intramuscular or subcutaneous injection at the rate of 1 ml / 50 kg body weight.

MODE OF ACTION:
- The primary mode of action of avermectins, the family of compounds to which doramectin belongs, is to modulate chloride ion channel activity in the nervous system or muscles of nematodes and arthropods.
- Avermectins bind to receptors that increase membrane permeability to chloride ions. This inhibits the electrical activity of nerve and muscle cells in nematodes and arthropods and causes paralysis and death of the parasites. In mammals, the neuronal receptors to which avermectins bind are localized within the central nervous system.
- Since doramectin does not readily penetrate the mammalian CNS it has a wide margin of safety in animals when used as recommended.

SAFETY:
DECTOMAX injectable solution is safe for use in growing lambs or calves and reproductively mature males and females sheep and cattle.

INDICATIONS (CLAIMS):
DECTOMAX injectable solution is indicated for the treatment and control of cattle and sheep parasites sensitive to doramectin.

» IN CATTLE
- Gastrointestinal roundworms (Adults and fourth stage larvae): Ostertagia ostertagi (including inhibited larvae), Ostertagia lyrata (adult), Haemonchus contortus  (adult), Haemonchus placei, Haemonchus similis (adult), Trichostrongylus axei, Trichostrongylus colubriformis, Trichostrongylus longispicularis (adult), Cooparia oncophora (including inhibited larvae), Cooparia pectinata (adult), Cooperia punctata, Cooperia spatulata  (adult), Cooperia surnabada (syn. mcmasteri), Nematodirus helvetianus, Nematodirus spathiger (adult), Bunostomum phlebotomum (adult), strongyloides papillosus (adult), Oesophagostomum radiatum, Trichuris discolor (adult), Trichuris ovis (adult).
- Lungworms (Adults and fourth stage larvae): Dictyocaulus viviparus.
- Eyeworms: Thelazia spp.

The sustained drug concentrations that result from its pharmacokinetics enable the product to protect animals against parasite infections and reinfections for extended periods following treatment.

DECTOMAX provides a protective period of up to:
• 3 weeks against Ostertagia ostertagi.
• 2 weeks against Cooperia oncophora.
• 4 weeks against Dictyocaulus viviparus.

- Grubs/Warbles (parasitic stages): Hypoderma bovis, Hypoderma lineatum, Dermatobia hominis.
- Screwworms (parasitic stages): Cochliomyia hominovorax.
- Lice: Haematopinus eurysternus, Linognathus vituli, Solenopotes capillatus.
- Mites: Psoroptes bovis (var. ovis), Sarcoptes scabiei.
- Single host ticks: Boophilus microplus.
- Biting Lice: Damalinia bovis (aid in control).

» IN SHEEP
- Gastrointestinal roundworms: Ostertagia (Teladorsagia), circumcincta (adults, L4), Haemonchus contortus (adults, L4), Trichostrongylus axei (adults, L4), T. colubriformis (adults, L4), T. vitrinus (adults, L4), Cooperia curticei (L4 only), C. oncophora (adults, L4), Oesophagostomum venulosum (adults only), Nematodirus spp. (adults, L4), Inhibited larval stages (L4) of Ostertagia (Teladorsagia) circumcincta, including strains that are benzimidazole resistant, are also controlled.
- Lungworms: Dictyocaulus filaria (adults only).
- Mange mites (sheep scab): Psoroptes ovis.

DOSAGE:
Administer DECTOMAX injectable solution at a dosage rate of 200 µg doramectin / kg (i.e. 1 ml / 50 kg) body weight as a single injection.

ADMINISTRATION:
DECTOMAX injectable solution can be administered by the intramuscular or subcutaneous route. Inject the product under soft skin in the neck or shoulder region or into the neck muscles. Administer product with a dry 16 to 18 gauge needle of 15-20 mm length. Use sterile equipment and follow aseptic procedures. When the temperature of the formulation is below 5°C, syringeability may be improved by gently warming the injecting equipment and product.

PARTICULAR PRECAUTIONS:
- In order to avoid secondary reactions due to the death of Hypoderma grubs in the oesophagus or in the vertebral column, it is recommended to administer DECTOMAX at the end of the flies activity period and before the grubs reach their sites; consult your veterinarian to know the correct period of treatment.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD:
- Meat and offals: 35 days.
- Milk: do not use in lactating animals producing milk for human consumption.

OTHER PRECAUTIONS:
- For animal treatment only.
- Keep this drug out of reach of children.
- Wash hands after use.
- Do not administer orally.

STORAGE CONDITIONS:
- Store below 30°C.
- Protect contents from light.

DISPOSAL:
Containers and residual contents should be disposed of safely, either by burying in waste ground away from water courses or by incineration.

PACKAGE INFORMATION:
DECTOMAX injectable solution is available in multiple dose vials in several ready-to-use sizes: 25, 50, 200, 500 ml.

Manufactured by:
Zoetis Manufacturing & Research Spain, S.L-Spain.

Dectomax Trademark of Zoetis Inc

Imported by Zoetis Import Egypt
name: Dectomax
package: 500 ml vial-200 ml vial-50 ml vial

description:
Anthelmintic (Imidazothiazole)

Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Levamisole HCl 7.5 gm (Equivalent to 6.364 gm levamisole)

Properties:
- Pharmacotherapeutic group: Anthelmintic Levamisole Hydrochloride is the levo isomer of dl 2,3,5,6 Tetrahydro-6-phenyl imidazo (1,2-b) thiazole Hydrochloride.
- Levamisole was found to be active against adult and immature gastro-intestinal and pulmonary nematodes when administered to experimentally infected animals by the oral, subcutaneous, intramuscular, or intraperitoneal routes. Levamisole stimulates the parasympathetic and sympathetic ganglia in susceptible worms. At higher levels, levamisole interferes with nematode carbohydrate metabolism by blocking fumarate reduction and succinate oxidation. The net effect is a paralyzing effect on the worm which is then expelled alive.
- Levamisole's effects are considered to be nicotine-like in action.
- Levamisole is believed it restores cell-mediated immune function in peripheral T-lymphocytes and stimulates phagocytosis by monocytes. Its immune stimulating effects appear to be more pronounced in animals that are immune compromised.

Indications:
A broad spectrum anthelmintic for use in the treatment and control of nematode infections. It should be used in cases of parasitic gastro-enteritis and lungworm disease caused by mature and developing immature forms of those organisms' sensitive to treatment with Levamisole Hydrochloride.

Target species:
Cattle & Sheep

Dosage and administration:
- Administer by subcutaneous injection.
• Cattle: 1 ml / 10 kg bodyweight (7.5 mg Levamisole / kg bodyweight).
• Sheep: 0.5 ml / 5 kg bodyweight (7.5 mg Levamisole / kg bodyweight).
- Divide large doses between two or more injection sites.

Overdose:
If recommended doses are exceeded animals may exhibit signs of impaired motor functions such as muscle tremors and increased salivation, which are of a temporary nature.

Contraindications:
Animals must not be treated within a period of 14 days before or after treatment with organophosphorus compounds.

Warnings:
a) In cases of lungworm infections, coughing may persist for a considerable time following successful treatment due to tissue damage caused by the parasites.
b) Care should be taken to avoid the following practices because they increase the risk of development of resistance and could ultimately result in ineffective therapy:
- Too frequent and repeated use of anthelmintics from the same class.
- Under-dosing.

Precautions:
- Estimate accurately the live weight of animals to be treated.
- After treatment animals should be moved to clean pasture to prevent re-infection.

Adverse reactions:
Although normally non-irritant, the product may occasionally cause local reaction at the site of injection. This should resolve naturally in a short period of time.

Pregnancy, lactation or lay:
- The product can be safely administered to pregnant or lactating animals.
- Care should be taken when treating heavily pregnant animals and animals under stress from adverse weather conditions, poor nutrition, penning, handling, etc.

Withdrawal period
- Cattle (Meat): 28 days.
- Sheep (Meat): 15 days.
- This product must not be used in cattle and sheep producing milk for human consumption.

Storage Condition:
- Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C away from light.
- Used within 3 months after opening when stored at temperature 30°C.

Packing:
Carton box containing amber glass vials (Type II) of 30 ml, 50 ml, 100 ml, 250 ml or 500 ml Injectable solution with chlorobutyl rubber stopper (Type I) and aluminium cap+ label and insert leaflet.

Manufactured by:
ADWIA Co. S.A.E. 10th of Ramadan City
Made In Egypt
name: Levamisole 7.5%

description:
Anthelmintic (Imidazothiazole)

COMPOSITION:
Each ml contains:
- Levamisole Hydrochloride 118 mg (eq to Levamisole base 100 mg)

INDICATIONS:
LEVAPAN 10% injection is indicated for cattle and sheep for the treatment and control of:
1- Gastrointestinal worms: Bunostomum spp., Chabertia spp., Cooperia spp., Haemonchus spp., Nematodirus spp., Oesophagostomum spp., Ostertagia spp., Strongyloides spp., Trichostrongylus spp.
2- Lungworms: Dictyocaulus spp.

DOSE:
3 ml LEVAPAN 10% injection per 40 kg body weight by subcutaneous route as a single dose. Repeat after 21 days.

WITHDRAWAL PERIODS:

Three years

name: Levapan 10%

description:
Anthelmintic (Imidazothiazole)

Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Levamisole HCL 100 mg (a.i.)

Properties
- AVISOLE Is effective against the parasitic round worms which are resistant to benzimidazoles.
- Levamisole hydrochloride which is the active ingredient of AVISOLE has a paralyzing action on the gastro-intestinal and lungs nematodes and most of them are expelled within one hour.
- AVISOLE can reach its peak blood level within one hour after the injection and is eliminated mainly through the faeces & urine.
- AVISOLE is highly potent at low dosage within minimum side-effect and abroad safety margin.
- It is well tolerated by all animals species & poultry.
- AVISOLE promotes maturation of the precurrsor T-cells into fully functioning lymphocytes.
- It has a great benefits for the immunologically stressed animals and birds.
- It has the capacity to enhance both humoral and cellular immunity as well as immune response.
- AVISOLE has no undesirable effect on the production of eggs, its fertility and its hatchability.

Indications
- AVISOLE is the most powerful Antinematodal drug effective for all species of animals and poultry.
- It is recommended effectively for both larval and adult stages of nematodes in the gastro-intestinal tract and lungs.

Dosage and administration
- Single dose by subcutaneous injection into the neck muscles.
- Cattle, Sheep and Goat: 3 ml/ 40 kg b. wt. (Equivalent to 7.5 mg/kg b. wt.), As immune stimulant administer half of the above dose.
- Poultry: 0.2-0.3 ml AVISOLE per 1 kg once by subcutaneous injection.

Withdrawal period
- Meat: cattle: 28 days.
- Sheep: 15 days.
- Milk: Not to be used in dairy cattle.

Storage:
Store in a dark place at a temperature below 30°C.

Packing:
100 and 50 ml amber injection glass bottles.
name: Avisole 10%

description:
Anthelmintic (Imidazothiazole)

Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Levamisol hydrochlorid 11.79 gm (eq. to 10 gm base)

Properties :
Levamisole acts as a cholinergic agonist nicotine-like, and performs a depolarizing neuromuscular blockade for spastic paralysis of the nematodes. The anthelmintic effect has been using one to three hours after application. In addition to its anthelmintic effect of levamisole also has immune-stimulating properties .

Indications
For treatment of cattle, sheep and pigs infected with gastrointestinal nematodes and lungworms.

Cattle:
Infections with adult stages of Dictyocaulus viviparus, Haemonchus placei, Ostertagia ostertagi, Trichostrongylus spp. (Axei T., T. colubriformis, T. vitrinus), Cooperia spp. (C. oncophora, C. punctata, C. pectinata), Nematodirus helvetianus, Bunostomum phlebotomum, Oesophagostomum radiatum, Chabertia ovina and Toxocara vitulorum and with non-inhibited larval stages of Dictyocaulus, Haemonchus, Cooperia spp. Nematodirus, Bunostomum, Oesophagostomum, Chabertia.

Sheep:
Infections with adult stages of Dictyocaulus filaria, Haemonchus contortus, Ostertagia spp. (O. circumcincta, O. trifurcata), Trichostrongylus spp. (Axei T., T. colubriformis, T. vitrinus), Strongyloides papillosus, Cooperia spp. (C. curticei, C. oncophora), Nematodirus spp. (Abnormalis N., N. battus, N. fillicollis, N. helvetianus, N spathiger), Bunostomum trigonocephalum, Oesophagostomum spp. (O.venulosum, O. columbianum), and Chabertia ovina and with larval stages (including inhibited forms) of Ostertagia spp. Haemonchus, Trichostrongylus spp. Nematodirus and Chabertia.

pigs:
Infections with adult stages of Ascaris suum, Strongyloides ransomi, Hyostrongylus rubidus, Oesophagostomum spp. (O. dentatum, O. quadrispinulatum) and Metastrongylus with apri and larval stages of Metastrongylus spp.

Target Species : Cattle, sheep , pigs

Dosage:
For active Ingredient:
7.5 mg of levamisole / kg & repeat the same dose after 3 weeks

For whole product:
2 ml of product /25 kg & repeat the same dose after 3 weeks .

Warnings & Precautions
- Not more than 10 ml should be injected at one point
- Avoid too frequent and repeated use of anthelmintics a class over a longer period to prevent resistant to levamisol .

Contra – Indications
- Do not use in animals intended for milk production for human consumption .
- The drug should not be used during pregnancy and in the presence of severe disturbances of general health .

Side Effects
Transient coughing; overdosage may cause transient muscle tremors, salivation, nervous symptoms, and colic; Slight reaction at injection site .

Withdrawal Time:
Cattle, sheep, pig: Meat and offal: 8 days

Storage condition:
In the original pack, at temperature not exceeding 30ºC and Keep out reach of children

Packaging:
Brown glass bottle type iii of 100 ml injectable solution

description:
Anthelmintic (Imidazothiazole)

Composition
Each 100 ml contains
- Levamisole Hydrochloride 7.5 gm

- Levamiazole contains levamisole that is the levo isomer of tetramisole.
- The levo-isomer is the only active portion of racemic tetramisole.

Indications:
Levamisole works against the more common Nematodes as Haemonchus S.P., Nematodirus S.P., Trichostrongylus S.P., Cooperia S.P., Neoascaris vitulorum, Ascaris sum, Chabertia S.P., Oesophagostomum S.P., Bunostomum S.P., Ostertagia S.P., Dictyocaulus S.P., Levamisole acts against both the larvae and the adult forms. Therefore, the activity spectrum of Levanmisole includes the majority of the gastro-intestinal roundworms and lungworms in cattle, sheep and goats and gastrointestinal roundworms in pigs. One of the more important characteristics of Levamizole is its speed action; it can act against the parasites within a very short time from the injection time (in some cases within few minutes).

Dosage and Administration
- By subcutaneous injection
- Cattle: 10 ml / 100 kg of body w.
- Sheep, goat & Pigs: 1 ml / 10 kg body wt.

Precautions:
- Not to be given during treatment by organophosphorous compounds.
- Must not be administered to animal under stress.

Side effects:
- Even at therapeutic doses, mild side effects may appear in hypersensitive animals, such as restlessness, diarrhea, muscular tremors.

Withdrawal time:
- 14 Days, Not to be given to animals producing milk for human use.

Storage
Stored at a temperature not exceeding 30 C, protect from light.

Package:
Bottles of 100, 250 ml

Product of
VETWIC VETERINARY DIVISION
El-Nasr Pharmaceutical chemicals co.
Abu zaabal - Egypt
name: Levamisole 7.5%

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains
- Flunixin meglumine  166 mg (as flunixin 100 mg)

Properties:
Flunixin meglumine is a relatively potent non-narcotic, non-steroidal analgesic with anti-inflammatory, anti-endotoxic, and antipyretic properties. Flunixin meglumine acts as a reversible inhibitor of cyclo-oxygenase, an important enzyme in the arachidonic acid cascade pathway which is responsible for converting arachidonic acid to cyclic endoperoxides. Consequently, the synthesis of eicosanoids, important mediators of the inflammatory process involved in central pyresis, pain perception, and tissue inflammation is inhibited. Through its effects on the arachidonic acid cascade, flunixin also inhibits the production of thromboxane, a potent platelet pro-aggregator and vasoconstrictor which is released during blood clotting. Flunixin exerts its antipyretic effect by inhibiting prostaglandin E2 synthesis in the hypothalamus. By inhibiting the arachidonic acid cascade pathway, flunixin also produces an anti-endotoxic effect by suppressing eicosanoid formation and therefore preventing their involvement in endotoxin-associated disease states. The product has been shown to have some benefits in the treatment of experimental acute pulmonary emphysema (fog fever).

Indications:
In horses, indicated for:
• The alleviation of inflammation and pain associated with musculoskeletal disorders.
• The alleviation of visceral pain associated with colic.
• Treatment of endotoxemia or septic shock associated with gastric torsion.
• Other conditions in which the circulation of the blood to the gastrointestinal tract is compromised.

In cattle, indicated for:
• The control of acute inflammation associated with respiratory disease.
• Used also as adjunctive therapy in the treatment of acute mastitis.

Dosage & administration:
• For intravenous administration.

» Horses:
- For use in equine colic & musculo-skeletal disorders: 0.5 ml / 45 kg b.wt. once daily for 5 days.
- For the treatment of endotoxemia or septic shock associated with gastric torsion and with other conditions in which the circulation of blood to the gastrointestinal tract: 11 ml / 45 kg b.wt. every 8-6 hrs. for up to 5 consecutive days.

» Cattle: 1 ml / 45 kg b.wt., repeat as necessary at 24-hour intervals for up to 5 consecutive days.

Warnings and precautions:
• Horses intended for racing and competition should be prevented from racing or competing when in need of treatment.
• Horses that have been recently treated should be dealt with according to local requirements.
• Cattle should be treated with flunixin in conjunction with disease-specific therapy and an improvement in housing conditions.
• Avoid intra-arterial injection.

Contraindications:
• Do not exceed the recommended dose or the duration of treatment.
• Do not administer to pregnant mares.
• Do not use in animals suffering from cardiac, hepatic, or renal disease.
• Do not use in dehydrated animals suffering from ileus-associated colic.
• Do not use the product within 48 hours before the expected parturition in cows.
• Do not use in mares producing milk for human consumption.

Side effects:
Flunixin meglumine is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). Untoward effects include gastrointestinal irritation, ulceration, and in dehydrated or hypovolemic animals, potential for renal damage.

Withdrawal times:
Cattle:
- Meat & offal: 7 days.
- Milk: 36 hours.

Horses:
- Meat & offal: 7 days.

Storage conditions:
Store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C and use immediately after opening.

Packaging:
The carton box contains an insert leaflet and one colorless transparent type II glass vial contains 20 or 50 ml injectable solution and is closed with chlorobutyl rubber stopper oversealed with an aluminium seal.

Manufactured by Delta Pharma for Pharmaceutical industries for WAYZON Company

description:
Anthelmintic (Halogenated Phenol)

Composition:
Each ml contains:
- Nitroxinil 340 mg

Properties:
Nitroxinil is a fasciolicide which is only active by injection. Nitroxinil is a substituted phenol that inhibits the phosphorylation in the cell mitochondria of worms and, consequently, blocks this channel of energy production. Nitroxinil is active against adult fluke (and 6-week-old worms at 2 time the normal dose). If given orally, reduction of the nitro group by microorganisms of the rumen causes losses of anthelminitic activity.

Indications:
1- Flucare is indicated for the treatrment of fascioliasis (infestations of mature and immature Fasciola hepatica) in cattle and sheep.
2- It is also effective, at the recommended dose rate, against adult and larval infestations of Haemonchus contortus in cattle and sheep and Haemonchus placei, Oesophagostomum radiatum and Bunostomum phlebotomum in cattle.

Target species:
Ruminants (cattle and sheep)

Dosage & administration:
- administration by subcutaneous injection.
- Cattle & Sheep: 3 ml / 100 Kg B.Wt. (1 ml / 34 Kg B.Wt.)
- In case of Acute fascioliosis: 2 ml / 45 Kg B.Wt. (1 ml / 22.6 Kg B.Wt.)

Precautions & Warnings:
1- Do not use in Cattle & Sheep producing milk for human consumption.
2- Small swellings are occasionally observed at the injection site in cattle. These can be avoided by injecting the dose in two separate sites and massaging well to disperse the solution.
3- No systemic effects are to be expected when animals (including pregnant cows and ewes) are treated at normal dosage.
4- Ensure the injection does not enter subcutaneous muscle.
5- Ewes in advanced pregnancy should be handled and dosed carefully.
6- Estimate the weight of the sheep carefully and use injection equipment calibrated to accurately deliver the calculated dosage.

Contra-indications:
1- Hypersensitivity to the active ingredient.
2- Do not exceed stated dose (The maximum tolerated dose of nitroxynil is only four times the therapeutic dose.

Side effects:
1- Solution may stain wool if accidental spillage occurs.
2- Transient swelling at injection site in cattle.

Withdrawal period:
Cattle & Sheep: Meat 60 days.

Storage Condition:
- Store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C away from light.
- Used within 3 months after opening when stored at a temperature 30°C.

Pack:
Cartoon box containing amber glass vials (Type II) of 30, 50 and 100 ml injectable solution with chlorobutyl rubber stopper (Type I) and aluminum cap + label + insert leaflet.

Manufactured by: ADWIA Co. S.A.E. 10th of Ramadan City
Made In Egypt

description:
Anthelmintic (Halogenated Phenol)

Composition
Each 100 ml contains:
- Nitroxynil  25 gm

Properties: 
- Dovix 25% is a fasciolicide contains Nitroxynil that belongs to the substituted phenols chemical group, which inhibit OXIdative phosphorlyzation of the worm.
- The substituted phenols act to uncouple or disconnect the mitochondrial reactions involved in electron-transport-associated events from ATP generation. This uncoupling is lethal to fasciola hepatica and other blood- Sucking helminthes. It also adversely affects fluke spermatogenesis resulting in fewer fertile eggs from surviving flukes.

Indications:
Cattle & Sheep: Dovix 25% is used for treatment of gastrointestinal distomatosis (mature forms of Fasciola hepatica & Fasciola gigantica), and nematodosis Immature and adult forms of Haemonchus contortus, Haemoncnus placel Oesophagostomum radiatum, Bunostomum phlebotum and Oestrous ovis).

Dosage instructions:
- By S/C injection only
- Cattle & Sheep: 10 mg Nitroxynil /kg bodyweight (1 ml Dovix 25% /25 kg bodyweight).
- lf necessary repeat the treatment not earlier than 4 weeks.

Side Effects
- Sometimes cold and some oedematous plate can appear at the site of injection that disappears quickly.

Warnings & Precautions:
- For S/C injection only.
- Not used for animals suffering from renal or hepatic failure.
- Administer the dose divided into two sites in order to avoid the appearance of oedematous plate.
- Avoid direct contact with the skin and mucous membranes of the applicant
- Do not mix with other preparations.

Withdrawal time: 28 days before slaughtering.

Store in a cool place away from direct sunlight.

Presentation:
10, 30, 50, 100, 250, 500 ml.

name: Kenavox

description:
Anthelmintic (Halogenated Phenol)

Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Nitroxynil  25 gm

Properties:
Nitroxynil is an antiparasitic of the salicylanilides class. Salicylanides are proton ionophores that act as specific uncouplers of mitochondrial oxidative phosphorylation disrupting the energtic metabolism of the parasite. The chemical structure of salicylanilides is characterized by the presence of an unstable proton. They are lipophilic molecules which allow the passage of protons across membranes, in particular of the inner mitochondrial membrane. Nitroxynil shows activity on Fasciola hepatica and on the blood sucking nematodes.

Target species:
Cattle - Sheep

Indications:
a) Trematodes (Fasciola hepatica & Fasciola gigantica).
b) Gastrointestinal nematodes (Haemonchus contortus, Oesophagostomum spp., Bunostomum spp.).
c) Skin nematodes (Parafilaria bovicola).

Dosage & Route of Administration:
• Via subcutaneous injection.
- 1 ml of the product / 25 kg b.wt.

Warnings & Precautions:
• Care should be taken to avoid the following practices because they increase the risk of development of resistance and could ultimately result in ineffective therapy:
a) Too frequent and repeated use of anthelmintics from the same class, over an extended period of time.
b) Underdosing, which may be due to underestimation of body weight, misadministration of the product, or lack of calibration of the dosing device (if any).
• Suspected clinical cases gf resistance to anthelmintics should be further investigated using appropriate tests (e.g. Faecal Egg Count Reduction Test).
• No signs of incompatibility are to be expected if Do-Nex is administered to cattle or sheep concurrently with therapeutic doses of levamisole or with clostridial vaccine.

Contraindications:
• Do not use in animals with a known hypersensitivity to active ingredient.
• Do not use in dogs as fatalities have been reported.
• Do not exceed stated dose.
• Do not retreat at intervals less than 60 days (cattle) or 49 days (sheep).

Side effects:
• Small swellings are occasionally observed at the injection site in cattle. These can be avoided by injecting the dose in two separate sites and massaging well to disperse the solution.
• No systemic ill effects are to be expected when animals (including pregnant cows and ewes) are treated at normal dosage.

Withdrawal time:
• Cattle (Meat & offal): 60 days.
• Sheep (Meat & offal): 49 days.
• Not authorised for use in cattle and sheep producing milk for human consumption including the dry period.
• Do not use during the last trimester of pregnancy in heifers which are intended to produce milk for human consumption.

Storage conditions:
• Store at temperature not more than 30°C.
• Used immediately after opening.
• Keep out of reach of children.

M.O.H Reg. No.: 2641 / 2019

Pack:
Carton box containing amber glass vial (type II) of 100 ml with outer label & inner leaflet closed with brombutyl rubber stopper and aluminum (Flip-off) with HDPE plastic cap.

MANUFACTURED BY
THE ARAB COMPANY FOR GELATIN AND PHARMACEUTICAL PRODUCTS FOR ABO EL-NAGA TRADING CO. (ATCO PHARMA)

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains
- Nitroxinil  340 mg

Properties:
Fasciodel 34% is a fasciolicide, which is effective against Fasciola hepatica infestations and has some activity against GIT nematodes.

Mode of Action:
- Nitroxinil is belong to the substituted phenols chemicals group which inhibit oxidative phosphorylation of the worm which acts to uncouple or disconnect the mitochondrial reactions involved in electron-transport-associated events from ATP generation.
- This uncoupling is lethal to Fasciola hepatica and other blood-suckling helminthes.
- It also adversely affects fluke spermatogenesis resulting in fewer infertile eggs from surviving fukes.

Indication:
Fasciodel 34% is a fasciolicide, which is effective against Fasciola hepatica infestations and has some activity against GIT nematodes:
1- Used for treatment of Fascioliasis (infestation of immature and adult Fasciola hepatica).
2- Active against adult and larva of Haemonchus contortus in cattle & sheep.
3- Active against Haemonchus placei, Oesophagostomum radiatum and Bunostomum phlebotomum in cattle.

Target Species:
Cattle & Sheep

Dosage & Administration:
Cattle & Sheep: 1.5 ml Fasciodel 34% / 50 kg. b.wt. by subcutaneous injection.

Warning & Precautions:
1- Should not be used in cattle producing milk for human consumption.
2- Should be injected in two sites to avoid the appearance of edematous plate.
3- Avoid spillage the product because it dyes hair and wool with yellow, this color disappears by washing with sodium hyposulphite.
4- Avoid contact with skin and mucous membrane of the person administering.
5- Should be used immediately within 24 days after opening.

Note:
Dairy cattle should be treated at least 15 days before calving.

Withdrawal Time:
Cattle - Sheep(slaughter): 60 days

Contra-indication:
1- Should not be used for animals suffering from renal failure.
2- Should not be used in animals with known hypersensitivity to nitroxynil.
3- Don't dilute or mix with other compounds.

Side effects:
1- Solution may stain wool if accidental spillage occurs.
2- Transient swelling at injection site in cattle.

Storage condition:
1- Don't store the product above 25°C.
2- Keep out of reach of children.

Package:
10, 30, 50, 100, 250, 500 ml and 1 liter in glass vials with outer label and insert leaflet in carton box.

Manufactured by:
DELTA PHARMA VETERINARY SECTOR Industrial Zone B4, Area No.: 77/B 10th of Ramadan City - Egypt

description:
Composition:
- Closantel  5 gm / 100 ml

Properties:
Closantel belongs to the salicylanilide family, its rapid mode of action on the parasite at several levels explains its effectiveness:
- Dephosphorylating action on the mitochondria of the cell by depriving them of their energy source “ATP”.
- Action on the energy reserves of the parasite thus inhibiting its nutrition.
- Rapid action on the integument of the parasite, causing in 24 hours large lesions on the integument of Fasciola hepatica, which could explain, with its neuromuscular action, the loss of motility observed in this parasite.
- Fast neuromuscular spastic action induced rapid and early spastic paralysis of the parasite.

Target species: Cattle, sheep.

Directions:
Prevention and treatment of hepatic distomatosis and fasciolosis in larval and adult stages, hypodermosis and oestrosis in larval stages and infestations by hematophagous nematodes in larval and adult stages: Haemonchus contortus, Haemonchus placei, Bunostomum phlebotomum, Oesophagostomum radiatum, Chabertia ovis.

Dosage and methods of administration:
Cattle: by subcutaneous route.
- Gastrointestinal distomatosis and nematodes: 0.5 ml / 10 kg in single doses.
- Hypodermosis: 1 ml / 10 Kg in a single dose.

Sheep: by subcutaneous route.
- Oestrosis and gastrointestinal nematodes: 0.5 ml / 10 kg in a single dose.
- Distomatosis 1 ml / 10 Kg in single dose.

Special precautions:
- Some cattle breeds such as the Charolais have a predisposition to anaphylactic reactions (2%).
- Do not use milk from treated animals for human consumption.

Contraindications:
Not described at therapeutic doses.

Interactions:
Do not use at the same time as organochlorines.

Side effects :
Possibility of having sporadic inflammation at the injection site.

Overdose:
- At therapeutic doses, Caliersantel is non-toxic and does not cause any side effects.
- In the event of an overdose, 5 times the therapeutic dose, one can have nervous reactions which can be treated.

Waiting time:
Meat: 28 days.

Storage:
In a cool, dry place away from light.

Presentations:
100 ml, 250 ml
name: Caliersantel

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Closantel (as Closantel Sodium Dihydrate) 125 mg
- Ivermectin 5 mg

Properties
- IVECLOSA is a member of the salicylanilide class of anthelmintics. Salicylanilides are hydrogen (proton) ionophores (Referred to as oxidative phosphorylase uncouplers.) The chemical structure of salicylanilides illustrates the possession of a detachable proton. This type of molecule is lipophilic and is known to shuttle protons across membranes, in particular the inner mitochondrial membrane. Closantel acts by uncoupling oxidative phosphorylation. Closantel is a parasiticide with flukicide activity and efficacy against certain other helminths and arthropods. Ivermectin is effectively treatment & control internal and external parasites in Cattle and Sheep, 

- Ivermectin is derived from the family avermectins, which are isolated from fermentation of the soil organism Streptomyces avermitilis. Ivermectin paralyzes and ultimately kills parasitic nematodes, arachnoids, and insects by a unique effect on the nervous systems of these parasites. Ivermectin action is due to a neurotransmitter chemical that serves as a signal from one nerve cell to another or from a nerve cell to a muscle cell and is called gamma amino butyric acid (GABA), In round worms Ivermectin stimulates the release of GABA from nerve endings and enhances binding of GABA to a special receptors at nerve Junctions, thus interrupting nerve impulses and leading to paralysis and death of the parasite. The same effect occurs in mites & lice. Ivermectin has no effect on acetylcholine which is the principal peripheral neurotransmitter in mammals and does not readily penetrate the central nervous system of mammals were GABA functions as neurotransmitter.

Indications
Cattle & Sheep: For the treatment of mixed trematode (fluke) and nematode or arthropod infestations due to gastrointestinal roundworms, lungworms, eyeworms, warbles, mites and lice of cattle.

Dosage and administration
- Single dose by subcutaneously injection.
- Cattle & Sheep: 1 ml per 25 kg b. wt. (eq 200 μg Ivermectin per 1 kg b. wt., and 5 mg closantel per 1 kg b. wt.)
- For the treatment and control of sheep scab can be repeated after 7 days.
- Note: Do not administer more than 10 ml in one injection site.

Withdrawal period
Cattle: 49 days.
Sheep: 28 days.
Milk: Do not use in animals producing milk for human consumption.

Precautions:
- IVECLOSA is not for intravenous or intramuscular injection.

Storage:
Store in a dark place at a temperature below 25°C.

Packing:
20, 50 & 100 ml amber glass injection bottles.
name: Iveclosa

description:
Anthelmintic (Salicylanilide)

Composition
Each 100 ml contains:
- Rafoxanide   7.5 gm

Properties
- Rafoxanide acts by uncoupling oxidative phosphorylation of flukes, including reduced ATP levels, decreased glycogen content and accumulation of succinate.
- Rafoxanide also binds strongly to plasma proteins and is inactive until ingested by the parasite and separated from the plasma albumin by digestion. For this reason rafoxanide does not affect the host’s mitochondria in vivo. Only blood-sucking nematodes and flukes residing in the bile, through which salicylanilides are excreted from the host’s body, are susceptible to rafoxanide.

Indications
- Rafoxanide is used as fasciolicide in cattle and, sheep active against adult and immature flukes aged 6 to 8 weeks and older.
- Rafoxanide is also active against gastrointestinal nematodes (Haemonchus, Bunostomum, Oesophagostomum, and Gaigeria species) and against the sheep nasal bot fly (Oestrus ovis)..

Target species
Cattle and Sheep & Goats

Dosage instructions
- By S/C injection only
- Cattle: 1 ml RAFOXANIDE 7.5% / 10 kg bodyweight.
- Sheep & Goats: 2.5 ml RAFOXANIDE 7.5% / 25 kg bodyweight

Contra Indications
- Do not administer to animals with known hypersensitivity to the active ingredient.
- It should not be used in newly born domestic animals.

Side Effects
- None known

Withdrawal time
Meat – 28 days

Storage condition
Store in temperature not exceeding 30°C. And used after opening for 30 days at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Packaging:
Carton box containing amber glass vials type I filled with 10, 30, 50, 100, 200, 250 and 500 ml solution with red chlorobutyl rubber stoppers capped with aluminium cap withouter label and inner leaflet.

Manufactured by:
Arab Company For Medical Products (ARABCOMED)
Obour City - Industrial Area - Cairo - Egypt
name: Rafoxanide 7.5%

description:

Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Rafoxanide  75 mg

Properties:
Rafoxanide is an effective anthelmintic against adult and immature liver flukes (Fasciolasis) and Haemonchus spp. in sheep and cattle. It acts by uncoupling oxidative phosphorylation.

Indications:
Flukanil 7.5% is indicated for the treatment of the following parasites in:
• Liver flukes infestation caused by Fasciola spp.
• Haemochiosis caused by Haemonchus spp.

Target species:
Cattle and sheep

Dosage and administration:
- 1 ml Flukanil 7.5% / 25 kg b.wt. SC injection only as a single dose.
- The recommended dose might be repeated within 3 weeks.

Side-effects:
Local swelling at injection sites may be occur.

Contra-indication:
- Not to be used for dairy animals.
- Not to be injected IV or IM.

Warnings and precautions:

Withdrawal time:

Storage:

For Veterinary Use Only

Reg. No.: 3224/2009

Pharma Swede - Egypt
10th of Ramadan City - B3

description:
Anthelmintic (Salicylanilide)

COMPOSITION	
Each 100 ml. contains:
- Rafoxanide 7.5 gm

INDICATIONS	
- RAFOXAJECT is indicated for the treatment of different parasites affecting cattle and Sheep such as:
• liver flukes infestation (adult and young flukes 6-10 week age).
• Blood sucking nematodes [especially those resistant to other anthelmintics such as Haemonchus spp , Bunostomum spp
• it is used also to control nasal bot fly ( Oestrus Ovis ) in Sheep.

DOSAGE

- Cattle , Buffaloes & Sheep : 1 ml RAFOXAJECT 7.5% / 25 kgs. B.wt

name: Rafoxaject 7.5%

description:
Composition:
Each 1ml contains:
- Ivermectin 10 mg
- Rafoxanide 125 mg

Mode Of Action:
- The mode of action of Ivermectin against the parasites is related to the inhibition of the parasite motility.
- It apparently increases the release of γ-aminobutyric acid (GABA) from the synaptosomes of the nervous system, which inhibit the neurotransmission.
- Increasing release of GABA increases the normal resting potential of postsynaptic cells making it difficult for neurotransmission of stimuli to muscles and muscle cells do not contract.
- Under the influence of Ivermectins the parasites are paralyzed and consequently expelled.
- Although paralysis is the most evident effect of Ivermectin, suppression of the reproductive function has been observed in ticks.
- It does interrupt feeding, molting and egg production, so that reducing the reproductive potential of ticks.
- Rafoxanide acts by uncoupling or disconnecting the mitochondrial reaction involved in electron - transport - associated events from ATP generation.
- This uncoupling is lethal to Fasciola spp. and other blood sucking helminthes as Haemonchus, Bunostomum, Oesophagostomum, and Oestrus ovis.

Indications
- RAMECTIN (Ivermectin & Rafoxanide) is an injectable Endecto-parasiticide for cattle and sheep.
- Single low-volume dose kills internal parasites (including liver fluke) and external parasites.
- Ivermectin is a broad-spectrum antiparasitc agent, which is effective against internal and external parasites.
- Rafoxanide is active against immature and adult liver flukes and some internal and external parasites.
- Cattle: Gastrointestinal round worms, Lungworms, liver fluke, Skin worms, Eye worms, Cattle Grubs, Mange Mites, Sucking Lice, Screwworm Fly, Sand Fly Tampans & ticks.
- Sheep: Gastrointestinal round worms, Lungworms, liver fluke, Nasal Bot and Mites.
In case of heavy infestations a second dose 7 days after the first injection is required.

Dosage:
•  0.25 ml / 25 kg by S/C only
- Heavier animals should receive an additional 0.5 ml for each 25 kg over 100 kg.In case of heavy infestations a second dose 7 days after the first injection is required.

Withdrawal period:
•  Meat: 50 days
name: Ramectin

Composition:
Each ml contains:
- Tulathromycin  100 mg
name: Tuladrax

description:
Composition:
Each pack (110 gm) contains:
- Tylosin Tartrate 110 gm (eq to Tylosin Base 100 gm)

Properties:
- Tylosin is one of the macrolide antibiotics. It acts through inhibiting protein synthesis by binding with 50S ribosomal subunits. 
- Tylosin is a bacteriostatic antibiotic act against Gram-positive bacteria, Spirochaetes including leptospira and mainly against mycoplasmas isolated from chickens and turkeys.

Indications: Tylovet is used in the treatment of:
- Chronic respiratory disease (CRD) caused by Mycoplasma gallisepticum and Mycoplasma synoviae sensitive to tylosin in broiler and replacement chickens.
- Chronic respiratory disease (CRD) caused by Mycoplasma gallisepticum sensitive to tylosin at time of vaccination or other stress in chickens.
- As an aid in the control of necrotic enteritis caused by Clostridia perfringens in chickens.
- Infectious sinusitis caused by Mycoplasma gallisepticum sensitive to tylosin in turkeys.

Dosage:
- To be added to drinking water.
- Broiler Chickens and turkeys: 55 gm Tylovet / 100 litres of drinking water for 3 – 5 days.

Withdrawal period:
- Broiler Chickens: 1 day.
- Turkey: 5 days.

Side effects:
- May induce diarrhea.

Contra-indication & Warnings:
- Not to be used in layers producing eggs for human consumption.

Packs:
110, 550 & 1100 gm
name: Tylovet

description:
Composition:
Each 1 gm contains:
- Tylosin Tartrate 110 mg (eq to Tylosin base 100 mg)
- Doxycycline HCl 133 mg (eq to Doxycycline base 125 mg)

Indications:
- Tydovet is indicated for the treatment of respiratory and gastrointestinal infections caused by tylosin and/or doxycycline sensitive microorganisms like E. coli, Salmonella, Pasteurella, Bordetella, Haemophilus, Campylobacter, Streptococcus and Mycoplasma spp., in poultry, calves, lambs and kids.

Dosage and administration:
- Calves, lambs and kids: 1 gm /10 kg for 3-5 days (10 mg tylosin + 12.5 mg doxycycline / 1kg)
- Broilers: 1 gm / 1 liter of drinking water for 3-5 days (100 ppm tylosin + 125 ppm doxycycline)

Withdrawal time:
- Calves, lambs and kids: 21 days.
- Broilers : 10 days.

Contraindications:
- Ruminants with developed rumen.
- Laying hens.
- Not to be used in case of hypersensitivity to tetracycline group or macrolide ,serious impaired liver functions and concurrent administration with bactericidal agents like penicillins.

Drug interaction :
- The absorption of tetracycline group from GIT is decreased by milk and milk products, anti acids, kaolin, and iron preparations.
- Macrolide antibiotic probably should not be used with chloramphenicol or the lincosamides since they may compete for the 50 S ribosomal binding site.

Packs: 100, 500 & 1000 gm
name: Tydovet

description:
Composition:
Each ml contains:
- Toltrazuril  25 mg

Properties:
Toltrazuril is an anticoccidial of the triazinetrione group, active against Eimeria spp. Toltrazuril induces changes in the fine structure of the developmental stages of coccidia. These are caused primarily by swelling of the endoplasmic reticulum and of the Golgi apparatus, abnormal changes to the perinuclear space and disturbances in cell division. Toltrazuril causes a decrease in the activity of respiratory chain enzymes in the parasites.

Indications:
For the treatment of coccidiosis in chickens and turkeys, caused by infections with various species of Eimeria in chickens: E. acervulina, E. brunetti, E. maxima, E. mitis, E. necatrix, E. tenella, and turkeys: E. adenoides and E. meleagrimitis.

Target species:
• Chickens (broilers, pullets and breeders).
• Turkey.

Dosage and administration:
» For active ingredient: 7 mg / kg bodyweight for 2 consecutive days; 24 hours continuously for 8 hours each day in the drinking water. or In cases of restricted water uptake (e.g. pullets on feed restriction or concurrent disease) treatment may be for 3 days.
» For whole product: 28 ml of product / 100 kg to be added to water, estimate water consumption of the flock to ensure that the birds are dosed for the correct time.

Contraindications & precautions:
• Do not use in birds with hypersensitivity to the active substance or to any of the excipients.
• Should not be used in birds producing eggs for human consumption.
• For best results, treatment should be initiated before the clinical signs of disease have spread throughout the whole group.
• It is important to keep to the recommended dose in order to minimize the risk of resistance.
• No other source of drinking water should be available to birds during treatment period.
• Tolycox mixes with all types of water. However in areas where the drinking water is acidic, the water should be tested with pH test strips and brough to a minimum pH of 8.5 using sodium carbonate (washing soda).

Withdrawal time:
• Chickens & Turkeys: 16 days.

Packaging:
Plastic bottles of 50 ml, 100 ml, 200 ml, 250 ml, 500 ml, 1 L and 5 L.

Storage:
• Store below 30°C (room temperature) in the closed, original container, as cool as possible.
• Keep out of reach and sight of children.

Produced by:
UNITED CO. or Chemicals & Medical Preparations (UCCMA)
name: Tolycox 2.5%

description:
COMPOSITION
- Dexamethasone sodium phosphate eq. 2 mg dexamethasone
- Excipients up to 1 ml.

PHARMACOLOGICAL PROPERTIES
Dexamethasone is a very potent synthetic glucocorticosteroid, its anti-inflammatory effects being 30 times stronger than those of cortisone and 7-10 times stronger than those of prednisolone. In addition to its antiphlogistic properties, dexamethasone also shows extraordinary anti-allergic, anti-stress and gluconeogenetic activities. Mineralcorticoid activity is minimal.

INDICATIONS
- Metabolic disorders such as: ketosis in cattle and puerperal toxaemia in ewes and sows.
- Non-infectious inflammatory processes, especially acute musculoskeletal infammations such as: arthritis, periarthritis, tendovaginitis, bursitis, luxations, myositis, osselets and sprains.
- As an aid in acute infectious diseases (e.g. acute mastitis, metritis, pneumonia, polyarthritis in calves) in combination with suitable anti-infectious therapy.
- Allergic conditions, e.g. asthma, allergic skin affections (eczema, urticaria, pruritis, ...), snake-bites.
- Stress and shock conditions.
- Induction of parturition in ruminants during the last stage of pregnancy (delivery within 2-4 days).

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION:
» By intravenous, intramuscular or subcutaneous (dogs, cats) injection:
- Cats, dogs: (0.1 - 0.2 mg / kg b.w.) 0.25 - 0.5 ml/5 kg 
- Cattle, horses: (2.5 - 5 mg / 100 kg b.w.) 5 - 10 ml/400 kg 
- Sheep, goats, calves: (2 - 4 mg / 50 kg) 1 - 2 ml / 50 kg 
*If necessary repeat with 2 days intervals in dogs and cats and 3-4 days intervals in other animals.

• For induction of parturition in cows (given within 1 week before expected calving date): (5 mg / 100 kg b.w.) 2.5 ml / 100 kg.
• Puerperal toxaemia and induction of parturition in sheep and goats: (2.5 mg / 10 kg b.w.) 6 ml / 50 kg.
• Shock therapy: by slow I.V. injection of high doses (10 x), eventually to be repeated after 8-12 h. 

» By intraarticular injection: according to the extension of joint and animal weight: 0.25 ml to 4 ml.

CONTRA-INDICATIONS
Cardiac and renal insufficiencies, hypercorticism (Cushing’s Syndrome), diabetes, osteoporosis, viraemia, simultaneous vaccination.

PRECAUTIONS
- Special care should be taken if used during the last trimester of pregnancy (Partus induction and premature parturition may occur).
- If infection is present or suspected, corticoid therapy should be supported by appropriate antimicrobial therapy (suppression of immune response). 
- Long-term treatment with higher doses may cause symptoms of hypercorticism.
- Since abrupt cessation of chronic administration may result in adrenocortical insufficiency (symptoms of hypocorticism), gradual withdrawal is advisable following a prolonged course of administration.

ADVERSE EFFECTS
Allergic reactions and laminitis; decrease of milk production; retentio secundinarum, endometritis and birth of premature calves after induction of parturition.

PACK SIZE:
50 ml.

KELA N.V. – Belgium
name: Dexakel 02

description:
COMPOSITION
Each 100 ml contains:
- Amoxicillin as trihydrate 15 gm
- Propylparaben 0.14 gm

CHARACTERISTICS
- Amoxicillin, a beta-lactam antibiotic, provides bactericidal antibacterial activity against a wide range of Giram negative (e g. Colibacilli, Salmonella, Pasteurella) and Gram positive pathogens (e g. Staphylococci, Streptococci, Cornynebacteria).
- The excipient based on cellulose polymer allows for an extended anti-infective action (48 hours per IM route).
- The suspension remains fluid in the vial and is therefore easy to inject. At the injection site, gel formation occurs which is later follawed by total solubilization of the polymer.
- LONGAMOX is well tolerated locally without leaving a trace at the injection site.

INDICATION
- Antibacterial sensitive to Amoxicillin in cattle, pigs and sheep.

DOSAGE OF USAGE
- Shake before use
- 1 ml for 10 kg animal body weight.
- Maximum administration of 20 ml per injection.
- Administration 2 times with an interval of 48 hours.

WITHDRAWAL
- Meat: Beef 35 days, Goat 21 days, Pig 27 days.
- Milk: After 5 times milking.

STORAGE CONDITIONS
Store at temperature not exceeding 25°C.
name: Longamox

description:
Composition
Each 100 ml contains:
- Oxytetracycline HCL  5.4 gm (eq to Oxytetracycline base 5 gm)

Properties
- Oxytetracycline is a bacteriostatic antibiotic that inhibits protein synthesis in susceptible bacteria. Inside the cell it binds irreversibly to receptors on the 30S subunit of the bacterial ribosome where it interferes with the binding of the aminoacyl-transfer RNA to the acceptor site on the messenger RNA ribosome complex. This effectively prevents the addition of amino acids to the elongating peptide chain, inhibiting protein synthesis.
- In vitro, oxytetracycline is active against a range of both Gram-positive and Gram-negative micro organisms including: Streptococcus spp., Staphylococcus spp., L. monocytogenes, M. haemolytica, H. parahaemolyticus and B. bronchiseptica.

Indications:
The product is indicated for use in Cattle, sheep, pigs, horses, dogs and cats in the treatment of infections caused by organisms sensitive to oxytetracycline.
- Atrophic rhinitis caused by Bordetella bronchiseptica, Mannheimia haemolytica and Pasteurella multocida.
- Navel/joint ill caused by Arcanobacterium pyogenes, E. coli or Staphylococcus aureus.
- Mastits caused by Corynebacterium pyogenes, E. coli, Staphylococcus aureus, Streptococcus agalactiae or Streptococcus uberis.
- Metritis caused by E. coli or Streptococcus pyogenes.
- Pasteurellosis and infections of the respiratory tract caused by Mannheimia haemolytica and Pasteurella multocida.
- Septicaemia caused by Salmonella dublin and Streptococcus pyogenes.
- Erysipelas caused by Erysipelothrix rhusiopathiae.

Target species
Cattle, sheep, pigs, horses, dogs and cats

Dosage & Administration
- Intramuscular or intravenous injection in large animals, subcutaneous or intramuscular injection in small animals
- The recommended general dosage rate is 0.6 -2 ml of Oxy-Five /10 kg bodyweight once daily for 5 days.
-- Horse: 1 ml of Oxy-Five / 10 kg bodyweight once daily for 5 days.
-- Foal : 2 ml of Oxy-Five / 10 kg bodyweight once daily for 5 days.
-- Cow: 0.6 ml of Oxy-Five / 10 kg bodyweight once daily for 5 days.
-- Calf, Pig, Sheep and lamb: 1.6 ml of Oxy-Five / 10 kg bodyweight once daily for 5 days.
-- Sow/boar: 1 ml of Oxy-Five / 10 kg bodyweight once daily for 5 days.
-- Dog and Cat : 2 ml of Oxy-Five / 10 kg bodyweight once daily for 5 days.

Warnings & Precautions
- Maximum recommended dose at any one site: 20 ml. cattle; 10 ml sheep, pig.
- Repeat doses should be administered at different sites, and the sites massaged well after injection.
- Intravenous injections must be given slowly over a period of at least one minute.
- As with other tetracyclines, caution should be exercised in treating horses under stress.
- Caution in animals with hepatic or renal impairment.
- The use of tetracyclines during the period of tooth and bone development, including late pregnancy, may lead to discolouration.
- It is not recommended to administer bacteriostatic and bactericidal antibiotics concurrently.
- Not for intravenous administration in dogs or cats.

Contra Indications
Not to be administered to horses during concomitant therapy with corticosteroids

Side Effects
- A transient swelling may be observed following intramuscular administration in horses and subcutaneous administration in dogs.
- Photodermatitis may occur after treatment if exposure to intense sunlight occurs.

Withdrawal time
Cattle:
- Meat : 35 days
- Milk – 6 days

Sheep:
- Meat : 14 days
- Milk : Not to be used in sheep producing milk for human consumption

Pigs:
- Meat :14 days

Storage condition
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C and used after opening for 50 days at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Packaging
Glass vials : 10, 30, 50, 100, 200, 250 & 500 ml .
name: Oxy five

description:
COMPOSITION:
- Amoxicillin (as trihydrate)  150 mg / ml

TARGET SPECIES:
Cattle, pigs, dogs, cats.

INDICATIONS:
- For the treatment of infections caused by Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria that are susceptible to amoxycillin.

CONTRA-INDICATIONS:
- Do not use in animals with a history of hypersensitivity towards penicillins and cephalosporins.
- Do not use in small rodents (Guinea pigs, hamsters, gerbils, rabbits) since amoxycillin may cause fatal colitis in these species.

DOSAGE:
- 7.5 to 15 mg / kg OR 0.5 to 1 ml / 10 kg once a day.
- for 3-5 days in cattle, dogs and cats.
- for 3 days in pigs.

ROUTES OF ADMINISTRATION:
- Dogs, cats: by intramuscular or subcutaneous administration.
- Cattle, pigs: by intramuscular route only.

UNDESIRABLE EFFECTS:
Allergic reactions (skin; life-threatening anaphylaxia) may occur in hypersensitized animals.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS:
- Shake before use. Do not use by intravenous route.
- Use always a dry syringe.
- Use during pregnancy and lactation is not contra-indicated.
- Amoxykel 15 should not be mixed with other drugs in the same syringe.

PACK SIZE:
100 ml
name: Amoxykel 15

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Streptomycin Sulphate 313.2 mg (eq to streptomycin 250 mg)

Indications:
- STREPTOSOID is indicated for the treatment of:
Enteritis and diarrhea caused by Salmonella spp. and E. coli in Broiler chickens and Non-ruminating calves & lambs.

Dosage:
- To be added to drinking water.
- Broiler Chickens: 2 ml of STREPTOSOID / 3 liter of drinking water for 3 – 5 days.
- Non-ruminating calves & lambs: 0.9 – 1.3 ml STREPTOSOID / 10 kg B.Wt. for 3 – 5 days.

Packs:
10, 20, 30, 50, 60, 100, 250 & 500 ml
name: Streptosoid

description:
Synthetic GnRh hormone

Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Buserelin acetate: 4.2 µg (eq to 4 µg Buserelin)

Properties:
Buserelin is a peptide synthetic analogue of the natural gonadotrophin-releasing hormone GnRH. Its effect is 20 - 170 times stronger that of LH-RH, by chemical substitution of the amino acids 6 (Gly) and 10 (GlyNH). The therapeutic dose of Buserelin is about 20 times lower than that of LH-RH, as a consequence of its higher potency. The release of follicle stimulating Hormone (FSH) is improved and the effect of an injection of Buserelin corresponds to that of an injection of LH-RH.

Indications:
1. Cattle: Anoestrus, delayed ovulation, and improvement of pregnancy rate, follicular cysts, synchronisation of oestrus.
2. Horses: Induction of ovulation.
3. Rabbits: Induction of ovulation in rabbits and Improvement of conception rate
4. Trout: To facilitate stripping and reduce mortality due to egg binding in rainbow trout.

Target Species:
Cattle, horses, rabbits and trout

Dosage & administration:
• Cattle: SC or IM (preferred) or IV
- Anoestrus: 5 ml, repeated after 8-22 days if required.
- Delayed ovulation: 2.5 ml, 6-8 h, Before or at time of insemination.
- Follicular cysts: 5 ml, repeated after 10-14 days if required.
- Improvement in pregnancy rate: 2.5 ml, 6-8 h, Before or at time of insemination or 11-12 days after insemination.
- Synchronisation of oestrus: 2.5 ml, followed by PGF after 8 days then 2.5 ml, after 2 days. Insemination 20-24 hours later.

• Horses: SC or IM (preferred) or IV
- Induction of ovulation: 10 ml, 6 hours before insemination repeated after 1 day if required.

• Rabbit: SC
- Induction of ovulation: 0.2 ml, 24 hours after parturition, followed by insemination.

• Trout: IM
- Facilitate stripping and reduce mortality: 0.75-1 ml / kg body weight. Stripping performed 2-3 days after treatment.

Warnings & Precautions:
Avoid contamination of the product with traces of disinfectant or alcohol.

Contraindications: None.

Side effects: None.

Withdrawal periods
• Cattle, horses & rabbit (Meat): Nil
• Cattle (Milk): Nil
- Not to be used in fishes intended for human consumption.

Storage conditions:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C and used after opening for 24 hr. When stored at temperature 2-8°C.

Packing:
Carton box containing amber glass (type II ) vial containing 10, 25, 30, 50 or 100 ml injectable solution each closed with bromobutyl rubber stopper and fixed with aluminum cap + outer label and inner leaflet.
