3 ml Sulpha Plus /50 kg.b.wt for 3 – 5 days by IM (Preferred) or IV injection.

Horses:
3 ml Sulpha Plus /50 kg.b.wt for 3 – 5 days by slow IV (Preferred) or IM injection.

Package:	
100 ml.

Manufactured by:
DELTA PHARMA VETERINARY SECTOR Industrial Zone B4, Area No.: 77/B 10th of Ramadan City - Egypt
name: Sulpha plus

description:
Composition:
Borgal is a ready for use aqueous solution and contains in each ml:
- Sulphadoxine  200 mg
- Trimethoprim  40 mg

Properties:
Borgal is a chemotherapeutic agent with two active principles which interfere at two different points with the biosynthesis of bacteria and which, even in small doses, exert a mutually potentiating bactericidal effect. The range of activity corresponds to that of the sulphonamides and broad spectrum antibiotics.

Indications:
For the parenteral treatment of primary infections caused by gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria and secondary infections to virus diseases.

Target species:
Cattle, horses, and sheep.

Dosage:
According to body weight: about 3 ml/50 kg body weight. 
- Adult cattle and horses: 20 - 30 ml
- Young cattle, foals: 5 - 10 ml
- Calves: 3 - 5 ml
- Adult sheep: 3 - 5 ml
- Lambs: 0.5 - 1 ml

Administration:
» Cattle: Intramuscular, subcutaneous, intratracheal injection.
» Horses: Intramuscularly; by intratracheal injection.
» Sheep: Intramuscular injection.

A single injection is often sufficient. If within 24 hours no therapeutic success is achieved or if it is not sufficient, the dose may be repeated within 48 hours of the initial injection.

Notes:
- Adequate drinking water for the animals should be available during treatment. The solution may occasionally show slight crystallization at low temperature; these crystals are easily dissolved by brief warming of the bottle in hot water.
- Sale and consumption of milk from animals treated with this preparation are subject to certain legal regulations, and the usual period of time must be allowed to elapse after treatment.
- Practical tests have shown that, following intramuscular injection of twice the therapeutic dose.

Storage conditions:
Store at temp. not exceeding 30°C to be used after opening for 20 days and stored not exceeding 30°C.

Withdrawal time:
Cattle & Sheep:
- Meat: 10 days
- Milk: 96 h

Presentation:
Bottles of 100 ml.

Manufactured by:
Memphis for Pharmaceuticals & Chemical Industries according to the under license agreement between Intervet Egypt for Animal Health & Intervet Canada Corp-Canada.

L.C. Cairo R.c.c. 7686
M.O.H Reg.: 1888

MSD Animal Health
name: Borgal 24%

description:
Composition 
Each 1 ml contains: 
- Gentamicin sulphate 30 mg (eq to 20 mg base) 
- Sulfadimethoxine 200 mg
- Trimethoprim 40 mg

Indications 
Infectious processes caused by germs sensitive to gentamicin and trimethoprim-sulphonamide, including respiratory tract infections, metritis, pyelitis, pyelonephritis, cystitis, urethritis, pasteurellosis, young animals diarrhoea, mastitis.

Contraindications 
Administer the veterinary medicinal product cautiously in case of renal failure. In pregnant animals, the relation risk-benefit should be assessed although toxicity of sulphonamides during gestation has not been established. 

Adverse reactions 
- In general, the veterinary medicinal product is well tolerated, although sometimes local reactions may appear at the site of injection. 
- If you notice any serious effects or other effects not mentioned in this package leaflet, please inform your veterinary surgeon.

Target species 
Cattle, pigs, horses, sheep, dogs and cats.

Dosage and administration
- Intramuscular use. 
- 1 ml per 10 kg of body weight every 12-24 hours for 3-5 days. 
- In persistent cases, the veterinary medicinal product can be administered for 7 days or a longer period, expressly prescribed by the veterinarian. 
- In renal insufficiency, the dose will be diminished according to the renal function.

Withdrawal period 
- Meat: 30 days. Not authorised for use in horses producing meat for human consumption. 
- Milk: 4 days.

Storage precautions 
- Keep out of the sight and reach of children. 
- Protect from moisture, light and heat. 

Special warnings 
- Special warnings for each target species: Do not use in horses producing meat for human consumption. 
- Interactions: It should not be administered in conjunction with ototoxic and nephrotoxic agents. Do not associate with PABA for its antagonistic effect with sulphonamides. 
- Overdose: There are not described cases of intoxication with the veterinary medicinal product. In case of overdosage, traditional measures and symptomatic treatment should be administered.

Disposal 
Medicines should not be disposed of via wastewater or household waste. Ask your veterinary surgeon how to dispose of medicines no longer required. These measures should help to protect the environment.

Other information 
Vials of 10 ml, 40 ml, 100 ml and 250 ml. 
Not all pack sizes may be marketed. 

For animal treatment only. To be supplied only on veterinary prescription.

Invesa 
Industrial Veterinaria, S.A. 
a LIVISTO company 
Esmeralda, 19 
08950 Esplugues de Llobregat 
(Barcelona) Spain
name: Gentaprim

description:
Kombitrim 240 contains: 
– Sulfamethoxazole 200 mg 
– Trimethoprim 40 mg 
– Excipients up to 1 ml.

TARGET SPECIES:
Horses, cattle, sheep, goats, pigs, dogs, cats.

INDICATIONS:
Infections of the respiratory tract, gastro-intestinal tract, and urogenital tract, infections of skin, soft tissues and wounds and septicaemia, caused by sulphamethoxazole/trimethoprim susceptible bacteria.

CONTRA-INDICATIONS:
- Haematopoietic, renal and hepatic disturbances.
- The intravenous route of administration is contra-indicated in the case of previous or concurrent administration of central nervous system depressants (e.g. anaesthetics, neuroleptics).

DOSAGE:
- 24 mg / kg b.w. or 1 ml / 10 kg b.w. once daily or divided over 2 administrations with 12 hours intervals.
- Treatment should be continued up to 1-2 days after disappearance of clinical symptoms.

METHOD AND ROUTE OF ADMINISTRATION:
By deep intramuscular, subcutaneous or slow intravenous injection.

UNDESIRABLE EFFECTS:
- Transient local reactions (swelling, pain) at the site of injection may occur.
- Allergic reactions (e.g. polyarthritis, keratoconjunctivitis sicca, erythrema in dogs) seldom occur.
- Cardiac and respiratory shock have been observed after intravenous administration (particularly in horses).

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS:
- Kombitrim 240 may be used in pregnant animals, only if it is
therapeutically justified.
- Cardiac and respiratory shock have been observed mostly in
horses after intravenous administration.
- The intravenous route therefore only should be used if therapeutically justified and after the injectable solution is brought approximately at body temperature.
- The intravenous route of administration is contra-indicated in the case of previous or concurrent administration of central nervous system depressants (e.g. anaesthetics, neuroleptics). At the first signs of intolerance, the intravenous injection should be interrupted and shock treatment should be initiated if necessary.
- To avoid sulfonamide mediated renal toxic effects, always supply sufficient amounts of drinking water.

PACK SIZE:
50 ml, 100 ml, 250 ml
name: Kombitrim 240

description:
Composition
Each ml contains:  
- Florfenicol 300 mg

PROPERTIES:
Florfenicol is a broad-spectrum antibiotic that has activity against many bacteria. It acts by binding to 50S ribosome, thereby inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis. Florfenicol has activity against gram-positive bacteria such as Staphylococcus aureus, Streptococci and gram-negative bacteria such as Pasteurella multocida, Pasteurella haemolytica and Histophilus somni.

INDICATIONS:
• Respiratory tract infections caused by Pasteurella multocida, Pasteurella haemolytica and Histophilus somni in cattle.
• Respiratory tract infections caused by Pasteurella multocida and Pasteurella haemolytica in sheep.

DOSE:
Cattle:
- By IM route: 1 ml FLORICOL Injection per 15 kg B.wt. twice 48 hours apart.
- By SC route: 2 ml FLORICOL Injection per 15 kg B.wt. once only. (This dose can be used for prevention purpose).

Sheep:
- By IM route: 1 ml FLORICOL Injection per 15 kg B.wt. daily for 3 days.

CONTRA-INDICATION:
- Not used for adult bulls and rams intended for breeding purposes.
- Not used for lactating animals producing milk for human consumption.

SIDE EFFECTS:
- A decrease in food consumption may occur.
- Inflammatory lesions at injection sites.

WARNINGS:
The dose volume given at any injection site should not exceed 10 ml.

WITHDRAWAL TIME:
Cattle:  By IM route: 30 days.   By SC route: 44 days.
Sheep: 39 days.

Packs: 10, 20, 50 & 100 ml. sterile injection bottles.
name: Floricol

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Florfenicol  30 gm

Properties:
- Florfenicol is a fluorinated analog of chloramphenicol. It has activity against many bacteria as Pasteurella multocida, Mannheimia haemolytica, Haemophilus somnus, Fusobacterium necrophorum and melaninogenicus and Moraxella bovis in Cattle.
- It also active against Actinobacillus pleuropnemonia and Pasteurella multocida in Swine.
- Florfenicol is a synthetic broad spectrum antibiotic.
- It acts by binding to 50S ribosome thereby inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis.

Indications:
A- Cattle: Delficol 30% is indicated for the treatment of:
1- Bovine respiratory disease complex, also called shipping fever, associated with Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida and Haemophilus somnus.
2- Bovine interdigital phlegmon (foot rot, interdigital necrobacillosis, infectious pododermatitis) associated with Fusobacterium necrophorum and Bacteroides melaninogenicus
3- Infectious bovine keratoconjunctivitis (IBK, Pinkeye) caused by Moraxella bovis.

B- Swine: Delficol 30% is indicated for the treatment of: Swine respiratory diseases associated with Actinobacillus pleuropneumoniae and Pasteurella multocida.

Dosage & Route of administration:
1- Cattle:
- 6 ml / 45 kg body weight (i.e. 40 mg / kg) as a single dose by subcutaneous injection.
- 3 ml / 45 kg body weight (i.e. 20 mg / kg) kg body weight, repeated after 2 days by intramuscular injection.

2- Pigs: 2.25 ml / 45 kg body weight (i.e. 15 mg / kg), repeated after 2 days by intramuscular injection.

Warning & Precautions:
1- Should not be used for cattle producing milk for human consumption.
2- Should not be used for veal calves.
3- Do not inject more than 5 ml in a single dose.
4- Do not give I/V injection.

Withdrawal time:
- Cattle: Slaughter: 30 days after I/M injection, 44 days after S/C injection.
- Pigs: Slaughter: 18 days.

Contra-indications:
1- Not to be used for adult bulls or boars intended for breeding purposes.
2- Not to be used for pregnant or lactating sows.
3- Not to be used for operators with known hypersensitivity to propylene glycol and polyethylene glycol.

Side effects:
in cattle cause:
1- Anorexia
2- Decreases water consumption
3- Diarrhea
4- Softening of stool
5- Inflammatory lesions at the site of injection.

Packages:
10, 30, 50, 100 ml in glass vials with outer label and insert leaflet in carton box.
name: Delficol 30%

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Florfenicol 300 mg

Properties
- AVIFLOR Injection is an efficient synthetic antibiotic For Intramuscular and Subcutaneous Use in Cattle.
- Florfenicol is primarily bacteriostatic and acts by binding to the 50S ribosomal subunit and inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis.
- It was shown to be like chloramphenicol in inhibiting peptidyl transferase activity especially on 70s ribosomes.

Indications:
- AVIFLOR Injection Solution is indicated for the control and treatment of bacterial pneumonia and associated respiratory infections BRD (bovine respiratory disease) also called shipping fever or transit fever in cattle caused by susceptible P. multocida, P. haemolytica, and H. somnus.
- AVIFLOR Injection is indicted also for the treatment of Infectious Pododermatitis (foot Rot) in cattle or interdigital phlegmon (acute interdigital necrobacillosis) associated with Fusobacterium necrophorum and Bacteroides melaninogenicus.

Dosage and Administration: 
- For the treatment of Bovine Respiratory Disease and Foot Rot:
a. Two Injections Regimen: AVIFLOR Injection is administered by IM to cattle (in the neck) at a dose rate of 3 ml/45 kg b. wt., (Equivalent to 20 mg/kg b. wt.). 48 hours later a second dose is administered.
b. One Injections Regimen: AVIFLOR Injection is given by a single subcutaneous injection to cattle (in the neck) at a dose rate of 6 ml/45 kg b. wt., (40 mg/kg b. wt.)

- For the Control of Bovine Respiratory Disease:
- AVIFLOR Injection is given by a single subcutaneous injection to cattle (in the neck) at a dose rate of 6 ml/45 kg b. wt., (40 mg/kg b. wt.).

- Do not administer more than 10 ml at each site.
- The injection sites should be only in the neck.

Withdrawal period: 
- Cattle must not be slaughtered within 28 days of the last intramuscular treatment.
- Cattle must not be slaughtered within 38 days of the last subcutaneous treatment.
- Not for use in veal calves or female dairy cattle older than 20 months of age.

Special Precautions:
- In case of accidental eye exposure, flush with water for 15 minutes, consult a physician.
- In case of accidental skin exposure, wash with soap and water.

Untoward Reactions:
- Following administration some signs transient signs including decreased water consumption Inappetence, or diarrhea may show.

Over dosage:
- Over-dosage can lead to decreased feed and water consumption leading to dehydration, loss of body weight, urine acidity and increased serum enzymes, depression, and soft stool consistency.
- Treating symptoms should be preferred using symptomatic and supportive therapies.

Storage:
Store in a dark place at a temperature below 30ºC.

Packing:
10, 20, 50 and 100 ml amber glass bottles.
name: Aviflor

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Florfenicol  30 gm

Properties:
* Florfenicol is a synthetic, broad spectrum antibiotic active against mariy gram-negative and gram-positive bacteria. It acts by binding to the 50S ribosome subunit and inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis.
* Florfenicol is generally considered a bacteriostatic drug, but exhibits bactericidal activity against certain bacterial strains. In vitro and in vivo activity has been demonstrated against commonly isolated pathogens involved in bovine respiratory disease (BRD) including Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida and Haemophilus somnus.

Indications:
* For the treatment of Bovine Respiratory Disease (BRD) associated with Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida and Haemophilus somnus.

Target Species: Cattle

Dosage and Administration:
» Cattle:
* By S/C: 6.5 ml / 50 kg as a single dose.
* By I/M: 3.5 ml / 50 kg body weight, repeat after 2 days.

Warnings and Precautions:
* Do not give this drug by intravenous injection.

Contraindications:
* Not be used in cattle producing milk for human consumption.
* Adult bulls intended for breeding purposes.
* Operators with known hypersensitivity to propylene glycol.

Side Effects:
* Transient decrease in appetite and softening of stool.
* Inflammatory lesions at site of injection.

Withdrawal Time:
Cattle (Slaughter): 30 days by I.M. injection, 44 days by S.C. injection.

Storage conditions:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C and valid for 45 days after opening.

Packaging:
Carton box containing amber glass (type II) vials of 10, 20, 30, 50, 100, 250 & 500 ml with an outer label and an inner leaflet.

Manufactured by:
Arab Company For Medical Products (ARABCOMED)
Obour City - Industrial Area - Cairo - Egypt
name: Floromed 30%

description:
Description
Nuflor is a light golden solution for injection, containing 300 mg/ml florfenicol.

Activity:
Florfenicol is a bacteriostatic synthetic broad-spectrum antibiotic effective against most Gram positive and Gram negative bacteria isolated from domestic animals.

Indications:
In cattle, Nutlor is indicated in diseases caused by florfenicol susceptible bacteria. Nuflor is indicated for the treatment of respiratory tract infections due to Pasteurella haemolytica and Pasteurella multocida.

Dosage and administration
- In cattle, the recommended dose of Nuflor is 20 mg/kg bodyweight (10 ml for 150 kg) given by intramuscular injection preferably into the neck musculature using a 16 gauge needle.
- The dose should be repeated after 48 hours.
- Intramuscular administration of Nuflor at the recommended dose maintains effective blood levels in cattle for 48 hours.

Contra-indications, warnings:
- Cattle may be slaughtered for human consumption only from 30 days after the last treatment.
- Do not use in cows producing milk for human consumption.
- Not to be used in adult bulls intended for breeding purposes. The effect of florfenicol on bovine reproductive performance and pregnancy has not been assessed.
- A decrease in food consumption may occur during the treatment period. Treated animals recover their appetites quickly and completely upon termination of treatment.

Pharmaceutical precautions:
- Store below 25°C. do not refrigerate, protect from frost.
- Swab septum before use, Use a dry sterile needle and syringe.
- Following withdrawal of the first dose, use the product within 28 days. Discard unused material.

Further Information:
- Florfenicol acts by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis at ribosomal level.
- Laboratory tests have shown that flortenicol is active against the most commonly isolated bacterial pathogens involved in bovine respiratory disease which include Pasteurella haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida and Corynebacterium pyogenes.

For animal treatment only.
Keep out of the reach of children.

Package
20mL, 50mL and 100mL vials

Made by:
Schering-Plough Santé Animale
La grindilière
49500 sergé - France
name: Nuflor

description:
COMPOSITION PER ML:
- Florfenicol 300 mg
- Excipient q.s.ad 1 ml

INDICATIONS:
Diseases caused by florfenicol susceptible bacteria: Therapeutic treatment of respiratory tract infections in cattle due to Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida, and Histophilus somni.

CONTRAINDICATIONS:
- Do not use in adult bulls intented for breeding purposes.
- Do not use in cattle producing milk for human consumption.
- Do not use in cases of hipersensitivity to the active substance or to any of the excipients.

ADVERSE REACTIONS:
- Cattle: a decrease in food consumption and transient softening of the faeces may occur during the treatment period. The treated animals recover quickly and completely upen termination of treatment. Administration of the product may cause inflammatory lesions at injection site which persist for 14 days.
- If you notice any serious effects or other effects not mentioned in this leaflet, please inform your veterinary surgeon.

TARGET SPECIES: Cattle.

DOSAGE AND ROUTE OF ADMINISTRATION:
- 20 mg/kg bodyweight (1 ml of the product per 15 kg) by intramuscular route to be administered twice 48 hours apart. The volume administered per injection site should not exceed 10 ml.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD:
- Meat and offal: 30 days.
- Not permitted for use in lactating animals producing milk for human consumption.

SPECIAL STORAGE PRECAUTIONS:
- Keep out of the reach and sight of children.
- Store at temperature below 25°C.
- Do not use after the expiry date stated on the label after Exp. Shelf life after first opening the container: 28 days.

SPECIAL WARNING(S):
- The use of the veterinary medicinal product should be based on susceptibility testing and take into account official and local antimicrobial policies.
- Swab the septum before removing each dose.
- Use a dry, sterile syringe and needle.
- Care should be taken to avoid accidental self-injection.
- Avoid contact with eyes and skin.
- If eye exposure occurs, flush eyes immediately with clean water.
- If skin exposure occurs, wash the affected area with clean water.
- Wash hands after use.
- People with known hypersensitivity to florfenicol, propylene glycol or polyethylene glycol should avoid contact with the veterinary medicinal product.
- The reproductive safety of florfenicol has not been specifically investigated in pregnant cows. Use only accordingly to the benefit/risk assessment by the responsible veterinarian.
- Do not mix the veterinary medicinal product with other veterinary medicinal products.
name: Selectan

description:
Composition
Each 100 ml contain
- 20 gm florfenicol.

Indications and Usage
Cows: bovine respiratory disease (BRD), a.k.a. shipping fever or transient fever, associated with florfenicol–sensitive bacteria.

Dosage
- I/M injection in neck muscles.
- For active ingredient, 20mg florfenicol base/kg b.wt.,
- for whole product, 1ml Ato Fenicol 200 /10kg b.wt.

Withdrawal time
Cows: 28 days.

Pack
Glass vials: 50, 100, 150, 250ml.
name: Ato Fenicol 200

description:
Composition:
- Florfenicol  300 mg / ml

Pharmacodynamic properties
- Florfenicol is a synthetic broad-spectrum antibiotic effective against most Gram positive and Gram negative bacteria isolated from domestic animals.
- Florfenicol acts by inhibiting bacteria protein synthesis at the ribosomal level, thus is bacteriostatic. However, in vitro tests have shown that florfenicol has a bactericidal activity against the most commonly isolated bacterial pathogens involved in respiratory diseases:
-- Histophilus somni, Mannheimia haemolytica and Pasteurella multocida isolated from cattle
-- Actinobacillus pleuropneumonia, and Pasteurella multocida isolated from pigs.

- Acquired resistance to florfenicol is mediated by efflux pump resistance associated with a floR gene. Such resistance has not yet been identified in the target pathogens except for Pasteurella multocida. Cross resistance with chloramphenicol can occur. Resistance to florfenicol and other antimicrobials has been identified in the food-born pathogen Salmonella typhimurium and co-resistance with the third-generation cephalosporins has been observed in respiratory and digestive Escherichia coli.
- For Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida and Histophilus somni the following breakpoints have been determined for florfenicol in bovine respiratory disease; susceptible: ≤2 µg/ml, intermediate: 4 µg/ml, resistant: ≥8 µg/ml.

Pharmacokinetic particulars
• In cattle: Intramuscular administration of the formulation at the recommended dose of 20 mg/kg maintains efficacious blood levels for 48 hours. Maximum mean serum concentration (Cmax) of 3.8 µg/ml occurred 5.7 hours (Tmax) after dosing. The mean serum concentration 24 hours after dosing was 1.95 µg/ml. The mean elimination half life was 15.3 hours

• In pigs: After intramuscular administration of florfenicol, maximum serum concentration of 4.7 µg/ml is reached after 1.8 hours and the concentrations deplete with a terminal mean half-life of 14.8 hours. Serum concentrations drop below 1 µg/ml, the MIC90 for the target porcine pathogens, 12-24 hours following IM administration. Florfenicol concentrations achieved in lung tissue reflect plasma concentration, with a lung: plasma concentration ratio of approximately 1. After administration to pigs by the intramuscular route, florfenicol is rapidly excreted, primarily in urine. The florfenicol is extensively metabolised.

Indications for use
Diseases caused by florfenicol susceptible bacteria. Cattle: Treatment of respiratory tract infections due to Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida and Histophilus somni. Pigs: Treatment of acute outbreaks of swine respiratory disease caused by strains of Actinobacillus pleuropneumoniae and Pasteurella multocida susceptible to florfenicol.

Dosage
- Intramuscular use. The injection should be given in the neck.
• Cattle: 20 mg florfenicol per kg bodyweight, i.e. 1 ml of solution per 15 kg bodyweight, twice 48 hours apart. 
• Pigs: 15 mg florfenicol per kg bodyweight, i.e. 1 ml of solution per 20 kg bodyweight, twice 48 hours apart.
- The dose volume given at any one injection site should not exceed 10 ml in cattle and 3 ml in pigs.
- To ensure a correct dosage body weight should be determined as accurately as possible to avoid underdosing.
- It is recommended to treat animals in the early stages of disease and to evaluate the response to treatment within 48 hours after the second injection.
- If clinical signs of respiratory disease persist 48 hours after the last injection, treatment should be changed using another formulation or another antibiotic and continued until clinical signs have resolved. 

Withdrawal period(s)
- Cattle: Meat and offal: 46 days / intramuscular use; 54 days / subcutaneous use.  Milk: Not permitted for use in lactating animals producing milk for human consumption.

- Pigs: Meat and offal: 18 days 

Storage
- Shelf-life
   As packaged for sale: 2 years.
   After first opening: 28 days.
- This veterinary medicinal product does not require any special storage conditions. 

Packaging:
Colourless glass vial type II (20 – 50 – 100 – 250 - 500 ml). Translucent multi-layer plastic vials (50 – 100 – 250 – 500  ml).

Manufacturer: Ceva Santé Animale 10, av. de la Ballastière - 33500 Libourne - France

FOR ANIMAL TREATMENT ONLY
name: Florkem

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Florfenicol 300.0 mg
- Flunixin (as flunixin meglumine) 16.5 mg

Properties
Treatment of respiratory infections caused by Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida, Mycoplasma bovis and Histophilus somni associated with pyrexia.

Indications
Treatment of respiratory infections caused by Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida, Mycoplasma bovis and Histophilus somni associated with pyrexia.

Dosage and administration
- 40 mg/kg florfenicol and 2.2 mg/kg flunixin (equivalent to 2 ml/15 kg b. wt.), to be administered by a single subcutaneous injection.
- The dose volume given at any one injection site should not exceed 10 ml.
- It is recommended to treat animals in the early stages of the disease and to evaluate the response to treatment 48 hours after injection.
- The anti-inflammatory component of florflox, flunixin, may mask a poor bacteriological response to florfenicol in the first 24 hours after injection.
- If clinical signs of respiratory disease persist or increase, or if relapse occurs, treatment should be changed, using another antibiotic, and continued until clinical signs have resolved.
- The injection should only be given in the neck.
- Swab septum before removing each dose.
- Use a dry sterile needle and syringe.
- To ensure a correct dosage body weight should be determined as accuracy as possible to avoid underdosing.

Withdrawal period
Meat and Offal: 46 days.
Milk: Not authorized for use in lactating animals producing milk for human consumption.

Operator Warnings:
- Care should be taken to avoid accidental self-injection.
- Wash hands after use.
- Do not use the product in known cases of sensitivity to propylene glycol and polyethylene glycols.

Storage:
Store at a temperature below 30°C.

Further information:
- Overdose studies in the target species for 3 times the duration of treatment showed decreased food consumption in the groups given 3 and 5 times the recommended dose.
- Decreased body weights were observed in the 5 times overdose group (secondary to decreased food consumption).
- Decreased water consumption was observed in the 5 times overdose group.
- Tissue irritation increases with injection volume.
- Treatment at 3 times the recommended treatment duration was associated with dose-related erosive and ulcerative abomasum lesions.

Package:
- 10 ml, 20 ml, 50 ml, 100 ml & 250 ml transparence glass bottles.
- Not all package sizes may be presented.
name: Florflox

description:
COMPOSITION
Each ml contains:
- Florfenicol  300 mg
- Flunixin meglumine  27.4 mg (Equ to 16.5 mg / ml Flunixin base).

PROPERTIES
• Therapeutic Group:
- Florfenicol: Antimicrobial
- Flunixin Meglumine: anti-inflammatory drug.

• Therapeutic Class:
Florfenicol is a fluorinated analogue of chloramphenicol, Flunixin Meglumine is NSAIDs

• Mode of Action:
- Florfenicol is a synthetic broad spectrum antibiotic effective against most Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria involved in bovine respiratory disease which include Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida and Histophilus somni.
- Florfenicol acts by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis at the ribosomal level and is bacteriostatic.
- Flunixin meglumine is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug with analgesic and antipyretic activity. Flunixin meglumine acts as a reversible non-selective inhibitor of cyclo-oxygenase (both COX 1 and COX 2 forms), Flunixin exerts its antipyretic effect by inhibiting prostaglandin E2 synthesis in the hypothalamus.

DOSAGE & ADMINISTRATION
• Route of administration: Subcutaneous injection. The injection should only be given in the neck.
• Whole Product: (2 ml/15 kg body weight) or (6 ml/100 lb).

WITHDRAWAL PERIODS
• Meat and offal: 46 days.
• Milk: In the absence of a withdrawal time in respect of milk, do not use in females producing milk for consumption, during lactation or drying off periods, nor in the 2 months preceding calving in animals to be used for producing milk for consumption in the future.

SHELF-LIFE
• Shelf life of: 2 years.
• Shelf life after first opening the immediate packaging: 50 days.

STORAGE CONDITIONS
• Store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C.
• After opening: Store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C for 50 days.

PACKAGING
Carton box contains amber glass vials type (II) of 50, 100, 250 and 500 ml solution with red chlorobutyl rubber stoppers capped with flip off aluminum cap with outer label + insert leaflet.

Manufactured by
Arab Company for Medical Products (ARABCOMED)

Reg.No:- 3456

SCIENCEMED
For Veterinary Products And Feed Additives
name: Intramix

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Florfenicol  300 mg
- Flunixin meglumine  27.375 mg (Eq to 16.5 mg Flunixin base)

Properties:
- An injectable solution of the synthetic antibiotic Florfenicol and the non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) Flunixin.
- Florfenicol is a synthetic broad spectrum antibiotic effective against Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria isolated from domestic animals.
- Florfenicol acts by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis at the ribosomal level and is bacteriostatic. Florfenicol is considered to be a bacteriostatic agent but in vitro studies of florfenicol demonstrate bactericidal activity.
- Flunixin meglumine is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug with analgesic and antipyretic activity. Flunixin meglumine acts as a reversible non-selective inhibitor of cyclo-oxygenase (COX 1 and COX 2). Although flunixin has no direct effect on endotoxins after they have been produced, it reduces prostaglandin production that is involved in the development of endotoxic shock.
- The effectiveness of Florfenicol plus Flunixin in the control or pyrexia associated with naturally occurring bovine respiratory disease. Florfenicol plus Flunixin exhibited a more rapid antipyretic response than Florfenicol and saline-treated cattle.

Indications:
Curative treatment of respiratory infections caused by Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida and Histophilus somni associated with pyrexia.

Target species: Cattle.

Dosage & Administration route:
- 2 ml / 15 kg body weight by a single Subcutaneous injection.
- The dose volume given at any one injection site should not exceed 10 ml.
- The injection should be given only in the neck.

Contra-indications:
- Do not use in adult bulls intended for breeding purposes.
- Do not use in animals suffering from hepatic and renal diseases.
- Do not use if there is a risk of gastrointestinal bleeding or in cases where there is evidence of altered haemostasis.
- Do not use it in animals suffering from cardiac diseases.
- Do not use in the case of known hypersensitivity to active substances or to any of the Excipients.
- Do not administer to animals less than 6 weeks of age.

Special warnings for species: None.

Special precautions for use:
- The product should be used in conjunction with susceptibility testing and take into account official and local antimicrobial policies.
- Avoid use in dehydrated, hypovolaemic or hypotensive animals as there is a potential risk of increased renal toxicity.
- Concurrent administration of potentially nephrotoxic drugs should be avoided.

User warnings:
- Care should be taken to avoid accidental self-injection. Wash hands after use.
- Do not use the product in known cases of sensitivity to propylene glycol and polyethylene glycols.

Adverse reactions:
Subcutaneous administration of the product may result in injection site swellings that become palpable 2-3 days after injection.

Withdrawal periods:
- Meat and offal: 46 days.
- Milk: Not authorized for use in lactating animals producing milk for human consumption. Do not use during lactation or drying off periods. Do not use in pregnant animals which are intended to produce milk for human consumption within 2 months of expected parturition.

Storage Condition:
- Store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C, away from light.
- Shelf-life of the product before opening: 3 years.
- Shelf-life when the container is opened for the first time: 3 months at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Packing:
Cartoon box containing amber glass vials (Type II) of 100, 250, and 500 ml injectable solution with chlorobutyl rubber Stopper (Type I) and aluminium cap + label and insert leaflet.

Manufactured by:
ADWIA Co. S.A.E. 10th of Ramadan City
Made in Egypt
name: Injectomeg

description:
COMPOSITION
Each ml contains: 
Active substance:
- Florfenicol  300 mg
- Flunixin (as flunixin meglumine)  16.5 mg

Excipients
Propylene glycol (E1520) 150 mg, N-methyl-2-pyrrolidone, Anhydrous citric acid and (Macrogol 300).

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
Solution for injection. Clear, light yellow to straw coloured liquid.

TARGET SPECIES
Cattle

INDICATION(S)
Curative treatment of respiratory infections caused by Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida and Histophilus somni associated with pyrexia.

CONTRAINDICATIONS
- Do not use in adult bulls intended for breeding purposes.
- Do not use in animals suffering from hepatic, cardiac or renal diseases.
- Do not use in the case of known hypersensitivity to the product.
- Do not use if there is a risk of gastrointestinal bleeding or in cases where there is evidence of altered haemostasis.
- Do not administer to animals less than 6 weeks of age.

ADVERSE REACTIONS
Subcutaneous administration of the product may result in injection site swellings that become palpable 2 - 3 days after injection. The duration of the injection site swellings ranged from 15 - 36 days post-injection. Grossly, this is associated with minimal to mild irritation of the subcutis. Extension into the underlying muscle was noted in only a few instances. By 56 days post-dosing, no gross lesions were observed that would require any trim-out at slaughter. If you notice any serious effects or other effects not mentioned in this leaflet, please inform your veterinary surgeon.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
» 40 mg / kg florfenicol and 2.2 mg / kg flunixin (2 ml / 15 kg body weight) to be e administered by a single subcutaneous injection.
» To ensure correct dosage and avoid under dosing, body weight should be determined as accurately as possible. The dose volume given at any one injection site should not exceed 10 ml.
 » It is recommended to treat animals in the early stages of the disease and to evaluate the response to treatment 48 hours after injection. The anti-inflammatory component of Resflor, flunixin, may mask a poor bacteriological response to florfenicol in the first 24 hours after injection. If clinical signs of respiratory disease persist or increase, or if relapse occurs, treatment should be changed, using another antibiotic, and continued until clinical signs have resolved.
» The injection should only be given in the neck.

ADVIGE ON CORRECT ADMINISTRATION
Swab septum before removing each dose. Use a dry sterile needle and syringe. Care should be taken to avoid accidental self-injection. The product should be used in conjunction with susceptibility testing and take into account official and local anti-microbial polices.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
- Meat and offal: 46 days.
- Milk: do not use in females producing milk for consumption, during lactation or drying off periods, nor in the 2 months preceding calving in animals to be used for producing milk for consumption in the future.

STORAGE PRECAUTIONS
- Do not store above 25°C. De not freeze.
- Following withdrawal of first dose use the product within 28 days to be stored not above 25°C.
- When the container is broached (opened) for the first time, using the in-use shelf-life which is specified on this package leaflet, the date on which any product remaining in the container should be discarded should be worked out. This discard date should be written in the space provided or the label.
- Keep out of the reach and sight of children.
- For animal treatment only.

SPECIAL WARNING(S)
» The effect of florfenicol on bovine reproductive performance, pregnancy and lactation has not been assessed. Use only accordingly to the benefit/risk assessment by the responsible veterinarian.
» Concurrent use of other active substances that have a high degree of protein binding may compete with flunixin for binding and thus lead to toxic effects.
» Pre-treatment with other anti-inflammatory substances may result in additional or increased adverse effects and accordingly a treatment free period with such drugs should be observed for at least 24 hours before the commencement of treatment. The treatment-free period, however, should take into account the pharmacokinetic properties of the products used previously.
» The product must not be administered in conjunction with other NSAIDs or glucocorticosteroids.
» Gastrointestinal tract ulceration may be exacerbated by corticosteroids in animals given NSAIDs.
» Avoid use in dehydrated, hypovolaemic or hypotensive animals as there is a potential risk of increased renal toxicity. Concurrent administration of potentially nephrotoxic drugs should be avoided.
» Overdose studies in the target species for 3 times the duration of treatment showed decreased food consumption in the groups given 3 and 5 times the recommended dose. Decreased body weights were observed in the 5 times overdose group (secondary to decreased food consumption). Decreased water consumption was observed in the 5 times overdose group. Tissue irritation increases with injection volume.
» Wash hands after use.

DISPOSAL PRECAUTIONS
Any unused veterinary medicinal product or waste materials derived from such veterinary medicinal products should be disposed of in accordance with local requirements.

OTHER INFORMATION
» Florfenicol is a synthetic broad spectrum antibiotic effective against most Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria isolated from domestic animals. Florfenicol acts by iniibiting bacterial protein synthesis at the ribosomal level and is bacteriostatic. Laboratory tests have shown that florfenicol is active against the most commonly isolated bacterial pathogens involved in bovine respiratory disease which include Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida and Histophilus somni.
» Florfenicol is considered to be a bacteriostatic agent, but in vitro studies of florfenicol demonstrate bactericidal activity against Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida and Histophilus somni.
» Florfenicol bactericidal activity was characterized as essentially time dependant against the three target pathogens with the possible exception of H. somni where a concentration dependency was observed.
» During the florfenicol susceptibility monitoring program (2000-2003) a total of 487 M. haemolytica, 522 P. multocida and 25 H. somni isolates were collected. MIC values ranged between < 0.12 and 2 ug/ml for M. haemolytica (MIC90 = 1 µg/ml), between < 0.12 and 2 ug/ml for P. multocida (MIC90 = 0.5 µg/ml) and between 0.12 and 0.5 ug/ml for H. somni. Breakpoints have been established by the CLSI (Clinical and Laboratory Standard Institute) for bovine respiratory pathogens as follows:

 • Pathogen:
M. haemolytica, P. multocida and H. somni

• Florfenicol disk conc (µg): 30

• Diameter (mm):
S ≥ 19, I 15-18 and R ≤ 14

• MIC (µg/ml):
S ≤ 2, I 4 and R ≥ 8

» The only mechanisms of chloramphenicol resistance that are known to have significant clinical relevance are CAT-mediated inactivation and efflux-pump resistance. Of these, only some of the efflux mediated resistance would also confer resistance to florfenicol and thus have the potential to be affected by florfenicol use in animals. Resistance to florfenicol in the target pathogens has only been reported on rare occasions and was associated with efflux pump and the presence of the flo-R gene.
» Flunixin meglumine is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug with analgesic and antipyretic activity. Flunixin meglumine acts as a reversible non-selective inhibitor of cyclo-oxygenase (both COX 1 and COX 2 forms), an important enzyme in the arachidonic acid cascade pathway which is responsible for converting arachidonic acid to cyclic endoperoxdes. Consequently, synthesis of eicosanoids, important mediators of the inflammatory process involved in central pyresis, pain perception and tissue inflammation, is inhibited. Through its effects on the arachidonic acid cascade, flunixin also inhibits the production of thromboxane, a potent platelet pro- aggregator and vasoconstrictor which is released during blood clotting.
» Flunixin exerts its antipyretic effect by inhibiting prostaglandin E2 synthesis in the hypothalamus. Although flunixin has no direct effect on endotoxins after they have been produced, it reduces prostaglandin production and hence reduces the many effects of the prostaglandin cascade. Prostaglandins are part of the complex processes involved in the development of endotoxic shock.
» The administration of the product by the subcutaneous route at the recommended dosage of 40 mg/kg florfenicol maintained efficacious plasma levels in cattle (i.e. above the MIC90 of the least sensitive respiratory pathogen, Mannheimia haemolytica) for longer than 39 hours. Maximum plasma concentration (Cmax)of approximately 4.3 µg/ml occurred approximately 5.5 hours (Tmax) after dosing.
» After administration of the product by the subcutaneous route at the recommended dosage of 2.2 mg/kg flunixin peak plasma concentrations of 2.9 µg/ml were achieved after 1.3 hours. The volume of distribution was approximately 2 litres per kg.
» The binding of florfenicol on proteins is approximately 20% and for flunixin > 99%. The degree of elimination of florfenicol residues in urine is approximately 68% and in faeces approximately 8%. The degree of elimination of flunixin residues in urine is approximately 34% and for faeces approximately 57%.

PACKAGING
100 ml and 250 ml glass Type I vials closed with a bromobutyl stopper and aluminium cap. Not all pack sizes may be marketed.

Vet Pharma Friesoythe GmbH -Germany

Intervet Deutschland GmbH -Germany

Reg No: 3645/2014

Imported by Intervet Egypt For Animal
Health

MSD Animal Health

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Tripelennamine HCI  20 mg (equi to 17.5 mg Tripelennamine base)

Properties:
1. Tripelennamine HCI is an ethylenediamine derivative antihistamine (H1 receptor antagonist).
2. Antihistamine (H1 receptor antagonist) competitively inhibits histamine at H1 receptor sites.
3. It does not inactivate or prevent the release of histamine.
4. It prevents the histamine action on the cell.
5. Also Tripelennamine has a moderate stimulant activity and minimal anti-cholinergic activity.

Indications:
- Antihistaminics are used to reduce or help prevent histamine mediated adverse effects.
- Tripelennamine has been used as CNS stimulant in "Downer cows" when administered slow IV.

Target species:
Cattle & Horses.

Dosage & Administration:
» Cattle (IV, IM) & Horses (IM only): 2.5 ml / 45 kg B.wt. (i.e. 1.1 mg / kg). Treatment may be repeated in 6 - 12 hours if necessary.

Warnings & Precautions:
- Central nervous system stimulation in the form of hyperexcitability, nervousness, and muscle tremors lasting up to 20 minutes have been noted in horses, particularly following I.V.I., only the intramuscular route should be used in horses.
- Over-dosage may give rise to excitement, ataxia, and convulsions.
- Depression of the central nervOus system and in-coordination may occur when the drug is used at therapeutic dose levels.
- Disturbances in gastrointestinal function may occur in some instances.
- While poisonous snake bites have been treated with antihistaminic drugs, other conjunctive therapy is required because of toxic reactions associated with the protein complex of venom.
- Do not use in horses intended for food purposes.

Contra-indication:
Don't administer Tripelennamine IV in horses.

Side effects:
None.

Withdrawal Periods:
Cattle:
 Meat: 4 days.
 Milk: 24 hours.

Storage Condition:
Store at temp. not exceed 30°C for 3 years and after opening 30°C for 3 months away from direct light.

Packing:
10 ml, 25 ml, 30 ml, 50 ml & 100 ml vials + label and insert in carton box.

M.H. Reg. No.: 3266/2010 (Vet.)

Manufactured by:
ADWIA Co. S.A.E. 10th of Ramadan City
Made In Egypt

Each 1 ml Contains:

- Trimethoprim  40 mg

Properties:
- Sulphadiazine belongs to sulfonamides that block the synthesis of dihydrofolic acid from PABA by competitive inhibition of PABA. Trimethoprim blocks the synthesis of tetrahydrofolic acid from dihydrofolic acid by competitive inhibition of dihydrofolate reductase.
- Sulphadiazine and Trimethoprim, each used separately are bacteriostatic. By blocking both steps of folic acid metabolism, the combination becomes bactericidal and increases the spectrum of antimicrobial activity.

Indications:
• Colibacillosis caused by E. coli in poultry, young calves and foals.
• Infectious coryza caused by Haemophilus paragallinarum in poultry.
• Turkey coryza caused by Bordetella avium in turkeys.
• Fowl cholera caused by Pasteurella multocida in poultry.
• Pullorum disease caused by Salmonella pullorum in poultry.
• Fowl typhoid caused by Salmonella gallinarum in poultry.

Target Species:
Poultry, Turkeys, Horses and Calves.

Dosage:
- To be added to drinking water.
» Horses and Calves: 1 ml Colitrim /8 kg B.wt for 3 -5 days.
» Poultry and Turkeys: 1 ml Colitrim / 16 kg B.wt for 3 - 5 days.

Contra-indication:
• Sulfonamide hypersensitivity.
• Severe hepatic impairment.
• Animals with functional rumen.
• Birds which are producing eggs for human consumption.

Warnings and Side-effects:
Diarrhea in some horses.

Withdrawal Time:
- Animals should not be slaughtered until 14 days from last treatment.
- Broilers Chicken: 5 days.

Storage:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30° C and to be used immediately after opening.

Keep out of reach of children.

For Veterinary Use Only

name: Ademec LA

description:
COMPOSITION
Each ml contains:
- Oxytetracycline (as dihydrate) 200 mg

Pharmacodynamic properties
Oxytetracycline interferes with bacterial protein synthesis. Following diffusion through the outer cell membrane, oxytetracyclineis actively transported to the inner cytoplasmicmembrane. It binds to receptors on the 30 S subunit of the bacterial ribosomes and interferes with the binding to the aminoacyl-transfer RNA in the messenger RNA ribosome complex. This blocks the addition of amino acids to the elongating peptide chain and inhibits protein synthesis. Only a small portion of the drug is irreversibly bound and it appears that the reversibly bound antibiotic is responsible for antibacterial action.

Pharmacokinetic properties
- Absorption: Oxytetracycline is rapidly absorbed from the injection site with peak plasma levels within 2-6 hours. Therapeutic plasma levels are maintained for 48-72 hours post treatment.
- Distribution: Oxytetracycline diffuses throughout the body and is found in the highest concentration in kidney, liver, spleen and lung. It is also deposited at active sites of ossification. Oxytetracycline passes through the bovine placenta and enters the foetal circulation. The concentration in the foetal blood is approximately one half that in the maternal blood. Oxtetracycline diffuses with difficulty into the cerebrospinal fluid.
- Metabolism/Biotransformation: Oxytetracycline undergoes metabolism to various degrees. The most frequently identified substance in urine, faeces and tissues is the parent tetracycline. As much as 30% will be excreted unchanged in the faeces. Oxytetracycline is reversibly bound to plasma protein and widely distributed. It is removed from blood by the liver and high concentrations are achieved in parenchyma and bile. Bile concentrations may be 30 times that of blood. However, enterohepatic circulation limits bile secretion and prolongs maintenance of therapeutic concentrations.
- Excretion: Oxytetracycline is primarily excreted in the parent form by the kidney. Faecal elimination also occurs regardless of the route of administration. Less than 2% of an administered dose is excreted by the milk route

Target Species
Cattle, sheep and pigs

Indications
Duocycline LA is recommended in the treatment of a wide range of common systemic, respiratory and local infections caused by, or associated with, organisms sensitive to Oxytetracycline.

Contraindications
- Do not use in sheep producing milk for human consumption.
- Do not administer by the intravenous route.
- Do not use in horses, dogs and cats.
- Do not use in animals with known hypersensitivity to the active ingredient

Pregnancy, lactation or lay
Use of tetracycline during the period of tooth development, including late pregnancy, may lead to tooth discolouration.

Interaction with other medicinal products
Duocycline LA should not be diluted or mixed with solutions of calcium salts (Incompatibilities).

Dosage:
- For deep intramuscular use only.
- The recommended dosage is 20 mg per kg or 10 ml per 100 kg bodyweight.
- Cattle 10.0 ml / 100 kg
- Calf 5.0 ml / 50 kg
- Sheep 2.5 ml / 25 kg
- Lamb 1.0 ml / 10 kg
- Piglet 0.5 ml / 5 kg
- Weaner 2.0 ml / 20 kg
- Fattner / Sow 7.5 ml / 75 kg

- The maximum volume at one site is:
Cattle 20 ml, Sheep 5 ml & Pig 10 ml

Warning
**This product contains dimethylacetamide (DMAC) and care should be taken to prevent absorption through the skin of the person administering it.

Withdrawal Period
- Milk should not be used for human consumption during treatment. Milk for human consumption may be taken after 8 days after the last treatment. Do not use in sheep producing milk for human consumption.
- Animals should not be slaughtered for human consumption during treatment.
- Animals may be slaughtered for human consumption after 28 days after the last treatment.

Shelf-life
- As packaged for sale: 3 years.
- After first opening: 4 weeks.

Storage
- Do not store above 25°C.
- Do not freeze.
- Protect from light.
name: Duocycline LA

description:
Properties: Diminsan 2.36 gm
• Diminazene aceturate  1.05 gm
• Phenazone (antipyrine) 1.31 gm

Indications:
Chemotherapeutic active against trypanosomes and babesiae. The product is fixed irreversibly on the living piroplasms. Very often a single injection is sufficient to counteract the infection within 24 to 48 hours.
- Babesiosis caused by B. bovis, B. ovis, B. motasi, B. canis and other Babesia species, Theileria annulata.
- Trypanosomiasis caused by T. congolense, T. vivax, T. brucei.
- Diminasan is very suitable for treatment of mixed infections of trypanosomes and babesiae.

Preparation:
- Add the contents of one sachet to 12.5 ml of sterile water to obtain about 15 ml of ready for use solution; The product is readily soluble in water.
- Solutions may be stored up to 5 days at room temperature (15 days if refrigerated), provided the solution is stored in well closed bottles and protected from light.

Administration/dosage:
By intramuscular injection:
- 0.5 ml per 10 kg b.w. for treatment of infections caused by T. congolense and T.vivax. One sachet is sufficient for a cow of 300 kg.
-1.0 ml per 10 kg b.w. for treatment of infections caused by T. brucei and Theileria annulata.
- Overdosing (up to double or even triple dose) normally does not provoke secondary reactions in cattle, horses, sheep or pigs.
- Do not inject more than 80 ml per animal (cattle) per injection. However, if such dose should be administered, split the dosage into two doses of 40 ml each with 48 hrs interval.

Withdrawal:
Milk: 3 day  -  Meat: 28 days

Conservation:
Store dry, dark and at room temperature (15-25°C).

Stability:
5 years provided properly stored.

Presentation:
Box of 100 x 2.36 gm vials.
name: Diminsan

description:
Ornipural is Hepato-protector and Ammonemia regulator Injectable solution

COMPOSITION
- Betaine  15 mg
- Arginine (hydrochloride)  33.3 mg
- Ornithine (hydrochloride)  11.8 mg
- Citrulline   10 mg
- Sorbitol (E420)   200 mg
- Metacresol   3 mg
- Excipient QS   1 ml

TARGET SPECIES
Horses, cattle, sheep, pigs, dogs and cats

PHARMACODYNAMIC PROPERTIES
The active ingredients of this veterinary medicine have hepatoprotective, lipotropic and diuretic properties.
- Betaine is a lipotropic factor, involved in fighting against liver fat overload and fatty liver.
- Sorbitol is a carbohydrate that improves the intestinal absorption of some Vitamins, especially vitamins B12 and B6 and ferric ion. It is also a nutrient and a diuretic.
- Ornithin and citrulline are amino-acids used to detoxity the organism by activating the ureogenesis cycle.
- Arginine, another amino acid, is part of the Krebs' tricarboxylic acid cycle and also facilitates the ureogenesis cycle.

PHARMACOKINETIC PARTICULARS: Unknown

INDICATIONS
Horses, cattle, sheep, pigs, dogs and cats:
Stimulation of the hepatodigestive activity in digestive disorders, liver and kidney failure.

POSOLOGY AND METHOD OF ADMINISTRATION
- Intramuscular, subcutaneous or slow intravenous administration.
- Renew the injections 4 to 5 times within an interval of 2 days.
- Horses - Cattle: 50 to 100 ml
- Foals - Calves: 1 ml per 5 to 10 kg b.w.
- Pigs - Sheep: 10 to 15 ml
- Piglets - Lambs: 3 to 5 ml
- Dogs - Cats: 2 to 5 ml according to size

PREGNANCY OR LACTATION:
The safety of the medicinal veterinary product has not been established during pregnancy. However, it does not seem to be a problem to use it during pregnancy or lactation.

SPECIAL WARNINGS: None

CONTRAINDICATIONS: None

ADVERSE REACTIONS: None

INTERACTION: Unknown

OVERDOSE: Not applicable

WITHDRAWAL PERIODS
Meat: zero day
Milk: zero day.

SPECIAL STORAGE PRECAUTIONS
- Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.
- Shelf life after first opening: 28 days
- Keep out of the reach and sight of children.

Vetoquinol S.A.

70200 Lure - France

description:
Coglavax® Polyvalent Inactivated Vaccine Against Clostridial Infections In Ruminants 

COMPOSITION:
Coglavax contains antigens in sufficient quantity, which ensure satisfactory immunization against Cl. perfringens A, B, C, D and other clostridial infections due to Cl. oedematiens, septicum, tetani and chauvoei in inactivated form, homogenised with aluminium hydrioxide adjucant and formaldehyde as preservative.

TARGET SPECIES:
Cattle, sheep & goats.

INDICATIONS:
Prevention, by active immunisation, of clostridial enterotoxaemia due to C. Perfringens A.B.C.D and clostridial infections due to CI. oedematiens, septicum, tetani and chauvoei:
- Enterotoxaemia in adult sheep
- Bacillary dysentery in calves and lambs
- Pulpy kidney disease
- Haemorrhagic enteritis in lambs and kids
- Necrotic hepatitis
- Bradsot of malignant oedema of abomasums
- Blackleg
- Gas gangrene
- Tetanus.

DOSAGEAND ADMINISTRATION
- By Subcutaneous injection.

⟩⟩ SHEEP, GOATS
(1) Non pregnant ewes, nannies, rams and billies: 
• Initial Vaccination:
- Dose/Time of the 1st injection: 2 ml at any time.
- Time of the 2nd Injection: 4 weeks after the 1st injection.
• Booster: 2 ml, 1 year after the last injection

(2) Pregnant ewes, nannies: 
• Initial Vaccination:
- Dose/Time of the 1st injection: 2 ml no later than 2.5 months of gestation.
- Time of the 2nd Injection: 4 weeks after the 1st injection no later than the beginning of the 4th month of month gestation.
• Booster: 2 ml, 1 year after the last injection and not after 4th month of gestation.

(3) Lambs, Kids: 
• Initial Vaccination:
- Dose/Time of the 1st injection: 2 ml at 3 weeks of age. If the mother was previously vaccinated, start the vaccination at 8 weeks of age.
- Time of the 2nd Injection: 4 weeks after the 1st injection.

⟩⟩ CATTLE
(1) Calves weighing less than 100 kg: 
• Initial Vaccination:
- Dose/Time of the 1st injection: 2 ml at any time.
- Time of the 2nd Injection: 4 weeks after the 1st injection.
• Booster: 4 ml, 1 year after the last injection.

(2) Calves and Adult cattle:
• Initial Vaccination:
- Dose/Time of the 1st injection: 4 ml at any time.
- Time of the 2nd Injection: 4 weeks after the 1st injection.
• Booster: 4 ml, 1 year after the last injection.

(3) Pregnant cows:
• Initial Vaccination:
- Dose/Time of the 1st injection: 4 ml at the beginning of the 6th month of gestation.
- Time of the 2nd Injection: 4 weeks after the 1st injection.
• Booster: 4 ml, 1 year after the last injection and, if possible, close to the 7th month of gestation.

USAGE PRECAUTIONS:
- Observe the usual aseptic precautions.
- Shake well before use.
- As goats are very sensitive to parenteral injections it is advised to carry out a preliminary test on few animals or to prevent possible shock by suitable measures (high-water diet, anti-histaminic administration).
- Administer only to healthy animals.
- In case of injection to the user, consult immediately a doctor. Keep out of reach of children.

CONTRAINDICATION: Nil

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD: Nil

STORAGE:
Between +2°C and +8°C.

PACKAGE:
250 ml – 500 ml

FOR VETERINARY USE ONLY
name: Coglavax

description:
Composition
Each 1 tablet contains
- Sulfadiazine   1.0 gm
- Trimethoprim   0.2 gm

Properties
- The combination of a diaminopyrimidine (Trimethoprim) with a sulfonamide (Sulfadiazine) inhibits sequential steps in the synthesis of folic acid and thus the purines required for DNA synthesis.
- The interference by Trimethoprim with recycling of tetrahydrofolic or dihydrofolic acid is probably responsible for the synergistic interaction of the combination.

Antimicrobial spectrum:
Cotrimed tablet is effective against both gram-positive and gram-negative pathogenic bacteria sensitive to Sulfadiazine-Trimethoprim combination including Actinomyces, Bordetella, Clostridium, Corynebacterium, Fusobacterium, Haemophilus, Klebsiella, Pasteurella, Proteus, Salmonella, Shigella and Campylobacter spp., as well as Escherichia coli, Streptococci, and Staphylococci.

Indications
- Salmonellosis in calves caused by Salmonella spp, especially S. typhimurium and S. Dublin
- Undifferentiated diarrhea caused by E .coli
- Bacterial pneumonia caused by Pasteurella multocida.
- Footrot caused by Fusobacterium necrophorum, Staphylococcus aureus, Escherichia coli and Actinobacterium pyogenes.
- Septicemic colibacillosis caused by E. coli.
- Bovine respiratory disease caused by Pasteurella multocida and Haemophilus sommi.
- Urinary tract infection and mixed aerobe-anaerobe infections caused by Escherichia coli, Staphylococcus, Klebsiella, Proteus, Streptococci and Enterobacter spp.

Target species
• Pre ruminant Calves not more than 4 weeks of age.

Dosage instructions
- Calves: 1 tablet (bolus) orally / 40 kg bodyweight for 3-5 days.

Warnings & Precautions
- Care in renal impairment.
- Care with concurrent chloramphinicol, miconazole, phenylbutazone and procaine HCl .

Contra Indications
- Not used in animals with hypersensitivity to sulphonamides & Trimethoprim.
- Should not be used in case of severe hepatic impairment & blood dyscrasias.
- Do not use in calves with a functional rumen

Side Effects
• None when used as the recommended doses.

Withdrawal time
- 28 days for calves

Storage condition
• Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C in a dry place

Packaging
- Carton box containing (AL/transparent PVC) 2, 3 or 4 stripes each of 4 tablets + inner leaflet.
name: Cotrimed

description:
Himmvac IB-ND
Combined Live Vaccine
IB virus and ND virus, freeze dried

COMPOSITION
It contains Newcastle disease live virus (B1 strain) and Infectious bronchitis virus (H-120 strain) propagated in SPF chicken eggs.

INDICATIONS
For the vaccination of healthy chickens, as an aid in the preventing Newcastle disease and Infectious bronchitis.

DOSAGE & ADMINISTRATION
» Drinking water method
- Give the birds no water for at least two hours prior to vaccination.
- Dilute 1,000 doses of vaccine with fresh water as per the following:

• 7 days old
- Layer: 6 L
- Broiler: 11 L

• 14 days old
- Layer: 11 L
- Broiler: 16 L

• 28 days old
- Layer: 22 L
- Broiler: 36 L

• Older than 2 month
 - Layer: 40 L

STORAGE
Store at 2 to 8°C and protect from light.

PRECAUTIONS
• Vaccinate only healthy chickens.
• Do not vaccinate the animals under the conditions as follow:
- Under nutritional disorder or have fever.
- Stressed or showing any clinical sign of disease like parasite infection, infectious disease.
- Immunosuppressive conditions caused by infection of fungus or bacteria and etc.
- In case of anaphylactic reaction or a shock is caused by administration previously. Hypersensitivity reactions may be observed in some animals after vaccination. Ask your veterinarian or consultant for appropriate treatment.
• Clean the water dispenser and the water container before administration. contamination or disinfectants.
• Use a clean, cold and fresh water without contamination or disinfectants.
• Do not use any disinfectants within 48 hours before and 24 hours after vaccination.
• Prepare the vaccine just before administration and use immediately.
• Use entire contents of vial when first opened.
• Burn empty bottles and unused vaccine and accessories.
• Wear the protective clothes, goggle and gloves. The user should avoid contaminating his hands, eyes and clothing with this vaccine.
• Newcastle virus can cause inflammation of the eyelids in humans. If product of its dilutions are splashed into eye, rinse immediately with plenty of water and see medical advice as soon as possible.
• Do not use the product if it has been frozen or its expiry date has expired.
• Protect the prepared vaccine from excessive light and heat.
• Do not mix or use with other medicine.
• Keep out of reach of children and animals.
• Use by veterinarian's instruction, and veterinary use only.

Packing
1,000 doses, 2,000 doses, 5,000 doses

Manufactured by
KBNP, INC.
235-9 Chusaro, Sinam, Yesan,
Chungnam, Korea

www.kbnp.net

Made in Korea
name: Himmvac IB-ND

description:
Arthenile Injectable solution (For vet use)

Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Phenylbutazone  20 gm
- Sodium salicylate  2 gm

Properties:
» Phenylbutazone is a pyrazolone non-steroidal anti-inflammatory. analgesic and antipyretic agent. Phenylbutazone acts by inhibiting the production of prostaglandins. Prostaglandins possess a wide variety of physiological properties including of pain, inflammation and pyrexia. In the main metabolite, oxyphenobutazone possesses those involved in production similar pharmacological properties.
» Sodium salicylate is non steroid anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) and has an anti-inflammatory, analgesic and antipyretic effect. The mode of action is based on inhibition of the enzyme cyclooxygenase, resulting in decreased production of prostaglandin (inflammatory mediators). The combination of these two drugs provides both rapid action (sodium salicylate) and prolonged effect (phenylbutazone).

Target species: Horses

Indications:
» For the relief of painful musculoskeletal condition in horses. Such conditions include: arthritis, arthrosis, osteitis, osteoarthritis, bursitis, tendonitis, tenosynovitis, and the inflammation of soft tissues and skin.
» Foot and mouth disease (FMD).
» Bovine ephemeral fever (3 days).

Dosage & administration:
• By slow I/V injection at room temperature.
» For active Ingredient: (Based on phenylbutazone) 4.4 mg phenylbutazone + 0.43 mg sodium salicylate / kg.b.wt / day for 6 - 5 days.
» For whole product: 1 ml of product / 46 kg.b.wt / day for 6 - 5 days.

Warning & Precautions:
- Caution with use in animals less than 6 weeks of age and aged animals.
- Should not used in animals less than 7 days before surgery.

Contraindications:
• Not to be used for newborn pet animals.
• Cardiac, Hepatic or renal dysfunction.
• Blood disorder (especially hemoglobinuria).
• Gastrointestinal disturbance.
• Do not use the drug with other NSAID.
• Do not use in pregnant mare.
• Concurrent administration with aminoglycosides.

Withdrawal time:
- Not be used in horses intended of human consumption.

Side effects:
Toxic reaction to IV injection are uncommon, but may be expressed as oedema of legs, jaundice, blood dyscrasia or gastric irritation.

Storage conditions:
- Do not store above 25°C. Protect from light.
- Keep away from reach of children.

Packaging:
Amber colour glass vials of 100 - 30 - 20 ml + pamphlet + carton box.

M.O.H Reg. No.: 2577/2005

Manufactured by
Badr pharma for RAA Company

Properties:
Nitroxinil is effective against mature flukes of Fasciola hepatica and Fasciola gigantica., Haemonchosis and Parafilaria bovicola, against adult and larval infestations of Haemonchus contortus in cattle and sheep and Haemonchus placei, Oesophagostomum radiatum and Bunostomum phlebotomum in cattle. It acts by uncoupling oxidative phosphorylation in the cells.

Indications:

Small swelling is occasionally observed at the injection site in cattle.

Carton box containing clear colorless glass vial ( type I ) each of 50 ml, 100 ml & 250 ml + insert leaflet.

description:
Anthelmintic (Imidazothiazole)

Vamizole 7.5% Levamisole hydrochloride Injectable solution For veterinary use only

Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Levamisole hydrochloride  75 mg

Properties:
Levamisole is a broad spectrum anthelmintic. It acts by interfering with parasite nerve transmission causing muscular spasm and rapid expulsion. It is active against adult and larval gastrointestinal round worm (Trichostrongylus spp., Cooperi spp., Ostertagia spp., (except inhibited Ostertagia larvae in cattle), Haemonchus spp., Nematodirus spp.. Bunostomum spp., Oesophagostonum spp., Chabertia spp., and lung worm infections (Dictyocaulus spp.).

Indications:
• Vamizole injection is used in the treatment of nematode infections in cattle and sheep.
• Vamizole injection should be used in cases of parasitic gastroenteritis and lung worm caused by mature and immature forms of those organisms sensitive to treatment with Levamisole hydrochloride such as:
- Lung worm: Dictyocaulus spp.
- Gastrointestinal worms: Trichchostrongylus spp., Cooperi spp., Ostertagia spp.,(except inhibited Ostertagia larvae in cattle), Haemonchus spp., Nematodirus spp., Bunostomum spp., Oesophagostomum spp., Chabertia spp.

Target species:
Cattle, sheep

Contraindications:
- Administration within 14 days of treatment with organophosphorous compound or diethylcarbamazine.
- Not to be used in cattle and sheep producing milk for human consumption.

Side effects:
Transient coughing, transient muscle tremors, salivation, nervous symptoms and colic, reactions at site of injection.

Dosage and administration:
- By subcutaneous injection
- 1 ml of the product / 10 kg bodyweight

Warnings and precautions:
- Operators should wear suitable protective clothing.
- May cause idiosyncratic reactions and serious blood disorders.
- Seek medical advice immediately if dizziness, nausea, vomiting, abdominal discomfort, sore mouth or throat, or fever occurs.
- Prevent exposure of animals to rain for 1 hour after treatment.

Drug interactions:
Organophosphorus compounds diethylcarbamazine causing enhanced toxicity.

Withdrawal period:
- Cattle: slaughter 28 days
- Sheep: slaughter 15 days

Package:
Carton box containing amber glass vial (type I) contains 100 ml, 50 ml solution with rubber stopper and aluminum cap with outer label + insert leaflet.

Storage:
Stored in temperature not exceeding 30°C and used immediately after opening.

Manufactured by
Badrpharma for pharmaceutical industries
name: Vamizole 7.5%

description:
Composition
Each 1 ml contains:
- Lincomycin (as Lincomycin Hydrochloride Monohydrate)  50 mg
- Spectinomycin (as Spectinomycin Sulfate tetrahydrate)  100 mg

Indications
Spectovet Inj. is indicated for the treatment of infections caused by organisms sensitive to the action of Lincomycin and/ or Spectinomycin including: Actinobacillus spp. , Pasteurella spp. , Escherichia coli , Salmonella spp. , Campylobacter spp. , Bacteroides spp. , Clostridium spp. , Fusobacterium spp. , Actinomyces spp. , Streptococcus spp. , Mycoplasma spp., Staphylococcus and Treponema spp. , and infections as Chronic Respiratory Disease (CRD), respiratory infections, air-sac disease, infections of skin- and adjoining tissues, enteritis, dysentery, foot rot in  non-ruminating Calves, Sheep, Goats, Poultry (broilers), Dogs and Cats.

Dosage and administration
- For intramuscular injection.
- Non-ruminating calves: 15 mg ingredients / kg (1 ml / 10 kg) intramuscularly twice daily for the first day followed by once daily for 2 – 4 days according to clinical response.
- Sheep and Goats: 15 mg ingredients / kg (1 ml / 10 kg) for 3 days.
- Poultry (broilers): 30 mg ingredients / kg (0.5 ml / 2.5 kg) daily during 3 days.
- Dogs and Cats: 30 mg ingredients / kg (1 ml/5 kg) intramuscularly. May be repeated at 12 to 24 hour intervals for 3 -7 days according to clinical response.

Contraindications
- Do not use in animals previously found to be hypersensitive to either active ingredient.
- Do not administer to animals with an impaired renal and/or hepatic function.
- Concurrent administration of penicillins, cephalosporins, quinolones and cycloserine.

Withdrawal time
- Non-ruminating calves (Meat and offal): 21 days.
- Sheep and Goats (Meat): 14 days.
- Sheep and Goats (Milk): 3 days.
- Poultry (Meat): 7 days.

Storage
- Store in a dark and dry place at a temperature below 30oC.
- Shelf life after first opening of the container: 28 days.
name: Spectovet

description:

Each 100 ml contains:
- Flunixin meglumine  8.3 gm (eq to Flunixin base 5 gm)

Properties:
Flunixin meglumine has a potent analgesic, antipyretic and anti-inflammatory activity.

Mode of action
MAROFLAM acts by inhibition of cyclo-oxygenase cnzyme leading to reduced sythesis of prostaglandins and related compounds.

Indications
MAROFLAM is used in the treatment of:
1. Inflammation and Pain
2. Respiratory disease in cattle
3. Mastitis in Cattle
4. Endotoxic Shock
5. Equine Colic

Target species:
Cattle and Horse

Dosage & Administration:
- by I/M or IV injection
- Cattle: 2 ml Maroflam / 45 kg body weight once daily repeated for up to 3 days.
- Horse: 1 ml Maroflam / 45 kg body weight once daily repeated for up to 5 days.

Warnings & Precautions:
1- Caution with the use in animals less than 6 weeks of age or aged animals.
2- Avoid use in dehydrated, hypovolemic or hypotensive animals.
3- Avoid concurrent administration of potentially nephrotoxic drugs, warfarin or plasma protein bound drugs.
4- Repeated use in equine colic is not recommended due to pain masking effect.

Contra-indications:
1- Cardiac, renal & hepatic diseases affected animals.
2- Hypersensitivity to the drug, blood dyscrasias.
3- Treatment with other NSAID concurrently or within 24 hours.
4- Race horses prior to racing.

Side effects:
Prolonged use may cause gastro-intestinal lesions, inappetence, vomiting & diarrhea.

Withdrawal time:
• Cattle:
- Meat: 14 day after the last treatrnent
- Milk: 36 hours after the last treatment

Drug interactions:
Flunixin enhances the effect of nephrotoxic drugs, warfarin, aminoglycosides, corticosteroids, other NSAlD.

Storage conditions:
1- Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.
2- Keep out of reach of children.

Package:
Carton box containing clear colorless (type I) glass vial of 20 ml, 50 ml & 100 ml solution with outer label & chlorobutyl rubber stopper & aluminium cap with inner leaflet.

Shelf life:
Three years

Sole agent:
RAA Pharma

M.O.H. Reg. No.: 3564/2014

produced by
Badr pharma for pharmaceutical industries
