name: Enterocillin 20%

description:
PRESENTATION
Betamox LA is an off white oily suspension containing:
» 172.2 mg/ml Amoxicillin Trihydrate (Eq. to 150 mg/ml amoxicillin).
» 0.08 mg/ml butylated hydroxytoluene and 0.08 mg/ml butylated hydroxyanisole as antioxidants.

Chemically, Amoxicillin is 6[D(-)-∝- amino-p-hydroxy-phenylacetamido] penicillanic acid.

USES
• Amoxicillin is a broad spectrum semi-synthetic penicillin bactericidal in action for use in cattle, pigs, sheep, dogs and cats. In vitro it is effective against a wide range Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria which include: Escherichia coli, Klebsiella pneumoniae, Proteus species, Salmonella species, Staphylococci and Streptococci.
• Betamox LA is suitable for the control of infections, due to susceptible micro-organisms, in cattle, sheep, pigs, dogs and cats where a single injection giving prolonged activity required. It may also protect from secondary bacterial invasion in cases where bacteria are not the initial cause of the disease.

• Indications include infections of:
a) Alimentary tract.
b) Respiratory tract.
c) Skin and soft tissue.
d) Urogenital tract.
e) In prevention of post-operative infection (treat before surgery).

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
» Cattle, Sheep and Pigs: By intramuscular injection only.
» Dogs and Cats: By subcutaneous or intramuscular injection.
• The recommended dosage rate is 15 mg per kg bodyweight (1 ml per 10 kg bodyweight), repeatable if necessary after 48 hours. Massage the injection site. A separate injection site should be used for each administration.

- If dose volume exceeds 20 ml, it should be divided and injection into two sites.
- As with other injectable preparation, normal aseptic precautions should be observed.
- (Use dry syringe for extraction of suspension to avoid hydrolysis of amoxicillin).
- An appropriate graduated syringe must be used to allow accurate administration of the required dose volume. This is particularly important when injecting small volumes.

CONTRA INDICATIONS, WARNINGS, Etc:
• Suspension is not suitable for intravenous or intrathecal administration.
• Milk for human consumption must not be taken from a cow during treatment. With cows milked twice daily, milk for human consumption may only be taken from 79 hours (i.e. at the 7th milking) after the last treatment. With other dosing routines, the basis of the veterinary surgeons advice should be that milk may be taken for human consumption only after same time period from the last treatment (i.e. With three times a day milking, milk for human consumption may only be at the 10th milking).
• Not for use in sheep producing milk for human consumption.
• Animals must not be slaughtered for human consumption during treatment. Cattle may be slaughtered for human consumption only 23 days from the last treatment. Sheep and pigs may be slaughtered for human consumption only 16 days form the last treatment.
• Occasional local reaction may occur with use of Betamox LA.
• Not effective against beta-lactamase producing organisms.
• Amoxicillin, like other penicillins, should not be administered orally or parenterally in rabbits, hamsters, gerbils and guinea pigs.

SPECIAL WARNINGS
- Operator Warning – Penicillin/Cephalosporin Sensitivity
• Care should be taken to avoid accidental self-injection, seek medical advice immediately.
• Penicillins and cephalosporins may cause hypersensitivity (allergy) following injection, inhalation, ingestion or skin contact.
• Hypersensitivity to penicillins may lead to cross reactions to cephalosporins and vice versa. Allergic reactions to these substances may occasionally be serious.
1. Do not handle this product if you know you are sensitized, or if you have been advised not to work with such preparations.
2. Handle this product with great care to avoid exposure taking all recommended precautions.
3. If you develop symptoms following exposure, such as a skin rash, you should seek medical advice and show the doctor this warning. Swelling of the face, lips or eyes or difficulty breathing are more serious symptoms and require urgent medical attention.
• Wash hands after use.

STORAGE PRECAUTIONS
- Do not store above 30°C.
- Keep out of the reach of children.
- Protect from light.
- Shake the vial before use.
- Following withdrawal of the first dose, use the product within 14 days.
- Discard unused material.
- This product does not contain an antimicrobial preservative. Swab the septum before removing each dose. Use a dry sterile needle and syringe.

DISPOSAL
Dispose of any unused product or containers in accordance with guidance from your local waste regulation authority.

LEGAL CATEGORY
POM-VPS.

PACKAGE QUANTITIES
Multidose vials of 50 ml and 100 ml.

FURTHER INFORMATION
• Due to its wide distribution, after absorption, high levels of amoxicillin are found in kidney, urine, liver and bile.
• Also important is the rapid bactericidal action.
• Due to its mode of action amoxicillin prevents recrudescence of respiratory infections. The absence of toxicity, shared with other penicillins, is also apparent.
• Animals with functional rumens should only be treated parenterally.

FOR ANIMAL TREATMENT ONLY

MANUFACTURED BY
Norbrook Laborato ries Limited, Newry, Co. Down, Northern Ireland.

MOH Reg. No.: 3308B/2011 Vet

Imported by:
Al Safa Vet
name: Betamox LA

description:
Curamenth Endectocide & Flukicide for Cattle

Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Nitroxynil (as eglumine)  34 gm
- Ivermectin  670 mg
- Clorsulon  6.7 gm

Properties:
• Curamenth contains ivermectin, a member of the macrocyclic lactone family of chemicals, clorsulon, a member of the sulphonarnide family of chemicals and nitroxynil a related monophenolic compound.
» Nitroxynil: the main pharmacological action of nitroxynil is fasciolicidal. The mechanism of action is thought to be due to uncoupling of oxidative phosphorylation.
» Ivermectin acts by inhibiting nerve impulses. It binds selectively and with high affinity to glutamate-gated chloride ion channels which occur in invertebrate nerve and muscle cells. This leads to an increase in the permeability of the cell membrane to chloride ions with hyper-polarization of the nerve or muscle cell, resulting in paralysis and death of the relevant parasites.
» Clorsulon is rapidly absorbed into the circulating blood. Erythrocytes with bound drug as well as plasma are ingested by Fasciola spp. Adult Fasciola spp. are killed by clorsulon because of inhibition of enzymes in the glycolytic pathway, which is their primary source of energy.

Indications:
• Curamenth is used for the treatment and control of nitroxynil, ivermectin and clorsulon sensitive strains of internal and external parasites of cattle and triclabendazole resistant strains of early immature (including 2-week old stages), immature and adult liver fluke.

» Curamenth is effective against sensitive strains of the following internal parasites:
- Gastro-intestinal roundworms:
> Adult and immature:
• Ostertagia ostertagi - Small brown stomach worms (including third and fourth stage larvae and inhibited immatures).
• Haemonchus placei - Barber's pole worm.
• Trichostrongylus axei - Stomach hair worm (including third and fourth stage larvae).
• Trichostrongylus colubriformis - Intestinal hair worm.
• O. lyrata - Stomach worm.
• Cooperia spp - Small intestinal worm (including third and fourth stage larvae).
• Oesophagostomum radiatum - Nodule worm (including third and fourth stage larvae).
• Bunostomum phlebotomum - (including third and fourth stage larvae).

> Adult stages of:
• Trichuris spp - Whipworm.
• Strongyloides papillosus - Intestinal worm.
• Nematodirus spp. - Thin necked intestinal worm.

- Immature (6-week old), Immature and Adult Liver Fluke: Fasciola hepatica.

- Lungworms: Dictyocaulus viviparus (adult and immature, including inhibited stages).

- Eyeworm: Thelazia spp (adult stages).

- Sucking Lice:
• Linognathus vituli - Long nosed sucking louse.
• Haematopinus eurysternus - Short nosed sucking louse.
• Solenopotes capillatus - Little blue sucking louse.

- Mites: Sarcoptes scabei var bovis.

- Screw Worm Fly: Chrysomya bezziana (parasitic larval stages.

- Cattle tick: Boophilus microplus.

When used as directed for control of internal parasites of cattle, Curamenth concurrently aids in control of:
- Mites: Chorioptes bovis.
- Biting Lice: Bovicola (Damalinia) bovis.

Sustained activity:
Curamenth effectively controls infection with Ostertagia spp. and Cooperia spp. acquired up to 7 days after treatment, and Dictyocaulus viviparous and Chrysomya bezziana acquired up to 14 days after treatment.

Target species: Cattle.

Dosage & Administration:
- 1.5 ml / 50 kg body weight, by subcutaneous injection.
- If required the dose can be divided and administered in two sites.

Contraindications:
Not to be used intravenously or intramuscularly.

Side effect:
- Curamenth has been shown to be safe in cattle when used as directed.
- Pregnant and breeding cattle may be treated provided normal care is taken in handling.

Precautions & Warnings:
- Avoid overdosing of cattle.
- Do not retreat cattle for 120 days after the last treatment.
- Care should be taken when administering Curamenth or other medications to sick debilitated animals in poor condition
- If product leaks from the injection site staining of the coat of light colored cattle may occur for a period of several weeks.
- Gloves are recommended during usage.
- Not to be used in recently born pet animals.

To avoid carcass damage:
- Use shortest needle possible, certainly not exceeding 15 mm.
- As far as possible avoid injection of animals during wet weather or under dusty conditions.
- This product should be injected only under the skin.

Withdrawal period:
- Meat: 56 days.
- Milk: Do not use in cattle which are producing or may in the future produce milk where the milk or milk products may be used for human consumption.

Storage conditions:
- Store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C, away from light.
- Used within 3 months after opening when stored at temperature not exceeding 30°C, away from light.

Packing:
Cartoon box containing amber glass vials (Type II) of 100 ml injectable solution closed with chlorobutyl rubber stopper (Type I) and aluminum cap + label and insert leaflet.

Manufactured by:
ADWIA Co. S.A.E. 10th of Ramadan City
Made In Egypt
name: Curamenth

description:
Composition:
Each 1 kg contains:
- Vitamin B1  750 mg
- Vitamln B2  1100 mg
- Pantothenic acid  1500 mg
- Vitamin B6  400 mg
- Sodium Citrate  45 gm
- Sodium Chloride  65 gm
- Sodium Carbonate  50 gm
- Potassium Chloride  25 gm
- Monopotassium Phosphate  13 gm
- Dextrose up to  1 kg

Indications
- To overcome heat stress, prevent dehydration and conmpensate the body electrolytes during hot climatic.
- Reduce stress during vaccination and transportation.
- During chicks brooding to improve vitality and increase disease resistance.
- Prevention of heatstroke due to exposure of birds to high temperatures and humidity.
- Use during healing periods of diarrhea and gastrointestinal disorders.
- Help in compensate water-salts balance in young calves that suffering from dehydration, as the product rich in salts with easily absorbed form that necessary to overcome the dehydration.
- Contains electrolytes and essential nutrients which are lost by calves during periods of digestive disturbance.

Dosage
- Calves: 60 gm / head single dose is mixed with 2.5 liters of water and given to the calf twice a day
- Poultry: 0.5 - 1 gm / 1 liter drinking water for 3 days.

Srorage
Store in a cool dry place away from direct sunlight.
name: Dextrolyte

description:
• Clamoxyl Long Acting 150 mg/ml Suspension for Injection is an off-white oily suspension containing 150 mg/ml amoxicillin as Amoxicillin trihydrate.
• The formulation is designed to provide effective antibiotic activity over a period of 48 hours.

Indications:
- Clamoxyl Long Acting Suspension for Injection is suitable for the control of infections caused by susceptible organisms in sheep, dogs and cats where prolonged activity from a single injection is required. It may also be used to control secondary bacterial invasion in conditions where bacteria are not a primary cause of disease.
- Bacterial infections caused by M.O susceptible to penicillins, such as infections of the alimentary tract, respiratory tract, urogenital tract, coliform mastitis and secondary bacterial infections.
- Clamoxyl is a broad spectrum semi-synthetic penicillin which is bactericidal in vitro, against a wide range of Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, including the following:
• Actinobacillus lignieresi
• Bacillus anthracis
• Bordetella bronchiseptica
• Clostridium spp.
• Escherichia coli
• Corynebacterium spp.
• Fusobacterium spp.
• Erysipelothrix rhusiopathiae
• Haemophilus spp.
• Streptococci and Staphylococci (penicillin sensitive strains)
• Moraxella spp.
• Pasteurella spp.
• Proteus mirabilis
• Salmonella spp.

Particular indications
1. Alimentary tract infections, including enteritis.
2. Respiratory tract infections.
3. Urogenital tract infections, including cystitis and metritis.
4. Skin and soft tissue infections, including wounds, abscesses, foot infections, joint and navel ill.
5. Prevention of post-operative infections by injection prior to surgery.

Dosage and administration
- The recommended dosage rate is 15 mg/kg bodyweight, which is equivalent to 1 ml/10 kg
- Shake the vial well before use. Inject by the subcutaneous or intramuscular route (dogs and cats) or the intramuscular route only (sheep), then massage the injection site. (For ease of administration in dogs and cats, needles no finer than 20 gauge should be used). If the volume to be given is greater than 5 ml (sheep) it should be divided and injected into two separate sites. The suspension is not suitable for intravenous or intrathecal administration.

- In common with other penicillin preparations, hydrolysis takes place rapidly in the presence of water. It is important, therefore, that a dry syringe is used when extracting suspension for injection, to avoid contaminating the remaining contents of the vial with drops of water. Do not broach the vial more than 40 times.

Contra-indications, warnings, etc
- Use of the product should be based on susceptibility testing of the bacteria isolated from the animal. If this is not possible, therapy should be based on epidemiological information.
- In common with all other penicillins, amoxicillin should not be used orally or parenterally in rabbits, guinea pigs, hamsters or gerbils. Caution is advised in its use in any other very small herbivores.
- Use of the product may occasionally result in local tissue reaction.

Storage precautions
- Do not store above 25°C.
- This product does not contain an antimicrobial preservative. Following withdrawal of the first dose, use the product within 28 days. Discard unused material.
name: Clamoxyl LA

description:
COMPOSITION PER ML:
- Amoxicillin trihydrate  150 mg
- Gentamicin sulphate  40 mg.

Amoxicillin and gentamicin are two known antibiotics that individually have particular and interesting therapeutic properties, and when acting together they have a broad antibacterial spectrum which includes Gram (+) microorganisms (mainly Streptococcus, Staphylococcus and Corynebacterium) and Gram (-) microorganisms (particularly Escherichia coli, Pasteurellas, Salmonellas and Pseudomonas). Moreover, tests «in vitro» have shown that they act synergistically. In addition, this product has excellent diffusion in the organism and the formulation in oil suspension results in a treatment with long lasting effects. The gentamicin-amoxycillin association, included in the product GENTAMOX, improves the therapeutic properties of each one of these antibiotics administered individually.

INDICATIONS:
- Swine: Pneumonia, Colibacillosis, Metritis, Diarrhoea, Bacterial enteritis and Mastitis.
- Sheep and Goats: Pneumonia, Diarrhoea, Bacterial enteritis, Pasteurellosis and Colibacillosis.
- Cattle: Pneumonia, Diarrhoea, Bacterial enteritis, Mastitis, Metritis and Cutaneous abscesses.
- Horses: Pneumonia, Diarrhoea, Bacterial enteritis, Genito-urinary infections, Strangles, Cutaneous abscesses and Foot infections.

SIDE EFFECTS:
Prolonged treatment with doses greater than those recommended may cause renal disorders.

DOSAGE:
- by I/M injection route.
- Sheep, Goats and Swine: 5 to 10 ml/adult animal/day; and 1 to 5 ml/young animal/day.
- Cattle: 30 to 40 ml/adult animal/day; and 10 to 15 ml/calf/day.
- Horses: 30 to 50 ml/adult animal/day; and 5 to 15 ml/foal/day.
- Generally, administer 1 ml/10 kg b.w./day, for 3 days.
- When large volumes are administered, e.g. cattle and horses, it is advisable to inject the volume at two inoculation sites to favour absorption.

OVERDOSE:
In the case of an intoxication due to an overdose, discontinue treatment and administer a symptomatic therapy. To avoid this type of problem, do not administer more than 3 ml/10 kg b.w.

OBSERVATIONS:
- This product contains a mineral oil based compound. It may cause severe pain and inflammation in the case of accidental self-injection. Clean and disinfect the wound immediately, see a doctor and show him this leaflet.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS:
- Store in a cool place, protected from light.
- Shake vigorously before use. If the bottle has been allowed to stand for some time, a separation of the product into two phases may occur. It will be easily resuspended after agitation.
name: Gentamox

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml contains
- Butaphosphan  10 gm
- Cyanocobalamin (1-(n-Butylamino)-1-methylethylphosphonous acid  0.005 gm

Properties:
- Vitamin B12 is a collective term for the Cobalamins of which cyanocobalamin and hydroxocobalamin are the principle compounds. They are cobalt-containing water soluble vitamins ruminants are able to use cobalt to synthesis Vitamin B12 in the rumen and deficiency occurs when inadequate cobalt is present in the diet.
- Cyanocobalamin is used for treating deficiencies of Vitamin B12. Malabsorption of nutrients secondary to gastrointestinal tract disease or dietary chromium deficiencies (in ruminants) can be associated with dietary deficiencies of vitamin B12.
- In carnivores vitamin B12 deficiency may occur as a result or inadequate absorption of the vitamin from Gl tract or increased body requirements.
- Vitamin B12 is essential for DNA svnthesis. Deficiency causes inhibited nuclear maturation and division. RBC maturation arrest in the bone marrow leads pernicious anemia. Clinical signs of deficiency include anorexia, unthriftiness, anemia and in coordination.
- Butaphosphan is an organic source of phosphorus and is a key component in energy and protein metabolism and also as a structural part of bone. Phosphorus is essential for many interstitial processes, notably glycolysis, membrane maintenance, oxygen transport, muscle contraction and protection from oxidative damage. It is also an important component of bones, teeth, milk, and ruminant saliva. Deficiency is usually primary and results in multi-organ system dysfunction and eventually progressive demineralization of bone.
- Acute phosphorus deficiency is uncommon in farm animals but may be encountered in older beef suckler cows during the first 6 weeks of lactation.

Indications:
Alexcafo is indicated for:
- Metabolic disorders resulting from poor nutrition, inadequate management, or diseases.
- Development and nutritional disorders in young animals due to rearing diseases.
- Metaphylaxis of infertility and puerperal diseases and support of sterility treatment.
- Tetanies and pareses in addition to Ca and Mg therapy.
- As a roborant in cases of stress, overexertion, exhaustion and reduced resistance.
- As a tonic in cases of weakness, secondary anaemia and chilling.
- Support of muscular physiology.

Target animals: horse, cattle, foals, calves, sheep, goat, lamb, pigs, dogs, cats.

Dosage and administration:
Administered intravenously, intramuscularly or subcutaneously
- Horse, catte: 10-25 ml
- Foals, calves: 5-12 ml
- Sheep, goat: 2.5-8 ml
- Lamb: 1.5-2.5 ml
- Pig (depending on weight): 2.5-10 ml
- Suckling pig: 1-2.5 ml
- Dog (depending on size): 0.5-5 ml
- Cat and fur animals:  0.5-2.5 ml

Precautions
- In acute cases treatment should be repeated daily if necessary
- In chronic cases half the dose if necessary repetiion of 1 to 2 weeks or less
- In healthy animals half the dose given

Side effects: None

Contraindications: None

Withdrawal times: None

Storage conditions:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C, after opening use within 4 weeks and store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Packing:
A carton box containing amber glass type III bottle of 100 or 250 ml injectable solution with chlorobutyl rubber closure & aluminium cap, with outer label and an inner pamphlet.

ALEXANDRIA Co. FOR PHARMACEUTICALS & CHEMICAL INDUSTRIES ALEXANDRIA - EGYPT
name: Alexcafo

INSTRUCTIONS FOR USE

- Horses: by slow intravenous injection only.

Should anyone accidentally be injected with the product during administration, a doctor should be consulted immediately and be informed of the nature of the product.

» General Precautions and Warnings: When administered intravenously, an intravenous set with filter should be used, administer very slowly; the infusion rate should not exceed 2 ml / kg / hour. Aseptic precautions should be observed.

description:
Isotonic Sodium Bicarbonate sterile solution for Injection for veterinary use only.

Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Sodium bicarbonate  1.3 gm

Properties:
Sodium bicarbonate is soluble and acts rapidly, producing carbon dioxide. This carbon dioxide may worsen pre-existing bloat often encountered in severe ruminal acidosis or may be released by eructation. Bicarbonate may be absorbed systemically and produce alkalosis. Sodium bicarbonate is useful in the treatment of metabolic acidosis due to a wide variety of causes. Sodium bicarbonate increases plasma bicarbonate, buffer the excess hydrogen ion concentration, rises blood pH and reverses the clinical manifestation of acidosis.

Indications:
1. Sodium Bicarbonate is indicated in the treatment of metabolic acidosis which may be due to severe renal disease, uncontrolled diabetes, circulatory insufficiency due to shock or severe dehydration, cardiac arrest and severe primary lactic acidosis.
2. Sodium Bicarbonate is also indicated in severe diarrhea which is often accompanied by a significant loss of bicarbonate.
3. Sodium bicarbonate is indicated in the treatment of metabolic acidosis in cattle, horses, sheep, swine and dogs depending upon causative factors.

Target species:
Cattle, horses, sheep, swine and dogs.

Dosage & Administration:
- Sodium Bicarbonate is injected intravenously.
- Of product: 13 to 32 ml/ kg B.Wt. / infusion over 4 to 8 hours depending upon the severity of the acidosis.

Contraindications:
Sodium Bicarbonate is contraindicated in animals losing chloride by vomiting and in animals receiving diuretics known to produce a hypochloremic alkalosis.

Precautions:
- Bicarbonate therapy is directed at producing a substantial correction of low total CO2 content and blood pH, but risks of alkalosis should be avoided.
- Sodium Bicarbonate in addition to parenteral solutions containing calcium should be avoided except where compatibility has been previously established.
- Precipitation or haze may result from sodium bicarbonate-calcium admixtures, and the resulting solution should not be administered.
- Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C and away from direct sunlight.
- Shelf life is 3 years from manufacturing date.

Packing:
High density polyethylene bottles of 100 ml, 250 ml, 500 ml with label + insert leaflet.

Manufactured by: ADWIA Co. S.A.E. 10th of Ramadan City
Made In Egypt
name: Isotonic NaHCO3

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Amikacin sulphate 333.8173 mg (eq to 250 mg Amikacin base)

Properties:
Amikacin sulphate is a semisynthetic aminoglycoside antibiotic from kanamycin. The effectiveness of Amikacin sulfate solution in infections caused by E. coli, Pseudomonas spp. & Klebsiella spp. has been domenestrated clinically in the horse. In addition, the following microorganisms have been shown to be to amikacin in-vitro: Enterobacter spp., Proteus mirabilis, Proteus spp. (indole positive), Serratia marcescens, Salmonella spp, Shigella spp, Providencia spp., Citrobacter freundii, Listeria monocytogenes & Staphylococcus aureus. The aminoglycoside antibiotics in general have limited activity against Gram +ve pathogens, although Staphylococcus aureus & Listeria monocytogenes are susceptible to amikacin. Amikacin has been to be effective against many aminoglycoside-resistant strains due to its ability to resist degradation by aminoglycoside inactivating enzymes known to affect gentamicin, tobramycin & kanamycin. It exerts its antimicrobial action by irreversibly binding to the 30 S ribosome subunit, thereby inhibiting protein synthesis of bacterial cells.

Indications:
Treatment of uterine infections (endometritis, metritis & pyometra) in mares.

Target species:
Mares

Dosage & Administration:
» Route: Via intra-uterine infusion.
» 8 ml of the product mixed with 200 ml 0.9% Sodium chloride injection, USP & aseptically infused into the uterus daily for 3 consecutive days.

Warning & precaution:
• Although amikacin sulphate is not absorbed to an appreciable extent following intrauterine infusion, concurrent use of other aminoglycoside should be avoided because of the potential for additive effects.
• In-vitro studies have been demonstrated that when sperm are exposed to the preservative which is present in the 48 ml vials (250 mg/ml) sperm viability is impaired.
• It should be used with caution in horses with preexisting renal disease.
• It should be used with caution in horses with neuromuscular disorders (e.g. myasthenia gravis) due to their neuromuscular blocking activity.

Contra-indications:
• Not to be used in horses intended for food.
• Not to be used in horses hypersensitive to amikacin.

Side effects:
• No adverse reactions or other side effects have been reported.
• Amikacin sulphate solution is non-irritating to equine endometrial tissue when infused into the uterus.
• Intrauterine infusion of 2 gm of amikacin sulphate solution 8 hours prior to breeding by natural service did not impair fertility in mares. Therefore, mares should not be bred for at least 8 hours following uterine infusion.

Withdrawal time:
Not to be used in horses intended for food.

Storage condition:
• Store at temperature not more than 30°C.
• Used Immediately after opening.
• Keep out of reach of children.

M.O.H.Reg. No.: 3540/2014

Pack:
Carton box containing amber glass vial (type II) containing 48-100-250-500 ml solution closed by chlorobutyl rubber stopper & aluminum flip off, with outer label & inner leaflet.

Manufactured By
The Arab Company For Gelatin And Pharmaceutical Products For Atco Pharma For Pharmaceutical Industries
name: Amigasol

description:
Anthelmintic (Avermectin)

Composition:
Each 1 ml contains
- Doramectin 10 mg

Properties
Doramectin is a highly active broad spectrum parasiticide which is active against gastrointestinal roundworms, lungworm, eyeworms, grubs, sucking lice and mange mites. It is a novel fermentation derived macrocyclic lactone.

Mode of Action
MACTILAN acts by modulation of chloride ion channel activity in the nervous system of nematodes and arthropods by binding to receptors that increase membrane permeability to chloride ions, This inhibits the electrical activity of nerve cells in nematodes and muscle cells in arthropods and cases paralysis and death of the parasites.

Indications:
» Cattle
Treatment of infections caused by:
1- Gastrointestinal roundworms (Adults & fourth stage larvae) caused by (Ostertagia ostertagi, Haemonchus placei, Trichostrongyus axel, Cooperia oncophor, Bunostomum phlebotomun, Strongyloides papillosus, Oesophagostomum radiatum , Trichuris spp.).
2- Lungworms (adult and forth stage larvae) caused by Dictyocaulus viviparus.
3- Eyeworms ( adult) caused by Thelazia spp.
4- Grubs (parasitic stages) caused by Hypoderma bovis.
5- Sucking lice (Haematopinus eurysternus, Linognathus vituli).
6- Mange mites (Psoropres bovis, Sarcoptes scabiei).

» Swine
Treatment of infections caused by:
1- Gastrointestinal roundworms (Adults & fourth stage larvae) caused by (Ascaris suum, Oesophagostomum dentarum, Oesophagostomum quadnspinulatum, Strongyioides ransomi, Hyostrongylus rubidus).
2- Lungworms (aduls) caused by Metastrongylus spp.
3- Kidney worms (adults) caused by Stephanurus dentatus.
4- Mange mites (adults & immature satges) caused by Sarcoptes scabiei var. suis.
5- Sucking lice (adults & immature satges ) caused by Haematopinus suis.

Target species: Cattle, swine

Dosage & Route of administration:
- Cattle: 1 ml / 50 kg body weight by intramuscular or subcutaneous injection.
- Swine: 1 ml / 34 kg body weight by intramuscular injection.

Contra-indications:
- Not for use in female dairy cattle 20 months of age or older
- Don't use in calves to be processed for veal

Warning and Precautions
Use in cattle and swine only this product shouldn't be used in other animals species as severe adverse reactions may result.

Side effects
There are no known side effects at this time.

Withdrawal time:
- Cattle: meat 35 days
- Swine: 24 days

Storage Conditions:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30, and used immediately after opening.

Package:
Carton box contain amber (type 1) glass vial containing 50 ml, 100 ml solution with chlorobutyl rubber stopper and Aluminum cap with outer label + insert leaflet.

Manufactured by
Badr Pharma for Pharmaceutical industries
Badr City - 250 Acre - Zone 164

name: Highticol 1%

description:
Anthelmintic (Avermectin)

Composition:
- Doramectin 10 mg / ml (1% W / V)

Properties:
Pharmacotherapeutic group:
Doradect injectable solution is a highly active, broad-spectrum parasiticide. It contains doramectin, a fermentative-derived parasiticide macrocyclic lactone. Doramectin is isolated from fermentations of selected strains derived from the soil organism streptomyces averimitilis.

Mode of action:
Mode of action of macrocyclic lactone is to modulate chloride ion channel activity in the nervous system of nematodes and arthropods, Also bind to receptors that increase membrane permeabilIty to chloride ions. This inhibits the electrical activity of nerve cells in nematodes and muscle cells in arthropods and causes paralysis and death of the parasites. In mammals, the neuronal receptors to which macrocyclic lactones bind are localized within the central nervous system, a site reached by only negligible concentrations of doramectin.

Indications:
1. Cattle: Doradect injectable solution is indicated for the treatment and control of the following species of gastrointestinal roundworms, eyeworms, grubs, sucking lice and mange mites.
- Gastrointestinal roundworms (adult and fourth stage larvae): Ostertagia ostertagi (including inhibited larvae), O. lyrata, Haemonchus placei, Trichostrongylus axei, T. colubriformis ,T. longispicularis, Cooperia oncophora, C. ectinata, C. punctata, C. Surnabada, Bunostomum phlebotomum, Strongyloides papillosus, Oasophagostomum radiatum, Trichuris spp.
- Lungworms (adults and forth stage larvae): Dictyocaulus viviparous.
- Eyeworms (adults): Thelazia spp.
- Grubs (parasitic stage): Hypoderma bovis. H. lineatum.
- Sucking lice: Haematopinus eurysternus, linognathus vituli, Solenopotes capillatus.
- Mange mites: Psoroptes bovis, Sarcoptes scabiei.
» Doradect injectable solution has been proved to effectively control infections and protect cattle from reinfection with Cooperia oncophera and Haemonchus placei for 14 days, Ostertagia ostertagi for 21 days, and C. punctata, Oesophagostomum radiatum, and DictyocauIus viviparous for 28 days after treatment.

2. Sheep: Doradect injectable solution is indicated for the treatment and control of the roundworm, nasal bots.

3. Swine: Doradect injectable solution is indicated for the treatment and control of the following species of gastrointestinal roundworms, lungworms, kidney worms, sucking lice and mange mites.
- Gastrointestinal roundworms (adults and fourth stage larvae) Ascaris suum, Oesophagostomum dentatum, 0esophagostomum quadrispinulatum, Strongyloides ransomi, Hyostrongylus rubidus.
- Lungworms (adults): Metastrongylus Spp.
- Kidney worms (adults): Stephanurus Dentatum.
- Mange mites (adults and immature stages): Sarcoptes scabiei var. suis.
- Sucking lice (adults and immature stages) Haematopinus suis.

Target species:
Cattle, Sheep, Swine

Dosage and administration:
- Cattle: 1 ml / 50 kg (IM or SC)
- Sheep: 1 ml / 33 kg (IM or SC)
- Swine: 1 ml / 34 kg ( IM)

Warnings and precautions:
- Not for human use
- Keep out of reach of children

Storage
- Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.
- Use after opening for 35 days and Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

M.O.H Reg. No: 4270/2018

Manufactured by:
Arab Company For Medical Product (ARABCOMED) For ATM Pharmaceutical Industries and Imp. & Exp.
name: Doradect

description:
COMPOSITION:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Marbofloxacin 100 mg

PROPERTIES:
Marbofloxacin is a synthetic, bactericidal antimicrobial, belonging to the fluoroquinolones group which acts by inhibition of DNA gyrase. It has a broad-spectrum activity in vitro against Gram-negative bacteria (E. coli, Histophilus somni, Mannheimia haemolytica and Pasteurella multocida) and against Mycoplasma (Mycoplasma bovis). Resistance to Streptococcus may occur.

INDICATIONS:
» Cattle:
- Treatment of respiratory infections caused by strains of Histophilus somni, Mannheimia haemolytica and Mycoplasma bovis, Pasteurella multocida susceptible to marbofloxacin.
- Treatment of acute mastitis caused by strains of Escherichia coli susceptible to marbofloxacin during the lactation period.

» Pigs (sows):
- Treatment of Postpartum dysgalactia Syndrome - PDS - (Metritis Mastitis Agalactia syndrome), caused by bacterial strains susceptible to marbofloxacin.

TARGET SPECIES:
Cattle, pigs (sows).

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION:
» Cattle:
• Respiratory infections:
- 2 ml / 25 kg body weight in a single injection by intramuscular route.
- If the volume to be injected is more than 20 ml, it should be divided between two or more injection sites.
- In cases of respiratory infections caused by Mycoplasma bovis, 1 ml product/50 kg body weight, in a single daily injection for 3 to 5 consecutive days, by intramuscular or subcutaneous route, The first injection may be given by the intravenous route.

• Acute mastitis: 1 ml product / 50 kg body weight in a single daily injection, for 3 consecutive days. by intramuscular or subcutaneous route. The first injection may also be given by the intravenous route.

» Pigs (sows):
• 1 ml / 50 kg body weight in a single daily injection, for 3 consecutive days, by intramuscular route.

* To ensure administration of a correct dose, body weight should be determined as accurately as possible to avoid underdosing.
* In cattle and pigs, the preferred iniection site in the neck area.
* The cap may be safely punctured up to 30 times. The user should choose the most appropriate vial size according to the target species to treat.

WARNINGS AND PRECAUTIONS:
» Precautions for use in animals:
- Official and local antimicrobial policies should be taken into account when the product is used.
- Fluoroquinolones should be reserved for the treatment of clinical conditions which have responded poorly, or are expected to respond poorly, to other classes of antimicrobials. Whenever possible, fluoroquinolones should only be used based on susceptibility testing.
- Use of the product deviating from the instructions given in the SPC may increase the prevalence of bacteria resistant to fluoroquinolones and may decrease the effectiveness of treatment with other quinolones due to the potential for cross resistance. The efficacy data showed that the product has insufficient efficacy for the treatment of acute forms of mastitis induced by Gram-positive bacteria.

» User warnings:
- People with known hypersensitivity to (fluoro) quinolones should avoid contact with the veterinary medicinal product. Care should be taken to avoid accidental self-injection as it can induce a slight irritation.
- In case of accidental self-injection, seek medical advice immediately and show the package leaflet or the label to the physician.
- In case of contact with skin or eyes, rinse with plenty of water.
- Wash hands after use.

» Pregnancy and lactation:
- Laboratory studies in rats and rabbit have not produced any evidence of teratogenic, foetotoxic or maternotoxic effects.
- Safety of the product at 2 mg / kg body weight has been established in pregnant cows and in sucking calves and piglets when used in cows and sows. Can be used during pregnancy and lactation.
- Safety of the product at 8 mg / kg body weight has not been established in pregnant cows or in sucking calves when used in cows. Therefore, this dose regimen should be used only according to the benefit/risk assessment by the responsible veterinarian.
- In case of use in lactating cows, see section "withdrawal period".

» Interactions: None known.

» Overdose:
- No signs of overdosage have been observed after administration of 3 times the recommended dose.
- Signs as acute neurological disorder may occur when the dose is exceeded. These signs should be treated symptomatically.
- Do not exceed the recommended dose.

» Inconpatibilities:
In the absence compatibility studies, the veterinary medicinal product must not be mixed with other veterinary medicinal products.

CONTRA-INDICATIONS:
- Do not use in cases where the pathogen involved is resistant to other fluoroquinolones (Cross-resistance).
- Do not use in animals with known hypersensitivity to the active substance or to any other quinolone or to any of the excipients.

ADVERSE EFFECTS:
- Transitory inflammatory lesions can occur at the injection site, without clinical impact, when administered via the intramuscular or subcutaneous route.
- Administration by the intramuscular route may cause transient local reactions such as pain and swelling at the injection site and inflammatory lesions which may persist for at least 12 days after injection.
- However, in cattle. subcutaneous route was shown to be better tolerated locally than intramuscular route.
- Therefore, the subcutaneous route is recommended in heavy cattle. If you notice any serious effects or other effects not mentioned in this package leaflet, please inform your veterinary surgeon.

WITHRAWAL PERIOD:
» Cattle:
- 8 mg / kg on a single occasion (IM): Meat and offal: 3 days & Milk: 72 hours
- 2 mg / kg for 3 to 5 days (IV/SC/IM): Meat and offal: 6 days & Milk: 36 hours

» Pigs (sows): Meat and offal: 4 days

STORAGE:
- Store below 30°C, protected from light before and after opening.
- Keep out of the sight and reach of children.
- Do not use this veterinary medicinal product after the expiry date which is stated on the label.
- Shelf life: 3 years.
- Shelf life after first opening: 28 days.

PACK:
Amber coloured glass vials (type lI) of 100 ml and 250 ml closed with bromobutyl rubber stopper and aluminium capsule with outer label, individually packed in a carton box with insert.

For animal treatment only.

Sole agent:
The Egyptian European Co., Cairo, Heliopolis Gharb
EgyEuro Animal Health Dr: Essam Soliman
Tel: 02 44820586
Fax: 02 44820584
Reg. No.: 4497/2019

Manufactured by:
Kela N.V., Sint Lenaartseweg 48, 2320 Hoogstraten, Belgium
name: Kelbomar

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Butylscopolamine bromide  0.4 gm
- Dipyrone (Metamizole)  50 gm

- Butylscopolamine bromide is a spasmolytic agent with particular activity on the smooth muscle of the digestive and urinary systems.  It antagonizes the actions of acetylcholine at the muscarinic receptor and also has some activity at nicotinic receptors.  Its pharmacological profile is similar to atropine, the main member of this class.

- Metamizole is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug of the pyrazolone group and also has analgesic and anti-pyretic effects.

Indications
- Control of pain associated with simple equine colic and as a diagnostic aid in more severe equine colics.
- For the control of diarrhoea in horses and dogs particularly when pain or abdominal discomfort is present
- For the control of pain associated with urinary obstruction in horses and dog.

Target Species: Horses and dogs

Dosage & Administration:
- Use aseptic techniques.
- Horses: 5 ml / 100 kg by I/V injection only.
- Dogs: 1 ml / 10 kg by I/V or I/M injection

Warnings & Precautions
- In horses, a slight transient increase in heart rate may be observed due to the parasympatholytic activity of butylscopolamine bromide

Contra Indications
- Due to a risk of local reactions do not use the intramuscular route in horses.
- Do not use in animals with known hypersensitivity to the active ingredients.

Storage condition:
- Store at temperature not exceeding 30ºC and valid to 50 days after opening.

Packaging:
Amber glass vials 10, 20 , 30 , 40 , 50 , 100 & 250 ml.
name: Buscovet Compositum

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Tolfenamic acid  4 gm

Properties:
- Tolfenamic acid (N-(2-methyl-3-chlorophenyl) anthranilic acid) is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) belonging to the fenamate group.  Tolfenamic acid exerts anti-inflammatory, analgesic and antipyretic activities. 
- The anti-inflammatory activity of tolfenamic acid is mainly due to an inhibition of cyclo-oxygenase and thus to a reduction in the synthesis of prostaglandins and thromboxanes, which are important inflammatory mediators. 

Indications
- In cattle:
-- As an adjunct in the treatment of acute mastitis, used in conjunction with antibacterial therapy
-- As an aid in the control of acute inflammation associated with bacterial respiratory disease, used in conjunction with antibacterial therapy.
- In pigs:
-- As an adjunct in the treatment of Metritis Mastitis Agalactia syndrome, used in conjunction with antibacterial therapy.

Dosage & Administration:
- In cattle:
-- For use in bovine mastitis: 1ml Tolfimate / 10 kg body weight as a single IV injection.
-- For use in bovine respiratory disease: 1ml Tolfimate /20kg body weight by IV or SC injection.
-- Treatment may be repeated once after 48 hours.  If a second injection is needed this should be given in the opposite side of the animal’s body.
- In pigs: 1mlTolfimate / 20 kg body weight as a single intramuscular injection, in the neck musculature

Warnings & Precautions
- Do not exceed 20ml per intramuscular injection site.
- Do not exceed the stated dose or the duration of treatment
- Do not administer other NSAIDs concurrently or within 24 hours of each other
- Avoid use in any dehydrated, hypovolaemic or hypotensive animal as there is a potential risk of increased renal toxicity.
- Do not use in newborn domestic animals

Withdrawal Time:
- Pigs: Meat: 3 days
- Cattle:
-- Meat: Following intravenous administration ; 3 days
-- Meat: Following subcutaneous administration : 7 days
-- Milk: 24 hours

Storage condition:
- Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C and valid to 35 days after openingunder storage temperature not exceeding 30°C

Packaging:
Carton box  contains amber glass vials ( type II) filled with   10 ml,  20 ml  , 30 ml  , 50 ml  , 100 ml   250 ml and 500  ml with red chlorobutyl rubber stoppers & caped with flip off aluminum cap with outer label and  insert leaflet.
name: Tolfimate

description:

- Simethicone  70 mg
- Turpentine oil  0.3 ml
- Anise oil  0.01 ml
- Paraffin oil  0.2 ml
- Fennel oil  0.01 ml

Mode of Action (MOA):
- Simethicone is an antifoaming agent that reduces surface tension of gas bubbles.
- Turpentine oil decreases the gastrointestinal fermentation and prevents the gas formation and causes its rapid expulsion by eructation. besides turpentine oil, as a laxative, helps also the evacuation of excreta from the intestine, thus alleviates the painful case of tympany.
- Anise oil is antispasmodic agent in case of colic.
- Paraffin oil is a strong laxative agent.
- Fennel oil is antispasmodic agent in case of colic and flatulence.

Indications:
Treatment of forthy bloat and tympany in cattle, sheep and goats.

Dosage & Administration:
• Cattle: 50 – 100 ml
• Sheep & Goat: 15 – 25 ml
• To be injected directly into the rumen or to be mixed with half liter of vegetable oil or water as a drench or by gastric tube.

description:
Each 1 ml contains: 
Furosemide ........ 50 mg 

Indications: 
Furosix is indicated in the treatment of oedemata associated with cardiac insufficiency, renal dysfunction, trauma and parasitic disease. It is also recommended for the treatment of mammary oedema and limb oedemata. 
- Furosix gives rapid onset of diuretic action with increased sodium and water excretion. It is even effective where glomerular filtration is impaired. 
- A potent saluretic type of diuretic for pa rentera I administration to Cattle, Horses, Cats and Dogs. 
- Furosix is indicated in the treatment of oedemata associated with cardiac insufficiency. renal dysfunction, trauma and parasitic disease. It is also recommended for the treatment of mammary oedema and limb oedemata. 

Dosage and Administration 
Horses: 1 - 2 ml per 100 kg (0.5 -1.0 mg Furosemide/ kg) intravenously 1 - 2 times per day at interval of 6 - 8 hours. 
Cattle: 1 - 2 ml per 100 kg (0.5 -1.0 mg Furosemide/ kg) intravenously 1 - 2 times per day at intervals of 12 -14 hours. 
Dogs and Cats: 0.25 - 0.50 ml per 5 kg (2.5 - 5.0 mg Furosemide/ kg ) intramuscularly or intravenously, first dose 5 mg/ kg bodyweight reduced to 1 - 2 mg/ kg for maintenance at 6 - 8 hours intervals.
- In severe or refractory cases, the dose may be doubled on a single occasion in the horse or cow. 
- Furosix may be administered observing aseptic precautions 
- By I/V injection only in cattle and horses. 
- By I/V or I/M injection only in Dogs and Cats

Contraindications: 
- Do not use in cases of acute glomerular nephritis renal failure with anu ria, electrolyte deficiency disease or overdosage with digitalis. 
- Do not use concurrently with am inoglycoside antibiotic treatment 
- The therapeutic effect may be impaired by increased intake of drinking water. So far as the patients condition allows. the amount of drinking water should be restricted. 

Withdrawal Time: 
- Cattle must not be slaughtered for human consumption during treatment and within 28 days of the last treatment 
- Cattle milk must not be used for human consumption within 24 hours of the last treatment 
- Not to be used for horses intended for human consumption. 
- Treated horses may never be slaughtered for human consumption. 

Storage: 
- Store in a dark and dry place at a temperature below 30°C. 
- Shelf life after first opening of the container: 28 days.
name: Furosix

description:

- 4-Dimethylamino_2-methylphenyl_phosphonic acid (equivalent to 28 mg phosphorous).
- Vitamin B1. 25 mg.
- Vitamin B2. 55 mg.
- Vitamin B6. 30 mg.

Indications: 
• It is used in the treatment of early diseases in young animals that cause a disruption in growth.
• Helps treat convulsions and paralysis associated with magnesium and calcium.
• High efficiency in stress situations.
• It improves the efficiency of weak muscles in animals used in sports and breeding.
• General metabolic disorders caused by poor nutrition and poor care.
• Useful in cases of anemia, tremors and wasting.

Dosage: 
- Horses and cows: 20-30 ml / animal / day.
- Foals, calves,Sheep and goats: 5-10 ml/animal/day.
name: Aviphosphan

description:
Composition
Each ml contains:
- Phenylbutazone 200 mg

Properties:
Phenylbutazone is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory, analgesic and antipyretic drug (NSAID) related to the pyrazolone derivative. The anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects of phenylbutazone depend on its ability to inhibit hypothalamic cyclo-oxygenase leading to reduced synthesis of prostaglandins and related compounds. This is followed by activation of heat loss mechanisms, i.e. panting, sweating and peripheral vasodilatation, and inhibition of thermogenesis. It also has the ability to trap or scavenge toxic oxygen-free radicals.

Indications:
- Cabutazone is indicated for the treatment of musculoskeletal and joint disorders such as arthritis, rheumatoid, myositis, acute and chronic laminitis, bursitis, tendinitis, and carpitis. Cabutazone is also indicated for the reduction of post-surgical soft tissue reaction, pain and painful injuries in horses, cattle, camels, sheep, goats, and dogs.
- Cabutazone is also indicated as an adjunct to a specific therapy in cases of pneumonia, mastitis, bacterial scours and endotoxic shock horses, cattle, camels, sheep, goats, and dogs.

Dose:
- By Slowly I/V or deep I/M (equine by slowly I/V only).
- 1 ml / 50 kg body weight (4 mg / kg body weight).

Warnings:
the administration should be limited to a maximum of five successive days in animals and two successive days in dogs.

Contra-indication:
Not to be used in case of known hypersensitivity, cardiac, renal diseases, edema and a possibility of gastrointestinal ulceration.

Withdrawal period:
- Meat: 12 days.
- Milk: 4 days.

Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C and To be used immediately after opening.
name: Cabutazone

description:
Anthelmintic (Halogenated Phenol)

Composition
Each 1 ml contains: 
- Nitroxinil 340 mg.

Properties:
Nitroxinil is a fasciolicide which is effective against Fasciola hepatica infestations and has some activity against gastrointestinal nematodes in cattle and sheep. Nitroxinil acts as an uncoupler of oxidative phosphorylation by causing severe disruption of the tegument of Fasciola hepatica.

Indications:
FASCIOCURE 34% is indicated for the treatment of:
- Fascioliasis (infestations of mature and immature Fasciola hepatica) in cattle and sheep.
- Adult and larval infestations of Haemonchus contortus in cattle and sheep.
- Haemonchus placei, Oesophagostomum radiatum and Bunostomum phlebotomum in cattle.

Dose:
- by subcutaneous injection.
- 1.5 ml FASCIOCURE 34% per 50 kg body weight.
- The dose must be repeated after 21 days.

Contra-indication & Warnings:
- Not used in newly born pet animals.
- Not used in cattle and sheep producing milk for human consumption.

Side effects:
- Transient swellings at the injection site in cattle.
- Withdrawal Time: Meat for cattle and sheep: 60 days.

Packs: 10, 20, 50, 100, 250 & 500 ml.

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Tulathromycin  100 mg

Properties:
Tulathromycin belongs to macrolide antibiotics, which have antibacterial action by inhibition of protein synthesis by binding to the 50S ribosomal subunit of microorganisms. Tulathromycin acts against gram negative activity compared to other drugs in this group so it is active against Pasteurella haemolytica and Pasteurella multocida. It is also has a good activity against Mycoplasma bovis and Moraxella bovis.

Indications:
- Treatment of bovine respiratory disease (BRD) in cattle caused by Pasteurella multocida, Pasteurella haemolytica and Mycoplasma bovis.
- Treatment of infectious bovine keratoconjunctivitis (IBK) in cattle caused by Moraxella bovis.

Dosage and administration:
- 1 ml Tulathroswede / 40 kg body weight as a single dose by subcutaneous injection in the neck area.
- Do not inject more than 10 ml per injection site.

Contra-indication & warnings:
- Hypersensitivity to macrolides.
- Concurrent use with other macrolides or lincosamides.
- Not to be used in lactating cattle producing milk for human consumption.

Side effects:
Transient reaction at the injection site.

Withdrawal Time:
Meat: 22 days.

Storage:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Pharma Swede - Egypt
10th of Ramadan City - B3
name: Tulathroswede

description:
Anthelmintic (Salicylanilide)

Composition
Each 1 ml contains: 
- Oxyclozanide 34 mg.

Properties:
Oxyclozanide is a member of the salicylanilide class of anthelmintics. Salicylanilides are hydrogen ionophores which act as potent uncouplers of oxidative phosphorylation. The site of action of these proton ionophores is known to be selective uncoupling of oxidative phosphorylation in parasite mitochondria.

Target species: Cattle, sheep and goats.

Indications :
- Tremazanide is indicated for the treatment of Fascioliasis (Adult liver fluke) caused by Fasciola spp.
- Tremazanide also indicated for the treatment of tapeworms (Moniezia spp.).

Dosage and administration:
- Administer as an oral drench and shake well before use.

Cattle:
- Animals from 50 to 350 kg B.Wt : 15 ml of Tremazanide per 50 kg B.Wt.
- Animals over 350 kg B.Wt: 100 ml Tremazanide regardless of the weight.

Sheep & goats:
- Animals to 15 kg B.Wt : 5 ml of Tremazanide .
- Animals from 15 to 30 kg B.Wt : 10 ml of Tremazanide .
- Animals from 30 to 45 kg B.Wt : 15 ml of Tremazanide .
- Animals over than 45 kg B.Wt : 20 ml of Tremazanide regardless of the weight.

Side effects:
- It can be used at therapeutic doses in debilitated and pregnant animals without side effects.
- At doses of 25 mg / kg in ruminants may produce minor side effects including softening of feces, increase frequency of defecation, slight depression and in appetence.

Contra-indications & warnings:
- Animals should not be slaughtered for human consumption during treatment.
- Not used in lactating sheep.

Withdrawal Time :
Meat: 14 days.
Milk: 3 days for cattle.

Packs: 0.5, 1, 2, 2.5, 3 & 4 liters.
name: Tremazanide

description:
Anthelmintic (Benzimidazole)

Composition
Each 1 ml contains:
- Triclabendazole 100 mg.

Properties:
Triclabendazole is a member of benzimidazole group of anthelmintics. It is a newly launched member with a very different spectrum of activity – directed against liver flukes. It is very potent against liver flukes (Fasciola hepatica) from 1 day old early immature to adult. Triclabendazole acts by interrupting parasite energy metabolism by binding to tubulin, thereby disrupting microtubular cell structure and preventing nutrient uptake and other functions. Triclabendazole acts primarily by binding to worms’ tubulin. Specifically it binds to dimeric tubulin, which, in turn, prevents the polymerization of tubulin during microtubule assembly. The earlier effects ascribed to triclabendazole, such as inhibition of fumarate reductase activity, may be secondary to the disruption of microtubules, which are essential for secretion of many enzymes.

Indications:
- Cattle : For the treatment and control of liver fluke infections in cattle caused by all stages of triclabendazole susceptible Fasciola hepatica from 2 week old immature to adult fluke.
- Sheep : For the treatment and control of liver fluke infections in sheep caused by all stages of triclabendazole susceptible Fasciola hepatica from 2 day old immature to adult fluke.

Dose:
For active ingredient:
- Cattle: 12 mg of triclabendazole / kg.b.wt.
- Sheep: 10 mg of triclabendazole / kg.b.wt.

For whole product:
- Cattle : 12 ml of Triclafluke suspension / 100 kg.b.wt. to be given orally as a single dose.
- Sheep: 10 ml of Triclafluke suspension / 100 kg.b.wt. to be given orally as a single dose.

Warnings:
- Shake well before use.
- Although triclabendazole is highly effective against all liver stages of Fasciola. - - Liver fluke resistant to triclabendazole have recently been found.

Contra-indication:
- Not used for dairy cattle producing milk for human consumption.
- Not used for dairy cattle and sheep after the start of dry period.

Side-effects:
- None at therapeutic doses.

Withdrawal periods:
- Meat of cattle: 56 days.
- Meat of sheep: 35 days.

Packs: 500, 1000 & 4500 ml.
name: Triclafluke

description:
Anthelmintic (Benzimidazole)

Composition:  
Each 1 ml contains:
- Albendazole 25 mg

Indications:
Cattle:
- Roundworms infestation by Bunostomum, Chabertia, Cooperia, Haemonchus, Nematodirus, Oesophagostomum, Ostertagia, Strongyloides and Trichostrongylus spp.
- Lungworms infestation by Dictyocaulus viviparus.
- Tapeworms infestation by Moniezia spp.
- Adult liver fluke infestation by adult Fasciola hepatica.

Sheep:
- Roundworms infestation by Chabertia, Haemonchus, Nematodirus ( including N. battus ) , Oesophagostomum, Ostertagia and Trichostrongylus spp.
- Lungworms infestation by Dictyocaulus filaria.
- Tapeworms infestation by Moniezia spp.
- Adult liver fluke infestation by adult Fasciola hepatica.
- Albendazole is ovicidal and will kill fluke and roundworm eggs, thus reducing pasture contamination.

Dose:
- Orally as a single dose.
Cattle:

Sheep:

Contra-indication:
- Not to be used in sheep producing milk for human consumption.

Side-effects:
- Coughing for some weeks after treatment in cattle suffering from severe lung damage due to
- heavy lungworm infestation.

Warnings:
- Care not to exceed fluke and worm dose in cows during first month of pregnancy.
- Operators should wear suitable protective clothing.
- Avoid direct contact and wash hands after use.

Withdrawal time: Cattle: Meat: 14 days. Milk: 60 hours. Sheep: Meat: 4 days.

Packs: 100, 500, 1000 ml. & 2 lit.

Pharma Swede - Egypt
10th of Ramadan City - B3
name: Albendazole 2.5%

description:
Anthelmintic (Benzimidazole)

Composition: 
Each 1 ml contains:
- Albendazole 50 mg

Properties: Albendazole is a broad spectrum anthelmintic against roundworms, lungworms, tapeworms and adult liver fluke in Cattle, Sheep and Goats. It belongs to benzimidazoles which act by interrupting parasite energy metabolism by binding to tubulin, thereby disrupting microtubular cell structure and preventing nutrient uptake and other functions.

Indications:
- Control of different types of worms and adult liver fluke in Cattle, Sheep and Goats.
Cattle:
1 – Roundworms infestation by Bunostomum, Chabertia, Cooperia, Haemonchus, Nematodirus, Oesophagostomum, Ostertagia, Strongyloides and Trichostrongylus spp.
2 – Lungworms infestation by Dictyocaulus viviparus.
3 – Tapeworms infestation by Moniezia spp.
4 – Adult liver fluke infestation by adult Fasciola hepatica.

Sheep & Goats:
1- Roundworms infestation by Chabertia, Haemonchus, Nematodirus ( including N. battus ), Oesophagostomum, Ostertagia and Trichostrongylus spp.
2 – Lungworms infestation by Dictyocaulus filaria.
3 – Tapeworms infestation by Moniezia spp.
4 – Adult liver fluke infestation by adult Fasciola hepatica.
• Albendazole is ovicidal and will kill fluke and roundworm eggs, thus reducing pasture contamination.

Target Species: Cattle, Sheep and Goats.

Dose:
- To be given orally as a single dose.
Cattle:
• For Roundworms and Tapeworms: 1.5 ml albendazole 5% – pharma swede / 10 kg. b.wt.
• For Adult flukes: 1 ml albendazole 5% – pharma swede / 5 kg. b.wt.

Sheep & Goat:
• For Roundworms and Tapeworms: 1 ml albendazole 5% – pharma swede/ 10 kg. b.wt.

Contra-indication:
• Not to be used in sheep producing milk for human consumption.

Side-Effects:
- Coughing for some weeks after treatment in cattle suffering from severe lung damage due to heavy lungworm infestation.

Warnings: Operators should wear suitable protective clothing.
