Storage: Store at temperature not exceeding 30º C.
name: Albendazole 5%

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml. contains
- Dipyrone 500 mg.

Properties:
Dipyrone is a derivative of the pyrazolon analgesics. It is an effective analgesic, anti-inflammatory and antipyretic drug. These effects are due to its action on the central nervous system, leading to pain relief and quietening of the animal. Flostac 50% is effective against wide range of symptoms such as colic, spasmodic conditions, hypermotility of intestine, paresis , both acute and chronic rheumatic conditions (Rheumatism, Neuritis ,Tendo-vaginitis) , pain , fever and mastitis.

Indication :
Flostac 50% is indicated as analgesics, anti-inflammatory and antipyretic.

Doses and administration :
- Dose may be given by subcutaneous, intramuscular or intravenous injection.
- Horses : 10 – 20 ml ( 5 – 10 gram dipyrone) / adult animal ( IM or very slowly IV injections)
- Cattle : 5 ml ( 2.5 gm dipyrone ) / 50 kg B.wt.
- Dogs and Cats : 0.55 ml /10 kg of B.wt.( 27.5 mg dipyrone / 1Kg ).

WARNING:
- Total daily dose should not exceed 300 mg / animal / day for dogs and cats.
- Total daily dose should not exceed 10 gm / animal / day for horses.

Withdrawal Time : 28 days for ruminants.

Contra-indications:
- Not to be used for dairy animals.
- Not to be used for poultry.
- Dipyrone is physically incompatible with apmorphine, aspirin, chloral hydrate and oxidizing agents.
- Dipyrone should not be used concurrently with phenylbutazone or barbiturates.
- Concomitant administration with chloropromazine may cause serious hypothermia.
- In horses do not administer the drug within 5 days of racing.
- Blood picture should be monitored with long time therapy.

Packs: 10, 20, 50 & 100 ml. sterile injection bottles.
name: Flostac 50%

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains :
- dl-alpha tocopheryl acetate 150 mg. (Equiv. to vitamin E 150 IU)
- Sodium selenite 1.1 mg. (Equiv. to Selenium 0.5 mg)

Properties:
Tocosel forte injection composed of Vit. E and Selenium which are essential nutrients for animals. Vitamin E plays an important role in various biochemical and physiological processes, it acts as an antioxidant. Vitamin E supplementation has been proven to improve growth performance, enhance immunity and restore impaired immunity. Selenium is an important part of the glutathione (GSH) peroxidase family that is involved in the antioxidant protection of cells against oxidative stress. Selenium exerts its protective effect against oxidative damage by decreasing the amount of free radicals and increasing the synthesis of glutathione peroxidase, which catalyses the breakdown of toxic hydrogen peroxide and lipid hydroperoxides.

Indications:
- For the prevention and treatment of the various syndromes which are associated with deficiency of vitamin E and/or selenium in horses, cattle, buffaloes, sheep, and goats.
• prophylactic indications:
• Farms located in selenium-deficient soil areas.
• When diets low in vitamin E are fed or a diet containing high levels of moist-stored grains or maize silage.
• In case of vitamin E and/or selenium deficiency, indicated by poor breeding performance; or nutritional muscular dystrophy.
• To provide extra vitamin E during periods of heavy work-load ( horses ).

• Therapeutic indications :
• Tocosel forte injection is indicated in various manifestations of nutritional muscular dystrophy (white muscle disease, nutritional myopathy) affecting cardiac and/or skeletal muscles, and symptoms associated with chronic diarrhea, unthriftiness, stiffness, lameness, abortions or immature birth.
• Tocosel forte injection administrates to the pregnant ewes may assist in the prevention of the deficiency syndrome of newborn lambs under similar conditions.
• Tocosel forte injection can be used as an ancillary treatment to enhance immunity in the case of bacterial, viral and parasitic disease.

Dosage and Administration:
Prophylactic dose:
- 1 ml per 50 kg one injection at intervals of 3 months to be administrated I/M incase of horses & I/M or S/C incase of cattle, buffaloes, sheep, and goats.
- To be given once and repeated after two to four weeks if required

Contra-indications:
Shouldn’t be given intravenously.

Withdrawal time: Meat & Milk: 0 day.

Store tightly closed, in dark place below 30ºC.
name: Tocosel Forte

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Clanobutine sodium  106.4 mg (Equiv. to Clanobutine base 100 mg)

Properties:
Clanobutine acts as a choleretic agent by increasing the secretory activity of exocrine digestive glands, increasing bile secretion and by stimulation of pancreatic enzymes such as pepsin, trypsin, chymotrypsin and amylase. It also acts as a hepatoprotective agent by protecting the liver during digestive disorders. It also acts as a cardio tonic through increasing the protection force and the number of beats per minute and increasing cardiac output and coronary flow.

Target Species:
Horses, Cattle & Dogs.

Indications:
Overeating, bloat, ketosis, constipation, decreased appetite, colic gas and intestinal atony.

Dosage:
- General dose : 1 – 2 ml per 10 kg in weight ( 10 – 20 mg Clanobutine per kg. ), to repeat as possible after 12 to 24 hours intramuscularly or intravenously.
- Adult cattle & Horses : 20 – 30 ml by I/V.
- Dogs : 2 – 8 ml by I/M.

Contra-indication, Side effects & Warnings: None.

Withdrawal Time: Zero.

Storage:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C & to be used immediately after opening.

For animal treatment only

Pharma Swede - Egypt
10th of Ramadan City - B3
name: Bykatonic

description:
Composition
Each 1 ml contains:
- Ivermectin 5 mg.
- Closantel 125 mg.

Properties :
- Ivermectin is an endectocide with activity against a wide range of internal and external parasites. It enhances the release of gamma amino butyric acid (GABA) at presynaptic neurons. GABA acts as an inhibitory neurotransmitter and blocks the post-synaptic stimulation of the adjacent neuron in nematodes or the muscle fiber in arthropods. By stimulating the release of GABA, ivermectin causes paralysis of the parasite and eventual death.

- Closantel is a member of the salicylanilide class of anthelmintics. Salicylanilides are hydrogen ionophores which act as potent uncouplers of oxidative phosphorylation. The site of action of these proton ionophores is known to be selective uncoupling of oxidative phosphorylation in parasite mitochondria.

Indications :
In Cattle:
- Gastrointestinal roundworms: Ostertagia ostertagi (including inhibited larval stages), Ostertagia lyrata (adult), Haemonchus placei (adult and immature), Trichostrongylus axei (adult and immature), Trichostrongylus colubriformis (adult and immature), Cooperia oncophora (adult and immature), Cooperia punctata (adult and immature), Cooperia pectinata (adult and immature), Oesophagostomum radiatum (adult and immature), Nematodirus helvetianus (adult), Nematodirus spathiger (adult), Strongyloides papillosus (adult), Bunostomum phlebotomum (adult and immature), Toxocara vitulorum (adult), Trichuris spp. Lungworms: Dictyocaulus viviparus ( adult and 4th stage larvae ).
- Liver Fluke (trematodes): Fasciola gigantica, Fasciola hepatica. Eyeworms (adult): Thelazia spp.
- Cattle grubs (parasitic stages): Hypoderma bovis, Hypoderma lineatum.
- Lice: Linognathus vituli, Haematopinus eurysternus, Solenopotes capillatus.
- Mange Mites: Psoroptes ovis ( syn P communis var bovis ), Sarcoptes scabiei var bovis.

In Sheep: For the treatment of :
- Gastrointestinal roundworms : Ostertagia circumcincta (including inhibited L4), Ostertagia trifurcata (adult and L4), Haemonchus contortus (including inhibited L4), Trichostrongylus axei (adult), Trichostrongylus colubriformis (adult and L4), T. vitrinus (adult), Cooperia curticei (adult and L4), Oesophagostomum columbianum (adult and L4), O. venulosum (adult), Chabertia ovina (adult and L4), Nematodirus filicollis (adult and L4), Trichuris ovis (adult).
- Lungworms: Dictyocaulus filaria (adult and 4th stage larvae) Protostrongylus rufescens (adult).
- Liver Fluke ( trematodes ) : Fasciola gigantica, Fasciola hepatica.
- Nasal Bots : Oestrus ovis.
- Mange Mites : Psoroptes ovis.

Dosage : by subcutaneous injection.
1 ml / 25 kg B.Wt. S/C.

Contra-indication & Warnings:
- Not to be used intravenously or intramuscularly.
- Not to be used in animals producing milk for human consumption, including pregnant animals intended to produce milk for human consumption.
- Do not use in cases of known hypersensitivity to the active ingredients.

Side effects:
Transitory swelling has occasionally been observed at the injection site.

Withdrawal Time:
- Meat for cattle: 49 days.
- Meat for sheep: 28 days.

Packs: 10, 50, 100, 250 & 500 ml.
name: Closaverm

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Toldimfos sodium 200 mg. Equiv. 14% phosphorus ( 28 mg phosphorus )

Properties: 
Toldimfos is considered one of phosphorus salts that used for the treatment and prevention of hypophosphataemia in cattle and dogs.

Indications:
- Skeletal defects, rickets and osteomalacia or promotion of rapid union in fractures, particularly when associated with Vitamin D therapy.
- Post-parturient paresis, lactation tetany and grass tetany caused by disorders of calcium, magnesium and phosphorus metabolism.
- General metabolic disorders and debility, whether during convalescence or the result of nutritional disorders.
- PHOSPHO – TONIC may be useful after difficult parturition, in debility of the newborn and in deficiency syndromes in cattle and dogs of all ages.

Dosage:
• Acute hypophosphataemia:
- By subcutaneous, intramuscular or intravenous injection.
- Cattle : 10 – 25 ml as a single dose.
- Dogs : 1 – 3 ml as a single dose.
- Dosage must be repeated according to clinical effect.
- In severe cases: for rapid absorption, the dose is given as half by intravenous injection and half by intramuscular or subcutaneous injection.

• Chronic hypophosphataemia:
- By subcutaneous or intramuscular.
- Cattle : 2.5 – 5 ml every 2 days for 5 – 10 doses.
- Dogs : 1 – 2 ml every 2 days for 5 – 10 doses.

Contra-indication:
- Not to be used in cases of hyperphosphataemia.

Warnings:
Avoid perivascular injection.

Withdrawal periods:
- Meat : Nil.
- Milk : Nil.

Packs: 10, 20, 30, 50, 100, 250 & 500 ml.
name: Phospho Tonic

description:
Composition:
Each 1 gm contains:
- Amprolium HCl 240 mg (Eq to amprolium base 212.2 mg)

Properties:
- Amprolium is an anticoccidial agent that acts as a competitive inhibitor of thiamine in the parasite metabolism and interferes with the metabolism of glucosides necessaries for coccidian multiplication and survival.
- In in-vitro studies it was shown that the uptake of thiamine by schizonts of Eimeria tenella and by host intestinal cells can occur through passive diffusion or by an active, energy- and ph-dependent process.
- Amprolium competitively inhibited both systems, amprolium act against E. acervulina and E. tenella.

Target species:
Broilers.

Indications:
It is used for treatment of coccidioss caused by Eimeria spp. (E. tenella, E. acervulina).

Dosage and Administration:
- Taken orally via drinking water.
- For Whole Product: 0.94 gm / 10 kg b.wt. (0.94 gm  per liter) for 5-7 consecutive days.

Warnings & Precautions:
- The product is not intended for a preventive use.
- This product should be reserved in case of coccidiosis outbreaks due to non-availability of vaccine, in case of lack of efficacy of vaccine and in vaccinated flocks if a severe coccidial challenge is diagnosed before immunity has fully developed.
- Persons with known hypersensitivity to the active substances or to any of excipients, should avoid contact with the product.

Contraindications:
- Prolonged high dosages may cause thiamine deficiency.
- Treatment is usually no longer than 14 days.

Side effects:
- Occasionally may cause G1 or neurological effects.
- May be unpalatable.

Withdrawal time:
Meat and offal: Zero days.

Storage conditions:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C in a dry place, used immediately after opening and reconstruction.

Packaging:
HDPE opaque plastic jar contains LDPE coloress plastic bag Contains 10, 20, 25, 50, 100, 250, 500 or 1000 g powder and tightened with LDPE plasic seal strip, the jar is covered by HDPE opaque plastic cap with HDPE safety seal with outer label.

E.D.A. Reg. No: 4910/2021

Manufactured by:
Eva Pharma For Pharmaceuticals And Medical Appliances For Eva Pharma Pharmaceutical Industries
name: Viewcoxol 21.2%

description:
Composition
Each ml contains:  
- Florfenicol 300 mg
- Flunixin ( as flunixin meglumine ) 16.5 mg.

Properties:
- Florfenicol is a broad spectrum antibiotic that has activity against many bacteria such as Pasteurella multocida, Pasteurella haemolytica, Haemophilus somnus and Mycoplasma bovis. It acts by binding to the 50S ribosome, thereby inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis.
- Flunixin meglumine belongs to NSAIDs which have analgesic, anti-inflammatory and antipyretic activity by acting as a very potent inhibitor of cyclooxygenase.

Indications:
Megluflor is indicated for treatment of bovine respiratory disease (BRD) in cattle associated with Pasteurella multocida, Pasteurella haemolytica and Mycoplasma bovis.

Dosage:
- by subcutaneous injection.
- 6 ml Megluflor / 45 kg body weight as a single dose.

Contra-Indication & Warnings :
- Hypersensitivity to active ingredients.
- Do not use in animals suffering from hepatic, renal or cardiac diseases.
- Not to be used in lactating cattle producing milk for human consumption.

Side effects:
Swelling at the injection site after subcutaneous administration.

Withdrawal Time:
Meat : 46 days.

Packs: 10, 20, 30, 50 and 100 ml
name: Megluflor

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Carprofen 50 mg

Properties:
Carprofen is a non-steroidal, anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) with analgesic and antipyretic properties. It acts primarily by inhibiting cyclo-oxygenase leading to reduce the synthesis of prostaglandins and related compounds.

Indications:
- Morprofen Injection is indicated for reducing inflammation and pain during respiratory disease in cattle, in combination with suitable antibacterial if bacterial infection present.
- Morprofen Injection is indicated for analgesic and anti-inflammatory action in musculoskeletal disorders and after surgery in horses and ponies.

Dosage and administration:
- Cattle (less than 12 months of age): 1 ml Morprofen Injection /35 kg.b.wt administered subcutaneously or intravenously as a single dose.
- Horses and Ponies: 1 ml Morprofen Injection /70 kg.b.wt by intravenous injection as a single dose.
- This can be repeated after 24 hours if required.

Warnings and Precautions:
- Caution should be taken in treating any animal less than 6 weeks of age, or aged animals.
- Animals on long-term treatment should be monitored.
- Concurrent antibacterials should be given if a bacterial infection present.
- Following the withdrawal of the first dose, use remainder of the product within 28 days.
- Avoid the introduction of contamination during use
- For intravenous use only in the horse.

Contra-indications:
- Should not be used in cattle producing milk for human consumption.
- Should not be used in pregnant animals.
- Should not be used in racehorses prior to racing.
- Do not administer other NSAIDs concurrently or within 24 hours of each other.
- Avoid use in any dehydrated, hypovolaemic or hypotensive animals.
- Avoid concurrent administration of potential nephrotoxic drugs.

Side-effects:
- Prolonged use may cause gastro-intestinal lesions, inappetence, vomiting, and diarrhea.
- Rarely transient swelling at injection site.

Withdrawal periods:
Slaughter of cattle ( less than 12 months of age): 21 days.

Storage:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.
name: Morprofen

description:
Composition:
Each sachet contains:
- Neomycin sulphate 571.5 mg. (Neomycin base 400 mg.)
- Sulfaguanidine 4000 mg.
- Kaolin 4000 mg.
- Pectin 400 mg.
- Vitamin A 80000 I.U.
- Bismuth subnitrate 2000 mg.

Properties:
- Neomycin belongs to Aminoglycosides that acts against Gram-negative bacteria as E.coli through irreversibly binding to the 30S subunit of the bacterial ribosome and thereby interfering with several mechanisms in the mRNA translation process.
- Sulfaguanidine belongs to sulfonamides that have been used for the treatment of colibacillosis (E. coli) by interfering with normal production of RNA, protein synthesis and microbial replication mechanism by interfering with folic acid production.
- Kaolin and Pectin have adsorbent ability so it can adsorb and remove bacterial toxins from intestinal mucosa like E. coli toxins which consider the most important toxin in diarrhea.
- Bismuth subnitrate is a GIT protectants and adsorbent. It is not absorbed from the GIT and acts by lining the mucosal surface and adsorbing toxic products e.g. E. coli enterotoxins.

Indications:
For prevention and treatment of diarrhea and enteritis.

Target species: Calves, Lambs and Kids.

Dose: By oral route
Calves, Lambs and Kids: 0.5 sachet twice daily.

Contra-indication:
Presence of intestinal obstruction or hypersensitivity to Aminoglycosides.

Side-effects:
- Rarely cause ototoxicity and Nephrotoxicity.
- Severe diarrhea and intestinal malabsorption.

Warnings:
Don’t administer Kaolin and pectin with lincomycin as it may inhibit the oral absorption of lincomycin.

Withdrawal periods: 7 Days for meat.

Packs: 6 sachet x 12 gm. / Box.
name: New Diaclean

description:
Composition
Each 1 ml contains: 
- Butaphosphan 100 mg 
- Cyanocobalamin ( Vit. B12 ) 0.05 mg.

Properties:
Butaphosphan is one of organic phosphorus that is involved in all organic systems for improving the process of assimilation. Vitamin B12 is involved in the synthesis of proteins and red cells.

Indications:
For protecting and treatment of any phosphorus deficiency and in cases of acute and chronic metabolic diseases and disorders.

Target Species: Cattle, Horses, Sheep, Goats, Calves and Foals.

Dose: To be injected I/V, I/M or S/C.
- Cattle & Horses : 10 – 25 ml.
- Calves & Foals : 5 – 12.5 ml.
- Sheep & Goats : 2.5 – 5 ml.
- Dose should be repeated if necessary.
- In chronic cases, half of the dose should be taken for several times at various intervals from 3 – 5 days.

Side effects:  
Hypersensitivity to Cyanocobalamin.

Withdrawal Time: 
Milk: None. Meat : None.

Packs: 20, 50, 100 & 250 ml.
name: Metafosphan

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Oxytetracycline Hydrochloride 50 mg. ( eq to 46.3 mg of Oxytetracycline )
- Bromhexine Hydrochloride 3 mg. (eq to 2.74 mg Bromhexine)
- Lidocaine 20 mg.

Properties:
- OxyClear is a synergistic combination between Oxytetracycline & Bromhexine.
- Oxytetracycline is a wide spectrum antibiotic, which is widely used for local and systemic infection. Oxytetracycline has a bacteriostatic action against a large number of aerobic and anaerobic Gram-negative and Gram-positive microorganisms, Rickettsia, Mycoplasma, Chlamydia, Actinomyces and some blood protozoa.
- The bacteriostatic effect is based on the inhibition of the synthesis of bacterial protein. Oxytetracycline penetrates very rapidly into the blood and tissues with high concentration and relatively a high percentage of oxytetracycline is bound to serum proteins, therapeutic levels remain in the body for long times.
- Bromhexine is a mucolytic agent which aims to make bronchial secretions easier to propel by ciliary action to expel by coughing and in this way reduce cough frequency. It is also of value in achieving liquefaction and improving flow characteristics of mucus by increasing volume and decreasing viscosity.
- It is suggested that bromhexine improves lysosomal function and that lysosomal enzymes hydrolyze the mucopolysaccharide fibers of mucus.
- The advantage of bromhexine is that brings about an increase in the content of immunoglobulin and Oxytetracycline in bronchial secretions, presumably by increasing membrane permeability.
- The addition of bromhexine to oxytetracycline (OxyClear) significantly increases the sputum concentration of oxytetracycline which is cleared from plasma more effectively in the presence of bromhexine. So combination of bromhexine with oxytetracycline proves of value in the treatment of certain pulmonary Infections.
- The antibiotic activity is enhanced due to the synergistic action of bromhexine so bromhexine increases the efficacy of oxytetracycline against respiratory infections.

Indications:
OxyClear is indicated for the treatment of upper and lower respiratory tract infections caused by oxytetracycline sensitive G-ve and G+ve bacteria as well as Rickettsia, Mycoplasma and Chlamydia, especially in cases of retained mucoid secretions in Cattle and buffaloes.

Dosage and administration:
- Cattle and buffaloes: 1ml / 10kg .B.wt ( 5 mg Oxytetracycline HCl + 0.3 mg Bromhexine HCl / kg. B.wt) to be injected deep intramuscular daily for 3 – 5 days.

Contra-indications:
- Not to be used for lactating or pregnant animals.
- Not to be used by S/C or I/V injection.
- Not to be used for poultry.
- Not to be used with penicillin or streptomycin.

Side effects:
- Local swelling and pain at injection site.
- Teeth discoloration may be seen in growing calves.

Warning:
- For large volumes the dose should be injected deep intramuscular in different injection sites.
- Do not inject more than 15 ml for cattle and buffaloes in one site.

Withdrawal Period:
- Meat: 19 days.

Packs: 30, 50, 100 ml.
name: Oxyclear

description:
Anthelmintic (Benzimidazole)

Composition: 
Each Bolus (4 gm) contains
- Albendazole 0.25 gm

Properties:
Albendazole is a broad spectrum anthelmintic against roundworms, lungworms, tapeworms and adult fasciola in cattle and sheep. It belongs to benzimidazoles which act by interrupting parasite energy metabolism by binding to tubulin, thereby disrupting microtubular cell structure and preventing nutrient uptake and other functions.

Target Species: Cattle & Sheep.

Indications:
Parabenzole is indicated for the treatment of:
- Roundworms infestation by Bunostomum, Chabertia, Cooperia, Haemonchus, Nematodirus, Oesophagostomum, Teladorsagia (Ostertagia), Strongyloides and Trichostrongylus spp affecting cattle & sheep.
- Lungworms infestation by Dictyocaulus spp affecting cattle and sheep.
- Tapeworms infestation by Moniezia spp affecting cattle and sheep.
- Flukes infestation by adult Fasciola hepatica affecting cattle and sheep.

Dose: 
- To be given orally as a single dose.
Sheep:
- For Roundworms and Tapeworms : 1 bolus / 50 kg. B.wt.
- For Adult flukes : 1 bolus / 33 kg. B.wt.

Cattle:
- For Roundworms and Tapeworms : 1 bolus / 33 kg. B.wt.
- For Adult flukes : 1 bolus / 25 kg. B.wt.

Contra-indication:
- Should not be used in sheep producing milk for human consumption.
- Not to be used concurrently with other ruminal boluses.
- Should not be used in ewes at a dosage of 7.5 mg / 1 kg during the mating period and until 1 month after rams are removed.

Side-effects:
Coughing for some weeks after treatment in cattle suffering from severe lung damage at time of treatment.

Warnings:
- Operators should wear suitable protective clothing.
- Care should be taken to avoid exceed « fluke and worm dose » in cows during first month of pregnancy.

Withdrawal Time:
Meat & Milk: Nil

Packs: 32 & 64 Bolus / Box.
name: Parabenzole Bolus

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Oxytetracycline dihydrate 215.7 mg (Equivalent to 200 mg oxytetracycline)

Properties: 
Oxytetracycline belongs to tetracyclines which act as bacteriostatic antibiotics and inhibit protein synthesis by reversibly binding to 30S ribosomal subunits of susceptible organisms, thereby preventing binding to those ribosomes of aminoacyl transfer-RNA. Oxytetracycline is active against wide range of microorganisms including Gram-positive bacteria such as Staphylococcus spp., Streptococcus spp., Actinomyces spp., Bacillus anthracis and Clostridium spp. and Gram-negative bacteria such as Bordetella spp., Brucella, Haemophilus spp., Pasteurella multocida, Shigella, and Yersinia pestis. It is also active against Mycoplasma, spirochetes, Chlamydia, Rickettsia, Anaplasma and Listeria monocytogenes.

Indications: 
Oxyvet-Pharma 20% L.A Inj. is indicated for treatment of:
- Shipping fever pneumonia cause by Pasteurella multocida and Pasteurella haemolytica in cattle.
- Infectious bovine keratoconjunctivitis in cattle caused by Moraxella bovis.
- Navel/joint ill caused by Actinomyces pyogenes, E. coli and Staphylococcus aureus in cattle and sheep.
- Mastitis caused by Actinomyces pyogenes, E. coli, Staphylococcus aureus, Streptococcus agalactiae, or Streptococcus uberis in cattle and sheep.
- Metritis caused by E. coli or Streptococcus pyogenes in cattle and sheep.
- Septicemia caused by Salmonella dublin and Streptococcus pyogenes in cattle and sheep.
- Erysipelas caused by Erysipelothrix rhusiopathiae in cattle and sheep.
- Control of enzootic abortion in sheep caused by Chlamydia psittaci.

Target species: Cattle and Sheep.

Dosage and administration:
- by deep intramuscular injection.
- 1 ml Oxyvet-Pharma 20% L.A Inj. / 10 kg body weight as a single dose.

Contra-Indication:
- Hypersensitivity to tetracyclines.
- Not used in sheep producing milk for human consumption.

Side Effects:
- May cause vomiting and diarrhea.
- Photodermatitis.
- Transient swelling at site of injection.

Warnings:
Care with use in animals with renal or hepatic impairment.

Withdrawal time:
- Cattle : Meat : 31 days. Milk : 10 days.
- Sheep: Meat : 9 days. Milk : 7 days.

Packs: 30 & 100 ml sterile injection bottles.
name: Spectropan 20% LA

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Oxytetracycline HCl 107.93 mg (Equiv. to Oxytetracycline base 100 mg.)

Properties:
Oxytetracycline is a broad spectrum bacteriostatic antibiotic. It acts through inhibiting protein synthesis by binding with 30S ribosomal subunits. Oxytetracycline is active against wide range of Gram-positive and Gram negative organisms. It is also active against Mycoplasma, Ehrlichia, Rickettsia, Chlamydia and Anaplasma.

Indications:
- Treatment of infections caused by oxytetracycline sensitive organisms as:
- Shipping fever pneumonia cause by Pasteurella spp in cattle.
- Pneumonia caused by Pasteurella haemolytica in sheep.
- Bacterial Enteritis (scours) caused by E. coli in cattle.
- Calf Diphtheria caused by Fusobacterium necrophorum.
- Wooden Tongue in cattle and sheep caused by Actinobacillus lignieresii.
- Anaplasmosis caused by Anaplasma marginale in cattle.
- Theileriosis caused by Theileria parva in cattle.
- Wound infections, acute metritis and traumatic injury caused by oxytetracycline-susceptible strains of streptococcal and staphylococcal organisms.

Target Species: Cattle, Sheep & Calves.

Dose:
- By Intramuscular or Intravenous injections.
- 0.5 ml Spectropan-10 per 10 kg B.Wt for 3 – 5 days.

Contra-indications:
- Not to be used in sheep producing milk for human consumption.
- Last 2 – 3 weeks of gestation in pregnant animals and up to 4 weeks of age in neonates.

Side-Effects:
- May cause slight diarrhea.
- Transient swelling at site of injection.
- Photodermatitis.

Warnings:
Care with use in animals with renal or hepatic impairment.

Withdrawal Time:
- Cattle: Milk : 2.5 days. Meat : 15 days.
- Sheep: Meat : 21 days.

Packs: 50, 100, 250 & 500 ml.
name: Spectropan-10

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Fenbendazole 50 mg.
- Rafoxanide 50 mg.

Indications: 
Parafluke suspension is a combination of broad spectrum anthelmintic used for the treatment and control of different parasitic infestations in farm animals such as mature and immature stages of gastro-intestinal nematodes including inhibited & hypobiotic larvae, lung worms, liver flukes (mature and immature Fasciola spp over 4 weeks of age), rumen flukes (Paramphistomum spp), cestodes infestations (Moniezia spp) as well as Larval stages of tissue invading flies such as cattle warble flies and nasal bot flies in sheep.

Dosage & administration: (oral drench)
- The recommended therapeutic dose of Fenbendazole and Rafoxanide is 8 mg/kg body weight for cattle & buffaloes and 7.5 mg/kg body weight for sheep & goats.
- Shake well before use

Withdrawal periods: 28 days.
name: Parafluke

description:
Anthelmintic (Avermectin)

Composition: 
Each 1 ml contains
- Ivermectin 0.8 mg.

Properties: 
Ivermectin is an endectocide with activity against a wide range of internal and external parasites. It enhances the release of gamma amino butyric acid (GABA) at presynaptic neurons. GABA acts as an inhibitory neurotransmitter and blocks the post-synaptic stimulation of the adjacent neuron in nematodes or the muscle fiber in arthropods. By stimulating the release of GABA, ivermectin causes paralysis of the parasite and eventual death.

Indications:
Sheep & Goats:
- Gastrointestinal roundworms: Ostertagia circumcincta, Haemonchus contortus, Trichostrongylus spp., Cooperia spp., Strongyloides papillosus, Oesophagostomum spp., Chabertia ovina, Nematodirus spp., Trichuris ovis (adult).
- Lungworms: Dictyocaulus filaria (adult and immature).
- Nasal Bots: Oestrus ovis (all larval stages).
- Mange Mites: Psoroptes ovis.

Cattle:
- Gastrointestinal roundworms: Ostertagia circumcincta, Haemonchus contortus, Trichostrongylus spp., Cooperia spp., Strongyloides papillosus, Oesophagostomum spp., Chabertia ovina, Nematodirus spp., Trichuris ovis (adult).
- Lungworms: Dictyocaulus viviparus (adult and immature).
- Grubs: Hypoderma bovis, Hypoderma lineatum.
- Lice: Linognathus vituli, Haematopinus eurysternus.
- Mange Mites: Sarcoptes bovis.

Horses:
- Adult and 4th small strongyles, the large strongyles: Strongylus vulgaris, S. equines, S. edentates.
- Ascarids: Parascaris equorum.
- Pinworms: Oxyuris equi.
- Stomach worms: Draschia megastoma, Habronema spp.
- Intestinal worms: Trichostrongylus axei.
- Lungworms: Dictyocaulus arnfieldi.

Target Species: Sheep, Goats, Cattle and Horses.

Dose:
- To be used as oral drench.
- 2.5 ml of ORAMECTIN per 10 kg B.Wt. as a single dose and not to be repeated.

Side effects: 
Occasional coughing in sheep and goats.

Contra-indication:
• Not to be used in animals producing milk for human consumption.
• Not to be used in animals with hypersensitivity to ivermectin.

Warnings & Precautions:
• Avoid contact with the eyes, skin and clothing.               
• Resistance may be developed to any drench.

Withdrawal Time: 
• Meat for sheep & goats: 14 days.              
• Meat for Cattle: 28 days.

Storage: Store at temperature not exceeding 30ºC and to be used immediately after opening.
name: Oramectin

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Imidocarb dipropionate 120 mg  (Equivalent to 85 mg imidocarb)

Properties: 
Imidocarb dipropionate is N,N’-bis [ 3-(4,5-dihydro-1H-imidazol-2-yl)- phenyl ] urea dipropionate which is a carbanilide diamidine derivative. It is effective against Babesia spp. infection. It is a cholinesterase inhibitor. It appears to act directly on the parasite leading to an alteration in morphology. Imidocarb is excreted unchanged mainly in the urine. It is effective in preventing and treating bovine babesiosis without interfering with the development of immunity.

Indications:
- Prophylaxis and treatment of babesiosis (Redwater fever) caused by Babesia bovis, Bab. bigemina and Bab. divergens sensitive to imidocarb in cattle.
- Prophylaxis and treatment of babesiosis caused by Babesia canis sensitive to imidocarb in dogs.
- Treatment of babesiosis caused by Babesia caballi sensitive to imidocarb in horses.
- Treatment of anaplasmosis caused by Anaplasma marginale and A. centrale sensitive to imidocarb in cattle.

Dose:
Cattle:
- Treatment: 1 ml Imicarbzole / 100 kg.b.wt. to be injected SC as a single dose.
- Prophylaxis: 1 ml Imicarbzole / 40 kg.B.wt. to be injected SC as a single dose.

Dogs:
- Treatment:1 ml Imicarbzole / 60 kg.B.wt. to be injected SC as a single dose.
- Prophylaxis: 1 ml Imicarbzole / 30 kg.B.wt. to be injected SC as a single dose.

Horses: 1 – 1.5 ml Imicarbzole / 60 kg. B.wt. to be injected IM and repeated after 24 hours.

Warnings:
- Operators should wear suitable protective clothing.
- Not to be handled by operators under medical advice not to work with compounds that may exhibit anti cholinesterase activity.
- Risk versus benefit should be considered before using this drug in animals with impaired lung, liver or kidney functions.

Contra-indication:
- Do not repeat doses in cattle.
- Do not inject IV or SC in horses.
- Safety has no determined in puppies, or in breeding, lactating or pregnant dogs.
- Do not use this product simultaneously with exposure to cholinesterase inhibiting drugs, pesticides or chemicals.

Side-effects:
- Restlessness, sweating and abdominal pain may occur.
- Transient vomiting immediately after dosing in dogs.
- Pain on injection in dogs.
- Mild cholinergic signs after dosing such as salivation, nasal drip or brief episodes of vomiting.
- Other effects seen less frequently are panting, diarrhea, and mild injection site inflammation lasting one to several days.
- Rarely, injection site ulceration occurs, but the lesion is not resistant to healing.
- If severe cholinergic signs occur, they may be reversed with atropine sulfate.

Withdrawal Periods:
Horse : 60 days.
Cattle : Meat: 28 days. Milk: 2 days.

Packs: 10, 20, 30, 50, 100 ml.
name: Imicarbzole

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Vitamin E 20 mg 
- Sod. Selenite 800 mcg

Indications : 
TOCOSEL – B is recommended for the prevention and treatment of selenium-tocopherol deficiency in cattle, sheep and poultry.

Dosage :
- Cattle : 10 ml TOCOSEL – B / 67 kg.B.wt / day for 3 – 5 days
- Sheep : 1 ml TOCOSEL – B / 6.7 kg.B.wt / day for 3 – 5 days.
- Poultry : 1 ml TOCOSEL – B per liter of drinking water for 3 – 5 days.
name: Tocosel-B

description:
Anthelmintic (Halogenated Phenol)

Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Nitroxynil  340 mg

Properties:
Nitroxynil is an antiparasitic salicylanilides. Salicylanides are proton ionophores that actas specific uncoupler of mitochondrialoxidative phosphorylation disrupting theenergy metabolism of the parasite. The chemical structure of salicylanilides ischaracterized by the presence of a proton unstable. Are lipophilic molecules that allow the passage of protons across membranes, in particular of the inner mitochondrial membrane. It is active against mature and immature Fasciola hepatica in cattle and sheep. It is also effective, at the recommended dose rate, against adult and larval infestations of Haemonchus contortus in cattle and sheep and Haemonchus placei, Oesphagostomum radiatum and Bunostomum phlebotomum in cattle.

Indications:
Nitrolid 34% is indicated for the treatment of fascioliasis caused by infestation of mature and immature Fasciola hepatica in cattle and sheep.

Target Species:
Sheep and Cattle

Dosage & administration:
Administrated by S/C injection.

Sheep:
- 0.5 ml / 14-20 kg b.wt
- 0.75 ml / 21-30 kg b.wt
- 1 ml /31-40 kg b.wt
- 1.5 ml / 41-55 kg b.wt
- 2 ml / 56-75 kg b.wt
- 2.5 ml / Over 75 kg b.wt

• In outbreaks of fascioliasis each sheep in the flock should be injected immediately the presence of the disease is recognised, repeating treatment as necessary throughout the period when infestation is occurring, at intervals of not less than one month.
• On farms with fluke-infested pastures, routine preventative dosing should be carried out at intervals of not less than one month.

Cattle:
- 1.5 ml of product / 50 kg b.wt
- Both infected and in-contact animals should be treated, treatment being repeated as considered necessary, though not more frequently than once per month.

Warning & Precautions:
Ewes in advanced pregnancy and not intended to produce milk for human consumption should be driven, handled and dosed carefully.

Contraindications:
- Do not use in animals with known hypersensitivity to the active ingredient.
- Not authorised for use in cattle and sheep producing milk for human consumption including during the dry period.
- Do not use during the last trimester of pregnancy in heifers which are intended to produce milk for human consumption.
- Do not use within 1 year prior to the first lambing in ewes intended to produce milk for human consumption.

Withdrawal time:
- Cattle and sheep may be slaughtered for human consumption only after 60 days from the last treatment.
- Not authorised for use in cattle and sheep producing milk for human consumption including during the dry period.

Side Effects:
Small swellings are occasionally observed at the injection site in cattle. These can be avoided by injecting the dose in two separate sites and massaging well to disperse the solution.

Storage conditions:
Store at temperature not more than 30°C.

Packaging:
Carton box containing treated soda-lime type II amber glass bottle contains 100ml, 250ml, 500ml and 1 L injectable solutions with bromobutyl rubber stopper and aluminium/PET Plastic flip off cap with outer label and insert leaflet.

Manufacture by
Badr Pharma For Pharmaceutical Industries For Raa Company
name: Nitrolid 34%

description:
COMPOSITION
Each 1 ml contains:
• Active substances:
- Sulfadoxine  200 mg 
- Trimethoprim  40 mg

• Excipients:
- Methyl parahydroxybenzoate  0.5 mg

PHARMACOLOGICAL PROPERTIES
» Pharmacodynamic properties:
- Sulfadoxine is used in combination with trimethoprim in the mixing ratio 5 parts sulfadoxine + 1 part trimethoprim used. The mechanism of action of the combination is based on a blocking sequential effect of the substances in the bacterial folic acid metabolism. The combination has an additive effect on intensity and thus allows a significant dose reduction of individual components.
- The spectrum of action of the drug combination corresponds to the sulfonamides. The action is directed against accordingly numerous gram positive and gram negative bacteria (E. coli, Shigella spp, Klebsiella spp, Proteus vulgaris, Arcanobacterium pyogenes, Pasteurella and Mannheimia species, staphylococci, streptococci, pneumococci, Salmonella, etc.) and coccidiostatic against various Eimeria species (E. tenella, E. necatrix, E. maxima, E. brunetti, E. acervulina, etc.).

» Pharmacokinetic properties:
- Both components of the combination are absorbed as wel as the individual substances after oral and parenteral administration. Maximum plasma levels are reached within about 1 to 8 hours.
- The elimination half-lives move in a range of about 7 to 16 (up to 25) hours (sulfadoxine) or about 0.5 to 3 (up to 4) hours (Trimethoprim). Sulfadoxine and trimethoprim are distributed in all tissues where the volume of distribution of trimethoprim is higher than that of sulfadoxine.

INDICATIONS
Cattle, calves, pigs, piglets:
As a treatment of infectious diseases caused by Sulfadoxine- and Trimethoprim-sensitive pathogenic organisms in the early stage of the infection like:
Primary and secondary infections of
- The respiratory system,
- The gastro-intestinal tract an the uro-genital system,
- The skin and the joints.
• The application of Trimetox® 240 should be subject to an antibiogram.

CONTRAINDICATIONS
- Hypersensitivities to sulfonamides or Trimethoprim,
- Resistances against sulfonamides or Trimethoprim,
- Severe liver and kidney function disorders,
- Fluid losses,
- Disturbances in the haemogram.
- The intravenous application of Trimetox® 240 after application of or simultaneous with substances acting on the central nervous system (e.g. anaesthetics, neuroleptics) should be avoided.
- Do not use in new-borns.

ADVERSE REACTIONS
• Upon application of Trimetox 240 may occur:
- Local irritations on the injection site after intramuscular application,
- Liver damages,
- Renal lesions,
- Changes in the haematogram (e.g. haemolytical anemia, agranulocytosis),
- Sensitization reactions (e.g. exanthema, fever).
• Upon intravenous application in cattle, short-term systemic reactions (dyspnea, excitation) have been noticed in isolated cases.

» When alleraic reactions occur, the administration of the veterinary medicinal product has to be stopped immediately and a symptomatic treatment should follow:
- In anaphylaxia: Epinephrin (Adrenalin) and glucocorticoids, intravenous.
- In allergic skin reactions: antihistaminics and/or glucocorticoids.

• If you notice any serious effects not mentioned in this leaflet, please inform your veterinary surgeon.

TARGET SPECIES
Cattle, calves, pigs, piglets

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
- For intravenous or intramuscular use for cattle and calves
- For intramuscular use for pigs and piglets.

- 15 mg of the Sulfadoxine-Trimethoprim combination / kg body weight (b.w.)yday, equivalent to 1 ml / 16 kg b.w./day.

- In case of considerably severe cases of disease, the dose can be increased to 25 mg of the Sulfadoxine-Trimethoprim combination / kg b.w./day, equivalent to 1 ml / 9.6 kg b.w./day.

- The indicated dosage shall only be applicable if the pathogenic organism is sensitive to both individual components.

Special Note:
- Because of the tissue-irritating characteristic of Trimetox® 240 in cattle, large volume injections for the intramuscular route of administration should be distributed over a number of injection sites. The duration of treatment encompasses a minimum of 3 days, preferably, however, 5 to 7 days. After the disease symptoms subside, Trimetox® 240 should be administered for at least 2 further days.
- Where there is no significant improvement in the state of the illness after 1-day treatment, the continuation of the treatment is recommended only after confirming the pathogen's sensitivity by an antibiogram; as the case may be a change in therapy may be necessary.

ADVICE ON CORRECT ADMINISTRATION
Not applicable.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
Cattle: (IV Route)
- Meat and offal: 8 days
- Milk: 4 days

Cattle: (IM Route)
- Meat and offal: 6 days
- Milk: 4 days

Pigs:
- Meat and offal: 6 days

STORAGE PRECAUTIONS
- Keep out of the reach and sight of children.
- Do not store above 25°C.
- Protect from light!
- Do not use after the expiry date which is stated on the label and box.
- Once broached, use within 28 days.

SPECIAL WARNINGS
» Precautions for the person:
Persons administering the veterinary medicinal product should avoid the direct contact with the skin and mucosa for reasons of sensitization.

» Pregnancy, lactation or lay:
The safety of the administration of sulfonamides during pregnancy has not been verified. They should only be used when the benefit of treatment is significantly higher than possible risks. Mares giving milk for human consumption are to be excluded from the treatment.

» Drug interaction:
Trimetox® 240 should not be simultaneously used with: Hexamethylene tetramine (Methenamine), Phenylbutazone, local anaesthetics belonging to the group of esters of para-aminobenzoic acid (Procaine, Tetracaine).

» Overdose:
After resorption of high amounts of sulfonamides atactic motions, muscular convulsions and myospasms as well as comatose situations are observed. The symptomatic treatment of neurotropic effects is carried out by administration of centrally sedating substances, like barbiturates. Additional to an administration of Vitamin K and folic acid for increasing the renal excretion of sulfonamides, alkalizing agents (e.g. Sodium bicarbonate) should be administered.

DISPOSAL PRECAUTIONS
- Medicines should not be disposed of via wastewater or household waste.
- Ask your veterinary surgeon how to dispose of medicines no longer required.

Date on which the package leaflet was last approved
12/2014

OTHER INFORMATION
- Multidose glass containers at 100 ml and 250 ml.
- Package sizes: 1 x 100 ml, 12 x 100 ml, 1 x 250 ml and 12 x 250 ml.
- Not all pack sizes may be marketed.

Marketing authorisation holder:
Veyx-Pharma GmbH
Söhreweg 6
34639 Schwarzenborn
Germany

Manufacturer:
Veyx-Pharma B.V.
Forellenweg 16
NL-4941 SJ Raamsdonksveer
The Netherlands
name: Trimetox 240

description:
Synthetic prostaglandin hormone

Juramate
Synthetic Prostaglandin for Cattle and Horses
A luteolytic agent for clinical use and the control of the bovine and equine oestrus cycles.

Active Constituent
250 micrograms/mL Cloprostenol  (as the sodium salt)

Indications
Cattle: A single intramuscular dose of Juramate is likely to be effective for the following conditions: suboestrus (NDO), termination of normal but unwanted pregnancies, termination of abnormal pregnancy, chronic endometritis, induction of parturition, ovarian luteal cysts. Also for use in controlled breeding programs in dairy and beef cattle.

Horses: Juramate is of value in the following clinical situations: induction of luteolysis following early foetal death and resorption, treatment of pseudopregnancy, treatment of lactation anoestrus, barren and maiden mares, synchronisation of oestrus, nomination of the time of service.

Dosage
- Cattle: Single or repeat doses of 2mL by intramuscular injection
- Horses (less than or equal to 400kg bodyweight)
A single dose of 0.5mL to 1.0mL by intramuscular injection
- Horses (greater than 400kg bodyweight)
A single dose of 1.0mL to 2.0mL by intramuscular injection.

Withholding Period(s)
Meat: DO NOT USE less than 1 day before slaughter for human consumption
Milk: Nil

Size	& Code:
100 mL multi-dose vial-501530
10 x 20 mL multi-dose vials-500965
name: Juramate

description:
Composition
Each injector contains:
- Neomycin sulphate 500 000 I.U.
- Procaine benzylpenicillin 300 000 I.U. 
- Excipients up to 10 g.

Target species
Lactating cattle

Indications
Treatment of mastitis caused by microorganisms susceptible to penicillin and/or neomycin.

Dosage and administration
Before infusion, the udder should be milked out completely. The teat and its orifice should be thoroughly cleaned. The contents of one syringe should be infused into each affected quarter via the teat canal, immediately after milking.

Dosage: 
- Cow: 1 injector per infected quarter
- If necessary repeat once or twice with an interval of 12 hours.

Pack size
Box with 20 injectors
name: Mastikel NP

description:
Composition
Diacidol is a non-systemic public health pesticide, from the organophosphorus compounds, used as ectoparasiticide, contains 60% (w/v) Diazinon (O,O-diehyl 0-2- isopropyl- 6-methylpyramidin- 4-yl Phosphorothioate (IUPAC)) as emulsifiable concentrate.

Indications
Diacidol:  is a non-systemic organophosphoric public health pesticide, affecting by contact and via digestive and respiratory systems.
Diacidol:  controls several species of insects and is used to treat all types of scabs and control ticks, fleas and snails on goats, sheep, cows and other farm animals.
Diacidol:  is used to control different types of stable flies and their larvae.

Dosage and administration:
Sheep & Goats
Spray 1 Lit / 1000 Liters water
Dip 1 Lit / 2400 Liters water

Cows & Camels
Spray 1 Lit / 1000 Liters water
Dip 1 Lit / 1000 Liters water

Other Animals
Spray 1 Lit / 1000 Liters water
Dip 1 Lit / 1000 Liters water

Animal Houses
Spray 1 Lit / 25 Liters water

Contraindications
Toxic for cats, fish, bees and poultry.

Storage
Store away from any direct source of heat or flame and at temperature below 30 C.
name: Diacidol 60 EC

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Toldimfos Sodium  200 mg (Sodium-4-dimethylamino-2-methyl phosphonate)

Properties:
Toldimfos Sodium is the Sodium salt of 4-dimethylamino-2-methyl phosphonate. No specific data on the pharmacodynamic action of toldimfos was submitted. The precise mode of action of toldimfos is unknown, it appears more likely that the effect of toldimfos arises due to the multiple stimulation of metabolism within the body. Toldimfos is an aromatic phosphorus compound which falls between phosphorous itself and phosphoric acid in the stage of oxidation.

Indications:
» Cattle, sheep, goats, horses, dogs and cats: For prevention & treatment of phosphorus deficiencies.
» Cattle and dogs: As Tonic & restorative for the treatment of general metabolic disorders.

Skeletal defects:
Rickets and osteomalacia or promotion of rapid union in fractures, particulary when associated with vitamin D therapy.

Tetany and paresis:
Caused by disorders of calcium, magnesium and phosphorus metabolism (post – parturient paresis, lactation tetany, grass tetany, etc.). In these cases, Tonotest has a synergistic effect when given in conjunction with specific magnesium or calcium therapy.

General metabolic disorders:
Tonotest is a useful form of therapy in the treatment of debility, whether during convalescence or the result of nutritional disorders. It may be useful after difficult parturition, in debility of the newborn and in deficiency syndromes in cattle and dogs of all ages.

Target species:
Cattle-Horse-Sheep-Goat-Dog and Cats.

Dosage and administration:
- Intravenously, intramusculary or subcutaneously.

Equine and Cattle:
• As whole product:
- Adults: 1 ml per 50 kg, may be increased to 1 ml per 10 kg for cattle during the first intervention.
- Young: 1-2 ml per 10 kg
• As active ingredient:
- Adults: 200 mg Toldimfos Sodium per 50 kg, may be increased to 200mg Toldimfos Sodium per 10 kg for cattle during the first intervention .
- Young: 200-400mg Toldimphos Sodium per 10 kg

Sheep and goats: 
• As whole product:
- Adults: 0.5 ml to 1 ml per 10 kg
- Young: 0.5 ml per kg
• As active ingredient:
- Adults: 100-200mg Toldimfos Sodium per 10 kg
- Young: 100 mg Toldimfos Sodium per kg

Dogs and cats: 
- As whole product: 0.5 ml to 1 ml per kg to 10 kg
- As active ingredient: 100-200 mg Toldimfos Sodium per kg to 10 kg

- They will be repeated every day or every 2 to 3 days for 5-10 days in the opinion of the attending veterinarian.
- In the case of chronic conditions, 5-10 injections can be performed

Warnings and precautions:
Following withdrawal of the first dose, use the product within 14 days.

Contra-indications:
Do not use in case of hypersensitivity to the active substances or to any of the excipients.

Advers effects:
In case of overdose, there is a risk of electrolyte imbalance.

Withdrawal time:
Meat, Milk: Zero days

Storage conditions:
Do not store above 25ºC.

Package:
50, 100, 250 ml multidose glass bottles

M.O.H. Reg. No.: 2991/2006 vet

MADE IN EGYPT
MANUFACTURED BY ARABCOMED FOR DRUGEST PHARMACEUTICALS COMPANY
name: Tonotest

description:
Anthelmintic (Avermectin)

Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Eprinomectin 20 mg

Properties
- Zero-Mec for the treatment of infestations by the internal and external parasite sensitive to eprinomectin:
- Sucking lice: Haematopinus eurysternus, Linognathus vituli, Solenopotes capillatus.
- Horn flies: Haematobia irritans
- Warbles (parasitic stages): Hypoderma bovis, Hypoderma lineatum
- Mange mites: Sarcoptes scabiei var. bovis.

Prevention of reinfestations:
The product protects treated animals against reinfestations with: Trichostrongylus spp. (including Trichostrongylus axei and Trichostrongylus colubriformis), Haemonchus placei, Cooperia spp. (including Cooperia oncophora, Cooperia punctata, Cooperia surnabada), Dictyocaulus viviparus, Oesophagostomum radiatum, Ostertagia spp. (including Ostertagia ostertagi and Ostertagia lyrata) and Nematodirus helvetianus for 14 days. Haematobia irritans for at least 7 days.

Dosage:
- By Subcutaneous Injection.
- Single administration of 0.2 mg of eprinomectin per kg bodyweight, (equivalent to 1 ml of the veterinary medicinal product per 100 kg bodyweight).

- 50 ml and 100 ml vials: Do not exceed 30 broachings per vial. If more than 30 broachings are required, use of a draw off needle is recommended.

- 250 ml and 500 ml vials: Do not exceed 20 broachings per vial. If more than 20 broachings are required, use of a draw off needle is recommended.

​​​​​​​- To ensure administration of a correct dose, bodyweight should be determined as accurately as possible and accuracy of the dosing device should be checked.

Withdrawal period
- Meat and Offal: 63 days
- Milk: zero hours.

Contraindications:
- Do not use in other animal species.
- Do not use in case of hypersensitivity to active substance or to any of the excipients.

Adverse reactions:
- Following treatment, moderate to severe swelling at the site of injection is very common.
- Typically, the swelling resolves within 7 days, but induration (hardness) may persist for in excess of 21 days.
- Swelling may be associated with mild to moderate pain.
- This reaction disappears without any treatment and does not impair the safety or efficacy of the veterinary medicinal product.
- If you notice any serious effects or other effects not mentioned in this package leaflet, please inform your veterinary surgeon.
name: Zero-Mec

description:
Composition:
Each sachet contains:
- Quinapyramine Sulphate 3 gm

Properties
The Quinapyramine sulphate salt is water soluble to which the curative action of TRYPA-STOP could be attributed, which is a potent trypanocidal.

Indications
- TRYPA-STOP is composed of quinapyramine sulphate which is a potent trypanocidal.
- TRYPA-STOP is effective in the treatment of trypanomiasis in camels, cattle & horses caused by different trypanosoma spp., T. evansi, T. congolense, T. vivax, T. brucei, and T. simiae.

Dosage and administration
- Dissolve 1 sachet in 15 ml sterile water use for intramuscular or subcutaneous.
- Camels, Cattle & Horses: 1 ml per 40-67 kg b. wt..

Withdrawal period
Meat: 21 days.
Milk: 4 days.

Special Precautions:
- Weight of the animal need to be assessed as accurately as possible especially young animals.
- Shake well before use, and use immediately upon reconstitution.
- Don’t Store the reconstituted suspension, use immediately.

Untoward Reactions:
- Upon correct assessment of b. wt., and dosing, side effects are less likely to occur, however, salivation, restlessness and tremors at the site of injection had been observed in some susceptible animals.
- These signs are only transitory and need resting of the animal in a quite place.

Overdosage:
- Toxicity is not so important as with other trypanocidals, except in young animals where over dosage may cause sweating, salivation, trembling and followed in severe cases by an increase in heart rate and respiration, collapse and possibly death.
- In cow some time rusty colored diarrhea might be observed.

Storage:
Store in a dark place at a temperature below 30ºC.

Packing:
3 gm aluminum foil sterile powder for injection.
name: Trypa stop

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains
- Dipyrone 500 mg

Properties
- Dipyrone, like other non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, acts by inhibiting cyclo-oxygenase mediated production of prostaglandins.
- It has analgesic, antipyretic and slight anti-inflammatory properties and reportedly has antispasmodic activity on bradykinin-induced spasms on the intestinal tract, but does not appreciably alter spontaneous intestinal motility.

Indications
- Dipyrone, the active ingredient of PYROGESIC, is a derivative of the pyrazolon Analgesics.
- It is an effective analgesic, anti-inflammatory and antipyretic drug.
- These effects are due to its analgesic action over the Central Nervous system, leading to pain relief and quietening of the animal.
- PYROGESIC proved to be effective against wide range of symptoms of colic, spasmodic conditions, hypermotility of intestine, paresis, both acute and chronic rheumatic conditions (Rheumatism, Neuritis Tendo-vaginitis), pain, fever, Mastitis.

Dosage and administration
By subcutaneous, intramuscular or intravenous (slow) injection.
- Horses: 11-22 mg/kg b. wt. (Equivalent to 2.2-4.4 ml/100 kg b. wt.)
- Dogs and Cats: 27.5 mg/kg body weight. (Equivalent to 0.55 ml/10 kg b. wt.)

Withdrawal period
In horses do not administer the drug within 5 days before racing.

Contraindications and Precautions:
- Dipyrone is physically incompatible with apmorphine, aspirine, chloral hydrate and oxidizing agents.
- Contraindicated in animals with history of hematological or bone marrow abnormalities.
- Dipyrone should not be used concurrently with phenylbutazone or barbiturates.
- Concomitant administration with chloropromazine may cause serious hypothermia.
- In horses do not administer the drug within 5 days before racing.

Storage:
Store in a dark place at a temperature below 30°C.

Packing:
20, 50 and 100 ml amber glass bottles
name: Pyrogesic

description:
Composition:
Each 2.5 gm contains;
- Quinapyramine Sulphate 1.5 gm
- Quinapyramine Chloride 1 gm

Properties
TRYBAN is composed of both Quinapyramine salts (Sulphate and Chloride) which differ in their absorption and action in the body, the Sulphate salt is water soluble to which the curative action of TRYBAN could be attributed, and the chloride salt which is less soluble forming a depot at the site of injection, it is absorbed slowly and the prophylactic action could be attributed.

Indications
TRYBAN is effective in prevention and treatment of trypanomisis in camels, cattle, horses, dogs & pigs caused by different Ttypanosoma spp. T. evansi, T. con golense, T. vivax, T. brucei, T. equinum, T. equiperdeum and T. simiae.

Dosage and administration
- Add 15 ml water for injection to the bottle, shake to reconstitute the suspension.
- The recommended dose for animals is 0.025 ml per kg b. wt., subcutaneous route.
- Which is (Equivalent to Quinapyramine Sulphate: 2.5 mg/kg b. wt. and Quinapyramine Chloride l.67 mg/kg b. wt.).
- TRYBAN injection should be administered subcutaneously using sterile syringes and needles and employing an aseptic technique.
- Massage at the site of injection is good to disperse the drug and minimise the risk of local reactions.
- In debilitated animals TRYBAN should be reconstituted to 30 ml and dose be divided up to 12 hourly installments.
- In areas where Nagana and Surra are endemic, herds should be given TRYBAN prophylactically every 2-3 months.
- For horses it is advisable to dilute to 30 ml and be given intramuscularly into two or three injections at different sites.

Withdrawal period
Meat: 21 days.
Milk: 4 days.

Untoward Reactions:
- Upon correct assessment of body weight and dosing, side effects are less likely to occur, however, salivation, restlessness and tremors at the site of injection had been observed in some susceptible animals.
- These signs are only transitory and need resting of the animal in a quite place.

Overdosage: 
- Toxicity is not so important as with other trypanocidals, except in young animals where over dosage may cause sweating, salivation, trembling and followed in severe cases by an increase in heart rate and respiration, collapse and possibly death.
- In cow some time rusty colored diarrhea might be observed.
- The chloride salt is absorbed very much more slowly than the sulphate and used by itself is non toxic.

Storage:
Store in a dark place at a temperature below 30ºC.

Packing:
2.5 gm injectable powder in amber glass bottles to be dissolved in 15 ml.
2.5 gm injectable powder in aluminum foil sachets to be dissolved in 15 ml.
name: Tryban

description:
Scourban Plus suspension is an oral Anti-Diarrheal Prevention and treatment of intestinal infections of bacterial origin in horses, cattle, goats, pigs, sheep, dogs and cats.

Indications:
- For the treatment of bacterial infections causing gastroenteritis and scour/pneumonia Complex.
- For restoring electrolyte loss, reducing intestinal mobility and elimination of bacterial toxins.

Description
Each 30 mL Pink liquid contains:
- Sulphadimidine 639 mg
- Sulphaguanidine 639 mg
- Sulphadiazine 852 mg
- Hyoscine Hydrobromide 0.6 mg
- Calcium gluconate 66 mg
- Potassium chloride 109 mg
- Magnesium sulphate 18 mg
- Sodium chloride 340 mg
- Kaolin 3.1 gm
- Pectin 213 mg
- Glycine 627 mg

Mode of action:
Sulphonamide antibiotics exert antibacterial effect. Electrolytes and glycine assist restoration of fluid balance. Hyoscine hydrobromide acts as an antispasmodic. Kaolin and pectin absorb bacterial toxins and provide protective coating in inflamed mucosa.

Directions for use:
- For oral use only.
- SHAKE WELL BEFORE USE
- Small animals: 4 – 8mL per 8 – 10kg bodyweight
- Calves, Pigs & other large animals: 30mL per 25kg bodyweight
- Piglets: 1 – 2 mL
- Lambs: 5mL
- These dosages should be doubled for the initial treatment, Thereafter treat as above night and morning for 3-5 days.
- Dehydrated animals should get additional fluid and electrolyte replacement therapy.

Warning
- Not for use in bobby calves.

Witholding period:
- MEAT: 14 days.
- MILK: 35 days.

Storage:
- Store below 30°C for 3 years, as packaged.
- Store below 30°C for 28 days, after opening.
- Protect from light.

Pack Sizes:
Available in 1L, 2L and 5L bottles.
name: Scourban Plus

description:
FORMULA:
Each ml contains:
- Boldenone undecylenate ... 50 mg
- Sesame oil .... 1 ml

PROPERTIES:
■ Boldenone undecylenate is a modern steroid with anabolic properties and little androgenic activity.
■ EQUI-GAN acts beneficially in equines, bovines, porcines and canines. It stimulates appetite and increases energy, which leads to muscle development and a better appearance of skin and hair.
■ EQUI-GAN works on equines which have been vigorously trained and which show fatigue and low performance.
■ EQUI-GAN has a rapid effect. It improves the physical state of animals by increasing their weight due to a better food conversion.
■ EQUI-GAN can be used as a support treatment after surgery, diseases or traumatic injuries.
■ EQUI-GAN has a long-lasting effect and should not be used constantly, since it may cause androgenic activity development (libido increase).
■ EQUI-GAN suppresses estrus in mares that compete. It is reversible.

DOSAGE:
- Administer by intramuscular injection.
- Equines, bovines and porcines: 1 ml every 45 kg of body weight. The dosage can be repeated after two or four weeks.
- Canines: 0.25 ml (1/4 ml) every 5 kg of body weight.
- Ostriches (more than 6 months old): 0.5 ml every 45 kg of body weight.
- Fighting birds: 0.1 to 0.3 ml.

SPECIES:
- Equines, bovines, porcines, caprines, ovines, canines and birds.

RECOMMENDATIONS
• Keep in a dry and cool place. Keep away from sunlight.
• Keep out of the reach of children.

WARNINGS:
- Do not use in animals with malign tumors (adenoma and adenocarcinoma in the prostate or mammary gland).
- Do not use in pregnant animals. Do not use this product 20 days before the slaughter of animals intended for human consumption.
- QUANTIFIED PRESCRIPTION IS NEEDED FOR SALE. 

PRESENTATION
10, 50, 100 and 250 ml flasks.
name: Equi-gan

description:
Ingredient of Tolfine 4%
Each ml contains:
- Tolfenamic Acid    40 mg
- Benzyl Alcohol    1% w/v
- Excipients     q.s.

Indications:
- In Cattle : As an adjunct in the treatment of bovine respiratory disease, acute mastitis in
conjunction with antibacterial therapy & in  musculoskeletal disorders
- In Dog :  Chronic locomotor disease
- In Cat : Febrile syndrome
- In Pig : As an adjunct in the treatment of Mastitis Metritis Agalactia (MMA) syndrome. Available in 30 ml & 100 ml vials
 
Direction for Use
In Cattle:
- For inflammation associated with respiratory disease, the recommended dosage is 2 mg / kg (1 ml / 20 kg BW) by intramuscular injection into the neck area.
- Treatment may be repeated once after 48 hours
- For use in mastitis, the recommended dosage is 4 mg / kg BW (1 ml per 10 kg BW) as a single IV injection
- For use in musculoskeletal disorders, the recommended dosage is 2 mg / kg BW by IM route

In Dog : 4 mg / kg BW by S.C. or I.M. May be repeated once only  after 24 hours if required

In Cat : 4 mg / kg BW S.C. May be repeated once only after 24 hours if required.

In Pig : The recommended dosage is 2 mg / kg (1 ml / 20 kg BW) as a single intramuscular injection

Packing of Tolfine
Available in 30 & 100 ml vial
name: Tolfine

description:
Composition:
Each  100 ml contains:
- Tolfenamic Acid   4 gm
 
Indication:
Tolfenamic acid is usefui for treatment of the acute or chronic pain and lor inflammation in dogs &acute paiu inflammation in cats and also used in case of cattle in case of mastitis & in case of bacterial respiratory disease.

Dose:
• In Cattle:
- For inflammation associated with respiratory disease, the recommended dosage is 2 mg / kg (1 ml / 20 kg BW) by intramuscular injection into the neck area. Treatment may be repeated once after 48 hours
- For use in mastitis, the recommended dosage is 4 mg / kg BW (1 ml per 10 kg BW) as a single IV injection
- For use in musculoskeletal disorders, the recommended dosage is 2 mg / kg BW by IM route

• In Dog: 4 mg / kg BW by S.C. or I.M. May be repeated once only  after 24 hours if required

• In Cat: 4 mg / kg BW S.C. May be repeated once only after 24 hours if required.

• In Pig: The recommended dosage is 2 mg / kg (1 ml / 20 kg BW) as a single intramuscular injection
name: Tolfex 4%

description:
A phosphorus preparation for the promotion of metabolic processes; tonic and restorative.

Composition:
Each 1 ml contains
- Toldimfos 144 mg (eq to 200 mg of toldimfos sodium trihydrate)

Properties:
The toldimfos belongs to the group of aromatic phosphorus compounds (organic phosphorus) and has stimulating and regulating action on the metabolism, it serves as a substitute for phosphorus daficiency, and thus allows stimulation of the metabolism of the body. The toldimfos in the form of sodium salts trihydrate is an organic compound with 11.27% phosphorus, The product therefore provides 2.25 gm of phosphorus element per 100 ml of solution.

Target species:
Cattle, horses, sheep, goats and dogs.

Indications for use:
Prevention and treatment of phosphorus deficiencies.

Dosage and route of administration:
• Cattle, Horses: 5 - 20 ml by intravenous injection
• Sheep, goats: 1 - 3 ml by intravenous injection
- According to the size and weight of the animal. Dosage should be repeated at short intervals (1-3 days) until recovery is evident.

• Dog: 1 - 3 ml by subcutaneous, intramuscular or intravenous injection.
- For chronic conditions, 5 - 10 subcutaneous or intramuscular injections should be given at 48 hours interval with the dose rate of 1-2 ml.

Contraindications: Not known

Side effects: Not known

Withdrawal period: Nil

Storage:
store at temperature not exeeding 25ºC.

Shelf life: 3 years

Packs:
50 and 100 ml glass bottles type I with bromobutyl rubber stopper and flip-off polypropylene / aluminum capsule with outer label and leaflet.

Manufactured by:
Memphis for Pharmaceuticals & Chemical Industries according to license agreement between Intervet Egypt for Animal Health & Intervet - France

Product of
Intervet Egypt For Animal Health

LC. Cairo R. c. c. 7686

Manufactured in Memphis pharmaceuticals & chemical Industries
Under license of Intervet International - GmbH Germany

MSD Animal Health
name: Tonophosphan 20%

active_principle: Magnesium Carbonate + Sodium Carbonate + Gentiana Herbal
description:
LAXAVET PLUS Laxative, Antacid, Appetizer

Composition:
Each pack of (99 g) Contains:
- Magnesium Carbonate 87 g
- Sodium Carbonate 10 g
- Gentiana 2 g

Properties:
- Magnesium carbonate has an osmotic laxative action and it is used as adjunct in the treatment of abomasal ulceration.
- Sodium carbonate can be used as an antacid, it can be used in conditions in which there is need for intestinal antacid and to reverse systemic acidosis.
- Gentiana is a gastrointestinal stimulant and has a stomachic and action.

Indications
- Laxavet Plus is indicated for ruminal acidosis and constipation.
- Laxavet Plus is used as stomachic so it is useful in case of anorexia.
- Laxavet Plus is indicated for rumen indigestion, over feeding and tympanitis.

Target Species:
Cattle, calves, sheep, goats, buffalos and horses.

Dosage and administration:
- Large animals (cows, horses, camels & buffaloes): Dissolve one sachet (99 gram) / 1 liter of drinking water
- Small animals (calves, sheep & goats): Dissolve 50 gm in ½ liter of drinking water, given as drench.

Contra-indication & warnings:
- Hypersensitivity to active ingredients
- Shouldn’t be used in dehydrated animals & in cases of strychnine poisoning and renal failure.
- To be used with caution in dogs.

Side effects: None

Withdrawal time:
Meat: zero days.

Storage
At temperature not exceeding 30°C in dry place, and used immediately after opening and reconstitution.
name: Laxavet plus

description:
OXITOCINA DIANA induces contraction of smooth muscle, most importantly of the myoepithelial cells of the mammary gland, which results in milk ejection. It also results in uterine smooth muscle contraction, an effect that increases during pregnancy. It is used in the management of milk letdown and uterine contraction (induction of parturition and treatment of pyometra). 

COMPOSITION:
- Oxytocin (synthetic)   1000 IU / 100 ml

INDICATIONS:
• Induction to parturition.
• Uterine inertia or atony.
• Swine agalaxia.
• Expulsion of afterbirth and residues after parturition.
• Milk letdown after parturition.
• Uterus involution after a caesarean section and alleviation of haemorrhages.
• Chronic pyometritis and endometritis to induce the exudate expulsion.
• As adjunctive therapy to antibiotics in the treatment of acute and chronic mastitis, to produce residues expulsion and to facilitate drainage. 

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION ROUTE:
OBSTETRICS (i.v., i.m. and s.c. route):
• Cows: 7.5-10 ml.
• Mares: 7.5-15 ml.
• Sows: 3.5-5 ml.

MILK EJECTION (preferably i.v. route):
• Cows and Mares: 1-2 ml.
• Sows: 0.5-2 ml.
The administration can be repeated every 30 minutes, if the veterinarian considers it is necessary. 

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD:
- MEAT: 3 days
- MILK: 24 hours
 
PRESENTATION:
Vials of 10 ml, 100 ml and 250 ml
name: Oxitocina Diana

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Oxytetracycline base 20 gm

Properties:
Oxytetracycline is a bacteriostatic antibiotic active against susceptible organisms e.g E. coli, Pasteurella, Salmonella, Protozoa and Mycoplasma.

Mode of action:
The method of Anti bacterial action is an interference with RNA and bacterial protein synthesis by effecting protein induction at the ribosome 30 S level.

Indications:
Delta-Oxy 20 % LA. is used in the treatment of diseases in Cattle, Sheep and Goat which caused by oxytetracycline susceptible organisms as:
1- Respiratory tract infections as pneumonia, bronchopneumonia and pleurisy.
2- Gastrointestinal infections as Enteritis & Gastritis.
3- Pasteurellosis (Shipping Fever), calf diphtheria, foot rot, navel ill & joint ill.
4- Anaplasmosis & Theileriosis (Blood parasites).
5- Infected wounds and abscesses.
6- Control of post operatives and post parturient infections.
7- Pink eye disease in cattle (Moraxella bovis infection).

Dosage & administration:
• By I/M injection.
A) For active ingredient:
- 20 mg of oxytetracycline base / kg body weight once.
- The second injection could be injected after 2-4 days by deep I/M injection.

B) For whole product:
» Cattle, sheep, goat and Pigs: 1 ml Delta-Oxy 20 % L.A. / 10 kg b. wt. in once dose.
» Lambs, Kids and piglets: 1 ml Delta-Oxy 20 % L.A. / 10 kg b. wt. in once dose.
• If the dose volume exceed than 20 ml (for cattle) or 5 ml (for sheep), the drug should be injected in half doses in both sites.

Warning & Precautions:
1- Avoid the application of more than 20 ml in cattle and more than 5 ml in sheep be injected in any one site.
