description:
Composition:
Each ml contains:
- Florfenicol 450 mg

Properties:
- Florfenicol is a synthetic broad-spectrum antibiotic effective against most Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria isolated from domestic animals. Florfenicol acts by inhibiting protein synthesis at the ribosomal level and is bacteriostatic and time-dependent. Laboratory tests have shown that florfenicol is active against the most commonly isolated bacterial pathogens involved in bovine respiratory disease which include Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida and Histophilus somni.
- Florfenicol is considered to be a bacteriostatic agent, but in vitro studies of florfenicol demonstrate bactericidal activity against Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida and Histophilus somni.

Indications:
Preventive and therapeutic treatment of respiratory tract infections in cattle due to Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida and Histophilus somni susceptible to florfenicol. The presence of the disease in the herd should be confirmed before administering preventive treatment.

Target species: Cattle.

Dosage & Administration:
- SC route: 4 ml / 45 kg b.w. (i.e. 40 mg / kg) once only.
- IM route: 2 ml / 45 kg b.w. (i.e. 20 mg / kg) to be administered twice 48 hours apart.

*The injection should only be given in the neck. The dose volume given at any one injection site should not exceed 10 ml.

Contraindications:
- Do not use in adult bulls intended for breeding purposes.
- Do not use in case of known hypersensitivity to the active substance.

Warnings for species: None.

Precautions for animals:
- The product should be used in conjunction with susceptibility testing.
- Do not use where resistance to florfenicol or other amphenicols is known to occur.

Adverse reactions:
- A decrease in food consumption and transient softening of the faeces may occur during the treatment period.
- Subcutaneous and Intramuscular injection may cause transient local algesia and clinically obvious swelling at the injection site.
- Local algesia may persist for some days.

Withdrawal periods:
Meat & offal:
- By SC: 64 days.
- By IM: 37 days.

*Not permitted for use in lactating animals producing milk for human consumption.

Storage conditions:
Store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C and use after opening for three months to store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Shelf life: 3 years.

Packing:
Carton box containing transparent Colorless glass (type ll) containing 50 ml, closed with chlorobutyl rubber stopper ( Type I) and aluminum cap + Label and insert leaflet.

Manufactured by:
ADWIA Co. S.A.E. 10th of Ramadan City
Made in Egypt
name: Adwirac

description:
Pnmol Injectable Solution For Veterinary Use Only.

Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Tylosin Tartarate  216.384 mg (eq. to Tylosin base 200 mg).

Properties:
- The macrolides are usually bacteriostatic in action. Tylosin is a macrolide antibiotic which acts by interfering with bacterial protein synthesis. Macrolides attain high concentrations inside cells, including macrophages which may target the drug to sites of infection. They can be effective against intracellular pathogens (for example Mycobacteria spp.).
- Tylosin has good activity against Mycoplasma spp. and Serpulina hyodysenteriae (Treponema hyodysenteriae) and a number of Gram-positive aerobes, but little activity against Gram-negative organisms or obligate anaerobes.

Indications:
• For the treatment of infections caused by tylosin susceptible pathogens.

» Cattle (adult):
- For the treatment of respiratory tract infections, metritis caused by gram-positive pathogens, mastitis caused by Streptococcus spp, Staphyiococcus spp. or Mycoplasma and inter-digital foot rot, foot rot, or infectious as pododermatitis.

» Calves:
- For the treatment of respiratory infections, and foot rot.

» Pigs:
- For the treatment of enzootic pneumonia, hemorrhagic enteritis, erysipelas and metritis.
- For the treatment of arthritis caused by Mycoplasma spp and Staphylococcus.

» Sheep and goats:
- For the treatment of respiratory tract infections, metritis caused by gram-positive pathogens, mastitis caused by gram- positive organisms or Mycoplasma spp.

Target species:
beef, sheep, goat, and swine

Dosage and administration:
- Administration by the I.M. route only.

» Cattle: 2.5 to 5 ml/100 kg body weight. The maximum volume/injection site should not exceed 15 ml.

 » Sheep and goats: 5 ml per 100 kg body weight.

» Pigs: 2.5 to 5 ml per 100 kg body weight.

Special warnings for animal:
Not to be used in recently born pet animals.

Special precautions for use:
- Careful use to avoid accidental self-injection.
- In case of accidental self-injection, seek medical attention immediately.
- In case of accidental skin contact, wash them thoroughly with soap and water. in case of accidental eye contact, wash with eyes with plenty of clean running water.
- Wash hands after application.
- Tylosin may cause irritation.

Contraindications:
- Do not use in horses.
- An intramuscular injection in chickens and turkeys can lead to death.
- Do not use in animals with known hypersensitivity to tylosin and other macrolides.

Adverse reactions:
- Injection site reactions may occur and may persist up to 21 days after application of the product.
- By using the recommended application side effects may occur with the following clustering: in very rare cases rectal swelling/inflammation at the injection site, swelling of the vulva in cattle, oedema of the rectal mucosa, partial prolapse ('rosebuds'), erythema and pruritus in pigs, anaphylactic shock and death.

Withdrawal periods:
» Beef:
- Meat and offal: 28 days
- Milk: 108 hours

» Sheep and goats:
- Meat and offal: 42 days
- Milk: 108 hours

» Pigs:
- Meat and offal: 14 days

Storage conditions:
- Store a temperature not exceeding 30°C and use after opening for three months when stored at temperature not exceeding 30°C.
- Shelf-life as packaged: 3 years

Package:
Carton box Contains amber glass (Type II) vial of 100 ml solution capped with chlorobutyl rubber (Type I) stopper and aluminum seal with label leaflet.

MANUFACTURED BY:
ADWIA Co. S.A.E. 10th of Ramadan City
Made In Egypt

description:
Dexamethasone Sodium Phosphate Injection (B.P. Vet. 2015) Injectable Solution For Vet. Use Only.

Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Dexamethasone Sodium Phosphate  2 mg

Properties:
The dexamethasone sodium phosphate is a fluoro-methyl derivative of prednisolone, which is a potent glucocorticoid with minimal mineralocorticoid activity. Dexamethasone has ten to twenty times the anti-inflammatory activity of prednisolone. Corticosteroids suppress the immunologic response by inhibition of dilatation of capillaries, migration and function of leucocytes and phagocytosis. Glucocorticoids have an effect on metabolism by increasing gluconeogenesis.

Indications:
- Horses, cattle, pigs, dogs and cats: Treatment of inflammatory or allergic conditions.
- Cattle: Treatment of primary ketosis (acetonaemia) and Induction of parturition.
- Horses: Treatment of arthritis, bursitis or tenosynovitis.

Target species:
Horses, cattle, pigs, cats and dogs.

Dosage & Administration:
» Horses: For intravenous, intramuscular, intra-articular.
» Cattle, pigs, dogs and cats: For intramuscular injection.

» For the treatment of inflammatory or allergic conditions:
- Horses, cattle, pigs: 1.5 ml / 50 kg
- Dogs, cats: 0.5 ml / 10 kg
• Doses may be repeated once after a 24-48 hours interval if required.

» For the treatment of primary ketosis in cattle (acetonaemia): 0.5 - 1 ml / 50 kg given by intramuscular injection, in most cases, a single dose will effect a cure but the dose may be repeated after 48 hours if necessary.

» For the induction of parturition: 1 ml / 50 kg as a single intramuscular injection after day 260 of pregnancy. Parturition will normally occur within 48 - 72 hours. If calving does not occur within these periods, the dose may be repeated.

» For the treatment of arthritis, bursitis or tenosynovitis by single intra-articular in the horse: 1 - 5 ml, Injections into joint spaces or bursae should be preceded by the removal of an equivalent volume of synovial fluid. Strict asepsis is essential. To measure small volumes of less than 1 ml a suitably graduated syringe should be used to ensure accurate administration of the correct dose.

Warnings:
- An overdose can induce drowsiness and lethargy in horses.
- Do not administer the product in pregnant females, except where the intentiontinal tract ulceration
- Administration in late pregnancy is likely to cause abortion.
- Use in lactating cows may cause a reduction in milk yield.
- Concurrent use with non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs may exacerbate gastrointestinal tract ulceration.
- Dexamethasone should not be used in combination with vaccines or within two weeks after vaccination.
- Administration of dexamethasone may induce hypokalaemia and hence increase the risk of toxicity from cardiac glycosides. The risk of hypokalaemia may be increased if dexamethasone is administered together with potassium depleting diuretics.
- Concurrent use with anticholinestaerase may lead to increased muscle weakness in patients with myasthenia gravis.
- Glucocorticoids antagonise the effects of insulin.
- Concurrent use with phenobarbital, phenytoin and rifampicin can reduce the effects of dexamethason.

Precautions:
- If the veterinary medicinal product is used for induction of parturition in cattle, then a high incidence of retained placentas may be experienced and possible subsequent metritis and/or subfertility. Response to long term therapy should be monitored at regular intervals by a veterinary surgeon.
- Use of corticosteroids in horses has been reported to induce laminitis.
- Special care should be taken when the product is used in animals with a weakened immune system.
- Except in cases of acetonaemia and induction of parturition, corticoid administration is to induce an improvement in clinical signs rather than a cure.
- Following intra-articular administration, use of the joint should be minimized for one month and surgery on the joint should not be performed within eight weeks after use of this route of administration.

Contraindications:
- Do not use in viral infections during the viraemic stage or in cases of systemic mycotic infections.
- Do not use in animals suffering from gastrointestinal or corneal ulcers, or demodicosis.
- Do not administer intra-articularly where there is evidence of fractures, bacterial joint infections or aseptic bone necrosis.
- Do not use in known cases of hypersensitivity to the active substance, to corticosteroids or to any other ingredient of the product.

Adverse effects:
- Steroids themselves, during treatment, may cause iatrogenic hyperadrenocorticism (Cushings disease) involving significant alteration of fat, carbohydrate, protein and mineral metabolism, e.g. redistribution of body fat, increase in body weight, muscle weakness and wastage and osteoporosis may result.
- During therapy effective doses suppress the hypothalamo-pituitreal adrenal axis. Following cessation of treatment, signs of adrenal insufficiency extending to adrenocortical atrophy can arise and this may render the animal unable to deal adequately with stressful situations.
- Consideration should therefore be given to means of minimizing problems of adrenal insufficiency following the withdrawal of treatment.
- Systemically administered corticosteroids may cause polyuria, polydipsia and polyphagia, particularly during the early stages of therapy.
- Some corticosteroids may cause sodium and water retention and hypokalaemia in long term use.
- Systemic corticosteroids have caused deposition of calcium in the skin (calcinosis cutis).
- Corticosteroids use may delay wound healing and the immunosuppressant actions may weaken resistance to or exacerbate existing infections.
- In the presence of bacterial infections concurrent antibacterial therapy is usually required in the presence of viral infections, corticosteroids may worsen or hasten the progress of the disease.
- Gastrointestinal ulceration has been reported in animals treated with corticosteroids and gastrointestinal ulceration may be exacerbated by steroids in patients given non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs and in animals with spinal cord trauma.
- Corticosteroids use may cause enlargement of the liver (hepatomegaly) with increased serum hepatic enzymes and may increase the risk of acute pancreatitis. Other possible adverse reactions associated with corticosteroid use include retained placenta, metritis, subfertility, laminitis, reduction in milk yield, changes in blood biochemical and haematological parameters.
- Transient hyperglycaemia can occur.

Withdrawal time:
Cattle:
  Meat: 8 days
  Milk: 3 days
Pig Meat: 2 days

Storage Conditions:
- Store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C and use after opening for 3 months to be stored at temperature not exceeding 30°C.
- Shelf life: 3 years.

Packs:
Cartoon box containing amber glass vials (Type II) of 100 ml injectable solution with chlorobutyl rubber stopper (Type I) and aluminum cap + label & insert leaflet.

Manufactured by:
ADWIA Co. S.A.E. 10th of Ramadan City
Made In Egypt

name: Rafoxanide 7.5%

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Imidocarb dipropionate  17.1 gm (eq to 12 gm imidocarb base)

Properities:
Imidocarb dipropionate is a substituted carbinilide, used as an antiprotozoan treatment for the control of babesia spp. Little is known about the mode-of-action of imidocarb dipropionate it appears that imidocarb acts directly on the parasite, causing alteration in number and size of nuclei and in morphology (vacuolation) of the cytoplasm. the antiprotozoan activity is derived from the carbanilide acting on glycolysis of the parasite. This is the result of this class of drugs giving rise to hypoglycaemia in the host. Babesia as well as many other parasites like trypanosomes depends upon host glucose for aerobic glycolysis. There is also a selective blocking effect on the replication of the quinetoplastic DNA of the parasite.

Indication:
For treatment and prevention of bovine (red water fever - babesia divergens infection) only.

Target spp:
Cattle (Not Lactating Cows).

Dosage & administration:
- Administrated by subcutaneous injection only.
- For treatment: 0.7 ml / 100 kg body weight once.
- For prevention: 1.8 ml / 100 kg body weight once.

Warnings and Precautions:
- Not for use in any other species.
- Special precautions for use in animals.
- Estimate bodyweight carefully and do not exceed the recommended dosage.
- Special precautions for the person administering the veterinary medicinal product to animals.
- Do not use if under medical advice not to work with compounds which may exhibit anti-cholinesterase activity.
- Wash splashes of the product off the skin and eyes immediately.
- Wear suitable protective clothing (i.e. impermeable gloves) when using the product.
- Not used for lactating cows.

Contra-indications:
- Mamizole must not be administered intravenously or intramuscularly.
- Repeat doses of mamizole must not be given.

Adverse effect:
- Animals may show cholinergic signs after dosing. It may be possible to alleviate these side effects by treatment with atropine sulphate.
- While side-effects (salivation, discomfort, muscle tremors, tachycardia, cough, colics) are rare, they do occur and deaths from anaphylactoid reactions have been recorded following product use.

Withdrawal time:
Cattle (slaughter): 28 days.

Storage condition:
Store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C, used 40 days after opening at a temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Pack:
Carton box containing amber glass vial type (II) filled with 50, 100 ml injectable solution with red chlorobutyl rubber stoppers capped with AL/HDPE plastic flip off cap with outer label + insert leaflet.

Manufactured by Arab company for medical products (arabcomed) for Mam Egypt pharmaceuticals
name: Mamizole 12%

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Flunixin meglumine 8.2448 gm (equivalent to flunixin base 5 gm)

Properties:
Flunixin meglumine is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory agent with analgesic and antyretic activity. it acts through inhibition of cyclooxygenase blocks synthesis of eicosanoids, including prostaglandins, thromboxane, and prostacyclin (PGI2), which are chemical mediators of inflammation.

Indications:
Cattle:
1- Control of acute inflammation associated with respiratory disease.
2- Mamphedin 5% has some benefit in the treatment of experimental acute bovi e pulmonary emphysema(for fever).
3- Treatment of acute mastitis.
4- Provides effective anti-inflammatory and analgesic action in a wide range or muscloskeletal disorders.
5- Used in the therapy of artheritis, myositis and traumatic injuries resulting in fractures and contusions.
6- Recommended as an adjunct to the treatment of persistent hyperthermia.

Pigs:
1- For use as an adjunctive therapy in the treatment of swine respiratory diseases.
2- Recommended as an adjunct to the therapy of Mastitis - Metritis - Agalactia (MMA) syndrome.

Horses:
1- For the alleviation of inflammation and pain associated with musculo-skeletal disorders.
2- For the alleviation of visceral pain associated with colic in the horse.
3- employed pre- and post- operatively to reduce inflammation resulting from intraocular surgery.
4- Administered subconjunctivally prior to intraocular surgery to reduce aqueous humour prostacyclin accumulation.

Dogs:
1- Provides effective anti-inflammatory and analgesic action in a wide range of muscloskeletal disorders.
2- Used in the therapy of artheritis, myositis and traumatic injuries resulting in fractures and contusions.
3- employed pre- and post- operatively to reduce inflammation resulting from intraocular surgery.
4- Administered subconjunctivally prior to intraocular surgery to reduce aqueous humour prostacyclin accumulation.

Target species:
Cattle, pigs, horses, dogs

Dosage & administration:
- Cattle: 1 - 2 ml per 45 kg b.w. (i.e. 1.1 - 2.2 mg / kg) by IM or IV injection daily for up to 3 - 5 days.
- Pigs: 1 - 2 ml per 45 kg b.w. (i.e. 1.1 - 2.2 mg / kg) by IM injection daily for up to 3 days.
- Horses: 1 ml per 45 kg b.w. (i.e. 1.1 mg / kg) by IM or IV injection daily for up to 5 days.
- Dogs: 0.2 ml / 10 kg b.w. (i.e. 1 mg / kg) by IM or IV injection daily for up to 3 days.

Warnings and precautions:
1- Used with caution in conjunction wtn dicerogenic or nephrotoxic agents
2- Used in caution in cases of pre-existing gastrointestinal ulceration or renal , hepatic, severe cardiac failure or haematological disorders
3- Shouldn't use for pregnant animals.
4- Should use all product within 30 days of opening.
5- The milk of treated cows should not be fed to bobby calves.

Contra-indications:
1- Do not use in cats.
2- Do rot admix in syringe with other compounds.
3- Do not use concomitantly with other anti-inflammatory drugs, or with nephrotoxic substances.
4- Milk collected from cows within 36 hours (3 milkings) following treatement must not use tor human consumption or processing.

Adverse effects
1- occasional cases of localised Swelling induration, muscle stiffness, and sweating have been reported following intramuscular injection of flunixin in horses.
2- flunixin toxicity has been reported in a pony mare after intravenous administration of flunxin at greater than 5 times the recommended dose for 5 days.
3- anorexia, depression, gastrointestinal ulceration, hypoproteinaemia and neutropaenia may observed.
4- vomiting, diarrhoea and gastrointestinal ulceration may occur in dogs treated with flunixin at excessive doses or for prolonged periods.

Withdrawal time:
- Meat: don't use less than 7 days before slaughter for human consumption.
- Milk: milk collected from cows within 36 hours (3 milkings) following treatement.
- Meat (horses): 28 days

Storage condition:
- Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.
- Used 30 days after opening at temperature not exceeding 30°C

Pack:
Carton box containing clear colorless glass Vials type (II) filled with 30, 50, 100 ml solution with red chlorobutyl rubber stopper capped with aluminium / HDPE plastic flip off cap with outer label + an insert leaflet.

Manufactured by:
Arab Company for Medical Products (Arabcomed) For MAM Egypt pharmaceuticals.
name: Mam Phedine 5%

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Carprofen 50 mg

Properties:
Carprofen is a non-steroidal, anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) with analgesic and antipyretic properties. It acts primarily by inhibiting cyclo-oxygenase leading to reduce the synthesis of prostaglandins and related compounds.

Indications:
- It is indicated for reducing inflammation and pain during respiratory disease in cattle, in combination with suitable antibacterial if bacterial infection present.
- Also for analgesic and anti-inflammatory action in musculoskeletal disorders and after surgery in horses and ponies.

Dose:
- Cattle (less than 12 months of age): 1 ml / 35 kg.b.wt administered subcutaneously or intravenously as a single dose.
- Horses and Ponies: 1 ml /70 kg.b.wt by intravenous injection as a single dose.
- This can be repeated after 24 hours if required.

Warnings and Precautions:
- Caution should be taken in treating any animal less than 6 weeks of age, or aged animals.
- Animals on long-term treatment should be monitored.
- Concurrent antibacterials should be given if a bacterial infection present.
- Following the withdrawal of the first dose, use remainder of the product within 28 days.
- Avoid the introduction of contamination during use
- For intravenous use only in the horse.

Contra-indications:
- Should not be used in cattle producing milk for human consumption.
- Should not be used in pregnant animals.
- Should not be used in racehorses prior to racing.
- Do not administer other NSAIDs concurrently or within 24 hours of each other.
- Avoid use in any dehydrated, hypovolaemic or hypotensive animals.
- Avoid concurrent administration of potential nephrotoxic drugs.

Side-effects:
- Prolonged use may cause gastro-intestinal lesions, inappetence, vomiting, and diarrhea.
- Rarely transient swelling at injection site.

Withdrawal periods:
Slaughter of cattle ( less than 12 months of age): 21 days.

Storage:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

description:

- Phenylbutazone  200 mg
- Sodium salicylate  20 mg

INDICATIONS
Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory In cattle, horses and pigs, for the treatment of infectious, traumatic and rheumatic arthritis, acute pulmonary infections, myocarditis and endocarditis, as well as musculoskeletal conditions, dislocations, tendinitis and trauma.

DOSE 
- 1 ml / 20-25 kg I.M. or I.V., every 24 hours for 3-5 days.

- Cattle and adult horses: 1st day: 20 to 30 ml & 2nd day: 20 ml & 3rd day: 10 ml

WARNINGS
- Do not use this product 15 days before the slaughter of animals intended for human consumption.
- Do not use milk from treated animals until after 4 milkings.
- Do not administer this product to horses intended for human consumption.
name: Arthridine

description:
Amoxoil retard injectable oily suspension

COMPOSITION
- Amoxicillin (as trihydrate)  150 mg
- Excipient, s.q.f.  1 ml

CHARACTERISTICS
- Amoxicillin is a wide spectrum bactericidal antibiotic belonging to aminopenicillin group.
- Chemically is similar to ampicillin.
- It has a bactericidal action and acts against both Gram positive and Gram negative microorganisms by inhibiting the biosynthesis and repair of the bacterial mucopeptide wall.
- It is a semisynthetic penicillin, sensitive to the action of beta-lactamases.

Action mechanism:
The antibacterial action mechanism of amoxicilinhibition of biochemical processes of the bacterial wall synthesis, by means of aconsists in thes selective and irreversible blockade of several enzymes implicated in such processes. mainly transpeptidases and carboxypeptidases. The inadequate formation of the bacterial wall in the susceptible species produces an osmotic unbalance that affects especially bacteria in growth phase (during which the processes of synthesis of the bacterial wall are especially important) that finally induces the bacterial cell lysis.

Action spectrum:
Among the species considered sensitive to amoxicillin the following stand out:
• Gram-positive bacteria: Staphylococcus not producers of penicillinase, streptococci (Streptococcus suis), clostridia (Clostridium perfringens, Clostridium tetani, Clostridium spp.), Arcanobacterium spp., Bacillus anthracis, Listeria monocytogenes, Erysipelothrix rhusiopathiae.
• Gram-negative bacteria: Pasteurella spp., Mannheimia haemolytica, Haemophilus spp..Actinobacillus spp., Escherichia coli, Salmonella spp., Moraxella spp., Fusobacterium spp.
- There is complete cross-resistance between amoxicillin and other penicillins, particularly other aminopenicillins (ampicillin).
- Amoxicillin presents a low bond to plasmatic proteins and diffuses quickly to most of corporal liquids and tissues. This diffusion spreads to synovial discharges, expectoration liquids and the lymphatic tissue. The diffusion is more satisfactory in liquids resulting from an inflammatory process.
- Amoxicillin metabolism limits to the opening of the beta-lactam ring by hydrolysis, which induces the release of the inactive penicilloyl acid (20%). Biotransformations take place in liver.
- Amoxicillin is mainly distributed in the extracellular compartment. Its distribution towards tissues is facilitated by the weak bond index to the plasmatic proteins.
- The main way of elimination for amoxicillin is renal in active form. It is also excreted in small amounts by milk and bile.

INDICATIONS & TARGET SPECIES
Bovine, ovine, pigs, dogs and cats: Infectious processes caused by microorganisms sensitive to amoxicillin, located in: Digestive tract, respiratory tract, urogenital tract, skin and soft tissues; as well as bacterial complications sensitive to amoxicillin in diseases that require it.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
- Administration: Intramuscular or subcutaneous injection.
- Inject 1 ml of AMOXOIL RETARD per 15-30 Kg body weight.
- It is advisable not last the treatment more than 5-7 days. If an improvement is not observed in the first 48 hours, reconsider diagnostic. The dose and/or frequency can be increased at the veterinary discretion.
- To assure a correct dosage, the weight of animals must be determined previously the use.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
- In front of any infectious process, it is advisable the bacteriological confirmation of diagnosis and to carry out a sensitivity test of the bacterium causing the process.
- Adjust dose in animals with renal dysfunctions. Shake the product well before use. Use sterile and dry syringes. Massage gently on the injection site. Do not administer by intravenous injection.

CONTRAINDICATIONS
- Do not administer to animals with a background of hypersensitivity to penicillins.
- Do not administer by oral route to rabbits, guinea-pigs and hamsters due to amoxicillin, as all aminopenicillins, has an important action on the cecal bacterial population.
- Do not administer to equidae due to amoxicillin, as all aminopenicillins, has an important action on the cecal bacterial population.

SIDE EFFECTS
Sensitization reactions which seriousness may vary from a simple urticaria to an anaphylactic shock. Local reaction on the injection site. Gastrointestinal symptomatology, mainly in herbivores. Super intections by no sensitive microorganism after long use. Occasionally haematic dyscrasias and colitis can appear.

GESTATION AND LACTATION
It can be used during gestation. Category B of FDA.

INTERACTIONS
Do not administer together with antibiotics that inhibit the bacterial protein synthesis because of they can antagonize the bactericide action of penicillins.

OVERDOSAGE
It has a wide margin of safety. In case that some intense allergic reactions appear, stop the treatment and administer corticoids and adrenaline. In other cases, administer a symptomatic treatment.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
- Meat: 14 days.
- Milk: 3 days.

STORAGE CONDITIONS
Store at temperature not exceeding 25°C, in dry place, away from light and to be used immediately after opening.

SUPPLY
Vials of 10, 50, 100 and 250 ml.

Keep the product out of the reach of children

Distributed in Egypt by:
TABA MEDICAL PHARMA

Manufactured by:
laboratorios syva s.a.u.
Avda. Párroco Pablo Díez, 49-57
24010 León (Spain)
name: Amoxoil Retard

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Oxytetracycline HCL 5.4 gm (Eq to Oxytetracycline base 5 gm)

Properties:
Oxytetracycline is a broad spectrum antibiotic. It is mainly active against Gram-positive and negative, aerobic and anaerobic, and against mycoplasma, chlamydia and rickettsiae. Oxytetracycline has a primarily bacteriostatic activity, Oxytetracycline binds reversibly to the receptor 30S ribosomal fraction, this leads to a blockage of the binding of aminoacyl-tRNA corresponding to the ribosome-mRNA complex site. This results in inhibition of protein synthesis and thus stops the growth of the bacterial culture.

Indications:
» Cattle & Sheep:
- The primary indications for tetracyclines are in the treatment of bacterial pathogens involved in the bovine respiratory disease complexes (Mannheimia haemolytica and Mycoplasma bovis), borreliosis, brucellosis, chlamydiosis, ehrlichiosis, lawsonia proliferative enteropathy, leptospirosis, listeriosis, porcine mycoplasmosis, rickettsiosis, and tularemia.
- Clostridial infections and listeriosis can be treated by tetracyclines.
- Oxytetracycline is the drug of choice in acute Anaplasma marginale injections.

» Swine: Tetracyclines are commonly used in swine to prevent and treat atrophic rhinitis and bacteria associated with the porcine respiratory complex (A. pleuropneumoniae, M. hyopneumoniae, P multocida).

» Adult dogs: Tetracyclines are drugs of choice for A. phagocytophilum, Ehrlichia canis, and Rickettsia rickettsii infections.

Target species:
Cattle, sheep, pigs and adult dogs.

Dosage & administration:
- Administer by slow intravenous, deep intramuscular, subcutaneous or intraperitoneal.
- 1 ml / 10 kg bodyweight for 3 - 5 days with 12 hours intervals.

Contraindications:
- Not to be used in late pregnancy.
- Not for neonates under 4 weeks.
- Discard milk during treatment and 3 days later.
- Do not use in case of known allergy to oxytetracycline or any other substance of tetracycline.
- Do not use in case of known tetracycline resistance.
- Not to be used with penicillins and cephalosporins.

Precautions:
- Not to be used in recently born pet animals.
- Use with caution in horses with gastrointestinal or under stress conditions.

Drug interactions:
Divalent or trivalent cations (Mg, Fe, Al, Ca) can chelate tetracycline

Side effects:
As with all tetracyclines, systemic adverse effects were noted such as gastrointestinal di orders. less commonly allergic reactions and photosensitivity on rarely dysentery-enterocolitis in horses can be fatal.

Withdrawal periods:
Cattle, sheep & pigs:
- Meat and offal: 14 days.
- Milk: 3 days.

Storage conditions:
Store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C and used after opening for 3 months to be stored at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Shelf life: 3 years.

Packing:
Carton box containing amber glass vials (Type II) of 100 ml injectable solution with chlorobutyl rubber stopper (Type I) and sealed with aluminium cap + outer label and insert leaflet.

Manufactured by:
ADWIA Co. S.A.E. 10th of Ramadan City
Made in Egypt
name: Oxyject 5%

description:
Composition:
Each ml contains
- Meloxicam  20 mg

Pharmacotherapeutic group:
Anti-inflammatory

Mode of action:
- Meloxicam is a non-steroidal anti inflammatory drug (NSAID) of the oxicam class which acts by inhibition of prostaglandin synthesis, thereby exerting anti-inflammatory, anti-exudative analgesic and antipyretic properties.
- Meloxicam also has anti-endotoxic properties because it has been shown to inhibit production of thromboxane B2 induced by E. coli endotoxin administration in calves, lactating cows and pigs.

Indications:
» Cattle
- For use in acute respiratory infection with appropriate antibiotic therapy to reduce clinical signs in cattle. For in diarrhea, in combination with oral rehydration therapy, to reduce clinical signs in calves of over one week of age and young non-lactating cattle. For adjunctive therapy in the treatment of acute mastitis, in combination with antibiotic therapy.
- For the relief of post-operative pain following dehorning in calves.

» Pigs
- For use in noninfectious locomotor disorders to reduce the symptoms of lameness and inflammation. for adjunctive therapy in the treatment of puerperal septicaemia and toxaemia (mastitis-metritis-agalactia syndraome) with appropriate antibiotic therapy.

» Dogs
- For reducing postoperative pain and inflammation following orthopaedic (e.g. fracture operation) and soft-tissue surgery.
- Moreover, it is used for the alleviation of inflammation and pain in both acute and chronic musculoskeletal disorders in dogs.

» Cats
- For reducing postoperative pain and inflammation after ovariohysterectomy (spay operation), orthopaedic and minor soft tissue surgery. Moreover, it is used for the alleviation of pain and inflammation in acute and chronic musculoskeletal disorders.

» Horses
- For use in the allevlation of inflammation and relief of pain in both acute and chronic musculo-skeletal disorders.
- For the relief of pain associated with equine colic.

Target species:
Cattle, Horses, Pigs, Dogs, Cats

Dosage:
» Cattle: 2.5 ml / 100 kg b.wt., by single S/C injection or intravenous injection in combination with antibiotic therapy or with oral re-hydration therapy, as appropriate.

» Pigs: 2 ml / 100 kg b.wt., by single IM injection in combination with antibiotic therapy, as appropriate. If required, a second administration of meloxicam can be given after 24 hours.

» Horses: 3 ml / 100 kg b.wt., by IV injection, Avoid introduction of contamination during use.

» Dogs: 0.1 ml / 10 kg b.wt., before surgery by single subcutaneous injection.

» Cats: 0.15 ml / 10 kg b.wt., before surgery by single subcutaneous injection.

Warnings and precautions:
- Caution with use in animals less than 6 weeks of age, or aged animals avoid use in dehydrated, hypovolaemic, hypotensive patients; safety in pregnancy has not been established.
- Not for human use.
- Keep out of reach of children.
- Do not use with newly born pet animals.

Contra-indications:
- Do not use in animal suffering from impaired hepatic, cardiac or renal function and haemorrhagic disorders, or where there is evidence of ulcerogenic gastrointestinal lesions.
- Do not use in case of hypersensivity to the active substance or to any of the excipients.
- For the treatment of diarrhea, do not use in animals less than one week of age.

Side effects:
Prolonged use may cause gastro-intestinal lesions, inappetance, vomiting, and diarrhea; rarely transient swelling at injection site.

Withdrawal time:
- Cattle: Slaughter 15 day, milk 5 days
- Horses: meat and offal: 5 days
- Pigs: Slaughter 5 days.

Storage conditions:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C & used after opening within 40 days when stored at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Pack:
Carton box containing amber (type II) glass vials filled with 10, 30, 50, 100, 250 ml with red chlorobutyle rubber stoppers capped with a flip of aluminum cap with an outer label and insert.

Shelf life: 2 years

M.O.H Reg. No.: 4180 / 2018

Manufacturer:
Arab company for medical products (Arabcomed) FOR ATM pharmaceutical industries import & export.
name: Melomat

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Metronidazole  5 mg

Properties:
- Metronidazole is a synthetic, nitroimidazole antibacterial and antiprotozoal agent.
- Metronidazole is bactericidal against susceptible bacteria. Its antimicrobial activity is disrupting DNA and nucleic acid synthesis in the bacteria.
- Metronidazole has activity against most obligate anaerobes including Bacteroides sp. (including B. fragilis), Fusobacterium, Veillonella, Clostridium sp. Peptococcus and Peptostreptococcus.
- Metronidazole is also trichomonacidal and amebicidal in action and acts as a direct amebicide. Its mechanism of action for its antiprotozoal activity is not understood. It has therapeutic activity against Entamoeba histolytica, Trichomonas, Giardia, and Balantidium coli.
- Metronidazole is relatively well absorbed after oral administration. Metronidazole is rather lipophilic and is rapidly and widely distributed after absorption. It is distributed to most body tissues and fluids.

Indications:
» Horses: Pleuropneumonia and lung abscesses caused by anaerobic penicilin-resistant bacteroides fragilis and clostridial enterocolitis.

» Cats and dogs: In small animals
- Bacteial stomatitis, osteomyelitis, hepatitis, pneumonia, lung abscessation, anaerobic clostridial enteritis, and peritonitis.
- Giardiasis and other protozoal infections caused by Trichomonas, Balantidium coli.

Target species:
Horses, dogs and cats.

Dosage & Administration:
- Horses, Dogs & cats: 4 ml / kg b.wt, twice daily for 5-7 days, by intravenous, subcutaneous administration.

Contraindications:
- Metronidazole is contraindicated in animals hypersensitive to the drug or nitroimidazole derivatives.
- It has also been recommended not to use the drug in severely debilitated, pregnant or nursing animals.
- Metronidazole should be used with caution in animals with hepatic dysfunction.

Adverse Effects / Warnings:
- Adverse effects reported in dogs include neurologic disorders, lethargy, weakness, neutropenias, hepatotoxicity, hematuria, anorexia, nausea, vomiting and diarrhea.
- Neurologic toxicity may be manifested after acute high dosages or, more likely, with chronic moderate to high-dose therapy.

Withdrawal time:
Not to be used in horses that may be slaughtered for human consumption.

Storage:
Store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C away from light and to be used during 3 months after opening at temperature not exceeding 30°C away from light.

Packaging:
Cartoon box containing amber glass vials (Type II) of 50, 100 ml injectable solution closed with chlorobutyl rubber stopper (Type I) and aluminum cap + label and insert leaflet.

M.O.H. Reg. No.: 4195/2018

Manufactured by:
ADWIA Co. S.A.E. 10th of Ramadan City
Made In Egypt
name: Diagyl

description:
- Ketoprofen is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug doted with powerful anti-inflammatory, analgesic and antipyretic activity. It acts by inhibiting prostaglandin synthesis.
- The classic tests for the evaluation of anti-inflammatory and analgesic activity reveal the pronounced superiority of ketoprofen compared with phenylbutazone and aspirin.
- Ketoprofen does not cause any of the known side-effects of corticoids.

COMPOSITION
Each 100 ml:
- Ketoprofen       10 g
- Benzyl alcohol      1 g
- Excipient (qs)     100 ml.

KETOFEN® 10% is indicated for pigs, cattle, sport and race horses:
Pigs:
• Anti-inflammatory, analgesic and antipyretic treatment especially in:
– respiratory conditions
– mastitis-metritis-agalactiae syndrom in the sow

Cattle:
• Anti-inflammatory, analgesic and antipyretic treatment especially in:
– respiratory conditions
– mammary oedema
– mastitis
– musculo-skeletal conditions: assistance in rising after parturition
• Lameness, arthritis (complement to etiological treatment)
• Traumatic injury
• Dystocia
– colics

Sport and race horses:
• Anti-inflammatory and analgesic treatment of the osteoarticular and musculo-skeletal systems, in particular:
– lameness of traumatic origin
– arthrosis, arthritis
– osteitis, spavin
– navicular disease
– tendinitis, bursitis
– laminitis
– myositis
– post-surgical inflammation
• Symptomatic analgesic treatment of colics

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
Pigs:
Route of administration: Intramuscular (IM).
Dosage: 3 mg of active ingredient per kg, i.e. 3 ml per 100 kg bodyweight.

Cattle:
Routes of administration: intravenous (IV), intramuscular (IM).
Dosage: 3 mg of active ingredient per kg and per day, i.e. 3 ml per 100 kg bodyweight for 1 to 3 consecutive days.

Sport and race horses:
Route of administration: Intravenous (IV).
Dosage:
- Inflammation and pain in the osteoarticular and musculoskeletal systems: 2.2 mg of active ingredient per kg and per day, i.e. 1 ml per 45 kg bodyweight for 3 to 5 consecutive days
- Colics: 2.2 mg of active ingredient per kg and per day, i.e. 1 ml per 45 kg bodyweight. A single injection is usually sufficient.
Any additional injection should be given after another clinical examination of the animal.

RECOMMENDATIONS
Do not mix with another substance.
In the absence of specific data in the pregnant mare and the foal less than 15 days old, it is recommended not to use KETOFEN® 10% in the pregnant mare and foals that are less than 15 days old.

CONTRAINDICATION
Do not administer to pigs, cattle or horses that have previously shown a hypersensitivity to ketoprofen.
As for the other non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, ketoprofen is contra-indicated:
- in case of severe kidney failure
- in combination with other non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, or with diuretics, or anticoagulants.
Do not administer to horses destined of human consumption.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
Meat and offal:
– Pigs: 4 days
– Cattle: 1 day (IV route) - 4 days (IM route)
– Horses: Not to be used in animals destined for human consumption
Milk: 0 milking

PRESENTATION
Bottle (10; 50; 100 ml).

STORAGE
Away from heat.

Manufacturer: Ceva Santé Animale 10, av. de la Ballastière - 33500 Libourne - France

FOR ANIMAL TREATMENT ONLY

Florfenicol is a broad spectrum antibiotic that has activity against many bacteria such as Pasteurella multocida, Pasteurella haemolytica, Haemophilus somnus and Mycoplasma bovis. It acts by binding to the 50S ribosome, thereby inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis.

description:
Anthelmintic (Milbemycin)

What is Equest Oral Gel?
Equest Oral Gel is a deworming product specially produced for horses, that is strictly available on prescription. This has to do with the fact that horses can no longer be dewormed preventively, but can only be treated when your horse is actually diagnosed with worms. This diagnosis can be made on the basis of a coprological examination.
 
Active ingredient;
18,92 mg Moxidectin, this is enough to deworm a horse with a maximum of 700 kg bodyweight.

Indication:
Equest® Tape is palatable and effective for the treatment and control of:
- Tapeworm: Anoplocephala perfoliata, Anoplocephala magna and Paranoplocephala mamillana.
- Large Strongyles: Strongylus vulgaris (adults, L3 and L4 arterial stages), Strongylus edentatus (adults and L4 visceral larval stages), Strongylus equinus (adults), Triodontophorus spp. (adults) including T. brevicauda,
- T. serratus and T. tenuicollis, Craterostomum acuticaudatum (adults).
- Small Strongyles (adults): Cyathostomum spp. including C. catinatum and C. pateratum; Cylicostephanus spp. including C. calicatus, C. goldi; C. longibursatus and C. minutus, Cylicocyclus spp. including C. brevicapsulatus,
- C. elongatus, C. insigne, C. leptostomum, C. nassatus, C. radiatus, C. ashworthi and C. ultrajectinus; Cylicodontophorus bicoronatus; Coronocyclus spp. including C. coronatus, C. labiatus and C. labratus; Gyalocephalus capitatus; Parapoteriostomum mettami; Peterovinema poculatus; Poteriostomum imparidentatum, as well as benzimidazole resistant strains.
- Pinworms: Oxyurus equi (adults and L3/L4 larval stages). Ascarids: Parascaris equorum (adults and intestinal stages (L4)). Hairworms: Trichostrongylus axei (adults).
- Intestinal Threadworms: Strongyloides westeri.
- Large Mouthed Stomach Worms: Habronema spp. – gastric and cutaneous (summer sore) forms. Stomach Bots: Gasterophilus intestinalis (2 & 3 stage larvae), Gasterophilus nasalis (2 & 3 stage larvae). Cutaneous Onchocerciasis: Onchocerca spp. (microfiliariae).

How does Equest Oral Gel work?
The active ingredient in Equest Oral Gel is moxidectin. Moxidectin is an anti-parasitical medicine that is comparable to ivermectin. There a couple important differences. The difference is mainly in the effect that the medicine has on marsh worms and the so called ‘sleeping larva’. For this, products with moxidectin as active ingredient are a better choice than deworming products with ivermectin as active ingredient.
Equest Oral Gel can be safely used to treat pregnant mares, but cannot be used to treat foal younger than 4 months.
 
Why Equest Oral Gel?
Equest Oral Gel is a very effective product against parasites amongst horses, internal as well as external. Think about worms like Parascaris (nematode), foal worms, roundworms, arse worms and horsefly larva. Equest Oral Gel is also a good product to use when you want to prevent benzimidazole (fenbendazole) resistant Cyathostomin, also known as the marsh worm amongst horses.

How do you use Equest Oral Gel?
Equest Oral Gel can only be used on recommendation of a veterinarian. For treatment with this medicine you need to have a prescription.
One whole injector (14,8 gr with 18,92 Moxidectin) is to deworm a horse with 700 kg bodyweight. Per kg bodyweight of your horse, you need to administer 0,4 mg moxidectin.
Washing your hands after administering Equest Oral Gel is advisable.

Advise;
Not to administered on foal younger than 4 months.
Not to administered in case of known over-sensitiveness for the active ingredient, any other milbemycin or another element of the medicine.

Waiting time;
(Organ)Meat; 32 days
name: Equest

description:
Anthelmintic (Avermectin)

Composition:
Each 1 gm contains:
- Ivermectin  2 mg

Properties:
Ivermectin is the first in a series of antiparasitic agents derived from the avermectin family of compounds. Ivermectin is a member of the macrocyclic lactone class of endectocides. Compounds of the class bind selectively and with high affinity to glutamate-gated chloride ion channels which occur in invertebrate nerve and muscle cells. This leads to an increase in the permeability of the cell membrane to chloride ions with hyperpolarization of the nerve or muscle cell, resulting in paralysis and death of the parasite. Compounds of this class may also interact with other ligand-gated chloride channels, such as those gated by the neurotransmitter gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA). The margin of safety for compounds of this class is attributable to the fact that mammals do not have glutamate-gated chloride channels, the macrocyclic lactones have a low affinity for other mammalian ligand-gated chloride channels and they do not readily cross the blood-brain barrier.

Indications:
Equiveen is indicated for the treatment of parasitic infestations due to:
1. Large Strongyles: Adult and arterial larval stages of Strongylus vulgaris, and adult stage of S. edentatus, S. equinus, Craterostomum acuticaudatum, Triodontophorus brevicauda and T. serratus.
2. Small Strongyles (including Those Adult And Luminal Larva Resistant To Some Benzimidazole Class Compounds): larval  stages of (L4) Coronocyclus Coronatus, C. Labiatus, C. Labratus; Cyathostomum Catinatum, C. Pateratum; Cylicocyclus elongatus, C. Insigne, C. Leptostomum, C. Nassatus, C. Radiatus; Cylicostephanus Asymetricus, C. Bidentatus, C. Calicatus, C. Goldi, C. Longibursatus, C. Minutus; Parapoteriostomum Mettami, P. Euproctus; Petrovinema Poculatum, Poteriostomum Imparidentatum, Cylicodontophorus spp. And gyalocephalus spp.
3. Intestinal Threadworms (adults): strongyloides Westeri.
4. Pinworms (adult and Luminal Larval (14) Stages): oxyuris Equi.
5. Ascarids (adult And Third and Fourth Stage Larvae): parascaris Equorum.
6. Hairworms (adult): trichostrongylus Axei.
7. Large-mouthed Stomach Warms (adult): habronema Muscae
8. Neck Threadworms (microfilariae): onchocerca Cervicalis.
9. Bots (oral and Gastric Stages): gasterophilus Intestinalis, g. Nasalis.

Equiveen may aid in the clinical improvement of dermatoses caused by cutaneous larvae of Habronema Spp. and Draschia Megastonma Spp., and Microfilariae of Onchocerca Cervicalis.

Target Species:
Horses.

Dosage & Administration:
- 200 mcg / kg B.Wt.
- Of Product: 1 division of syringe/40 kg B.Wt. (Each division of syringe delivers 4 gm of paste).
- Equiveen is administered orally.
- Remove the plastic cap from the tip of the nozzle. Make sure the horse's mouth contains no feed, Insert the syringe into the horse's mouth at the interdental space. Advance the plunger as far as it will go, depositing the medication at the base of the tongue. Immediately raise the horse's head for a few seconds after dosing.

Precautions:
1. Some horses have experienced reactions with swelling and itching shortly after treatment. In most such cases, the horses have been diagnosed as carrying heavy infections of Onchocerca microfilariae. and it is assumed the reactions were the result of microfilariae dying in large numbers. Although the signs have resolved spontaneously in a few days, symptomatic treatment may be advisable.
2. Reasonable care should be taken in the handling of sick or debilitated animals.
3. Equiveen Paste has been formulated specifically for use in horses only.

Warnings:
This drug is not to be administered to horses that are to be slaughtered for use as food.

Storage condition:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C away from direct sunlight and Keep out of the reach of children.

Packaging:
40 gm plastic syringe + label and insert in carton box.
name: Equiveen

description:
Strolitine Liver tonic, improves metabolism, improves FCR , increases growth rate.

Composition:
Each 1 liter contains:

description:
COMPOSITION:
Each ml Contains:
- Oxytetracycline hydrochloride  200 mg

PROPERTIES:
Oxytetracycline is a broad spectrum antibiotic acting by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis in gram positive and gram negative bacteria, some Rekittsia, Clamydia and certain blood parasite including theileria and Anaplasama. It is absorbed slowly from deep intramuscular injection continuing its efficacy for up to 3 days.

INDICATIONS:
Oxytetracycline HCl is used for the treatment of diseases induced by pathogens sensitive to Oxytetracycline in cattle, sheep and goats, it is used for the treatment of Pneumonia, Diphtheria, Shipping fever, Acute metritis, Enteritis, Anthrax, Foot rot Anaplasmosis, Theileriasis, Leptospirosis and Mycoplasmosis, it is effective for controlling secondary infections associated with viral diseases.

DOSAGE:
1 ml / 10 kg b. wt. deep lM one shot is almost sufficient, in certain cases repeat after 3 - 4 days.

CONTRAINDICATIONS:
- Don't use in horses, dogs, or cats.
- Don't use in pregnant animals.

PRECAUTIONS:
- Don't inject more than 20 ml in one site in large animals or 5 ml in small animals, Do not dilute.
- N.B. change in colour does not affect the potency.

WITHDRAWAL TIME:
28 days

STORAGE:
To be stored at a temperature not exceeding 15°C, protected from light.

PACKAGE:
Vials 30, 50 & 100 ml
name: Oxytetracycline 20% LA

description:
Composition:
Each ml Contains:
- Gentamycin Sulphate equivalent to 100 mg Gentamycin base

Action & Uses:
Gentamycin is an aminoglycoside broad spectrum antibiotic active against gram negative and gram positive bacteria. It is used in animals for control the uterine infections (metritis) urinary tract infections (Cystitis, Nephritis), respiratory tract infections (Pneumonia Tracheobronchitis) and soft tissue infections.

Dosage:
» Horses: 2 - 4 ml / 100 Kg. body wt. By I.M. injection.

» For metritis & mastitis: 5 ml diluted to 200 ml with saline (Intrauterine & Intra-Mammary infusion)

» Dogs & Cats: 0.5 ml / 10 Kg body wt. Doses are given daily by I.M. or S.C. injection for 3 days to be extended to 7 days in severe infections.

Precautions and Side Effects:
- Not to be given with neuromuscular blocking agents or with general anesthetics.
- Treatment with high dose for long periods may cause nephrotoxicity.
- In pyometritis the uterus should be evacuated before treatment.

Warning:
Not to be used for chicken or animals for human consumption

Storage:
Stored at temperature not exceeding 30°C and protected from light

Package:
Vials of 50 ml
name: Gentamycin 10%

description:
COMPOSITION
Each mL contains:
- Imidocarb dipropionate  120 mg
- Excipients q.s.p  1 mL

SPECIES
Bovine, equine and canine

INDICATIONS:
Treatment of animals clinically affected by babesiosis, and anaplasmosis. It can be used as a chemoprophylactic control when cattle susceptible is introduced in enzootic areas or areas with risk of anaplasmosis and piroplasmosis.

ROUTE OF ADMINISTRATION:
- Cattle and dogs: Subcutaneous route
- Horses: Intramuscular

DOSAGE
• Cattle:
- Babesiosis: 1 mL / 100 kg via SC or IM (2 mg / kg)
- Anaplasmosis: 2.5 mL / 100 kg via S.C (3 mg / kg)
- Mixed: 2.5 mL / 100 kg via S.C (3 mg / kg)
- Chemoprophylaxis: 2.5 mL / 100 kg via SC (3 mg / kg)

• Horses:
- Babesiosis: 2 mL / 100 kg via S.C (2.4 mg / kg) You can repeat the dose with 48hr interval (Babesia equi)
- Chemoprophylaxis: 2 mL / 100 kg via SC (2.4 mg / kg)

• Canines:
- Babesiosis: 0.5 mL /20 kg via SC (3 mg / kg)

WITHDRAWAL TIME
- Treated animals should not be slaughtered for human consumption until 165 days after completion of treatment.
- The milk produced during the treatment and 96 hours after its completion, not for human consumption.

PRECAUTIONS:
- Do not apply intravenously.
- Do not apply simultaneously with organophosphate insecticides.
- Keep out of reach of children and pets.
- Store at a temperature below 30°C.
- Sale under formula of the Veterinary Doctor.

PRESENTATIONS:
Bottles for 50 and 100 mL
name: Imidocarb-LH

description:
Anthelmintic (Benzimidazole)

Composition
Each ml contains:
- Albendazole  113.6 mg

Indications
Cattle:
- adult liver flukes (Fasciola hepatica), heads and segments of tapeworms (Moniezia benedeni, M.expansa),
 
- adult and 4th stage larvae of stomach worms including: brown stomach worm including 4th stage inhibited larvae (Ostertagia ostertagi), barberpole worm (Haemonchus contortus, H.placei), small stomach worm (Trichostrongylus axei)

- adult and 4th stage larvae of intestinal worms including: thread-necked intestinal worm (Nematodirus spathiger, N.helvetianus), small intestinal worm (Cooperia punctata, C.oncophora) adult stage of intestinal worms including: hookworm (Bunostomum phlebotomum), bankrupt worm (Trichostrongylus colubriformis), nodular worm (Oesophagostomum radiatum) adult and 4th stage larvae of lungworms (Dictyocaulus viviparous).

Sheep:
- adult liver flukes (Fasciola hepatica, Fascioloides magna)
heads and segments of tapeworms including common tapeworm (Moniezia expansa) and fringed tapeworm (Thysanosoma actinioides)

- adult and 4th stage larvae of stomach worms including: brown stomach worm (Ostertagia circumcinta, Marshallagia marshalli), barberpole worm (Haemonchus contortus), small stomach worm (Trichostrongylus axei),

- adult and 4th stage larvae of intestinal worms including: thread-necked intestinal worm (Nematodirus spathiger, N.filicolis), cooper’s worm (Cooperia oncophora), bankrupt worm (Trichostrongylus colubriformis), nodular worm (Oesophagostomum columbianum), Large-mouth Bowel Worm (Chabertia ovina). adult and larval stages of lungworms including dictyocaulus filaria

- Goats: for the treatment of adult liver flukes in nonlactating goats (Fasciola hepatica).

Dosage
- Cattle and goats: 2.2 ml Atobenzole/25kg b.wt. in drinking water.
- Sheep: 1.65 ml Atobenzole/25kg b.wt. in drinking water.
- Treatment must be repeated after 21 days.

Withdrawal time
- Cattle: 27 days following last treatment.
- Sheep and goats: 7 days following last treatment.

Pack
Plastic bottles: 50, 100, 250, 500, 1000, or 5000 ml suspension.
name: Atobenzole 15%

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Triclabendazole 50 mg
- Levamisole hydrochloride 37.5 mg

Properties
- Our new product OVINEX contains two potent anthelmintic active ingredient, each of which has its own spectrum of activity that is integrated with the other, AVICO had proved to have all what makes it the ideal flukicidal and nematocidal, excellent results, activity against mature and immature stages, easily administered, wide margin of safety (regarding toxicity and residual effect) and above all it is economic.
- AVICO combined the effect of triclabendazole to that of Levamisole, thus widening its spectrum of activity to include a wide variety of round worms affecting the gastrointestinal tract of ovine.

Indications
- OVINEX is an effective combination of both Triclabendazole and Levamisole to be used in sheep, making a comprehensive wormer and flukicide that covers wide spectrum of gastric, intestinal, and lungworms.
- It is also effective against all of the three stages of liverfluke.
- OVINEX activity covers, Stomach worms (Haemonchus, Ostertagia spp. and T. axei), gut worms (Trichostrongylus. Cooperia, Nematodirus, Bunostomum, Gaigeria, Chabertia, and Oesophaostomum spp.), immature and mature stages of lung worms, (Dictyocaulus spp.), and that of all liver fluke stages (both F. hepatica and F. gigantica).

Dosage and administration
- Sheep: 2 ml of OVINEX per 10 kg body weight (Equivalent to 10 mg triclabendazole/kg b. wt., and 7.5 mg levamisole hydrochloride/kg b. wt.).

Withdrawal period
Meat: 28 days.
Milk: Do not be use in animals producing milk for human consumption.

Precautions:
- Use only for sheep
- Dispose of used containers properly
- Shake the container well before use.

Storage:
Store in a dark place at a temperature below 30ºC.

Packing:
500 ml & 1 L plastic bottles.
name: Ovinex

description:
STROLITINE Enhances energy production for performance, delays fatigue, prevents Tying Up and improves neuromuscular transmission.

Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- L Carnitine HCL  5 gm (L-Carnitine 4.077 g)
- Magnesium sulfate heptahydrate 25 gm (Magnesium 2.5 g)
- Sorbitol  25 gm
- Propylene glycol  55 gm
- Distilled water up to  100 ml

Biological properties: 
- L carnitine is amino acid essential in the transport of fats into muscle cells for energy production which cause delaying the accumulation of lactic acid. L-carnitine is an amino acid related to vitamins B that is synthesized in the body from three amino acids: arginine, methionine, and glycine. L-carnitine is located in muscle tissue and the liver, where it intensifies the disintegration of fatty acid molecules. L-carnitine has anabolic, anti-hypoxic, and anti-thyroid effects; it stimulates regenerative activity in tissues, helps to normalize metabolic processes, has anabolic effects, lowers cholesterol level, prevents osteoporosis and apoptosis, improves appetite, and activates fat metabolism.
- Sorbitol, accumulating in the liver in the form of glycogen important for energy metabolism and has a diuretic effect 
- Magnesium sulfate improves intestinal peristalsis, laxative and has choleretic effect.

INDICATIONS
• Increases daily weight gain in fattening animals by 18.6%.
• Normalizes metabolism in farm animals.
• Improves hepatic & GIT function.
• Improves sprint and endurance performance.
• Normalizes heart function.
• Efficiently recovers performance animals.
• Magnesium sulfate: laxative and an electrolyte replacement.
• Magnesium is a cofactor in many enzymatic processes in the body and is involved in muscular excitement and neuromuscular transmission.

Dosage and administration:
- IM or S/C injection, 2 - 3 doses per week or as advised by veterinarian
- Horses, Camel and Cattle: 15 - 20 ml / animal
- Foals and calves: 5 - 10 ml / animal
- Sheep and goat: 3 - 5 ml / animal
- Dogs: 1 - 3 ml / animal
- Cats: 0.5 - 1 ml / animal

Storage:
keep in a dry, cool place away from sun light with a temperature ranges from 4 - 25 C.

Shelf life:
36 months from the date of manufacturing

Reg. No.:2215/2020

Developer and manufacturer:
NITA-FARM LLC
1, Osipova V.I. Street, Saratov, 410010, RUSSIA
The system of production is certified by ISO 9001 and GMP
name: Strolitine

description:
Content:
- Boldenone undecylenate 50mg/1ml

Description
Boldenone is a steroid anabolic with a very little androgenic activity; it is a great appetite stimulant, it increases vigor, muscular development and gives skin and hair a better appearance.

Indication
- Is indicated for horses that are energetically trained and that present a lot of fatigue and low performance. 
- It promotes a better nourishing conversion by maintaining the animal with a stable body weight
- It increase daily weight gain in Fattening animals.
- Increase bone development can be used as a support treatment after surgery, diseases or trumatic injuries,improves sprint

- Fighting birds   0.1 - 0.3/bird

Suitable for: cattle, horse & swine

10ml - 50ml - 100ml

description:
COMPOSITION
Each ml contains:
- Marbofloxacin  160 mg
- Benzyl alcohol (E 1519)  15 mg

INDICATIONS
- Therapeutic treatment of respiratory infections in cattle caused by sensitive strains of Pasteurella multocida and Mannheimia haemolytica.
- Treatment of acute mastitis caused by sensitive strains of Escherichia coli.

CONTRA-INDICATIONS
- Do not use in animals with known hypersensitivity to fluoroquinolones or to any of the excipients.
- Do not use in cases where the pathogen involved is resistant to other fluoroquinolones (cross resistance).

DOSAGE & ADMINISTRATION
- The recommended dosage is 10 ml/160 kg body weight (i.e. 10 mg/kg) in a single intramuscular injection.
- If the volume to be injected is more than 20 ml, it should be divided between two or more injection sites.
- To ensure a correct dosage, bodyweight should be determined as accurately as possible to avoid underdosing.
- Where there is slight cloudiness or visible particles present, such cloudiness or particles disappear when the bottle is shaken before use.

ADVERSE REACTIONS
- Administration by the intramuscular route may cause rare transient local reactions such as pain and swelling at the injection site which may persist up to 7 days after injection.
- Fluoroquinolones are known to induce arthropathies. In cattle such lesions were observed after three days of treatment with the 16% marbofloxacin solution. These lesions did not induce clinical signs and should be reversible, particularly if they were to be observed after a single administration.
- No other adverse effect was observed on cattle.
- If you notice any serious effects or other effects not mentioned in this leaflet, please inform your veterinary surgeon.

TARGET SPECIES: Cattle

ADVICE ON CORRECT ADMINISTRATION
None.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
- Meat and offal: 5 days
- Milk: 48 hours

STORAGE PRECAUTIONSS
- Shelf-life: 3 years when stored at temperature not exceeding 25°C, and used after opening for 28 days when stored at temperature not exceeding 25°C.
- Keep out of the reach and sight of children.
- When the container is broached (opened) for the first time, using the in-use shelf-life which is specified on this package leaflet, the date on which any product remaining in the container should be discarded should be worked out. This discard date should be written in the space provided on the label.
- Do not use after the expiry date stated on the carton and vial after Exp.

SPECIAL WARNINGS
Warning for target species:
None.

Precautions for animals:
- Not used in newborn domestic animals.
- Official and local antimicrobial policies should be taken into account when this product is used.
- Fluoroquinolones should be reserved for the treatment of clinical conditions which have responded poorly, or are expected to respond poorly, to other classes of antimicrobials. Wherever possible use of the product should only be based on susceptibility testing.
- Use of the product deviating from the instructions given in this SPC may increase the prevalence of bacteria resistant to fluoroquinolones and may decrease the effectiveness of treatment with other quinolones due to the potential for cross resistance.

User warnings:
- People with known hypersensitivity to fluoroquinolones should avoid any contact with the product.
- If the product comes into contact with the skin or eyes, rinse with copious amounts of water.
- Care should be taken to avoid accidental self-injection. In the event of accidental self-administration, the user should immediately seek professional medical care.
- Accidental self-injection can induce a slight irritation.

Pregnancy, lactation or lay:
Studies in laboratory animals (rats, rabbits) did not show any evidence of a teratogenic, embryotoxic or maternotoxic effect associated with the use of marbofloxacin. Safety of the product at 10 mg/kg has not been determined in pregnant cows or in suckling calves when used in cows. Use therefore according to the benefit/risk assessment carried out by the responsible veterinarian.

Interaction: None known.

Overdose:
- Lesions of the joint Cartilage were observed in some animals treated at 10 mg/kg or 30 mg/kg for three times the recommended treatment duration, but did not induce clinical signs. Moreover, no sign of overdosage was observed throughout this study.
- Overdosage may cause signs such as acute neurological disorders which should be treated symptomatically.

Incompatibilities:
In the absence of compatibility studies, this veterinary medicinal product must not be mixed with other veterinary medicinal products.

DISPOSAL PRECAUTIONS
Dispose of any unused product and empty containers in accordance with guidance from your local waste regulation authority.

OTHER INFORMATION
Packaging:
Cardboard box containing amber (type II) glass vial containing 100 ml or 50 ml injectable solution closed with sterilized chlorobutyl rubber and over sealed with sterilized aluminum cap or flip cap with outer label + leaflet.

Regist. N°: 3816/2015

Manufacturer by:
VETOQUINOL S.A.
Veterinary Pharmaceuticals
Magny-Vernois 70200 Lure (France)

Keep the container in the outer carton.

For veterinary use only - to be supplied only on veterinary prescription

description:
Ainil ketoprofen (INN) is an injectable solution for Intravenous or intramuscular route for veterinary use only.

Composition:
- Ketoprofen 100 mg
- Benzyl alcohol 10 mg
- Excipient q.s. 1 ml

Properties:
- Non-steroidal antiinflammatory drug (NSAID), non-narcotic agent with analgesic and antipyretic properties (QM01AE03).
- Ketoprofen belongs to the generation of non-steroidal antinflammatory agents based on propionic acid.
- Inflammatory stimulus that damage the cell activate phospholipases which deliver arachidonic acid. This is the substract of the cycloxygenase and lipoxygenase enzymatic systems, whose activity produce important mediators of inflammation: prostaglandins, thromboxanes and leukotriens.
- Ketoprofen acts as double inhibitor of inflammation, blocking the cycloxygenase and also the lipoxygenase pathways and avoiding therefore tne prostaglandins and leukotriens production.
- Furthermore ketoprofen is a potent analgesic with central and peripheral effects. Its action consists on inhibiting directly bradykinin, a vasodilator and pain mediator. Bradykinin begins the painful stimulus by exciting nociceptor nerve ends. Besides its antibradykinin activity, ketoprofen acts at the central nervous system to inhibit the pain perception. Moreover, in the horse, ketoprofen counteracts the endotoxin effect and antagonizes the intestinal spasm induced by bradykinin.
- Ketoprofen is rapidly absorbed. In bovine, the peak plasma levels (8.025 ±1.9 mg /ml) are reached in less than one hour after intramuscular administration and bioavailability is almost complete. It is over 98% bound to plasma proteins and it is concentrated in inflammed tissues. It has a high affinity with synovial tissues, it is rapidly distributed and eliminated.
- Duration of action is longer than expected by it's half-life which varies from less than one hour (IV route in horses) and more than five hours (after IM administration in cattle). Substantial concentrations of Ketoprofen are found in the synovial fluid and remain there at levels higher than in plasma, with a half-life two or three times higher than in plasma.
- Ketoprofen is metabolised in liver to non-significant biologlcal active metabolites, and 90% are excreted as glucuronide conjugates in the urine.

Indications:
- Catle: Anti-inflammatory, analgesic and antipyretic treatment in cases of: infilammatory processes associated with respiratory diseases, mammary oedema, acute mastitis, musculoskeletal inflammatory processes.
- Horses: Treatment of inflammatory and painful states of osteoarticular and musculoskeletal systems, in particular: lameness of traumatic origin, arthritis, arthrosis, articular traumatisms (sprains, synovitis), fractures, tendinitis, foot affections (navicular disease, horseshoe accidents, pododermatitis circumscripta, founder), post-surgical inflammations. Symptomatic treatment of colics.

Dosage:
- Cattle: By Intravenous or intramuscular, administer 3 ml of Ainil / 100 kg b.w. daily for 1 to 3 consecutive days.

- Horses:
• Administer 1 ml of Ainil / 45 kg b.w., by IV injection, daily for 3 to 5 consecutive days in the treatment of musculoskeletal and osteoarticular system affections.
• Administer 1 ml of Ainil / 45 kg b.w., by IV injection, in a single dose in the symptomatic treatment of colics. 
• Generally, a single dose is enough, any supplementary injection should be preceded by a clinical re-evaluation of the animal.

Special precautions for use: Do not mix with other drugs in the same syringe.

Special safety precautions:
- Precautions should be taken, in case of accidental injection, in persons with asthma angiooedema, urticaria or rhinitis history precipitated by NSAIDS.
- Persons with gastroduodenal ulceration history, bleeding, kidney failure, cardiac failure, hypertension or hepatic failure should immediately request medical advice showing the label, box or leaflet of the product.
- Avoid splashes on the eyes, mucous membranes, wounds or irritated skins It is recommended to wash the area with abundant water.

Contraindications:
- Patients with cardiac, renal or hepatic disease. Where there is the possibility of gastro-intestinal ulceration or bleeding. Hypersensitivity to the drug. Blood dyscracias. Treatment with other NSAIDs concurrently or within 24 hours, race horses 15 days prior to racing; pregnant animals.
- Treatment before regaining consciousness after any general anaesthesia.
- Don't use in newly born pet animals.

- Side effects:
Prolonged use may cause gastro-intestinal lesions, inappetence, vomiting and diarrhoea. Transient swelling at injection site in dogs and cats.

Warnings:
Caution with use in animals less than 6 weeks of age or aged animals. Avoid use in dehydrated, hypovolaemic or hypotensive patients. Satety in pregnancy has not been established.

Drug Interactions:
- Avoid concurrent administration of potentialy nephrotoxic drugs or plasma-protein bound drugs. Patients on long-term treatment should be monitored.
- Concurrent antibacterials should be given if bacterial infection present.
- Do not administer other non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) concurrently, diuretics or anticoagulants.

Gestation and lactation periods:
As the effects of ketoprofen on fertility, pregnancy or foeotal death in horses have not been determined, Ainil should not be administered to pregnant mares and to colts less than 15 days of age.

Overdosage:
It may be identified by anorexia, vomits and diarrhoeas.

Withdrawal time:
- Cattle: Meat: 4 days. Milk: 0 milkings.
- Do not administer in food-producing horses.

Storage conditions:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C and valid for 14 days after opening.

Presentations: Brown glass (type I) vial of 50 ml and 100 ml.

Keep all medicines out of reach of children.

Veterinary prescription only.

Manufactured by:
Industrial Veterinaria, S.A. - Barcelona, Spain.

description:
Composition
Each vial contains:
- Ceftiofur sodium 1.105 gm (eq.to 1.06 gm ceftiofur base).

Properties:
• Respifur is the trade name of ceftiofur sod. a semisynthetic 3rd generation cephlosporins
• It has a broad range of activity against a variety of pathogens, including many species of Pasteurella, Staplylococcus, Streptococcus, Salmonella, Hoemophilus and E.coli.
• Ceftiofur is bactericidal antibiotic acts against susceptible bacteria. It acts by inhibiting mucopedtide synthesis in the cell wall resulting in a defective barrier and an osmotically unstable spheroplaste.

Indications and Usage
• Bovine respiratory disease (shipping fever, pneumonia) due to Past. Haemolytica, Past. Multocida and Haemophilus sommis.
• Respiratory infections in horses associated with Strept. Zooepidemicus.

Dosage
- For 1 gm Respifur, add up to 20 ml sterile water for injection to obtain a concentration of 50 mg ceftiofur / ml (5 %; w/v).
- Cattle: 2.2 ml of reconstituted product / 100 kg daily by IM for 3-5 days.
- Horses: 4.4 ml of reconstituted product / 100 kg daily by IM for 3-5 days.

Warning & precaution:
• Do not inject more than 10 ml in one site.
• Do not to be used in animals suffered from renal dysfunction.

Side effects:
• Non in the recommended dose. But large dose for long period may cause diarrhoea, hypersensitivity reactions.

Storage condition:
• Store at temperature 2 - 8 ° C and used immediately after reconstitution.

Withdrawal time
Cattle: 14 days.

Pack
Glass vials (type II): 1.133gm powder.
name: Respifur

description:

- Marbofloxacin 20 mg

- Dogs and cats: 0.5 ml Marboresp / 5 kg b.wt., daily for up to 3 – 5 days by S/C or I/V injection.

Withdrawal time

- Pigs: 2 days

description:
Composition
Each ml contains:
- Tylosin  200 mg (eq to Tylosin tartarate 216.3 mg)

Properties
- Tylosin is a macrolide antibiotic which acts by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis through binding to 50S ribosomal subunits. It has antibacterial spectrum that is essentially against Gram +ve bacteria including (Actinomyces spp. Erysipelothrix rhusiopathiae), certain Gram -ve bacteria including (Pasteurella spp and Fusobacterium necrophorum) and certain spirocbetes (as Treponema hyodysenteriae).

Indications
Beef Cattle and non-lactating dairy cattle:
- Bovine respiratory complex (shipping fever, pneumonia) usually associated with Pasteurella multocida and Actinomyces pyogenes.
- Foot rot (necrotic pododermatitis) and diphtheria caused by Fusobucterium necrophorum.
- Metritis caused by Actinomyces pyogenes.

Pigs:
- Swine arthritis caused by Mycoplasma byosynoviae
- Swine erysipelas caused by Erysipelothrix rhusiopathiae
- Swine pneumonia caused by strains of Pasteurella spp.
- Acute swine dysentery caused by Treponema hyodysenteriae.

Target species: Cattle, Pigs

Dosage & Route of administration:
- by IM injection route
- Beef Cattle: 0.4 -1 ml of Bovilan / 20 kg body weight for 3-5 days once daily.
- Pigs: 0.1 - 0.5 ml of Bovilan / 10 kg body weight for 3-5 days twice daily.

Warning & Precautions:
1- Do not use in lactating dairy cattle.
2- Operators should wear suitable protective clothing.
3- Don't mix Bovilan injection with other injectable solutions as this may cause a precipitation of the active ingredient.
4- It is not recommended to be used in pigs weighing less than 25 pounds.
5- If there is no response to therapy in 3 days, diagnosis and treatment should be reassessed.
6- Don't be used in newborn domestic animals.

Contra-indications:
There are no known contra-indications to tylosin injection at this time.

Drug interactions:
- Because tylosin is related to macrolides group, it interacts with Clindamycin (antagonism of effect).

Side effects:
local reactions to tylosin have been observed to animals including oedema of rectal mucosa, anal protrusion, diarrhea, erythema and pruritus.

WithdraWal time:
- Cattle: Meat 28 days.
- Pigs: Meat 3 weeks

Storage conditions:
- Store at temp. not exceeding 30°C, and used immediately after opening.
- Keep out of reach of children.

Pack aging:
Carton box containing ember glass ( type I) Vial containing 50 ml, 100 ml solution with chloro butyl rubber stopper and aluminum cap with outer label + inner leaflet.

M.O.H. Reg. No.: 3638/2014
