description:
COMPOSITION:
- Phenylbutazone 200 mg
- Dexamethasone 0.25 mg
- Excipient q.s. 1 ml

DESCRIPTION:
Analgesic, anti-inflammatory and anti-pyretic effect, derived from pyrazolone, indicated in the treatment of locomotor system diseases.

INDICATIONS:
Treatment of primary locomotor system diseases. Coadjutant treatment to the antibiotic therapy in infectious arthritis. Treatment of inflammatory processes in osteopathies, adenopathies, neuropathies, mastitis. To control congestive and painful symptoms associated to these processes.

TARGET SPECIES: Horses, dogs and cats.

POSOLOGY:
- Intramuscular or intravenous.
- Horses: Adult animals: 30 ml/day 1st day, 20 ml/day 2nd day, and subsequently 10 ml/day, during 4-6 days.
- Foals: 10 ml/day 1st day and 5 ml subsequent 4-6 days.
- Pets: 1 ml/15 kg b.w. per day, during 5 days

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD: No withdrawal period. Do not administrate to horses if their meat will be used for human consumption.

Withdrawal period: Not required. (Do not use in horses and calves intended for human consumption).

Expiration period: 3 years from the date of manufacture

Presentation: 
20 and 100 ml
name: Artrivet Forte

description:
Vita-C is used in cattle, sheep, goats, horses, pigs, dogs, cats and poultry:
- treatment of vitamin C deficiency
- adjuvant therapy for asthenia, notably in cases of infection or stress

Composition
- Ascorbic Acid (vitamin C) 200 mg/ml

Dosage and administration
Vita-C should be intravenous, intramuscular or oral administered.
The recommended daily dose is 20 to 60 mg ascorbic acid per kg body weight, corresponding to:
- Adult horses: 50 to 100 ml
- young horses: 10 to 30 ml
- Sheep, goats, pigs: 5 to 25 ml
- Dogs: 1 to 5 ml
- Cats: 0.5 to 1 ml
- Poultry (for 10 animals): from 1 to 5 ml

Oral administration is preferable for chronic conditions or as an addition to parenteral administration. Orally, the product can be administered on its own, mixed uniformly into feed, or diluted in water. Do not mix with milk!
name: Vita-C Vetoquinol

description:
Anthelmintic (Benzimidazole)

Composition
Each 1 ml contains:
- Albendazole 125 mg

Properties
- very effective anthelmintic which acts by preventing worms from utilizing glucose.
- Glucose is not absorbed and the parasite's glycogen become depleted and the worms are not able to synthesize Adenosine triphosphate ( A.T.P.), which is essential for survival.

Indications:
- treatment of different worms infestations such as tape, round and lung worms and liver flukes in cattle, sheep and goats.
- effective against Larvae and adult stages of liver fluke.

Dose:
- To be given via Drench
- Cattle, Calves and Goats: 3 ml / 50 kg (7.5 mg/ kg)
- Sheep: 2 ml / 50 kg (5 mg/ kg)

Warnings:
- Not to be used in lactating animal.
- Not to be used during first 45 days of pregnancy.

Withdrawal time: 
Meat:
- Cattle and Calves: 14 days before slaughter.
- Goats and Sheep: 7 days.
Milk:
- 72 hours after the last treatment.

Storage:
Store in a dark place at a temperature below 30°C.

Packing:
500 ml and 1 liter plastic bottles.
name: Albendazole forte

description:
Anthelmintic (Avermectin)

Bimectin Oral Paste with 1.87mg/g of ivemectin is an excellent option for the treatment of nematode or arthropod infestations in horses sensitive to ivermectin.

The calibrated syringe allows accurate dosing and the gel formulation facilitates absorption. What’s more, the Bimectin Paste gel formulation is apple-flavoured, for excellent palatability and ease of dosing.

The product is safe to use in horses of all ages and offers broad-spectrum activity against a wide range of debilitating and performance-depriving parasites; meaning you can have every confidence when Bimectin Paste, as part of your parasite control strategy.

Indications
treatment of nematode or arthropod infestations in horses due to:
- Large Strongyles (adults)
-- Strongylus vulgaris (also early forms in blood vessels)
-- S. edentatus (also tissue stages)
-- S. equinus
-- Triodontophorus spp. including T. brevicauda, T. serratus
-- Craterostomum acuticaudatum
- Small Strongyles (adults, including those resistant to some benzimidazole class compounds)
-- Coronocylcus spp. including C. coronatus, C. labiatus and C. labratus
-- Cyathostomum spp. including C. catinatum, and C. pateratum
-- Cylicocyclus spp. incluidng C. insigne, C. leptostomum, C. nassatus and C. brevicapsulatus
-- Cylicodontophorus spp.
-- Cylicostephanus spp. including C. calicatus, C. goldi, C. longibursatus, C. minutus
-- Petrovinema poculatum
- Small Strongyles (fourth–stage larvae)
- Pinworms (adults and fourth–stage larvae): Oxyuris equi
- Ascarids (adults and third– and fourth–stage larvae): Parascaris equorum
- Hairworms (adults): Trichostrongylus axei
- Large-mouth Stomach Worms (adults): Habronema muscae
- Bots (oral and gastric stages): Gasterophilus spp. including G. intestinalis and G. nasalis
- Lungworms (adults and fourth–stage larvae): Dictyocaulus arnfieldi
- Intestinal Threadworms (adults): Strongyloides westeri
- Summer Sores caused by Habronema and Draschia spp. cutaneous third-stage larvae
- Dermatitis caused by Neck Threadworm microfilariae, Onchocerca sp.
name: Bimectin

description:
Presentation:
A clear colourless to pale yellow, sterile injectable solution.

Active ingredients:
- Calcium 4.6% w/v, (as calcium borogluconate)
- Phosphorus 2% w/v (as magnesium hypophosphite)
- Magnesium 0.8% w/v (as magnesium hypophosphite)

Uses:
- For the treatment of hypocalcaemia in cattle, when complicated by magnesium and phosphorus deficiency.
- For treatment of downer cow syndrome.

Dosage & Method of Administration:
- Cattle: 100 ml - 200 ml by subcutaneous or slow Intravenous. As Intravenous administration of this product could cause death, this route should only be used by a veterinary surgeon.
- Actual dosage to be given intravenously will depend on the clinical condition of the animal and the amount to be used intravenously is left to the expertise of the veterinary surgeon.

Contraindications, Warnings, Side Effects and Precautions in Use:
- The solution should be the solution should be warmed to body temperature before use.
- Intravenous injections should be carried out slowly an stopped at once if untoward symptoms occur.
- When administered subcutaneously, massage the injection site.
- Any solution remaining in the vial following withdrawal of the required dose should be discarded.
- Any unused product or waste materials should be disposed of in accordance with national requirements.

FOR ANIMAL USE ONLY.
KEEP OUT OF REACH AND SIGHT OF CHILDREN.

Withdrawal Period: Nil

Storage:
Do not store above 25°C. Protect from light.

Registration no.: 3626/2014

Sole Agent: The Egyptian European Co.

Manufactured by:
Ballinskelligs Veterinary Products, Ballinskelligs, Co. Kerry, Ireland.
name: Megacal M

description:
ORNIPRIM CLONE B1, lyophilizate for suspension for domestic fowl

COMPOSITION
Each dose contains:
• Active substance per dose:
- Paramyxovirus Pseudopestis avium (Hitchner B1) min. 10^6 EID50 - max. 10^7.5 EID50

• Excipients:
- Lyophilisation medium (1 ml):
- Gelatina  140 mg
- Saccharosum  375 mg
- Aqua pro injectione  ad 1 ml

INDICATION(S)
- Active immunization of chickens one to fourteen days old against Newcastle poultry disease.
- Immunity is developed in one week after vaccination and lasts at least five weeks.

CONTRAINDICATIONS
It is not recommended to vaccinate poultry that is already ill.

ADVERSE REACTIONS
Not known.

TARGET SPECIES
Domestic fowl.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
» Individual application:
- 200 vaccine doses are diluted in 10 ml water for injection.
- Administer one drop of the diluted vaccines into the conjunctiva sac of individual birds a In the case of one-day-old chickens, apply the vaccine onto the nasal mucosa by dipping the beak into the vaccination solution.

» Mass application by spray:
- Administer the vaccine diluted in drinking water by means of a micro-droplet-making sprayer.
- 1000 vaccine doses are diluted in 200 to 250 ml water for injection.

ADVICE ON CORRECT ADMINISTRATION
Vaccinate chickens by application of a "coarse spray" evenly sprayed over equivalent number of poultry from a the distance of 30 to 50 cm. Too fine droplets (aerosol fog) cause inhalation of the vaccination virus into the lower airways and, as a consequence, development of a respiratory disease.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD(S)
Without withdrawal period.

STORAGE PRECAUTIONS
- Keep out of the sight and reach of children.
- Store in a refrigerator (2 °C- 8 °C).
- Do not expose the vaccine to the temperatures above 8°C for a long time.
- Do not use this veterinary medicinal product after the expiry date which is stated on the label.
- Shelf life after reconstitution: use immediately.

SPECIAL WARNING(S)
- Use usual aseptic measures during all procedures related to the product administration.
- The vaccination virus of avian Newcastle disease, strain Bio 52: NDV B1 reproduce and proliferate in the organism of vaccinated chickens after application.
- Several days after vaccination, the vaccination viruses are excreted into the environment to a limited extent, where they can attack other sensitive animals. The safety studies proved that the vaccination viruses are safe to target animals and passaging on the target animal does not increase their virulence or produce clinical symptoms of disease. Therefore, it is not necessary to take any special veterinary and animal husbandry actions in respect of the vaccination.
- No information is available on the compatibility of this vaccine with any other. Therefore the safety and efficacy of this product when used with any others (either when used on the same day or at different times) has not been demonstrated. Do not mix with any other vaccine/immunological product.
- The safety of the veterinary medicinal product has not been established during lay.

Precautions to the person:
- Avoid exposure to virus during vaccination and use safety goggles and a mask during spray application. Wash and disinfect your hands after the vaccination is finished. Wash used equipment and inactivate the vaccine residues with an efficient disinfectant, or by heat treatment (boiling or burning).

DISPOSAL PRECAUTIONS
- Any unused veterinary medicinal product or waste materials derived from such veterinary medicinal products should be disposed of in accordance with local requirements.

DATE ON WHICH THE PACKAGE LEAFLET WAS LAST APPROVED
6.4.2023

OTHER INFORMATION
- For animal treatment only.
- To be supplied only on veterinary prescription.

• 3 ml and 9 ml vials of type I hydrolytic glass containing 200, 500, 1000, 2000, 2500 doses of freeze-dried vaccine. The vial is closed with a rubber bung for lyophilizuation and sealed with a aluminium cap.

Vaccine is packaged in plastic or cardboard box:
• Individual packaging:
- 1 x 200 doses, 1 x 500 doses,
- 1 x 1000 doses, 1 x 2500 doses.

• Group packaging:
- 10 x 200 doses, 10 x 500 doses,
- 10 x 1000 doses, 10 x 2000 doses,
- 10 x 2500 doses.

Not all pack sizes may be marketed.

For any information about this veterinary medicinal product, please contact the local representative of the marketing authorisation holder.

MANUFACTURER
Bioveta, a.s., Komenského 212/12, 683 23 Ivanovice na Hané, Czech Republic
name: Orniprim Hitchner B1

description:

- Calcium gluconate  380 mg
(corresponding to Ca2+: 34mg or 0.85 mmol, respectively)

- Magnesium chloride hexahydrate 60mg

name: Calciveyxol

description:
Active ingredient
- Spectinomycin (sulphate)  100 mg/mL
- Lincomycin (hydrochloride)  50 mg/mL

Indications
- Bovids: Pneumonia, colibacillosis.
- Dogs: Pneumonia, colibacillosis.
- Porcino: Vibrionic dysentery, Colibacillosis, enzootic pneumonia, salmonellosis, infectious arthritis.
- For infections caused by microorganisms sensitive to the lincomycin/spectinomycin association

Contra-indications
- Do not administer to horses, animals with a history of hypersensitivity to these antibiotics or pregnant or lactating females.
- Do not administer jointly with macrolides or aminoglycosides.

Posology
- 1 ml / 5-10 kg /12 hours for 4-7 days.
- IM roure or IV route but it must be administered slowly, and with saline or glucose 5%.

Waiting time
Meat: 14 days.
Milk: do not use

Packaging
Container with 100 and 250 mL.
name: Biseptyl

description:
Anthelmintic (Salicylanilide)

Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Rafoxanide 25 mg

Properties
- Rafoxanide is a fasciolicide drug, which has a potent activity against adult liver flukes as Fasciola hepatica and Fasciola gigantica.
- It also has respectable efficacy against immature fluke.
- Rafoxanide is also active against blood sucking nematodes such as Haemonchus spp., Bunostomum spp.and tissue invading fly.
- Rafoxanide act by uncoupling or disconnect the mitochondrial reaction involved in electron-transport-associated events from ATP generation.
- This uncoupling is lethal to Fasciola spp. and other blood sucking helminthes.

Indications: 
- treatment of liver fluke infestations (Fasioliasis) in cattle, buffaloes, sheep and goats, it is specifically effective against the immature stages.
It is also recommended for the control of the blood sucking nematodes:
Bunostomum phlebotomum, adult Oesophagostomum radiatum, and fourth stage O. radiatum, Gaigeria spp. and Haemoncus spp. in various ruminants, it is effective also in eliminating larval stages of the nasal bot flies in sheep Oestrus ovis and other bot flies in goat, and cattle (Hypoderma bovis, H. lineatum).

Dosage: 
- shake well before use
- administer by mouth as drench.
- single dose is 10 ml per 25 kg b. wt., the dose can be repeated 4-6 weeks later.

Side-effect
- occasional increase defecation and inappetence in cattle

Contraindications:
- avoid contact with eyes and wash hands after application.
- no to use in dairy cattle

Storage:
Store in a dark place at a temperature below 25°C.

Withdrawal time:
Meat: 60 days
name: Rafinide

description:

name: Selectrolit

description:
Each ml contains:
- Dexamethasone 1 mg

Pharmacokinetic
After administration of the product intramuscularly, dexamethasone is absorbed rapidly, resulting in a rapid and short-acting response. T max in cattle, goats, horses, pigs, dogs and cats is reached within 30 minutes after intramuscular administration. The T% (half-life time) varies depending on the species between 5 and 20 hours. The bioavailability after intramuscular administration is approximately 100%.

Pharmacodynamic
Dexamethasone is a potent synthetic with low mineralocorticoid activity. Dexamethas one has ten to twenty times the anti-inflammatory activity of prednisolone at an equivalent molar dose. Corticosteroids may decrease the immune response. Indeed, they inhibit capillary dilation, leukocyte migration and phagocytosis. Glucocorticoids have an effect on metabolism by increasing gluconeogenesis. Dexamethasone induces parturition in ruminants if the fetus is alive.

Target species:
Equine, Camel, cattle, goats, pigs, dogs and cats.

Dosage
Intravenous or intramuscular use.
- Equine, Camel, cattle, goats, pigs 0.04 to 0.10 mg / kg (4 to 10 ml / 100 kg)
- Dogs, cats 0.05 to 0.10 mg / kg (0.5 to 1 ml / 10 kg)
- Administration for Race: pre-race: 5 ml for 5 days, suspend 2 days before the race

Indications:
- Treatment of inflammatory, allergic or shock conditions.
- primary ketosis (acetoneemia, pregnancy toxemia), induction of parturition in ruminants.
- osteoarticular inflammatory states in equine, increase in the performance as racing.

Contra-indications
- Don't use in animals suffering from diabetes mellitus, hyperadrenocorticism, renal insufficiency and heart failure or suffering from peptic ulcers.
- Don't use in animals with infectious disease, unless appropriate anti-infectious therapy is administered at the same time.

Side-effects
- In prolonged use, corticosteroid s such as dexamethasone may cause iatrogenic hypercorticism, polyuropolydipsia (PUPD), immunosuppression, bulimia and redistribution of the body's lipid reserves.
- The use of corticosteroids in lactating cattle and goats may lead to a temporary decline in milk production.
- Induction of parturition with corticosteroids may be associated with reduced progeny viability and increased incidence of placental retention.
- The use of corticosteroids in pregnant females is not recommended except in ruminants to induce parturition during the last third of gestation.
- Because corticosteroids can reduce the immune response to vaccination, dexamethasone should not be given at the same time as vaccines.
- Concomitant use of NSAIDs may increase the risk of ulceration of the gastrointestinal tract.
- High doses of corticosteroids may cause somnolence and lethargy in equines.

Special precautions
- In horses and Camel, dexamethasone should only be used at the beginning of the disease during laminitis.
- Administration of corticosteroids at the end of pregnancy may result in premature delivery or abortion in ruminants. Except in the indications of acetonaemia and induction of parturition, the function of cortico steroids is to improve rather than cure. Therefore, it's advisable to diagnose and treat the underlying disease. When used to treat shock, intravenous fluids should be administered to maintain circulation; An acid-base assessment must be carried out.

Waiting time
Meat and offal: 6 days.
Milk: 3 days.
name: Cortamethasone

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Florfenicol  30 gm

Properties:
- Florfenicol is a thiamphenicol derivative with same mechanism of action as chloramphenicol (inhibition of protein synthesis). However, it is more active than either chloramphenicol or thiamphenicol.
- Florfenicol has a broad spectrum of antibacterial activity that includes all organisms sensitive to chloramphenicol, gram-negative bacilli, Gram-positive cocci, and other atypical bacteria such as mycoplasma, florfenicol is active against the bovine respiratory disease (BRD) pathogens Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida, and Histophilus somni, and thet florfenicol exhibits bactericidal activity against strains of M. haemolytica and H. somni.
- Clinical studies confirm the efficacy of florfenicol against BRD as well as against commonly isolated bacterial pathogens in bovine interdigital phlegmon including Fusobacterium necrophorum and Bacteroides melaninogenicus.

Indicetions:
» Cattle: Treatment of Pneumonic Pasteurellosis caus ed by Mannheimia haemolytica And treatement of bovine respiratory disease caused by Pasteurella multocida, Mannheimia haemolytica, Histophilus somni and treatement of bovine interdigital phlegmon caused by fusobacterium necrophorm and bacteroides melaninogenious.
» Sheep: Treatment of Broncho Pneumonia caused by Mannheimia haemolytica and Pasteurella multocida.

Target Species: Cattle, Sheep

Dosage and Administration:
» Cattle:
- Intramuscular route: 1 ml / 15 kg (i.e. 20 mg / kg) twice 48 hours apart using a 16 gauge needle.
- Subcutaneous route: 2 ml / 15 kg (i.e. 40 mg / kg) once using a 16 gauge needle.

» Sheep: 1 ml / 15 kg (i.e. 20 mg / kg) by intramuscular injection daily for three consecutive days, the volume administrated per injection site should not exceed 4 ml.

- Clinical Improvement should be evident in most treated subjects within 24 hours of in initiation of treatment. If a positive response is not noted with in 72 hours of initiation of treatment, the diagnosis should be re-evaluated.

Contra-Indications:
- Don't use in animals that have shown hypersensitivity to florfenicol.
- For intramuscular and subcutaneous use in beef and non lactating dairy cattle only.
- Don't administer more than 10 ml at each site. The injection should be given only in the neck.

Precautions:
- Not for use in animals intended for breeding purposes. The effects of florfenicol on bovine reproductive performance, pregnancy, and lactation have not been determined. Toxicity studies associated the use of florfenicol with testicular degeneration and atrophy.
- Intramuscular injection may result in local tissue reaction which persists beyond 28 days. This may result in trim loss of edible tissue at slaughter. Tissue reaction at injection sites other than the neck is likely to be more severe.

Warning
- Not for human use, keep out of reach of children.
- Animals intended for human consumption must not be slaughtered within 28 days of the last Intramuscular treatment.
- Animals intended for human consumption must not be slaughtered within 38 days of the last subcutaneous treatment.
- Do not use veterinary products containing benzyl alcohol in the form of injection in newborn domestic animals.
- This product is not approved for use in female dairy cattle 20 months of age or older, including dry dairy cows. Use in these cattle may cause drug residues in milk and/or in calves born to these cows. A withdrawal period has not been established in pre-ruminating calves. Do not use in calves to be processed for veal.
- The product should be used in conjunction with susceptibility testing. As vial should not be broached more than 25 times, the user should select the most appropriate vial size according to the target species to be treated.

Adverse reactions:
Inappetence, decreased water consumption, or diarrhea may occur transiently following treatment.

Withdrawal time:
Cattle:
- Meat and offal (IM): 30 days
- Meat and offal (SC): 44 days
Sheep meat and offal (IM): 39 days
- Milk: Not authorised for use in lactating animals producing milk for human consumption.

Storage condition:
Store below 30°C. Do not freeze.

Packing:
10, 30, 50,100, 250, 500 ml, 1 Litre in glass vials in carton box with outer label and leaflet.

Manufactured by:
ARABCOMED pharmaceutical industries For Allam pharmaceutical industries
name: Felorex

Indication:

A) Major internal parasites:

- Roundworms: Including adult and immature stages of Ostertagia spp ., Haemonchus spp., Trichostronglylus spp., Cooperia spp., Bunostomum spp., Oesophagostomum spp., Chabertia spp., Nemtodirus spp., Strongyloides papiliosus , Thelazia (eyeworms ) , Asccarids , Tricuris , Filarial nematodas (parafilariasis and onchoceriasis ) , Stephanurosis (kidney Worms ) , and Toxocara vitulorum
- Lungworms: Mature and immature stages of Dictyocaulus spp ., ( D.viviparous and D.filaria )

B) Major external parasites: Mites responsible for Sarcoptic , Chorioptic and Psroptic mange , Hypoderma spp ., Dermatobia Screw – Worm fly , Biting and sucking lice, ticks grubs and agent of Myiasis.

Dosage instructions:

Warning and precautionary instructions :

- Withdrawal time: 35 days.

description:
Anthelmintic (Benzimidazole)

COMPOSITION
Each 100 ml contains:
- Albendazole  10 gm

PROPERTIES
» Albendazole is a broad spectrum anthelmintic which is highly effective against Gastrointestinal round woms, lungworms, tape worms and adult liver flukes infestation in cattle, sheep and goat.
» Albendazole is a benzimidazole anthelmintic, acts by:
a) Binding to tublin, structural protein and block polymerization of tublin into nmicrotubules, this leads to damage in the integrity and transport functions of the absorptive cells within the parasite.
b) Inactivation of electron transport enzymes as fumarate reductase which interferes with absorption and utilization of food stuffs by parasite.

INDICATIONS
» In cattle used in the treatment and control of gastrointestinal round worms as: ostertagia ostertagi; adults and inhibited larvae, lung worms: Dictyocaulus viviparus; adults and inhibited larvae liver fluke: Fasciola hepatica; adults and immature 8 weeks.
» In sheep used in the treatment and control of gastrointestinal round worms as: ostertagia circumcina; adult and inhibited larvae lung worm (Dictyocalus filaria), liver fluke: Fasciola hepatica and gigantica (adult).

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
• Shake well before use.
• Route: Orally via drinking water.
1- Cattle:
- In round worms: 7.5 ml / 100 kg body weight.
- In liver flukes: 10 ml of / 100 kg body weight.

2- Sheep:
- In round worms: 1.25 ml / 25 kg body weight.
- In liver flukes: 1.875 ml / 25 kg body weight.

WARNING AND PRECAUTIONS
1- Not to be used for animals producing milk for human consumption.
2- Not to be used for animals with known hypersensitivity to albendazole.
3- Not to be used during early stage of pregnancy(Not administer to female in the first 45 days of pregnancy or for 45 day after removal of bulls in cattle or ewes in sheep).
4- Not to be used with other ruminal boluses.
5- Not to be used concurrently with organophosphorus compounds.
6- Not to be used during coughing for some weeks after treatment in cattle suffering severe lung damage at the time of treatment.
7- To be used under veterinarian supervision.

ADVERSE EFFECTS
1. Hepatic Failure.
2. GIT disturbances.
3. Anemia.

WITHDRAWAL TIME
a) Cattle (meat): 14 days after last treatment.
b) Sheep (meat): 5 days after last treatment.
c) Not to be used for sheep producing milk for human consumption.

STORAGE CONDITIONS
Store at room temperature not exceeding 30°C.

PACKAGE
High-density polyethylene (HDPE) white plastic bottle triangular upper part containing 1-Liter suspension closed with polypropylene (PP) orange plastic Cap. With prominent dp logo with outer label.

EDA.Reg.no.: 3055/2022

DELTA PHARMA
VETERINARY SECTOR
Industrial Zone B4, Area No.: 77/B,
10th of Ramadan City, Egypt

Indications:
- FERROPLEX is an integrated combination of B-complex vitamins with a high concentration of iron that enters in the composition of haemoglobin.

It helps to increase milk production in cattle.

name: Ferroplex

description:
Composition:
Each ml contains:
- Dexamethasone Sodium phosphate 2.64 mg (eq to 2 mg Dexamethasone 2 mg)

Properties:
Dexamethasone is a synthetic glucocorticoid, Glucocorticoids have effects on virtually every cell type and system in mammals an overview of the effects of these agents follows:
» Hematopoietic System: Glucocorticoid can increase the numbers of circulating platelets, neutrophils And red blood cells, but platelet aggregation is inhibited. Decreased amounts of lymphocytes (Peripheral), monocytes and eosinophils are seen as glucocorticoid can sequester these cells into the lungs and spleen and prompt decreased release from the bone marrow. Removal of old red blood cell is diminished. Glucocorticoid can cause involution of lymphoid tissue.
» GI Tract: Glucocorticoids increase the secretion of gastric acid, pepsin and trypsin. They alter the structure of mucin and decrease mucosal cell proliferation.

Indications:
Dexamethasone used for treatment of the following:
- Inflammatory & allergic disorders.
- Ketosis (Acetonaemia), Milk fever & Shock.
- Chronic granulomatous enteritis in horses.
- Arthritis and inflammatory joint lesions.
- Asthma and allergic reactions.
- Musculo-skeletal inflammations.
- Atypical inflammatory reactions of skin.
- Dexamethasone can be used for induction of parturition in cattle.

Dosage & Route of administration:
- Administrated by I/V or I/M injection or intra-articular injection for 3 - 4 days.
- Horses, Cattle: 1 ml / 25 kg body weight.
- Dogs, Cats: 0.1 ml / kg body weight.

Warning:
1- should not to be used in horses intended for human consumption.
2- use with care in animal with laminitis.
3- may cause retained placenta and possible subsequent metritis or subfertility when used to induce paturtion.

Contraindication:
1- Renal impairment.
2- Diabetes mellitus
3- Chronic nephritis
4- Congestive heart failure.

Withdrawal time:
Cattle:
  slaughter: 21 days
  milk: 3 days

Side effects:
Polydipsia, Polyuria, Polyphagia, calcinosis, Immunosuppression, Delayed wound healing, Gastrointestinal Ulceration, decreased milk yield in lactating cows, hepatomegaly.

Storage condition:
1- Stored at temperature not exceeding 30°C in a cool place away from direct sunlight, it can be used after opening for 40 days.
2- Keep away from children.

Package:
Carton box containing Amber type (II) glass vials filled with 10 and 100 ml solution with brown chlorobutyl rubber stoppers capped with aluminium flip off cap with outer label + insert leaflet.

Manufactured by:
Badr Pharma for RAA Company

Mobile: +201110111756

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains
- Dipyrone 500 mg

Properties
- Dipyrone, like other non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, acts by inhibiting cyclo-oxygenase mediated production of prostaglandins.
- It has analgesic, antipyretic and slight anti-inflammatory properties and reportedly has antispasmodic activity on bradykinin-induced spasms on the intestinal tract, but does not appreciably alter spontaneous intestinal motility.

Indications
- Dipyrone, the active ingredient of PYROGESIC, is a derivative of the pyrazolon Analgesics.
- It is an effective analgesic, anti-inflammatory and antipyretic drug.
- These effects are due to its analgesic action over the Central Nervous system, leading to pain relief and quietening of the animal.
- PYROGESIC proved to be effective against wide range of symptoms of colic, spasmodic conditions, hypermotility of intestine, paresis, both acute and chronic rheumatic conditions (Rheumatism, Neuritis Tendo-vaginitis), pain, fever, Mastitis.

Dosage and administration
- By subcutaneous, intramuscular or intravenous (slow) injection.
- Horses: 11-22 mg/kg b. wt. (Equivalent to 2.2-4.4 ml/100 kg b. wt.)
- Dogs and Cats: 27.5 mg/kg body weight. (Equivalent to 0.55 ml/10 kg b. wt.)

Withdrawal period
In horses do not administer the drug within 5 days before racing.

Contraindications:
- Dipyrone is physically incompatible with apmorphine, aspirine, chloral hydrate and oxidizing agents.
- Contraindicated in animals with history of hematological or bone marrow abnormalities.
- Dipyrone should not be used concurrently with phenylbutazone or barbiturates.
- Concomitant administration with chloropromazine may cause serious hypothermia.
- In horses do not administer the drug within 5 days before racing.

Storage:
Store in a dark place at a temperature below 30°C.

description:
Composition:
Each vial contains
- Streptomycin sulphate 200 gm (eq o 160 gm streptomycin base)

Streptomycin sulfate is an aminoglycoside antibiotic that has a broad spectrum of antimicrobial (bactericidal) action. The drug is active against Mycobacterium tuberculosis , the majority of gram-negative bacteria ( Escherichia coli , Salmonella spp ., Shigella spp .,Yersinia spp ., Klebsiella spp ., In t. Ch. Klebsiella pneumoniae , Haemophilus influenzae , Neisseria gonorrhoeae , Neisseria meningitidis , Yersinia pestis, Francisella tularensis , Brucella spp .) And some gram-positive microorganisms (Staphylococcus spp., Corynebacterium diphtheria). The bactericidal effect of the drug is due to the binding to the 30S subunit of the bacterial ribosome, which subsequently leads to inhibition of protein synthesis in microorganisms

Indications:
Treatment of cattle, sheep, goats, pigs, horses and dogs suffering from leptospirosis, brucellosis, tularemia, pneumonia, diplococcal infections, mastitis, endometritis, endocarditis, meningitis, wound and postnatal sepsis, erysipelas and edema (in swine), malignant Catarrhal fever, campylobacteriosis and actinomycosis (in cattle) and other diseases caused by microorganisms susceptible to streptomycin

Dosage:
- Intramuscular injections make deep into the muscle.
- The course of treatment is 4-7 days
- Route of administration by I/M injection only
- For the active ingredient 10 mg / kg b. wt.
- Add sterile water for injection up to 500 ml to the content of the vial to obtain a concentration of 320 mg /ml reconstituted solution
- Cattle 3 ml of reconstituted solution / 100 kg b.wt for up to 3 day
- Sheep 1.5 ml / 50 kg for up to 3 days

Precaution:
- Streptomycin is cross-allergic to other aminoglycosides. Animals that are allergic to aminoglycosides should be banned from this product.
- Use with caution when suffering from dehydration

Withdrawal Time:
- Cattle 
-- meat & offal  16 days
-- milk  48 hours
- Sheep 
-- meat & offal 18 days
-- do not use in sheep producing mil for human consumption

Pack size:
Vials of 500 ml / contain 200 gm powder
name: Streptoprima

description:
- Combination Antibiotic and Antipyretic for effective treatment of Pneumonia
- Oxytetracycline inhibits the growth of bacteria via attachment to amino acyl transfer RNA on the surface of the 30s ribosomal subunit. Then this agent is bacteriostatic. Also Oxytetracyclines alter the permeability of the cell wall of the bacteria through the attachment to 50s ribosomal subunit. In this way the antibacterial effect of product is augmented more. On the other hand it reduces transformation of glutamate to cellular proteins resulting in growth inhibition.
- Flunixin(as Meglumine), like other NSAIDs inhibits cyclooxygnase enzymes and though prevents prostaglandins and thromboxane synthesis leads to reduction of pain, fever and inflammation

Indication:
- Treatment of respiratory infections specially caused by pasteurella spp. with severs inflammation and for the control of associated pyrexia in beef and non-lactating dairy cattle.
- Arcanobacterium pyogenes, Staphylococcus aureus and certain mycoplasmas in vitro which are sensitive to oxytetracycline.
- Treatment of acute mastitis with edema.
- Treatment of gastrointestinal infections.
- Treatment of metritis with fever and pain.

Dosage:
- 1 ml / 10 kg initially by intravenous then by intramuscular injection daily up to 5 days.

Warning and Precautions:
- IV injection should be done slowly.
- Do not mix with c a ++ preparations.
- Do not administer more than 10 ml in one site of injection.
- Should not be given in cattle producing milk for human consumption.

Contraindications:
- In animals suffering from cardiac, or renal disease. Where there is a possibility of gastrointestinal ulceration or bleeding
- Do not administer other non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs concurrently or within 24 hours of each other.
- Do not use in animals showing hypersensitivity to either flunixin meglumine or oxytetracycline.
name: Oxyfinadine

description:
Anthelmintic (Benzimidazole)

Composition
Each ml of paste contains;
- Fenbendazole  0.187 gram

Target species
Horses.

Indications
1. Treatment of infections with small and large strongyles, ascarids, Oxyuris spp. and Strongyloides spp. species.
2. Can also be used for treatment of horses with immature and migrating strongyles infections.

Method of administration
By the oral route.

Dosage
1. The standard dose is a single dose 7.5 mg/kg, which is equal to 1 syringe of 20 ml per 500 kg bodyweight.
2. In case of infection with migrating larval stages of large strongyles, or encysted mucosal stages of small strongyles, the standard dose of 7.5 mg/kg should be given for 5 consecutive days.
3. In cases of diarrhoea in 2-3 week old suckling foals, caused by Strongyloides westeri, the dose should be 50 mg/kg, which is equal to 1 syringe of 20 ml per 75 kg bodyweight.

Presentation
Cartons with 1 or 20 syringes containing 20 gram of paste each.

Storage
At room temperature.

Further information
Panacur Paste can be used in pregnant animals.
name: Panacur Paste

description:
Composition
Each ml contains
- Kanamycin sulphate 250 mg 

Mode of action
Kanamycin is broad spectrum bactericidal aminoglycoside antibiotic inhibits protein synthesis by irreversible binding to the 30s ribosomal subunit

Pharmacokinetics
- Rapid Absorption after IM injection
- Reach to plasma peak conc action after 30 - 60 min.
- Bioavailability reach to 90%
- Covered Minimum inhibitory Concentration (MIC) for 24 hr.
- Excreted unchanged in urine.
- Post Antibiotic Effect "PAE", Continues to suppress bacterial growth several hours after Fall in Minimum Inhibitory

Pharmacodynamics
1. Broad Spectrum
- Gram-negative bacteria such as Pasteurella, E. coli, Klebsiella, Proteus and Salmonella.
- Gram-positive: Staphylococcus,Corynebacterium
2. Bactericidal in low doses So, development of resistance is very slow.

Synergism and Antagonism
- Kanamycin Synergistic with: Tylosin, Spiramycin, Beta Lactams, Lincomycin.
- Kanamycin NOT used with: Chloramphenicol, Sulphonamides.

Features of KANAMYCIN ALFASAN 25 %
- Produced by Alfasan Holland.
- Registered in MOH (Ministry of Human Health).
- the only Molecule in Egypt with concentration 25 %.
- lowest withd rawal time 6 days in broilers (compared with others Aminoglycosides).
- Broad spectrum, bactericidal antibiotic inhibits microbial protein synthesis.
- Active against Gram-positive (Corynebacterium, Staphylococcus) and Gram-negative bacteria, such as, Enterobacter, E. coli, Klebsiella, Proteus and Salmonella.
- Kanamycin reaches to the blood level very quickly after intramuscular injection (within 30 minutes).
- Kanamycin is bactericidal in low doses, so development of resistance is very slow.

Indications
- treatment of coliform mastitis, staphylococcal mastitis, colibacillosis and salmonellosis.
- treatment of pneumonia and respiratory tract infections and CRD. Control secondary bacterial infections (Pasteurella).
- treatment of abscesses and phlegmons and dermatitis and skin and soft tissue infections.
- treatment of urogenital tract infections as endometritis, and pyometra.
- treatment of bone and joint infections as well as otitis media.

Dosage and administration
- By intramuscular or subcutaneous injection.
- Administered once daily for 3 -5 consecutive days, depend on severity

Dosage:
- Beef cattle: 6-8 mg/kg B.wt. in mild cases up to 15 mg (3 - 6 ml /100 kg B.wt).
- Foals and calves 2 ml per 50 kg B.wt. daily.
- Sheep 2 ml per 50 kg B.wt. daily.
- Intra-uterine 1-2 m.

- Poultry : 10-25 mg / kg but. By intramuscular or subcutaneous injection

Withdrawal times:
Meat: 6 days.
Milk: 4 days.

Conservation:
Cool (8-15 °C), protected from light.
name: Kanamycin 25%

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Oxytetracycline Hydrochloride 50 mg
- Lidocain hydrochloride 1 mg

Properties
- Oxytetracycline Hydrochloride is one of the most important and widely used antibiotics in Veterinary Medicine, it has a broad spectrum antibacterial action.
- Oxytetracycline HCI interferes with protein synthesis of the rapidly growing and reproducing bacterial cells, it inhibits bacterial cellular metabolism.
- The mechanism of action of oxytetracycline as well as all tetracycline’s includes protein synthesis prevention & chelation.

Indications
- For the treatment of bacterial infections caused by Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria affecting respiratory and gastrointestinal tract such as bronchopneumonia, pleuropneomonia, enteritis and septicaemia as well as for metritis, mastitis and urinary tract infection.
- It is also effective against mycoplasma, rickettsia, chlamydia and anaplasma.

Dosage and administration
- To be injected intramuscularly or subcutaneously.
- Cattle, Buffaloes, Sheep & Goats: 1 ml/10 kg b. wt., for 3 days.
- Dogs & Cats: 1.5 ml/10 kg b. wt., for 3 days.

Withdrawal period
Cattle:
- Meat: 21 days.
- Milk: Should not be use for animals producing milk for human consumption with 3 days post-administration.

Storage:
Store in a dark place at a temperature below 30°C.

Packing:
50 ml, 100 ml Amber color glass injection bottles.
name: Avicycline 5%

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Sulphadimidine sodium: 33.3 gm (eq to 30.93 gm Sulphadimidine base)

Properties:
- Sulphonamides form an extensive series of drugs that differ more in their physicochemical characteristics, and hence in mode of administration and pharmacokinetics, than they do in their antibacterial activity. They act by competing with tissue factors, notably p-aminobenzoic acid (PABA), and are therefore inactive in the presence of necrotic tissue.
- They ar bacteriostatic to a range of Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. They are active against aerobic Gram-positive cocci and some rods many Gram-negative rods including Enterobacteriaceae. Sulphonamides are also active against Chlamydophila, Toxoplasma, and coccidia.
- The popularity of Sulphadimidine results from the relatively slow excretion (the half life of elimination in the food producing animals is 8-12 h) and also from the good solubility of both the parent drug and metabolites which reduces the possibility crystaluria. About 70% Of the drug is protein bound.

Indications:
Sulphadimidine has been shown to be effective in vitro against the following bacterial species: Bordetella bronchiseptica, Escherichia coli, Pasteurella haemolytica, Salmonella dublin, Salmonella typhimurium and Actinobacillus lignieresi.

Specific indications:
enteritis caused by Escherichia coli, Salmonella dublin and Salmonella typhimurium: salmonellosis and septicaema caused by Salmonella dublin and Salmonella typhimurum pasteurellosis and infections of the respiratory tract caused by Pasteurella haemolytica, atrophic rhinitis caused by Bordetella bronchiseptica and Pasteurella haemolytica; and wooden tongue caused by Actinobacillus lignieresi.

Target species:
Cattle, sheep and pigs.

Dosage & Administration:
Cattle, sheep, and pigs: by subcutaneous or intravenous (preferred) injection: 65 ml/100 kg daily on day 1 (initial dose), then 32 ml/100 kg daily for 5 days.

Contra-indications:
Sulphonamide hypersensitivity; severe hepatic impairment.

Side-effects:
Agranulocytosis, haemolytic anaemia, avitaminosis-K with prolonged administration; crystalluria.

Warnings:
Care in renal impaiment, ensure adequate water intake during treatment; avoid prolonged administration.

Withdrawal period:
- Cattle and Sheep meat: 18 days
- Cattle milk: 6.5 days
- Pigs meat: 42 days

Storage condition:
- Store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C away from light & keep out of reach of children.
- Shelf-life: 3 years.
- Shelf-life after opening: 3 months.

Packing:
Carton box containing amber glass (type II) vial of 100 ml, 250 ml or 500 ml solution with rubber stopper and aluminum cap + insert leaflet
name: Sulphadimidine

description:
Each syringe (8 gm) contains:
- Neomycin 250 mg
- Oxytetracycline HCl 50 mg
- Predinsolone 10 mg

Properties
- AVIMAST is particularly effective against mastitis caused by bacteria; streptococci, staphylococci, and E. coli which are susceptible to neomycin and oxytetracycline.
- It contains the anti-inflammatory Prednisolone which reduces inflammation, redness and pain associated with mastitis.

Indications
- AVIMAST is an intra-mammary infusion indicted for the treatment of both acute and subacute mastitis in ruminants in their milking period.
- It contains the anti-inflammatory Prednisolone which reduces inflammation, redness and pain associated with mastitis.

Dosage and administration
- Manually empty udder gently and completely, wash udder and teat using warm water and suitable external antiseptic, dry, then disinfect the teat using alcohol swaps, uncap the syringe and insert the tip gently into the teat opening, push the plunger to empty the content of one syringe into udder, remove the tip while maintaining the teat opening tightly closed with your fingertips, massage the udder upwards starting from the teat to push the formula to the udder tissues.
- Use one tube per infected quarter (cattle) after milking, once daily for three consecutive days

Withdrawal period
Meat: 7 days.
Milk: 4 days.

Storage:
Store at a temperature below 30ºC.

Packing:
Plastic syringes with cap, ready for use.
name: Avimast

description:
Each ml contains:
• DL-Methionine   100 mcg
• L-Lysine-HCL   100 mcg
• DL-Carnitine  100 mcg
• Cyanocobalamin   500 mcg
• Sodium Selenite   1 mg
• Uridine Triphosphate  1 mg
• Adenosine Triphosphate   2 mg
• Magnesium Aspartate   15 mg
• Potassium Aspartate   15 mg
• Vehicle q.s   1 ml 

Directions:
SUPER PERFORMANCE-L contains elements that complement feeding. These elements are oriented towards motivating intense muscle activity such as the muscle oxygenation that competition demands. It has anabolizing properties that delay tiredness and fatigue, stimulating appetite and, therefore, growth.
- Potassium is an essential cation for the organism, necessary to maintain muscle-nerve excitability.
- Magnesium is the second most important cation in intracellular fluids and it is closely related to calcium and phosphorus. It acts together with enzymes and inside the neurochemical transmission linked to muscle excitability.
- Carnitine is important in the production of energy and in proteic synthesis. It is in charge of transporting cytosol fatty acids. It prevents unbalance between the contribution of energetic nutrients and the energy demand. It protects the liver and the kidney. It is excreted through urine and feces.
- Essential amino acids such as lysine and methionine favor the transportation and oxidation of fatty acids.
- Vitamin B12 (cyanocobalamin) is involved in the metabolism, nutrition and growth through the formation of red blood cells (hematopoiesis.) It is also involved in the production of epithelial cells and in the maintenance of myelin. It has a very important participation in cellular production and in the synthesis of nucleoproteins.
- Sodium Selenite (active form of selenium) has anti-inflammatory properties. It acts on myopathies, has a positive action in sulfur metabolism, protects the red blood cell against hemolysis and prevents the action of peroxidase in the unsaturated chain of the cell membrane.
- SUPER PERFORMANCE-L combats dehydration. Use it on weak, cachectic or rickety animals.

DOSAGE:
- Equines, bovines, ovines, caprines and camels: 3 ml / 100 kg of body weight. Use a maximum of 10 ml in equines and bovines.
- Canines and felines: 1 ml / each 25 kg of body weight.
- Fighting birds: 0.2 ml / bird. Apply every 9 days until 4 applications are completed.
- As prevention: One application a week during 2 to 3 weeks. Not apply more than 10 ml in each occasion in camels, bovines and equines.

Administration Route:
Slow intravenous or deep intramuscular injection. In bovines, only intramuscularly.

WARNINGS:
This product is of exclusive veterinary use. Keep out of the reach of children. Keep in a cool place and away from light. Do not consume the meat of treated animals until 28 days after the last application.
name: Super Performance L

description:
Composition:
Each ml contains:
- Flunixin meglumine 83 mg (Equ to Flunixin 50 mg)

Properties:
Flunixin is one of non steroidal anti-inflammatory drug, has a potent analgesic, antipyretic and anti-inflammatory activity. It acts by inhibition of cyclooxygenase enzyme leading to reduction of prostaglandins and related compounds synthesis.

Indications:
- Inflammation and pain
- Respiratory disease in cattle
- Mastitis in cattle
- Endotoxic shock
- Equine colic

Target species:
Horses, cattle

Dose And Administration:
- Horses: By intravenous injection 1 ml /45 kg body weight once daily repeated for up to 5 days.
- Cattle: By IM or IV injection 2 ml/ 45 kg given by once a day for up to 3 days the total daliy.

Contraindications:
1- The drug is contraindicated in animals with cardiac, renal or hepatic diseases.
2- Hypersensitivity to the drug, blood dyscrasias.
3- Treatment with other NSAIDS concurrently or within 24 hours.
4- Race horses prior to racing.

Warnings & precautions:
1- Caution with use in animals less than 6 weeks of age, or aged animals.
2- Avoid use in dehydrated, hypovolemic, or hypotensive animals.
3- Avoid concurrent administration of potentially nephrotoxic drugs.
4- Repeated use in equine colic is not recommended due to pain-masking effect.

Side effects:
Prolonged use may cause gastro-intestinal lesions, inappetence and diarrhea.

Drug interactions:
Flunixin enhances the effect of potentially nephrotoxic drugs, aminoglycosides, corticosteroids, other NSAIDs.

Withdrawal time:
- Cattle: 14 days after the last treatment
- Milk: 48 hours after the last treatment

Packaging:
Carton box contains Brown glass vial (type II) closed by rubber stopper & aluminum seal containing 50 ml, 100 ml solution with outer label and inner leaflet.

Storage:
Store at temperature not exceed 30°C, use immediately after opening, Keep Out Of Reach of Children.

E.D.A. Reg. No: 3573/2014 vet

Manufactured by:
Badr pharma for pharmaeutical industries for Eipivet
name: Epixin

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Enrofloxacin 50 mg

Properties
- Enrofloxacin belongs to the second generation of the family of compounds known as the 4 quinolones.
- The mode of action of quinolones is belived to be the inhibitiuon of DNA gyrase, an essential bacterial enzyme that maintains superhelical twists in DNA.
- As a result of its broad spectrum effectiveness, Enrofloxacin produces a comperhensive and extensive control against a wide range of infectious diseases of respiratory, digestive and urogenital systems.
- Its activity covers the whole Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria including: E.coli, Salmonilla, Staphylococci, Haemophilus, Pasteurella, Streptococcus etc..
- It is also effective against many diseases caused by Mycoplasma and Chlamydia.

Indications
- AVITRYL 5 Injection is recommended for the treatment of most diseases affecting respiratory, digestive and urogenital tracts, caused by Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria as well as mycoplasmas and Chlamydia.

- Calves and Lambs:
AVITRYL-5 Injection solution is indicated for treatment of E. coli diarrhoea, E. coli spesis, Bronchopneumonia (P. haemolytica and Mycoplasma bovis), Salmonella typhimurium and dysentry.

- Cattle and Buffaloes:
Bronchopneumonia (Pasteurella haemolytica, Mycoplasma bovis), haemorrhagic septicaemia, diarrhoea, salmonellosis, urogenital infections, septicaemia, dysentery, skin infection and acute mastitis (E. coli, Staphylococcus aureus and Mycoplasma agalactiae).

- Sheep and Goats:
Clostridiosis, (enterotoxemia, black leg and big head diseases) coli-entritis, colibacillosis, acute mastitis, gangrenous mastitis ( Staphylococcus aureus and Clostridia perfringens ) and infectious aglactia ( Mycoplasma aglactia ).

- Rabbits:
Respiratory disease complex, (pasteurella multocida, Bordtella bronchoseptica and stphylococcus), coryza, enzootic pneumonia, snuffles, Enteric complex (E. coli and clostridia spp.)

- Pet Animals ( Dog and Cat):
Enteritis ( Salmonella, klebsiella, Campylobacter and E. coli), bacterial dermatitis ( Staphylococci, Proteus and Pseudomonas aeruginosa ), bronchopneumonia, bacterial otitis and urogenital infections.

- Poultry:
CRD, CCRD, colibacillosis, salmonellosis, fowl cholera, dermatitis, arthritis and necrotic entritis.

Dosage and administration
- By intramuscularly and subcutaneously injection.

- Cattle, Buffaloes, Sheep and Goats: 1 ml per 20 kg b. wt., for 3 days. (Equivalent to 2.5 mg/ kg b.wt.)

- Rabbits, Dog and Cat: 0.1 ml per 1 kg b. wt., 3 days. (Equivalent to 5 mg/ kg b. wt.)

- Poultry: 0.1 ml per 1 kg b. wt., for 3 days. (Equivalent to 10 mg/ kg b. wt.)

- In severe cases as well as in cases of pasteurella and Salmonella, treatment can be extended for 5 days.
	
Withdrawal period
- Meat: 14 days.
- Milk: 7 days.

Storage:
Store in a dark place at a temperature below 30°C.

Packing:
20, 50 & 100 ml Amber glass bottles.
name: Avitryl 5%

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Enrofloxacin 100 mg
- Doxycycline 200 mg

Properties
- The active ingredients of Enrodox (Enrofloxacin & Doxycycline) have a broad spectrum of activity against wide range of gram negative bacteria including (Pasteurella, salmonellosis, E. coli, and Brucella) as well as gram positive bacteria and Mycoplasma.
- Enrofloxacin kills bacteria through inhibition of DNA gyrase enzyme while doxycycline inhibit bacterial growth via inhibition of protein synthesis.

Indications
- Cattle, Camels & Sheep: Enrodox is recommended for the treatment of the Bronchopneumonia (Pasteurella haemolytica, Mycoplasma bovis), haemorrhagic septicaemia, diarrhoea, salmonellosis, septicaemia, dysentery, skin infection and acute mastitis (E. Coli, Staphylococcus aureus and Mycoplasma agalactiae) as well as Urogenital infections caused by microorganisms sensitive to Enrofloxacin & / or Doxycycline.  

Dosage and administration
- Single dose therapy by intramuscular injection.
- Cattle, Camels & Sheep: 1 ml Enrodox per 10 kg b. wt., (Equivalent to 10 mg/kg b. wt., Enrofloxacin and 20 mg/kg b. wt., Doxycycline).
- In severe cases can be repeated after 3 days.

Withdrawal period
Meat: 28 days.
Milk: Should not be used for animals producing milk for human consumption.

Storage:
Store at a temperature below 30°C.

Packing:  
50 & 100 ml glass bottles.
name: Enrodox

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Tylosin (as Tylosin tartrate ) 100 mg
- Oxytetracycline (as dihydrate) 100 mg

Properties
- Tylox-20 has a broad antibacterial efficacy that includes Gram negative and positive bacteria, protozoas, spirochets, mycoplasmas and chlamydia.
- The active ingredient Oxytetracycline has the efficacy to stop the bacterial growth and multiplication, which could be attributed on its ability to block the synthesis of bacterial protein (in the bacterial cell), it can penetrate tissues and reach into satisfactory therapeutic levels in blood and tissues rapidly after injection, Oxytetracycline binds efficiently with blood proteins.
- Tylosin is another active ingredient that possesses hi efficacy against Mycoplams spp. Isolated from cattle, sheep and goats.
- It has therapeutic action against Spirochaetes including leptospira, erysipelas of turkeys, Haemophilus pertussis, Moraxella bovis, and certain vibrios as well as against gram positive bacteria including staphylococci, Streptococci, corynebacterium and Clostridium spp.

Indications
Tylox-20 is considered a first line treatment against: Metritis, Mastitis, gastro-enteritis, infectious pneumonia and shipping fever, secondary bacterial infections and anaplasmosis and other infectious diseases.

Dosage and administration
- By a single dose deep intramuscular injection.
- Cattle, Sheep, & Goat: Tylox-20 is to be administered at a dose rate of 1 ml / 10 kg body weight.
- In some disease where therapy should be prolonged, administer a second injection 2 days later.

Notes:
Do not administer at the same site more than 20 ml for cattle, and 5 ml for sheep and goat.

Withdrawal period
Meat: 14 days.
Milk: 4 days.

Storage:
Store in a dark place at a temperature below 30°C.

Packing:
20, 50,100 ml Amber color glass injection bottles.
name: Tylox 20

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Tilmicosin 300 mg

Indications
Cattle:
- Treatment of bovine respiratory disease associated with Mannheimia haemolytica and Pasteurella multocida.
- Treatment of interdigital necrobacillosis.

Sheep:
- Treatment of respiratory tract infections caused by Mannheimia haemolytica and Pasteurella multocida.
- Treatment of foot rot in sheep caused by Dichelobacter nodosus and Fusobacterium necrophorum.
- Treatment of acute ovine mastitis caused by Staphylococcus aureus and Mycoplasma agalactiae.

Dosage and administration
- For subcutaneous injection only.
- Cattle & Sheep: 10 mg tilmicosin per kg b. wt., (equivalent to 1 ml AVICOTIL per 30 kg b. wt.).

Withdrawal period
Cattle: Meat: 28 days.
Milk: Do not use in cattle producing milk for human consumption.

Sheep: Meat: 28 days.
Milk: 12 days.

Contraindications:
- Do not administer to sheep weighing less than 15 kg.
- Do not administer intravenously and intramuscularly in cattle and sheep has been fatal.
- Do not administer to equine and goats. Do not administer to lactating dairy cows.
- Do not administer to dairy cows or dairy heifers less than 35 days before calving.

Adverse reactions:
- Occasionally, a soft diffuse swelling may occur at the injection site but this disappears within five to eight days.
- In rare cases recumbency, incoordination and convulsions have been observed.
- Deaths of cattle have been observed following a single intravenous dose of 5 mg/kg body weight, and following the subcutaneous injection of doses of 150 mg/kg b. wt., at 72 hour intervals.
- Sheep have died following a single intravenous injection of 7.5 mg/kg body weight.

Storage:
Store at a temperature below 30°C, keep out of reach and sight of children.

Shelf life:
After first opening: 28 days.

Special Warnings:
Sheep:
- The clinical trials did not demonstrate a bacteriological cure in sheep with acute mastitis caused by Staphylococcus aureus and Mycoplasma agalactiae.
- Do not administer to lambs weighing less than 15 kg since there is a risk of overdose toxicity.
- Accurate weighing of lambs is important to avoid overdose.
- The use of a 2 ml or smaller syringe will facilitate accurate dosing.
name: Avicotil

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Lincomycin (Lincomycin hydrochlorid monohydrate) 50 mg
- Spectinomycin (Spectinomycin sulfate tetrahydrate) 100 mg

Indications
- Avispection Injection is indicated for the treatment of infections in non-ruminating calves, sheep, goats, chickens, turkeys, dogs, cats and pigs caused by organisms sensitive to the action of lincomycin and/or spectinomycin.

- Non-ruminating calves: it is indicated for the treatment of pneumoenteritis of calves.
This includes enteritis and/or pneumonia caused by bacterial organisms.

- Sheep and Goats: it is indicated for the treatment of contagious foot rot caused by Bacteroides nodosus and respiratory infections of sheep and goats.
Respiratory infections include both primary and secondary pneumonic conditions caused by mycoplasmal and bacterial organisms.

- Chickens and Turkeys: it is indicated for the treatment of airsacculitis (chronic respiratory disease or complicated air sac disease), fowl cholera, staphylococcal infection, and Arizona infection in turkey poults.

- Dogs: it is indicated for the treatment of respiratory infections, skin infections, urinary tract infections and secondary bacterial infections associated with virus disease.

- Conditions successfully treated with Avispectin Injection include pneumonia, pharyngitis, tonsillitis, bronchititis, pyogenic dermatitis, pustular dermatitis, abscesses, cystitis, metritis and gastroenteritis.

- Cats: it is indicated for the treatment of urinary tract and upper respiratory tract infections, localized infections and secondary bacterial infections associated with virus disease, infections successfully treated with Avispectin Injection in cat include cystitis, secondary bacterial infections associated with panleukopenia, pneumonitis and rhinotracheitis, upper respiratory tract infections, and infected fight wounds and abscesses.

- Pigs: it is indicated for the treatment of bacterial and mycoplasmal pneumonia, swine dysentery (T. hyodysenteriael), bacterial enteritis and infectious arthritis.
 
Dosage and administration
- As with any multi-dose vial, practice aseptic techniques in withdrawing each dose.
- Adequately clean and disinfect the vial closure prior to entry with a sterile needle and syringe.

- Non-ruminating Calves: 15 mg per kg (1 ml/10 kg) of b. wt., intramuscularly, twice daily the first day followed by once daily for 2-4 days.

- Sheep and Goats: 15 mg per kg (1 ml/10 kg) of b. wt., intramuscularly once daily for 3 days.

- Chickens and Turkeys: 30 mg per kg (0.1 ml/0.5 kg) of b. wt., subcutaneously once daily for 3 consecutive days.

- Dogs and Cats: 30 mg per kg (1 ml/5 kg) of b. wt., intramuscularly.
May be repeated at 12 or 24 hour intervals for up to 21 days.

- Pigs: 15 mg per kg (1 ml/10 kg) of b. wt., intramuscularly.
May be repeated at 24 hour intervals for 3-7 days as needed

Withdrawal period
Meat: 14 days.
Milk: 48 hours.

Cautions:
- Under veterinary prescription only.
- As with all drugs, the administration of Avispectin Injection is contraindicated in animals previously found to be hypersensitive to either antibiotic or to the combination.
- Use in species other than those indicated may result in adverse gastrointestinal effects.
- An occasional report of pain on injection has been received, however, serious inflammatory reactions following injection have not been reported.
- At levels higher than those recommended, the intramuscular administration to swine may cause a transient diarrhea or loose stools.
- Although this effect rarely has been reported at the therapeutic dose level, one must be alert to the possibility that it may occur.
- Occasional reports of transient diarrhea following use of Avispectin Injection have been reported in sheep, goats and swine.
- Loss of appetite and decreased milk production have been observed in goats.
- On rare occasions abortion and/or death have been reported in sheep treated during the last one-thrid of pregnancy.

Storage:
Store at a temperature below 30°C.

Packing:
20 ml, 50 ml, 100 ml & 250 ml transparence glass bottles.
name: Avispectin

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
Oxytetracycline (as dihydrate) 300 mg

Properties
- Oxytetracycline is a bacteriostatic antibiotic that inhibits protein synthesis in susceptible bacteria.
- Inside the cell it binds irreversibly to receptors on the 30S subunit of the bacterial ribosome where it interferes with the binding of the aminoactyl-transfer RNA to the acceptor site on the messenger RNA ribosome complex.
- This effectively prevents the addition of the amino acids to the elongating peptide chain, inhibiting protein synthesis.
- Avicycline 30% is specifically formulated to provide a prolonged action, resulting in sustained antibacterial activity.
- Following intramuscular administration, effective blood levels persist for 3-4 days at a dose rate of 20 mg/kg and for 5-6 days at a dose rate of 30 mg/kg Maximum blood levels are achieved between 4-6 hours following administration.

Indications
- Avicycline 30% For the treatment of conditions caused by or associated with organisms sensitive to oxytetracycline including: Bordetella bronchiseptica, Actinomyces pyogenes, Erysipelothrix rhusiopathiae, Pasteurella spp, Staphylococcus spp, Streptococcus spp. Certain mycoplasma, rickettsiae, protozoa and chlamydia are also sensitive to oxytetracycline.
- Avicycline 30% is indicated for the treatment and control of pasteurellosis, pneumonia, atrophic rhinitis, erysipelas, joint-ill, navel-ill, summer mastitis in cows, ovine keratoconjunctivitis (pink-eye) and enzootic abortion in sheep.

Dosage and administration
- By deep intramuscular injection.
- Avicycline 30% injection can be administered at the standard dose of 20 mg/kg to obtain 3 to 4 days duration of activity or at a high dose of 30 mg/kg for prolonged duration of activity (i.e. activity maintained for 5 to 6 days).

Cattle and Sheep:
- Standard dose: 20 mg/kg b. wt. (1 ml/15 kg b. wt.).
- High dose: 30 mg/kg b. wt. (1ml/10 kg b. wt.).

- Maximum recommended dosage at one site:
Cattle: 15 ml & Sheep: 5 ml

- This product does not contain an antimicrobial preservative.
- Swab the septum before removing each dose.
- Use a sterile needle and syringe.

Withdrawal period
Meat:
20 mg/kg dose:
- Cattle: 28 days.
- Sheep: 28 days.

30 mg/kg dose:
- Cattle: 35 days.
- Sheep: 28 days.

Milk:
- Cattle: 10 days
- Sheep: 8 days.

Storage:
Store at a temperature below 30°C.

Packing:
10 ml, 20 ml, 50 ml and 100 ml Amber color glass injection bottles.
name: Avicycline 30%

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Gentamycin (as Gentamycin Sulfate) 100 mg (a.i.)

Properties
GENTAVIC contains Gentamycin which is an aminoglycoside antibiotic which has a bactericidal effect against many gram-negative and some gram-positive bacteria, such as: E. coli, Salmonella spp., Shigella spp., Enterobacter aerogenes, Klebsiella spp., Proteus spp., Serratia spp., Pasteurella multocida, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Staphylococcus aureus, Campylobacter coli, and othersIndications

Indications
- GENTAVIC is used for the treatment of infections induced by gentamycin-susceptible organisms which includes: Skin and soft tissue infections Coliform mastitis in cattle.
- Bacterial gastroenteritis in cats and dogs. Respiratory tract infections.
- Genitourinary tract infections, Colibacillosis in newborn animals and Septicemia (caused by E. coli, Salmonella) especially in foals and cattle.
- Arthritis and polyarthritis.

Dosage and administration
- To be given by slow intravenous or deep intramuscular injection, and do not administer for more than 7 consecutive days.

Horses and Foals:
- By intramuscular or intravenous injection, 1 ml per 15 kg b. wt., (Equivalent to 6.6 mg/kg b. wt.)

- Ruminants (Cattle, Calves, Sheep, Goats):
By intramuscular injection, 1 ml per 15-23 kg b. wt., twice daily. (Equivalent to 4.4-6.6 mg/kg b. wt.)

- Dog and Cat:
By subcutaneous or intramuscular injection 5 mg/kg body weight twice daily for 24 hours then once daily.

Contraindications:
- Severe renal impairment and pregnancy.
- Concomitant administration of other aminoglycoside antibiotics, general anesthetics, or muscle relaxants.

Side Effects:
- If administered to animals suffering from renal failure, high blood concentrations may occur.
- In these cases, administer half dose or less in order to prevent alterations that may emerge as an outcome of gentamycin toxicity against the eighth cranial pair (deafness, loss of equilibrium).

Withdrawal period
Meat: 60 days.
Milk: 3 days.

Storage:
Store in a dark place at a temperature below 30ºC.

Packing:
20 ml, 50 ml, 100 ml amber glass bottles.
name: Gentavic

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Sulphadimidine 21.3 mg
- Sulphaguanidine 21.3 mg
- Sulphadiazine 28.4 mg
- Streptomycin (as Sulphate) 7.6 mg
- Neomycin Sulphate 1.8 mg
- Hyoscine (as hydrobromide) 0.02 mg
- Sodium Chloride 1 1.33 mg
- Calcium gluconate 2.2 mg
- Magnesium Sulphate 0.6 mg
- Potassium Chloride 3.6 mg
- Kaolin 103.3 mg
- Pectin 7.1 mg
- Glycine 20.9 mg

Properties
- DIABAN PLUS SUSPENSION is a comprehensive drug composed of gut active antibiotics, streptomycin and neomycin, systemic sulphonamides as sulfadimidine and sulfadiazine in addition to, electrolytes (sodium, potassium, magnesium and calcium), antispasmodic (Hyoscine), adsorbent, astringent, coating agents and Glycine.
- The active ingredients of DIABAN PLUS SUSPENSION are the most active systemic sulphonamides and most effective gut active antibiotic (streptomycin and neomycin).
- They are mainly active against Gram positive bacteria, some Gram negative organisms, a few Rickettsia, and some Protozoa.
- They are active against Streptococci, Staphylococci, E. coli, Salmonella, and Pasteurella and have some actions against Pseudomonas, Proteus and Clostridial species.

Indications
- DIABAN PLUS SUSPENSION is treatment for gastroenteritis and scour/pneumonia complex by sensitive bacterial organisms, and it is for restoring electrolyte loss, reducing intestinal motility and elimination of bacterial toxins.
- DIABAN PLUS SUSPENSION is used to treat sudden diarrhea. It works by treating different cause that induce diarrhea in calve, lambs, foal as well as dogs and cats.
- Two systemic sulphonamides (Sulphadimidine and Sulphadiazine) that control systemic infections caused by sensitive microorganisms, Two gut active antibiotics that control enteric infections caused by Gram positive bacteria, some Gram negative organisms, a few Rickettsia, and some Protozoa.
- They are active against Streptococci, Staphylococci, E. coli, Salmonella, and Pasteurella and have some actions against Pseudomonas, Proteus and Clostridial species.
- So DIABAN PLUS SUSPENSION treats not only the different cause of the diarrhea (e.g., infection), but also treat the various symptoms associated with diarrhea.

Mode of action:
- Sulphonamide antibiotics exert antibacterial effect Electrolytes and glycine assist restoration of fluid balance. Hyoscine hydrobromide acts as an antispasmodic.
- Kaolin and pectin absorb bacterial toxins and provide protective coating in inflamed mucosa.

Dosage and administration
- by oral route
- First dose: 2 ml per 1 kg bodyweight.
- Following Doses: 1 ml per 1 kg bodyweight night and morning for 3-5 days or for 24 hours after symptoms disappear.

- Note: Each plunger depression delivers 2 ml.
- When treating of salmonellosis and bacterial pneumonias continue for minimum of 5 days.
- Any variation by the prescribing veterinarian to the allowed dose, frequency, duration, route, disease or target species may require extending the approved with holding period.

Direct for Use:
- Not to be given to animals with known sulfonamide sensitivity, liver damage or blood dyscrasias.
- Shake pack thoroughly before use.
- Attach plastic delivery tube to pump and turn dosing nozzle anti-clockwise, as indicated by arrow, to unlock plunger.
- Depress plunger to deliver suspension.
- This pump pack has been specifically designed for use in, lambs, kids and other small animals.

Withdrawal period
Meat: 14 days.
Milk: DIABAN PLUS SUSPENSION should not be used in lactating cattle.

Storage:
Store at a temperature below 30°C.

Packing:
225 ml plastic bottles.
name: Diaban plus

description:
Composition:
Each 1gm contains:
- Benzyl benzoate 50 mg
- Salicylic acid 20 mg
- Sulphur sublimate 100 mg
- Tar 10 mg
- Phenol 15 mg

Properties
- Mangezal produce a comprehensive medication against most types of mange e.g. Sarcoptic, psoroptic and chorioptic in camels, horses, sheep, goats, cattle and other animals.
- Benzyl benzoat is effective against most external parasites in domestic animals, salicylic acid is non toxic and septic and has a keratolytic activity.
- Sulphur sublimate can be extensively used as an antimange dressing.
- Phenol aids to slough dead tissues without forming pus.

Indications
Mangezal is indicated for the treatment of different types of mange and ring worm of skin as well as other fungal infections affecting skin of farm animals.

Dosage and administration
- For swollen or bruised udders and cracked teats: bathe the affected area with a solution of Epsom salt in warm water and dry thoroughly.
- Apply the ointment and rub gently.
- Repeat the treatment as often as needed.

Contraindications:
- For external use only.
- Avoid contact with mucous membranes.

Storage:
Store in a dark place at a temperature below 30°C.

Package:
200 gm Plastic jars.
name: Mangezal

description:
Composition:
Each 1 gm contains:
- Gentiana 150 mg
- Nux vomica 20 mg
- Sodium carbonate 400 mg
- Vitamin A 2000 mg
- Vitamin D3 500 I.U.
- Vitamin E 400 I.U.
- Vitamin B2 400 mcg
- Vitamin B1 200 mcg
- Calcium -d- Pantothenate 500 mcg
- Nicotinamide 1mcg
- Folic acid 50 mg
- Iron 40 mcg
- Manganese 20 mg
- Copper 100 mcg
- Zinc 25 mcg
- Cobalt 20 mcg

Properties
- The preparation TONOVIT M contains a number of vitamins which are essential for the maintenance of good performance and the strengthening of the resistance against bacterial and viral diseases in livestock and household animals.
- The presence of electrolytes helps in reversing or preventing haemoconcentration and dehydration.
- It, also improves rearing results and increases feed efficiency.
- Nux Vomica and Gentiana are used as an antiacid and stimulating drenchs.

Indications
- TONOVIT M is indicated as general tonic, appetizer, haematinic and ruminal tonic for all animals and mainly recommended for prevention and treatment of anaemia, emaciation as well as vitamins and mineral deficiencies associated with bacterial, viral, fungal and parasitic infections, as cases of piroplasmosis and shiping fever.
- It is also used as growth prometer and for improvement of milk yield and fertility.
- TONOVIT M is also used as a tonic, appetizer, haematinic and rumen stimulant for all animals.
- It is also recommended for prevention and treatment of anemia and emaciation, as well as, in cases of piroplasmosis, shipping fever, constipation, acidosis and tympany.
- TONOVIT M acts also as a growth promoter and increases meat and milk production.

Dosage and administration
- Large animals: (Cattle, Horses, Camels): 2 table spoonful, with feed or 100 ml of drinking water, twice daily.
- Small animals: (Calves, Sheep, Goats): 2 tea spoonful, with feed or 100 ml of drinking water, twice daily.

Storage: 
Store in a dark place at a temperature below 30°C.

Package:
100 & 200 gm aluminum foil.
name: Tonovit

description:
Anthelmintic (Imidazothiazole)

Composition:
Each 1 gm contains:
- Tetramisole HCL 300 mg

Properties
- Tetramisole is a highly acceptable antinematodal drug due to its broad range of activity in a large number of hosts (Sheep, Cattle, Horse and Poultry).
- Through its paralysing action on the parasite and inhibition of the activity of fumarate and succinate dehydrogenase enzyme which is of vital importance of the worms.
- Tetramisole has the ability to kill many parasitic nematodes (adult and immature stage) which infest different animals.

Indications
- Cattle, Buffaloes, Sheep & Goats:
Tetramisole is effectively used for treatment of parasitic stages affect abomasum, intestines & lungs including Haemonchus, Ostertagia, Cooperia, Trichostrongylus, bunostomum, Oesophagostomum and Dictyocaulus and Ascaridiasis.

- Poultry:
Tetramisole is indicated for treatment of Ascaridia galli, Heterakis gallinarum capillaria obsignata affect intestine as well as lung worms known as syngamus trachea.

Dosage and administration
- Buffaloes, Cattle, Sheep & Goats: 1 gm TETRAMISOLE per 20 kg b. wt., in drinking water as a single dose (eq to 15 mg tetramisole /1 kg b. wt.).

- Poultry: 1-2 gm TETRAMISOLE per 6 kg living weight (50-100 mg tetramisole /1 kg b. wt.) via drinking water as a single dose.

Withdrawal period
Meat: 7 days.
Milk: 48 hours.
Eggs: 7 days.

Contraindications and warning:
- Tetramisole preparation is not a harmless drug.
- Sensitivity of animal species to it increases in the following order: Sheep-Poultry-Cattle-Horse.
- The animals being in poor health condition are more sensitive to the preparation.
- Tetramisole should be, individually, administered to horses and cattle.

Overdosage:
Overdosage in cattle and sheep gives rise to transient signs of head shaking, salivation and licking of the lips.

Storage:
Store in a dark place at a temperature below 30°C.

Package:
100, 500 gm & 1 kg aluminum foil.
name: Tetramisole forte

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Triclabendazole 50 mg
- Ivermectin 1 mg

Properties
- TRIMECTIN SHEEP is an effective combination of both Triclabendazole and Ivermectin to be applied in sheep, making a comprehensive wormer and flukicide that covers wide spectrum of gastric, intestinal, and lungworms.
- It is also effective against different stages of all liver fluke species, as well as nasal bots.

Indications
TRIMECTIN SHEEP activity covers, Stomach worms (Haemonchus, Ostertagia spp. and T. axei), gut worms (Trichostrongylus. Cooperia, Nematodirus, Bunostomum, Gaigeria, Chabertia, and Oesophaostomum spp.), immature and mature stages of lung worms, (Dictyocaulus spp.), and that of all liver fluke stages (both F. hepatica and F. gigantica). And Nasal bot fly (Oestrus ovis).

Dosage and administration
» Sheep: 10 ml of TRIMECTIN SHEEP per 50 kg b. wt., via oral drenching (eq to 10 mg triclabendazole/kg b. wt., and 0.2 mg Ivermectin/kg b. wt.)

Withdrawal period
- Meat: 28 days.
- Milk: Should not be used in sheep producing milk for human consumption.

Precautions:
Shake well before use.

Storage:
Store in a dark place at a temperature below 30ºC.

Packing:
500 ml and 1 Litre plastic bottles.
name: Trimectin sheep

description:
Composition:
- L-Carnitine Hydrochloride   613.3 mg
- Thioctic acid    20.0 mg
- Pyridoxine hydrochloride   15.0 mg
- Cyanocobalamin   3.0 mg
- DL-acetylmethionine    2,000.0 mg
- L-arginine   24.0 mg
- L-Ornithine Hydrochloride    153.2 mg
- L-Citrulline   120.0 mg
- L-Lysine Hydrochloride    62.5 mg
- Glycine   150.0 mg
- Aspartic acid   150.0 mg
- Glutamic acid   150.0 mg
- Fructose   5,000.0 mg
- Sorbitol   8,000.0 mg
- Excipients q.s   100.0 ml

Indications
Indicated as Hepatoprotective with restorative properties, toxins scavenger, in situations of physical stress and convalescence.

Dosage and administration
- Cattle, horses and adult pigs: 250-500 ml, intravenous, subcutaneous or intraperitoneal route twice a day.
- Calves, foals, sheep, goats: 250 ml intravenous, subcutaneous or intraperitoneal route twice a day.
- Piglets: 20-40 ml / 10 kg of body weight, subcutaneous route twice a day.
- Lambs and kids: 20-40 ml / 10 kg of body weight, intravenous, subcutaneous or intraperitoneal route twice a day.
- Rabbits and cats: 2-4 ml / kg per day by subcutaneous route twice per day, subdivided into two or more injection sites.
- Canines: 2-4 ml / kg intravenous or subcutaneous route twice a day.
name: Metabolase

description:

Each ml contains:
- Vit A  15,000 IU

- Vit B  110 mg

INDICATIONS:
