description:
Composition
Each 1 ml contains:
- Spectinomycin dihydrochloride 150mg (eq. to 100mg spectinomycin base)

Indications
Chickens turkeys: CRD and air saccuilits (mycoplasma and/ or E. coli), fowl cholera (past. multocida), infectious coryza (haemophilus gallinarum).

Dosage
- Chickens and turkeys, by S/C or I/M
- for active ingredient, 10-20 mg spectinomycin base/kg b.wt.
- for whole product, 1-2 ml Spectal Super/10kg b.wt. once daily for 2 days.

Chickens and turkeys: 10 days.

Pack

name: Spectal Super

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Ivermectin  10 mg
- Clorsulon  100 mg

Properties:
Drumectin Plus, is a combination of Ivermectin (an anthelmintic-ectoparasiticide) & Clorsulon (antifascioliasis) which have a high efficacy in the treatment & control of internal and external parasites of cattle, sheep & goats.

Indications:
- Gastrointestinal round worms (adult and fourth-stage larvae): Haemonchus placei, H. contortus, Ostertagia ostertagi, O. lyrata, trichostongylus axei, T. colubriformis
- Lung worms (adult and fourth-stage larvae): Dictyocaulus viviparous.
- Liver fluke (adult only): Fasciola hepatica.
- Grubs (parasitic stages): Hypoderma bovis, H. lineatum.
- Lice: Linognathus vituli, Haematopinus eurysternus.
- Mites: Psoroptes bovis, Sarcoptes scabiei var rbovis.

Dosage & Administration:
- Drumectin plus , is administered by subcutaneous injection only, an acceptable injection site is the loose skin behind the shoulder.
- Used in the treatment of liver flukes in cattle (adult only).
- Cattle: 1 ml / 50 kg.b.wt. given once by S/C injection only.
- Sheep & Goats: 0.5 ml / 25 kg.b.wt. given once by S/C injection only.

Precautions and Warnings:
- Not used in cattle producing milk for human consumption.
- Not used for pregnant animals.
- For subcutaneous use only, not for intravenous or intramuscular use.
- Shouid not be used in combination with monamine oxidase inhibitor so as to prevent additive sedative effect & adverse neurological effect.
- Not used in immature liver flukes (fasciola hepatica, f. gigantic).

Withdrawal time:
Meat: 35 days

Storage:
Keep at temp. not exceeding 30°C away from direct light.

Package:
Glass vials of 50-100ml

MADE IN EGYPT
MANUFACTURED BY ARABCOMED FOR DRUGEST PHARMACEUTICALS COMPANY
name: Drumectin plus

description:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Phenylbutazone  18 gm
- Dexamethasone  0.035 gm

Properties:
1- Phenylbutazone is a powerful non – steroidal anti- inflammatory, analgesic& anti- pyretic acts mainly in the early stages of inflammatory reactions.
2- Dexamthasone is a synthetic corticosteroid having anti- inflammatory & anti- allergic characters produces it's acticity in the late stage of the inflammatory reactions .

Indication:
- In cattle, calves, horses & foals in the Following:
- For the alleviation of inflammation and pain associated with musculoskeletal disorders.
- For the alleviation of visceral pain associated with colic.
- With antibiotics for treatment many inflammatory disorders as pneumonia, mastitis, metritis.

Dosage and administration :
- For Cattle, Horses & Dogs: By deep I/M or slow I/V injection.
- For adult: 20 ml at 1st day, then 10 ml for up to 4 days.
- For calves-foals: 6-10 ml at the 1st day, the dose could be repeated according to the case every other day.

Warning & Precautions:
- not used for lactating animals.
- Do not use the drug in cardiac, hepatic and renal insufficiency or in advanced Gestation.
- Gastritis and haemoglubinuria may occur in long term treatment.

Withdrawal Time :
- Meat : 21 days .

Storage:
Keep at temperature Between 10-25 ºC away from direct sunlight.

MADE IN EGYPT
MANUFACTURED BY ARABCOMED FOR DRUGEST PHARMACEUTICALS COMPANY
name: Dexa-Phen

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Ivermectin 0.67 gm
- Clorsulon 6.7 gm
- Nitroxynil (as eglunmine) 34 gm

Properties:
➡️ Ivermectin is an avermectin and a fermentation product of Streptomyces avermitilis. It's active against all stages of every major parasitic nematode. It is also a potent ectoparasiticide. Compounds of the class bind selectively and with high affinity to glutamate-gated chloride ion channels which occur in invertebrate nerve and muscle cells. This leads to an increase in the permeability of the cell membrane to chloride ions with hyperpolarization of the nerve or muscle cell, resulting in paralysis and death of the parasite. Compounds of this class may also interact with other ligand-gated chloride channels, such as those gated by the neurotransmitter gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA)

➡️ Clorsulon is antiparasitic, approved for use in the treatment of immature and adult forms of Fasciola hepatica (Liver fluke) in cattle. Clorsulon inhibits the glycolytic enzymes 3-phosphoglycerate kinase and phosphoglyceromutase, thereby blocking the Emden-Myerhof glycolytic pathway: The fluke is deprived of its main metabolic energy source and dies.

➡️ Nitroxynil is a member of Substituted Phenols chemical group and is a fasciolicide which is only active by injection. It's active against adult fluke, with some activity against fly larvae (e.g. Cestrusovis) and blood sucking nematodes The mechanism of action is thought to be due to uncoupling of oxidative phosphorylation.

Target species: Cattle

Indications:
Adult and Immature stages of:
- Small brown stomach worm ( including third and fourth stage lanvae and inhibited immatures) caused by Ostertagia ostertagia
- Barber's pole worm caused by Haemonchus placei
- Stomach hair worm (including third and fourth stage inhibited larvae) caused by Trichostrongylus axei
- Small intestinal worm (including third and fourth stage inhibited larvae) caused by Cooperia spp
- Hookworm (including third and fourth stage inhibited larvae) caused by Bunostomum phlebotomum
- Nodule worm (including third and fourth stage inhibited larvae) caused by Oesophagostomum radiatum

Adult stages of:
- Whipworm caused by Trichuris spp
- Thin necked intestinal worm caused by Nematodirus spp
- Intestinal worm caused by Strongyloides papillosus

Other internal parasites:
- Liver Fluke(early immature (including 2-week old), immat u caused by Fasciola hepatica
- Lungworm (adult and immature including inhibited stages) DIctyocaulus viviparous
- Eyeworm (aduit) caused by Thelazia spp

External parasites:
- Sucking Lice caused by Linognathus vituli, Haematopinus eurysternus, Solenopotes capillatus
- Cattle tick caused by Boophilus microplus

Aids in the control of:
- Mites: Sarcoptes scabiei var bovis
- Biting lice: Bovicola (Damalinia) bovis

Dosage and Administation:
- Route: by Subcutaneous injection
- For whole product: 1.5 ml / 50 kg body weight

Warnings and precautionss:
• If product leaks from the injection site, Staining of the coat of light coloured cattle may occur for a period of several weeks. Exercise care where staining may be a disadvantage (e.g. show cattle).
• Mectico is applied under the skin, preferably high on the neck behind the ear, using standard injection equipment
- Use the shortest needles possible (certainly not exceeding 15mm) and keep them sharp and clean.
- Do not re-treat cattle for 120 days after the last treatment.

Contraindications:
- Do not use less than 120 days before slaughter for export. (Calves born to cows that during pregnancy must not be slaughtered for export for 120 days after the treatment of the dam.) have been treated with Mectico.
- Do not give IM or IV.

Side effects:
Cattle may experience discomfort or transient swelling at the injection site.

Withdrawal time:
- Meat: 56 days (Calves born to cows that have been treated with Mectico during pregnancy must not be slaughtered for human consumption for 56 days after treatment of the danm.).
- Milk: Do not use in cattle which are producing milk or may in the future produce milk where the milk or milk products may be used tor human consumption.

Storage conditions:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C and used after opening for up to 30 days at temperature not exceeding 30° C.

Packaging:
Carton box containing colorless glass type ll vial containing 10,15,20,30,50,100 or 500 ml solution with red chlorobutyl rubber stopper capped with Aluminium flip-off cap with outer label inner leaflet.
name: Mectico

description:
COMPOSITION:
Each 1 ml contains
- Florfenicol 300 mg
- Flunixin (meglumine) 16.5 mg

PROPERTIES:
- Florfenicol is a synthetic, broad spectrum antibiotic active against many gram-positive bacteria isolated from domestic animals.
- Florfenicoi acts by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis at the ribosomal level.
- Flunixin is a potent, non-narcotic, non-steroidal, analgesic agent with anti-pyretic activity.

INDICATION:
Treatment of respiratory diseases caused by Mannheinia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida and Histophilus somni associated with pyrexia.

TARGET SPECIES: Cattle

DOSAGE & ADMINISTRATION:
- By subcutaneous injection only.
- Adult cattle: whole product: 2 ml / 15 kg body weight (once).

SIDE EFFECTS:
Mild, transient inappetence, decrease water consumption or diarrhea may occur in cattle following treatment. these symptoms should return to normal shortly after treatment.

CONTRAINDICATIONS:
- Do not use in calves to be processed for veal.
- Do not exceed 10 ml at any one injection site as greater than 10 ml may result in injection site residues that exceed approved limit at the withholding period.
- Do not re-treat animals for 3 months after the last treatment.
- This product is intended for use only in non-breeding beef cattle, including feedlot cattle and grass-fed steers and heifers.

WARNING & PRECAUTIONS:
- The content of the vial should be used within 30 days after opening of bottle and discard any unused portion.
- Keep out of reach of children.

WITHDRAWAL TIME:
- Cattle Meat: 49 days
- Do not use in cattle producing or may produce milk or milk products for human consumption.

STORAGE:
- Before Opening: Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.
- After Opening: Used within 30 days when stored at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

PACKS:
Amber (type II) glass vial filled with 100 & 250 ml Injectable solution with red chlorobutyl rubber stopper capped with aluminum flip off cap with outer label an insert leaflet inside carton box.

Manufactured by:
EVA Pharma For Pharmaceuticals and medical appliances (EVA Pharma)
name: Picoflun

description:

description:
COMPOSITION
Each ml contains:
- Benzylpenicillin Procaine  300 mg
- Methyl Parahydroxybenzoate  1 mg

Indications for use, specifying the target species
- For the treatment of infections caused by bacteria sensitive to penicillins in cattle, sheep and pigs.

Contraindications
- Do not administer to animals known to be sensitive to penicillin.
- Do not use when it is known that penicillinase-producing staphylococcus organisms are present.

Special warnings
- Occasionally in sucking and fattening pigs administration of products containing procaine penicillin may cause a transient pyrexia, vomiting, shivering, listlessness and incordination
- Procaine penicillin G can, under certain circumstances, be toxic and even lethal to pigs and this is thought to be due to a sudden release of toxic amounts of free procaine. The symptoms include shivering, lassitude, inappetence, vomiting, cyanosis of the extemities and pronounced pyrexia (40°C and over). A vulval discharge may appear and some animals may abort. Alarming side-effects are most likely to occur when pigs with erysipelas are injected with an older and, or, heat-affected procaine penicillin formulation. Treatment with 5 mg dexamethasone will result in rapid recovery.

Pregnancy and lactation
- Procaine penicillin is safe for use in pregnant animals.
- Not for use in lactating ewes producing milk for human consumption or milk products.

Dose & Administration
- For Cattle, Pigs and Sheep
- For intramuscular administration only
- The recommended dose is 8 ml per 100 kg bodyweight i.e. 24 mg per kg bodyweight.
- The dose should be given once daily for up to 3 consecutive days

The maximum volume at one site:
- Cattle: 20ml
- Sheep: 5ml
- Pigs: 10ml
 
Withdrawal period
Meat and Offal
- Cattle: 7 days
- Sheep: 7 days
- Pigs: 7 days

Milk
- Cattle: 72 hours
- Sheep: Not for use in lactating ewes producing milk for human consumption.

Shelf-life
- as packaged for sale: 2 years
- after first opening: 28 days.

Storage
- Do not store above 25°C, Do not freeze.
name: Unicillin

description:
PRESENTATION:
A sterile aqueous solution containing Oxytetracycline Dihydrate Ph.Eur. equivalent to 300 mg/ml of oxytetracycline base.

USES:
» Alamycin LA 300 is a broad spectrum antibiotic indicated for use in the treatment of conditions caused by, or associated with, organisms sensitive to oxytetracycline in cattle, sheep and pigs. A wide range of Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. including Bordetella bronchiseptica, Actinomyces Pyogenes, Erysipelothrix rhusiopathiae, Pasteurella spp., Staphylococcus spp, and Streptococcus spp., are sensitive to oxytetracycline. Certain mycoplasma, rickettsiae, protozoa and chlamydia are also sensitive to oxytetracycline.
» Alamycin LA 300 may be used in the treatment and control of a wide range of common systemic, respiratory, urinary and local infections caused by oxytetracycline sensitive organisms. Specific indications for Alamycin LA 300 would therefore include: pasteurellosis, pneumonia, atrophic rhinitis, erysipelas, joint ill/navel ill, summer mastitis in cows, ovine keratoconjunctivitis (pink eye) and the control of enzootic abortion in sheep.
» Alamycin LA 300 is specifically formulated to provide a prolonged action, resulting in sustained antibacterial activity. Following intramuscular administration effective blood levels persist for 3-4 days at a dose rate of 20 mg/kg and for 5 - 6 days at a dose rate of 30 mg/kg. Maximum blood levels are achieved between 4-6 hours following administration making Alamycin LA 300 suitable for the treatment of acute infections.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION:
Administer by deep intramuscular injection to cattle, sheep and pigs for the treatment and control of conditions caused by organisms sensitive to the action of oxytetracycline. Alamycin LA 300 can be administered at the standard dose of 20 mg / kg in order to obtain 3 - 4 days duration of activity or at the high dose of 30 mg/kg for prolonged duration of activity (i.e., activity maintained for 5 to 6 days).

Cattle, Sheep and Pigs:
- Standard Dose: 20 mg / kg (1 ml / 15 kg)
- High Dose: 30 mg / kg (1 ml / 10 kg)

Max. recommended dosage per site:
- Cattle: 15 ml
- Pigs: 10 ml
- Sheep: 5 ml
- Piglets 1 day: 0.2 ml
- Piglets 7 day: 0.3 ml
- Piglets 14 day: 0.4 ml
- Piglets 21 day: 0.5 ml
- Piglets >21 day: 1 ml / 10 kg

CONTRA-INDICATIONS, WARNINGS, ETC.:
I) Withholding Times:
» Meat: Animals must not be slaughtered for human consumption during treatment.

- 20 mg/kg dose:
• Cattle and sheep may be slaughtered for human consumption only after 28 days from the last treatment.
• Pigs may be slaughtered for human consumption only after 14 days from the last treatment.

- 30 mg/kg dose:
• Cattle may be slaughtered for human consumption only after 35 days from the last treatment.
• Pigs and sheep may be slaughtered for human consumption only after 28 days from the last treatment.

» Milk:
• Milk for human consumption must not be taken during treatment.
• Milk for human consumption may be taken from cows only after 7 days from the last treatment.
• Milk for human consumption may be taken from ewes only after 8 days from
the last treatment.

II) Warnings:
• Do not dilute Alamycin LA 300.
• Although Alamycin LA 300 is well tolerated, occasionally a slight local reaction of a transient nature may be observed.
• The use of tetracyclines during the period of tooth and bone development, including late pregnancy, may lead to discolouration.
• Oxytetracycline therapy does not completely eliminate chlamydial infection in a flock.
• If concurrent treatment is administered use a separate injection site.

PHARMACEUTICAL PRECAUTIONS:
- Shelf life is 2 years
- Do not store above 30°C.
- After first dose do not store above 30°C
- Discard the vial within 14 days.
- Wash hands after use. In case of contact with eyes or skin wash with water as irritation may occur.
- Avoid accidental self-injection.
- Keep out of the reach of children

PACKAGE QUANTITIES:
Multi-dose vials of 100 ml

FURTHER INFORMATION:
If stored as directed Alamycin LA 300 can be expected to retain its potency for 2 years from the manufacturing date. When the vial has been broached and the contents exposed to air, the solution may darken but the potency will be unchanged.

MANUFACTURED BY:
Norbrook Laboratories Limited,
Newry, Co. Down,
Northern Ireland,
BT35 6JP

MOH Reg. No.: 1959/2015

IMPORTED BY AL SAFA VET

FOR ANIMAL TREATMENT ONLY
name: Alamycin LA 300

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Trimethoprim 80 mg
- Sulphadiazine Sodium 400 mg

Properties
- The action of the combination proved to be bactericidal, whereas the components separately were only bacteriostatic in action.
- Sulphonamides act as an analogue for para-aminobenzoic acid, (PABA) which itself a part of the vitamin, folic acid.
- In organisms that synthesis their own folic acid, sulphonamides as sulphadiazine acts by blocking the synthesis of folic acid.
- Sulphonamides are active against bacteria but not against higher organisms as bacteria synthetic their own folic acid whereas higher animals or higher organisms obtained folic acid from the diet.

Indications
- Treatment of infections caused by microorganisms, susceptible to trimethoprim and/or Sulphadiazine affecting the respratory urogenital and gastro-intestinal tract.
- Against a wide range of Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria such as E. coli, Salmonella, Klebsiella, Brucella, Corynebacterium pyogens, Pasteurella, Staphylococcus, Streplococcus, Enterobacter and Haemophilus.

Dosage and administration
- Claves & lambs: 1 ml / 15 kg by oral route for 5 days.
- Poultry: 1-2 ml / 5 liters of drinking water for 5 days.

Withdrawal period
Stop drug administration 3 days before slaughter.

Storage:
Store in a dark place at a temperature below 30ºC.

Pack
100 ml, 1 L Containers
name: Coliprim

description:
Ultravac® BEF Vaccine
Each 2 mL dose contains
- Bovine Ephemeral Fever Standard strain (BB2271-919) at ≥ 10^4.3 TCID50

LIVING ATTENUATED VIRAL VACCINE

PROPERTIES
- Ultravac® BEF vaccine is prepared from an attenuated standard strain (919) of bovine ephemeral fever virus. The vaccine is used in cattle for the prevention of bovine ephemeral fever (3 day sickness).
- The BEF vaccine is a freeze dried suspension of the live attenuated virus.
- The BEF strain 919 was modified by passage in cell culture and grown in heterologous tissue at the University of Queensland. Vaccination and challenge trials have demonstrated the efficacy of the vaccine in healthy cattle. When used with the Ultravac® BEF Diluent, the vaccine provides effective immunity against BEF virus infection.

VIRUS: Bovine ephemeral fever virus
STRAIN: BB2271-919
SUBSTRATE: Vero continuous cell line

DIRECTIONS FORUSE
» Side effects: Following vaccination with this product, a transient febrile response in animals may be observed. This response could contribute to a sudden drop in milk production by affected dairy cattle.

» Preparation of the vaccine:
1. Draw up 2 mL of Ultravac® BEF Diluent into a sterile syringe.
2. Add to the freeze dried vaccine in the small vial.
3. Draw up reconstituted vaccine into the syringe.
4. Transfer reconstituted vaccine into the Ultravac® BEF Diluent bottle.
5. Gently shake the diluent bottle to evenly distribute the vaccine (excessive shaking during preparation or administration will cause foaming).
6. Reconstituted vaccine is orange in colour and must be used as soon as possible.

» Dosage and administration:
- USE ALL RECONSTITUTED PRODUCT IMMEDIATELY.
- 2 mL dose by subcutaneous injection.

• Primary vaccination:
- Cattle require an initial 2 mL dose subcutaneously.
- The second 2 mL subcutaneous dose can be effectively administered any time from 2 weeks up to 6 months later.
- Cattle can be vaccinated from 6 months of age.
- Two doses of vaccine are required to produce long lasting immunity.

• Booster vaccination: 2 mL annual booster dose is required for all cattle.

Note:
Equipment, syringes, needles used for vaccination must be clean, sterile and free of chemicals. After use, dismantle and wash in disinfectant such as household bleach (20 mL in 500 mL water) then rinse in cold water.

WITHHOLDING PERIODS: Nil

Additional user safety
- Take care to avoid accidental self-injection
- Accidental self-administration may result in local bruising, pain and swelling. In the event of self-administration, seek medical attention and show the package leaflet or the label, to the Medical Practitioner.

DISPOSAL
Discarded vials/containers should immediately be placed in a designated and appropriately labeled 'biologicals' container. If this option is not available, bury the vial/container below 500 mm in a disposal pit specifically marked and set up for this purpose clear of waterways, desirable vegetation and roots.

STORAGE
» Ultravac® BEF vaccine must be stored between 2°C and 8°C (Refrigerate. Do Not Freeze). Protect from light.
» Ultravac® BEF Diluent must be stored between 2°C and 8°C (Refrigerate. Do Not Freeze). Protect from light.

APVMA approval number: 41461/57696

Manufactured by
Zoetis Belgium SA
Rue Laid Burniat 1
1348 Louvain-la-Neuve
Belgium

Registered trademark®
© Zoetis 2014
name: Ultravac BEF

description:

Dexaphenylarthrite works as potent analgesic antiinflammatory for training , specially designed for horses and camels of high performance competition. Dexaphenylarthrite principal actives are dexamethasone and phenylbutazone.

Phenylbutazone works as a powerful analgesic and antipyretic which adds effects and strengthens each other with the dexa, generating tolerances that allow to improve the high performance training.

FORMULA
- Phenylbutazone 18 gr
- Dexamethasone 0.035 gr
- Benzyl alcohol  1 ml
- Edetate disodico 0.004 gr

ADMINISTRATION AND DOSAGES
Apply 5 ml for 5 days – IM (suspend 7 days before the race).
name: Dexaphenylarthrite

description:
COMPOSITION
Each 1 ml contains:
- Potassium penicillin G  50,000 IU
- Procaine penicillin G  150,000 IU
- Dihydrostreptomycin(sulfate) 250 mg
- Trypsin 2,500 U.N.F
- Chymotrypsin 1,000 U.N.F.

Target species.
Cattle, pigs, sheep, horses, dogs and cats

Indications
- Cattle and horses: pneumonia, pasteurellosis, mastitis.
- Pigs: respiratory infections, mastitis, septicemia, hemorrhagic.
- Sheep: gangrenous mastitis, polyarthritis, pneumonia.
- Dogs and cats: pneumonia, bronchopneumonia, tonsillitis.

Contraindications
Contraindicated in animals allergic to penicillin

Side effects
- Penicillins: Penicillins and B-lactam antibiotics are generally remarkably free of toxic effects even at doses well above recommended levels. The main adverse effects are acute anaphylaxis and collapse, although these are more common milder hypersensitivity reactions (urticaria, fever, edema angioneurotic).
- Dihydrostreptomycin: Allergic reactions may appear, which will be treated with antihistamines and/or corticosteroids.

Interactions
- PENICILLINS: Although rare, an interaction between the procaine penicillin G from long-acting formulations and sulfonamides. Procaine can be converted to p-aminobenzoic acid (PABA), which is a precursor of nucleic acid formation in bacteria. This can interfere with the action inhibitor of nucleic acid synthesis exhibited by sulfonamides.
- DIHYDROSTREPTOMYCIN: Aminoglycosides may also interact with some diuretics that act on the loop of Henle, such as furosemide or acid anachronistic, causing an increase in nephrotoxicity. They are incompatible with heparin, hydrocortisone.

Dose and route of administration
- by intramuscular route injection.
- Cattle, pigs, sheep and horses: 0.5- 1 ml / 10 Kg of live weight; each day during 3-4 days.
- Dogs and cats: 2-3 ml/ 10 Kg of live weight, every day for 3-4 days.
- Once the suspension is done, it maintains its activity for 2-3 days if it is kept in cool site.

Overdose
- Acute anaphylaxis and collapse although reactions are more common milder hypersensitivity (urticaria, fever, angioneurotic edema).
- In case of poisoning due to overdose, it is recommended to immediately discontinue the treatment.

Withdrawal period
- Meat: 30 days.
- Do not administer the product in horses intended for human consumption.

Pharmacodynamic
- PENICILLINS: Penicillins disrupt the development of bacterial cell walls by interfering with with the transpeptidase enzymes responsible for the formation of the conjugates between peptidoglycan filaments. Normal bacterial growth depends on balance between cell wall deposition and autolysis. When a penicillin reacts inhibits synthetic enzymes, a defective cell wall is formed causing abnormal cell elongation, spheroplast formation, and osmotic lysis.
- DIHYDROESTREPTOMYCIN SULFATE: Inhibition of protein synthesis by aminoglycosides is based on binding, much stronger than with any other inhibitor of protein synthesis, to the subunit 30 S of the bacterial ribosome. The specific point of attachment varies slightly depending on the specific antibiotic, but in general it has as a consequence the erroneous reading of the genetic message, by interfering with the correct pairing of the bases of the codon of the tRNA. This causes the beginning of the synthesis to be blocked by preventing the placement of the first amino acid, formylmethionine, or that translation is interrupted prematurely originating a non-functional truncated protein, or that they are placed amino acids other than those specified by the base sequence of the mRNA, forming abnormal proteins. The destruction of the microorganism is all the more faster the higher the concentration of the antibiotic. The lethal effect on cells bacterial seems to be related to the formation of abnormal channels in the cell membranes caused by the synthesis of abnormal membrane proteins. The Transport of aminoglycosides into cells occurs in part by a process of oxygen-dependent active transport, a mechanism that is not present in anaerobic microorganisms, which explains why their action is limited to bacteria aerobic. This transport is favored by the presence of antibiotics that block the synthesis of the bacterial cell wall, such as B-lactams, which act therefore as synergistic agents of aminoglycosides.
- Trypsin: Trypsin is a peptidase enzyme, which breaks protein bonds by hydrolysis to form peptides or smaller amino acids. trypsin is produced in the pancreas and secreted into the duodenum (part of the intestine), where it is essential for digestion. The optimum pH is 8 and the optimum temperature is 37°C. Is a specific enzyme as it binds to the peptide at the carboxyl terminal positions where there is Arginine (Arg) or Lysine (Lys), both amino acids with charged R groups positively, fragmenting the initial peptide. Trypsin is produced by the pancreas in the form of trypsinogen (inactive enzyme), and then it is activated in the duodenum by intestinal enterokinase to trypsin (enzyme active) by proteolytic cleavage.
- CHYMOTRYPSIN: Chymotrypsin is added to reduce swelling of the mammary gland tissue and oedema. This facilitates the diffusion of the antibiotic by dissolving barriers such as blood clot, pus and tissue shrinkage.

PHARMACOKINETICS
- PENICILLINS G: They are bactericidal antibiotics. destroy the bacterial cell wall they bind to a variety of proteins, responsible for the synthesis of said wall. The interference with such proteins results in death and lysis of the bacteria. The union is occurs with specific targets on the inner surface of the cell membrane bacteria, PBPs, enzymes (transpeptidases, carboxypeptidases and endopeptidases) involved in terminal stages of bacterial wall assembly and in the modification of the aforementioned wall during cell division. As a result of binding, the enzymes are inactivated. Different beta lactams have an affinity for different PBPs, with different results, according to the activity of the specific PBP. Inactivation can cause direct cell death, inhibition of glucose synthesis amino glycans with lysis or activation of autolytic enzymes Bacterial death is, then, the product of an indirect mechanism of inactivation enzymatic Penetration, essential for binding to PBPs, is more easily achieved in gram-positive bacteria than in gram-negative ones, due to the presence of lipopolysaccharides and lipoproteins that coat the bacterial cell wall of these latest. The rate of absorption and excretion depends on the salt used, with salts being sodium and potassium salts of rapid absorption and excretion while the procaine and benzathine are slowly absorbed and remain in the body for a long time
- DIHYDROESTREPTOMYCIN SULFATE: Following intramuscular administration, rapid absorption occurs from the inoculation, reaching the highest concentrations in blood after one hour. It is preferentially distributed throughout the extracellular spaces of the organism and is not hardly binds to plasma proteins less than 10%) penetrating minimally into most tissues except the kidney. (Volume of distribution relatively small: 0.35 - 0.45 L/Kg). Good concentrations are obtained in the liquids of the body cavities, especially if there is inflammation. cross the barrier hematoencephalic and placental, as well as joints and eyeball, but not achieve therapeutic concentrations in them, nor in bronchial secretions, liquid intestinal, prostatic secretions, bile and milk. 50-60% is excreted in the urine unchanged, and 2-5% is eliminated in the bile.

INCOMPATIBILITIES
- PENICILLINS: Although rare, an interaction between the procaine penicillin G from long-acting formulations and sulfonamides. Procaine can be converted to p-aminobenzoic acid (PABA), which is a precursor of nucleic acid formation in bacteria. This can interfere with the action inhibitor of nucleic acid synthesis exhibited by sulfonamides.
- DIHYDROSTREPTOMYCIN: Aminoglycosides may also interact with some diuretics that act on the loop of Henle, such as furosemide or acid anachronistic, causing an increase in nephrotoxicity. They are incompatible with heparin, hydrocortisone.

Withdrawal Period:
- Meat: 30 days
- Milk: 3 days

Period of validity: 3 years

Storage
Store in a cool, dry place protected from light at a temperature between 15 °C and 30°C.

Packaging
- 20 ml, 50 ml vial
- The containers containing the solvent vial and the antibiotic vial are made of treated glass transparent and hydrolytic class II. The vial is closed with a gray bromobutyl stopper and an aluminum capsule is placed on it to close the set with labels stickers printed with the technical information.
name: Quimiopen plus

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contain:
- Oxytocin 16.6 mcg (eq to 10 IU Oxytocin)

Properties:
- Systemic hormones, excluding sex hormones.
- Secreted by the posterior lobe of the pituitary gland, oxytocin stimulates the contraction of the smooth muscles of the uterus, the intestine and the mammary acinis. It is involved in trigger the birth and ejection of milk. Its action on uterus is amplified especially at the end of gestation when the latter is strongly sensitized by estrogen.
- After parenteral administration, oxytocin is rapidly degraded by a specific enzyme "oxytocinase". Its half-life is very short (from 4 seconds to 4 minutes).

Indication:
Hormone therapy in mares, cows, ewes, goats, sows, bitches and cats:
- Uterine atony during the puerperium,
- Languishing part,
- Placental retention due to uterine atony,
- Initiation of ejection of the milk in the event of agalactia due to stress or in conditions requiring emptying of the udder,
- Additional treatment for mastitis,
- Additional treatment for metritis.

Target species:
Horses (mares), cattle (cows), pigs (sows), sheep (ewes), goats (nanny), dogs (bitches) and cats (queen)

Dosage and administration:
- Route of administration: Intramuscularly, intravenously or subcutaneously.
- For the intravenous route, reduce the dose by half.
- Repeat if necessary at 2 hour intervals.

Dose of whole product:
- mares and cows: 3 to 5 ml.
- sows: 2 to 4 ml.
- ewes and goats: 1.5 to 2 ml.
- bitches: 0.5 to 1 ml.
- cats: 0.2 to 0.5 ml.

Warnings: None.

Precautions:
i) precautions for human: In the event of accidental injection of the medicinal product in a woman who is not pregnant, the following side effects may occur: facial redness and heat, lower abdominal pain. However, these symptoms go away fairly quickly. Pregnant, post-partum or lactating women should not administer the product to animals in order to avoid accidental injection. Accidental injection in pregnant women can cause uterine contractions.
ii) precautions for use in animals: In the case of uterine inertia, it is only necessary to intervene if the cervix is open and tiere is no obstacie preventing the expulsion of the fetus or the placenta. An excess of dosage delays the response.
iii) Precautions during pregnancy, lactation and laying: This product is used at the end of gestation or after parturition. It therefore does not require any special warning.

Contra-indications:
- Do not use in case of fetal dystocia and non-dilation of the cervix.

Drug-drug interaction: Not known.

Adverse effects:
Normal Dose not known.

Poisoning:
An overdose or too frequent administration of oxytocin causes over-stimulation of the myometrium and puts the uterus in a state of spasmodic cramp: symptoms of colic, uterine rupture.

Antidotes:
- Isoxsuprine 0.5 mg per kg, intramuscularly.
- parasympathicolytics, sympathomimetics.

Withdrawal Time:
- Meat and offal: zero days.
- Milk: zero hours.

Storage conditions:
store at temperature (2-8 °C), Protect from Light.

Pack:
Carton box Containing Transparent Colorless (Type I) glass ampoules, each of 2 ml, 3 ml or 5 ml with outer label and inner leaflet.

Manufactured By:
Marcyrl Pharmaceutical Industries (2) 1st Industrial Zone - Obour City
name: Birthease

description:
Composition:
Calcium chloride, Calcium sulfate

Guaranteed analysis:
- Calcium minimum: 21.2%
- Calcium maximum: 25.4 %
- Each bolus of 192 gm contains 43 gm of calcium

Target species & use:
Bovikalc is an oral calcium supplement for use around parturition in fresh dairy cows.

Actions:
- After administration of Bovikalc the bolus disintegrates completely within 30 minutes. The calcium chloride dissolves quickly in the rumen, while the calcium sulfate dissolves only after being degraded by the rumen microflora, providing a sustained release of calcium.

Feeding Directions:
■ Minimum protocol:
• 1st bolus immediately after calving & 2nd bolus 12-24 hours after calving.
■ Extended protocol:
- For high yielding cows and cows with previous history of hypocalcemia.
• 1st bolus at the first signs of parturition
• 2nd bolus immediately after calving.
• 3rd bolus 12-24 hours after calving & 4th bolus 24-48 hours after calving.

Please discuss protocol with Herd Nutritionist and/or Herd Veterinarian before implementation.

Precautions:
- Follow label instructions carefully.
- Incorrect use or handling may cause serious side effects.
- Only administer using the Bovikalc branded applicator.
- Use Bovikalc in healthy and standing cows only.
- Do not use bolus if broken.
- The bolus should be stored in the original plastic tube until immediately before use, as it is susceptible to humidity.

Storage condition:
- Do not store above 30°C.
- Keep out of the reach of children.

Withdrawal period & GMO: None
name: Bovikalc

description:
Super immune (large animals) Bio Energy Technique preparation works by Homeopathic theory effective for viral and bacterial diseases.

Composition
Super immune is a phytogenic immune-stimulant which contain a mixture of special & highly purified volatile oils treated by special positive energy to resist common viral & bacterial causative agents of diseases.

Uses and indications:
- Controls the neonatal infectious diseases and decrease the mortality rate via increasing the cellular immunity.
- Super Immune improves the gastrointestinal tract functions and control the infectious microbial diarrhea caused by Salmonella and E-coli.
- Achieve balance between microflora and harmful bacteria to avoid the occurrence of the diseases.
- Super Immune used during and after vaccination to accelerate the antibodies releasing and increase it's duration of action.
- Super Immune used as growth stimulant in fattening animals by increasing the feed conversion rate
- Super Immune used at last gestation period to decrease the mortality rate and prevents Mastitis.

Dosage:
Prevention:
- Small animals: 5 - 10 ml for 3 - 5 consecutive days.
- Large animals: 20 - 30 ml for 3 - 5 consecutive days
- Last gestation period: 10 ml / 100 kg for 3 - 5 consecutive days.

During diseases:
- Small animals: 10 - 20 ml for 3 - 5 consecutive days.
- Large animals: 30 - 50 ml for 3 - 5 consecutive days.
name: Super Immune

description:
Composition
Each ml contains:
Active substance:
- Ampicillin (as anhydrous ampicillin) 100 mg

Excipients
- Dodecyl gallate (as antioxidant preservative)  87.5 mcg
- Aluminium monostearate
- Fractionated coconut oil.

Pharmaceutical form
Suspension for injection. White to off white suspension

Pharmacodynamic properties
- Ampicillin is a beta-lactam antibiotic which has bactericidal activity against mainly Gram-positive bacteria and some Gram-negative aerobes. It is sensitive to beta-lactamase (penicillinase) inactivation. It is widely distributed in the extracellular fluids after absorption, and eliminated almost entirely by the kidneys.
- Bioavailability studies indicate that a minimum duration of activity of 48 hours can be expected following a single injection.

Pharmacokinetic properties
- Amfipen LA, containing ampicillin anhydrate in a long acting base, has been especially developed to overcome the disadvantage of frequent administrations required for short-acting ampicillin formulations. Blood level studies clearly show that the injection interval can be extended to at least 48 hours instead of the usual 12-24 hours.
- After an initial peak at one hour after injection, the ampicillin concentrations decline slowly and gradually over the 48 hour period and 34 to 50 % of the ampicillin becomes available on the second day after injection.
- Animal studies have demonstrated that ampicillin is evenly distributed throughout the body tissues and is concentrated in the liver and the kidneys. It is excreted unchanged in the urine. Investigations have shown that ampicillin is excreted in high concentration in the bile.

Target species
Cattle, sheep, pigs, dogs and cats.

Indications for use
Amfipen LA is indicated for treatment of diseases or secondary infections due to the following bacteria sensitive to ampicillin in dogs, cats, cattle, sheep and pigs and where prolongation of activity from a single injection is required: Streptococcus spp., Trueperella pyogenes, Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida, Erysipelothrix rhusiopathiae, Staphylococcus aureus and Staphylococcus species.

Contraindications
- Do not use in case of hypersensitivity to the active substance, or to any of the excipients.
- Do not administer to rabbits, hamsters or guinea pigs. Not effective against beta-lactamase producing organisms.
- Do not use this product in horses due to the likelihood of severe local reaction at the injection site.
- Do not inject dogs and cats intramuscularly.
- Do not use in animals producing milk for human consumption.

Side effects
Severe disturbances of the intestinal bacterial flora of herbivores may occur.

Special precautions for use
- Whenever possible, the product should only be used based on susceptibility testing.
- Official and local antimicrobial policies should be taken into account when the product is used.
- Use of the product deviating from the instructions given in the SPC may increase the prevalence of bacteria resistant to ampicillin and may decrease the effectiveness of treatment with other beta-lactams due to the potential for cross-resistance.

Operator warnings
- Penicillin and cephalosporins may cause hypersensitivity (allergy) following injection, inhalation, ingestion or skin contact. Hypersensitivity to penicillin may lead to cross reactions to cephalosporins and vice versa. Allergic reactions to these substances may occasionally be serious.
1. Do not handle this product if you know you are sensitised or if you have been advised not to work with such preparations.
2. Handle this product with great care to avoid exposure, taking all recommended precautions.
3. If you develop symptoms following exposure, such as a skin rash, you should seek medical advice and show the doctor this warning. Swelling of the face, lips or eyes or difficulty with breathing are more serious symptoms and require urgent medical attention.
- Care should be taken to avoid accidental self-injection. In case of accidental self-injection, seek medical advice immediately. Wash hands after use.

Adverse reactions
- Severe disturbances of the intestinal bacterial flora of herbivores may occur.
Allergies to ampicillin can occur rarely. Local swelling at the injection site may occur in dogs, this usually regresses spontaneously in 2-4 days.

Pregnancy or Lactation
No special precautions necessary.

Interactions
- Bacteria, particularly gram-negative organisms, that show a cross-resistance with other ß lactam antibiotics may show resistance.
- There is antagonism between this product and antibiotics with bacteriostatic activity.
Amounts to be administered and administration route

Dosage:
• Cattle and sheep 15 mg/kg, pigs 25 mg/kg by intramuscular route.
• Dogs 15 mg/kg, cats 20 mg/kg by subcutaneous route.

- Shake well before use.
- Clean the area of the injection site and swab with spirit.
- This product does not contain an antimicrobial preservative.
- Only dry sterile needles and syringes should be used for administration and the septum should be swabbed before removing each dose.
- Do not use the same injection site more than once during a course of treatment.
- Do not administer more than 10 ml per injection site in pigs and sheep and 20 ml in cattle.
- Treatment may be repeated once after 48 hours.
- To ensure a correct dosage, body weight should be determined as accurately as possible to avoid under dosing.
- Do not mix with any other veterinary medicinal product.

Overdose
Ampicillin is a compound with a very high therapeutic ratio. It is unlikely that an overdose of Amfipen LA will have adverse effects on the treated animal. No specific antidote or treatment is recommended.

Withdrawal periods
Not to be used in animals producing milk for human consumption.
Animals must not be slaughtered for human consumption during treatment.
Cattle, sheep and pigs may be slaughtered for human consumption only after 60 days from the last treatment.

Shelf life
- As packaged for sale: 3 years.
- After first opening: 28 days.

Special precautions for storage
Do not store above 25 °C. Do not freeze.
Immediate packaging
Type II (Ph Eur) glass vials closed with halogenated butyl rubber stoppers or PET vials closed with halogenated butyl rubber stoppers. The both types of vial are sealed with an aluminium cap. The vials contain 80 ml of product.
Not all pack sizes may be marketed
name: Amfipen LA

description:

Indications:
For treatment of systemic metabolic disorders it promotes protein, Carbohydrate and fat metabolism as well as it influence to the formation of R.B.C.S, for Horse, cattle, foal, calf, sheep, goat, lamb,pig, dog, cat and fur-animals.

Package:

description:
Anthelmintic (Benzimidazole)

Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Fenbendazole  10 gm

Indications:
• Cattle:
- Lung worms: ( adult and fourth-stage larvae ) Dictyocaulus viviparous.
- Stomach worms: Adult and 4th larval stage of Haemonchus contortus, Ostertagia ostertagi and the adult staga of Trichostronaylus axei
- Intestinal worms: Adult and 4th larval stage of Cooperia spp., Oesophagostomum radiatum, Nematodirus helvetianus, Bunostomum phelbotomum.

• Sheep: Gastro-intestinal round worms, lungwroms, tapeworms in ruminants (cattle, sheep, goats and camel).

• Horse:
- Large strongyles: Strongylus vulgaris, S. equinus, S edontatus, and Triodonlophonus spp.
- Small strongyles: Cyathostomum spp, Cylicocyclus spp, Cylicodontophorus spp, and Cylicostephanus spp.
- Pinworms (Oxyuris equi), and ascarids (Parascaris equorum).

Dosage and administration:
- Shake well before using.
- administration orally using a dosing syringe or drenching gun.
- Cattle and Horse: 4 ml / 50 Kg Bwt.
- Foals under 18 months of age for treatment of ascarid infections: 5 ml / 50 Kg Bwt.
- Sheep: 1 ml / 20 Kg Bwt.

- Fenbazole 10% suspension is compatible with trichlorfon which can be used concurrently for the treatment of infections with stomach bots (Gastrophilus spp.).

Storage condition:
- Store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C, away from light.
- Shelf-life when the container is opened 3 months and store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Manufactured by:
ADWIA Co. S.A.E. 10th of Ramadan City
Made In Egypt

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml Contains:
- Dipyrone 50 gm 

Properties:
- Kim-gen 50% is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug and has a central analgesic, antipyretic and antirheumatic agent with marked sedative and spasmolytic properties on animals.
- Kim-gen 50% has Spasmolytic effect on smooth muscles is accompanied by peripheral vasodilation thus increasing blood supply to striped muscles.
- Kim-gen 50% is extremely safe & non toxic with no side effects on circulatory system, Kidney or other organs.

Indications:
- Antipyretic in fever condition and to relief of pain.
- Colics, intestinal spasms and other spastic conditions of the abdomen.
- Acute and chronic arthritis, lumbago, rheumatic disorders of skeletal muscles and joints
- Neuritis, neuralgia & Tendovaginitis
- To calm the animal & to decrease pain during examination and treatment.

Warning
Not to be used for animals producing meat, milk, eggs

Precaution:
- Blood picture should be checked for WBCs, during long term treatment with Dipyrone.
- Agranulocytosis and leucopoenia may develop in high doses.
- Do not administer with phenylbutazone or barbiturate agents.
- Not to be mixed with any drugs before injection.
- In horses do not administered the drug with 5 days of racing.
- Total daily dose should not to exceed to 300 mg/animals/days for dogs
and cats.
- Total daily dose should not to exceed to 10 gm/ animals/ days for horses.
- Not to be used for poultry.

Administration:
Kim-Gen 50% is supplied by deep IM or slowly IV injection under supervision in the following appropriate.

Dosage:
- Calves & Cattle: 1 ml/ 10 Kg body weight
- Foal & Horse: 1 ml / 25 Kg body weight
- Cats & Dogs: 0.5 ml / 10 Kg body weight

Withdrawal time: 5 days

Storage
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Shelf life: 3 years

M.H. Reg. No.: 2729/2005

Product of Kirovest Pharmaceutical Co.
Manufacture in Grand pharma.

Industrial Zone El Obour City, Cairo, Egypt.

description:
Polyselnium Injectable Emulsion

Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Sodium selenite  5.48 mg (Eq. to selenium 2.5 mg)
- Vitamin E  50 mg (Eq. to d-alpha tocopheryl acetate 68 IU)

Properties:
- The selected combination of selenium and vitamin E acts very effectively in a variety of disease states caused by deficiency of the trace element selenium and vitamin E in livestock (myopathy and exudative diathesis). Both the active ingredients potentiate the effect of each other.
- Vitamin E prevents the formation of bonds between lipoperoxides and unsaturated fatty acids (an important component of cell walls), thus protecting cell membranes from destruction. Originating tocopherol radicals may be reduced by ascorbic acid. Selenium is needed in cells for the formation of glutathione peroxidase (GPX), which acts as an antioxidant in the cell fluid; hydroperoxides and lipoperoxides are converted with glutathione to harmless reduced forms. With this effect selenium supplements the protective effect of vitamin E.

Target species:
Horses.

Indications:
It is used in the prevention of the following clinical signs when associated with Myositis (STD) syndrome, rapid respiration, profuse sweating, muscle spasms and stiffness.

Dosage and administration:
- Route of administration: Slow Intravenous or deep intramuscular injection.
- For Whole product: 1 ml / 45 kg B.wt, may be repeated at 5-10 days intervals.

Warnings and precautions:
- Intravenous administration should be by slow injection.
- Do not exceed the recommended dose.
- Selenium is toxic if administered in excess.
- Don’t use products containing benzyl alcohol for newly born pets/ domestic animals.

Contraindications:
- Do not use in case of hypersensitivity to active substance or any excipients.
- Do not use at the same time as any other selenised fertilizer, prill or product without consulting a veterinarian.
- Do not exceed stated dose volume and frequency.

Side effects:
Possibility of Anaphylactic shocks, signs include excitement, sweating, trembling, ataxia, respiratory distress, and cardiac dysfunction.

Withdrawal time:
- Meat: Nil

Storage conditions:
- Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.
- Used after opening for 1 month when stored at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Packaging:
Carton box containing an amber type II glass vial of 100 ml solution, closed with bromobutyl rubber, and crimped with flip-off aluminum cap. With an outer label and inner leaflet.

Manufactured by:
Eva Pharma for pharmaceuticals and medical appliances (Eva Pharma)
name: Polyselnium

name: Engemycin Spray

description:
Composition
Each 100 ml contains
- Albendazole 10 gm

Properties
- Albendazole is a broad spectrum benzimidazoloe antiparasitic agent against Nematodes and Cestodes it acts by interrupting of the parasite energy metabolism by binding to tubulin, thereby disrupting micro-tubular cell structure and preventing nutrient uptake and other functions which leads to parasites death.
- Allbendazole is used or the treatment of parasite infestation caused by Gastrointestinal roundworms, Lungworms, Tapeworms and Liver fluke (Fasciola) in cattle and sheep.

Indications
• Cattle:
- Gastrointestinal roundworms: Ostertagia spp., Haemonchus spp., Trichostrongylus spp., Nematodirus spp., Oesphagostomum spp., Bunostomum spp., Cooperia spp & Strongyloides spp.
- Lungwems: Dictyocaulus viviparus.
- Tapeworm: Moniozia spp.
- Liver fluke: Fasciola hepatica (adult stage)

• Sheep
- Gastrointestinal roundworms: Ostertagia spp., Haemonchus spp., Trichostrongylus spp., Nematodirus spp. (including N. battus),  Chabertia spp. & Oesphagostomum spp.
- Lungwems: Dictyocaulus viviparus.
- Tapeworm: Moniozia spp.
- Liver fluke: Fasciola hepatica (adult stage)

Target species: Cattle and sheep

Dosage administration
• Route of administration orally without dilution or mixing with other products.
• Cattle
- For round worms & tape worms: 7.5 ml of the product/ 100 kg b.wt.
- For adult liver fluke, round worms & Tape worms: 10 ml of the product/ 100 kg b. wt.
• Sheep
- For round worms & tape worms: 2.5 ml of the product/ 50 kg b.wt.
- For adult liver fluke, round worms & Tape worms: 3.75 ml of the product/ 50 kg b. wt.

Warning & Precautions
- Care not to exceed the recommended dose in cows during 1st month of pregnancy.
- Coughing for some weeks after treatment in cattle suffering from severe lung damage at time of treatment.
- Shake well before using.

Contraindications
- Not to be given to sheep producing milk for human consumption.
- Treatment of ewes at a dosage of 7.5 mg /kg during the mating period and until 1 month after rams are removed.
- Not to be given during the first 45 days of pregnancy or for 45 days after removal of bulls.

Side effects
No side effects in the recommended doses

Withdrawal period
- Cattle: meat 14 days, milk 2.5 days
- Sheep: 5 days

Storage conditions
Stored at temp. not exceeding 30C

Packaging
White (HDPE) plastic bottle sealed with aluminum seal lined by (HDPE) plastic film closed by white (HDPE) plastic cap with an outer label.

Manufactured by Waki pharma for Elfath for Veterinary Drugs Co.
name: Neradozol

description:
Composition
Each ml of the product contains:
Active substance:
- Triclabendazole 240 mg

Excipients
- Methyl parahydroxybenzoate (E218) 1.1 mg
- Propyl parahydroxybenzoate (E216) 0.4 mg
- Benzyl alcohol (E1519) 5.0 mg
- Microcrystalline cellulose and carmellose sodium
- Povidone
- Simethicone Emulsion
- Propylene Glycol
- Purified Water

Pharmaceutical form
Oral Suspension, Cream-coloured aqueous suspension.

Target species: Cattle

Pharmacodynamic properties
Triclabendazole inhibits cellular transport mechanisms and binds to a different tubulin receptor, possibly the tubulozole receptor, than do other benzimidazoles, which bind to the colchicine receptor. Triclabendazole also inhibits protein synthesis.

Pharmacokinetic particulars
- Triclabendazole is readily absorbed and oxidised to its sulfoxide and sulfone. Triclabendazole sulfoxide reaches peak concentrations approximately 1 day after administration of FASINEX and the sulfone reaches peak concentrations approximately 3 days after administration. Both metabolites bind strongly to plasma protein, particularly albumin.
- Metabolites are excreted via the bile, primarily as conjugates. More than 90% of the total dose of FASINEX is excreted in the faeces, about 5% in the urine and 1% in milk. Elimination is virtually complete by 10 days after administration.

Indications for use, specifying the target species
For the treatment of acute, subacute and chronic infection due to early immature, immature, and mature stages of Fasciola hepatica. If infected animals are treated before disease has developed, fasciolosis can be prevented.

Contraindications: None known

Dosage & administration
- To ensure administration of a correct dose, bodyweight should be determined as accurately as possible; accuracy of the dosing device should be checked. If animals are to be treated collectively rather than individually they should be grouped according to their bodyweight and dosed accordingly, in order to avoid under- or over-dosing.
- Administer 5 mL/100 kg body weight, equivalent to 12 mg triclabendazole per kg of body weight. FASINEX 240 is administered orally after thorough shaking of the suspension. Most types of automatic drenching guns are suitable. Clean drenching gun before and after use. FASINEX can safely be given to young, pregnant or stressed cattle, cattle not producing milk intended for human consumption or dry cattle.
- Fasinex 240 is given once. The administration may be repeated several weeks or months after the first treatment depending on the epidemiological situation. In case of acute fasciolosis, treat immediately, then repeat in approximately 4-6 weeks, and consult a veterinarian for advice.
	
- Up to 50 kg: 2.5 ml
- >50-70: 3.5 ml
- >70-100: 5 ml
- >100-150: 7.5 ml
- >150-200: 10 ml
- >200-300: 15 ml
- >300-400: 20 ml
- >400-500: 25 ml

- Add 5 mL for each additional 100 kg

Special warnings
- Care should be taken to avoid the following practices because they increase the risk of development of resistance and could ultimately result in ineffective therapy.
• Too frequent and repeated use of anthelmintics from the same class, over an extended period of time.
• Underdosing, which may be due to underestimation of bodyweight, misadministration of the product, or lack of calibration of the dosing device (if any).
- Suspected clinical cases of resistance to anthelmintics should be further investigated using appropriate tests (e.g. Faecal Egg Count Reduction Test). Where the results of the test(s) strongly suggest resistance to a particular anthelmintic, and anthelmintic belonging to another pharmacological class and having a different mode of action should be used.
- Resistance to triclabendazole has been reported in Fasciola hepatica in a number of countries including ones in the EU. Therefore the use of this product should be based on local epidemiological information about susceptibility of F. hepatica and recommendations on how to limit further selection for resistance to anthelmintics. Dosing programmes should be discussed with your Veterinary Adviser.

Special precautions for use
(i) Special precautions for use in animals: None known

(ii) Special precautions for the person
- Do not eat, drink, or smoke while handling the product. Wash hands and exposed skin after handling the product.
- In case of accidental spillage onto skin or in eyes, wash immediately with water. Take off any contaminated clothes.
(iii) Other precautions: None known

Adverse reactions (frequency and seriousness): None known

Pregnancy or lactation
FASINEX is neither embryotoxic nor teratogenic, and can be used in all stages of pregnancy. Concerning use during lactation refer to Withdrawal period section below.

Interaction: None known

Overdose
A single oral dose of 150-200 mg triclabendazole/kg of body weight was shown to lead to side effects such as stumbling gait, depression, and decreased appetite. These side effects are slight and last 1 to 3 days. An antidote is not known.

Withdrawal period
- Meat and offal: 52 days.
- Milk: Milk for human consumption may only be taken from 48 hours after calving. Not intended for use within 48 days of calving. Should a cow calve earlier than 48 days after the last treatment, milk for human consumption may only be taken from 50 days after the last treatment.

Incompatibilities: None Known

Shelf life
- As packaged for sale: 3 years
- After first opening: 12 months

Storage precautions 
- Store in tightly closed original container.
- Shake well before use.

Packaging
- High density polyethylene bottles of 0.8, 2.2, 5 and 12 litres
- Not all pack sizes may be marketed.
name: Fasinex 240

description:
Composition
Each 100 ml Contains:
- Nitroxynil 34 g

Properties
Nitroxynil is anthelmintic , termatocidal drug, The mechanism of action is thought to be due to uncoupling of oxidative phosphorylation.

Indications
Fashioning solution is indicated for the treatment of fasciolosis (infestations of mature and immature Fasciola hepatica) in cattle and sheep also against adult and larval infestations of Haemonchus contortus in cattle and sheep and Haemonchus placei, Oesophagostomum radiatumand, Bunostomurm phlebotomum in cattle.

Target species: Cattle and sheep

Dose & Administration
- Rout of Administration: Subcutaneous injection
- Cattle: 1.5 ml of product / 50 kg live weight

- Sheep : Administer according to the following
- 14-20 kg: 0.5 ml
- 21-30 kg: 0.75 ml
- 31-40 kg: 1.0 ml
- 41-55 kg: 1.5 ml
- 56-75 kg: 2.0 ml
- Over 75 kg: 2.5 ml

Warnings & precaution:
- Ensure the injection does not enter subcutaneous muscle.
- Ewes in advanced pregnancy should be handled and dosed carefully.
- Fashioning solution stains and care should be taken not to spill it, especially on the fleece of sheep.
- Do not retreat at intervals less than 60 days (cattle) or 49 days (sheep).
- Care should be taken to avoid too frequent and repeated use of anthelmintics from the same class or Underdosing because they increase the risk of development of resistance and could ultimately result in ineffective therapy.

Contraindication:
- Do not use in animals with known hypersensitivity to the active ingredient.
- Do not use in dogs as fatalities have been reported.
- Do not exceed stated dose.
- Do not use during the last trimester of pregnancy in heifers which are intended to produce milk for human consumption.
- Do not use within 1 year prior to the first lambing in ewes intended to produce milk for human consumption.

Adverse effect:
Normal dose
- Small swellings are occasionally observed at the injection site in cattle.
- These can be avoided by injecting the dose in two separate sites and massaging well to disperse the solution.

Overdosee: In the event of accidental overdose, the symptoms are pyrexia, rapid respiration and increased excitability. Patients should be kept cool, and dextrose saline should be administered intravenously.

Withdrawal time:
- Cattle: 60 days
- Sheep: 49 days
- Not authorised for use in cattle and sheep producing milk for human consumption including during the dry period.

Storage conditions
- Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C away from light.
- To be used after opening within 28 days if stored at temperature 2-8°C.

Packing:
Carton box containing colorless glass bottle ( type lII) contains 100 ml solution with reddish brown rubber stopper formed of bromobutyl substance and aluminum cap with outer label + Insert leaflet.

Product of:
Chemical Industries Development (CID)
Giza - A.R.E. - G.C.R. 19717

description:
ROTAGAL Inactivated vaccine Emulsion for injection. Active immunization of pregnant cows and heifers to raise antibodies against Rotavirus, Coronavirus and Escherichia coli strain EC/17 expressing F5 (K99) Adhesin.

COMPOSITION
One dose of the vaccine (3 ml) contains:
- Bovine rotavirus strain TM-91, serotype G6P1 (inactivated): 2/3 dose of vaccine inducing ≥ 6 log2 (VNT)*
- Bovine coronavirus strain C-197 (inactivated): 2/3 dose of vaccine inducing ≥ 5 log2 (HIT)**
- Escherichia coli strain EC/17 (inactivated) expressing F5 (K99) Adhesin: 2/3 dose of vaccine inducing ≥ 44,8 % of inhibition (ELISA)***

Adjuvant:
- Montanide ISA 206 VG   1,6 ml

Excipients:
- Formaldehyde   max. 1,5 mg
- Thiomersal   max. 0,36 mg

*VNT – virus neutralisation test
**HIT –  hemagglutination inhibition test
***ELISA –  Enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay

INDICATION(S)
Cattle (pregnant cows and heifers)
- For active immunization of pregnant cows and heifers to provide calves with passive immunity targeted at reduction of mortality, incidence and severity of diarrhoea caused by bovine rotavirus, coronavirus and enteropathogenic E. coli F5 (K99) and reduction of rotavirus and coronavirus shedding by infected calves.
- Onset of immunity: Passive immunity starts with colostrum feeding.

CONTRAINDICATIONS
None.

ADVERSE REACTIONS
Occasionally a slight swelling up to 5-7 cm in diameter may be observed at the site of injection. Typically, such swelling resolves within 14 days. Slight, transient increases in temperature (up to 1.2°C) may be observed within 24 hours of vaccination, resolving within 4 days after vaccination. If you notice any serious effects or other effects not mentioned in this leaflet, please inform your veterinary surgeon.

TARGET SPECIES
Cattle (pregnant cows and heifers)

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
Direction for use:
- For intramuscular use. One dose: 3 ml
- One injection in the course of each pregnancy between the week 12 – 3 before calving is expected.

Feeding of colostrum
- The protection of calves depends on adequate ingestion of colostrum from vaccinated cows. Measures should be taken to ensure that calves receive sufficient amounts of colostrum within the first few days of life. It is important that all calves receive sufficient amounts of colostrum within the first six hours after calving. The highest content of antibodies in the colostrum is reached 72 hours after parturition, however absorption of antibodies in the gut of calves is highest within the first 6 – 8 hours after parturition. In the dairy herd, it is recommended that colostrum/milk from the first 6 – 8 milkings of vaccinated mothers is collected and pooled. During the first two weeks of life, the calves must be fed with 2,5 – 3 liters of this pooled colostrum/milk per day.
- To achieve optimum results and to reduce infection pressure on the farm, a whole herd cow vaccination policy should be adopted and all newborn calves should be fed with the pooled colostrum.
 
ADVICE ON CORRECT ADMINISTRATION
- Common aseptic procedures should be used during vaccination.
- Only sterile syringes and needles should be used.
- Allow the vaccine to reach room temperature before use.
- Shake well before and occasionally during use to ensure that the sediment is dissolved prior to administration.
- Do not mix with any other veterinary medicinal product.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
Zero days.

STORAGE PRECAUTIONS
- Keep out of the sight and reach of children.
- Store and transport refrigerated (2 - 8°C), in the dark place.
- Protect from frost.
- Once broached use within 10 hours or discard.
- Do not use after the expiry date stated on the label.

SPECIAL WARNING(S)
» To the person:
- This product contains mineral oil. Accidental injection/self injection may result in severe pain and swelling, particularly if injected into a joint or finger, and in rare cases could result in the loss of the affected finger if prompt medical attention is not given. If you are accidentally injected with this product, seek prompt medical advice even if only a very small amount is injected and take the package leaflet with you. If pain persists for more than 12 hours after medical examination, seek medical advice again.

» To the physician:
- This product contains mineral oil. Even if small amounts have been injected, accidental injection with this product can cause intense swelling, which may, for example, result in ischemic necrosis and even the loss of a digit. Expert, PROMPT, surgical attention is required and may necessitate early incision and irrigation of the injected area, especially where there is involvement of finger pulp or tendon.
- Product contains formaldehyde - potential eye, skin and respiratory irritant. Avoid contact with skin, eyes and mucosa.

» Accidental release measures:
Ventilate the room, use a non-combustible material like vermiculite, earth or sand to soak up the product and transfer to container for disposal. In case of accidental ingestion do not induce vomiting unless directed by medical personnel. Get medical attention.

DISPOSAL PRECAUTIONS
Any unused veterinary medicinal product or waste materials derived from such veterinary medicinal products should be disposed of in accordance with local requirements.

DATE ON WHICH THE PACKAGE LEAFLET WAS LAST APPROVED
September 2016.

OTHER INFORMATION
- Not all pack sizes may be marketed.
- For any information about this veterinary medicinal product, please contact the local representative of the marketing authorization holder.

Commercial sizes:
- 15 ml (5 doses), 90 ml (30 doses), 450 ml (150 doses).
- For packing of 90 ml and 450 ml respectively it is recommended to use automated dosing equipment to protect stopper against destruction by multi piercing.

For veterinary use

M.A.H and Manufacturer:
PHARMAGAL BIO s. r. o.,
Nitra, Slovak Republic.

Distributed in Egypt by:
Global Animal health
Tel: +201223474462 - info@global-ah.net

Country of origin: Slovak Republic

Registration number in Egypt: 757
