description:
Formula:
Each 100 mL contains:
- Acetyl DL-Methionine   500 gm
- Choline Chloride   200 gm
- Thiamine Hydrochloride   100 gm
- Pyridoxine Hydrochloride   4 gm
- L-Arginine Hydrochloride   60 g
- Riboflavin   2 gm
- Nicotinamide   50 gm
- Calcium Pantothenate   20 gm
- Glucose   2000 gm
- Vehicle q.s.p  100 mL

Description:
• Facilitating the elimination of toxins from the body Mercepton is a medicine used as a stimulant of the digestive process. The product can be applied to small and large animals, being an effective option in the treatment of various contaminations.
• Mercepton's formula acts in defense of the organism of cattle, goats, pigs and even domestic animals such as dogs and cats. Its use is therefore indicated for various situations such as:
- Drug poisoning caused due to excessive consumption of sulfa vermifuge and other antibiotics as well as any other prolonged treatment that causes digestive disorders as a side effect. Mercepton favors the methylation of different chemical substances, facilitating their elimination from the body.
- Poisoning resulting from the accidental ingestion of household and industrial cleaning products or incorrect dilutions of lethal chemical substances such as liquid waxes, kerosene, insecticides and rodenticides. Here Mercepton is used as a supportive treatment in the animal's recovery.
- Treatment and prevention of B-complex hypovitaminosis, liver cell degeneration and fatty infiltration. As a lipotropic agent Mercepton promotes the conversion of liver fat into phospholipids that can be transferred more rapidly from the liver into the blood. In this way, the drug prevents liver steatosis (fatty degeneration).
• Mercepton can also be used as an immunostimulant during periods of vaccination, aiding in the formation of antibodies. In addition, the product is effective in treating cases of ingestion of toxic plants and spoiled food.
• Available in two versions Mercepton Injectable and Mercepton Oral, the option guarantees the recovery of animals in order to ensure their health and well-being, avoiding losses for owners and breeders.

Indications:
- MERCEPTON is the association of 3 notable lipotropic and antitoxic agents for stimulating the body's defenses against hepatotoxic agents aided by glucose with its dynamogenic and also protective action of the parenchyma against harmful agents and B-Complex vitamins that at the same time increase the mechanism natural protector stimulate the transmethylating power of the liver.
- As a hepatoprotector before or after treatments with endoparasiticidal or ectoparasiticidal endectocides, thus favoring the methylation of different chemical substances, facilitating their elimination from the body.
- As an immunostimulant during vaccination periods, aiding in the formation of antibodies.
- As a supportive treatment in the recovery of the animal in accidents caused by accidental ingestion or even incorrect dilutions of lethal chemical substances (insecticides, rodenticides, toxic plants, spoiled food).
- As a lipotropic agent promoting the conversion of hepatic fat into phospholipids which can be transferred more quickly from the liver to the blood, thus avoiding hepatic steatosis (fatty degeneration).
 
Dosage:
- Large animals (cattle and horses) from 20 to 100 mL / day;
- Medium-sized animals (foals, calves, goats, sheep and pigs) from 10 to 30 mL / day;
- Small animals (dogs, piglets) from 2 to 10 mL / day.
- The duration of treatment is at the discretion of the Veterinarian.
 
Management:
Intramuscular or intravenous injections.

Precautions:
- Disinfect the application site.
- Use disposable or sterilized syringes and needles.
 
Presentation:
20 and 100 mL vial.
name: Mercepton

description:
COMPOSITION:
Each ml contains:
- Ivermectin 10 mg

THERAPEUTIC GROUP
Cattle, Goat, Sheep, Pig
	
INDICATIONS
Ivermectin is very effective against the adult and larval forms of nematodes (Ostertagia, Haemonchus, Cooperia, Nematodirus, Bunostomum, Trichuris, Oesophagostomum, Chabertia ovina), but it also effectively inhibits the development of the larvae of Ostertagia ostertagii, Dictiocaulus viviparus. In pigs, ivermectin is very effective against Ascaris suum, Hyostrongylus rubidus, Oesophagostomum spp, and adult forms of Strongyloides ransomi and Metastrongylus spp. It also exhibits excellent activity against external parasites, which cause scabies (Psoroptes, Sarcoptes) and against larval forms of Hypoderma spp.

CONTRAINDICATIONS
- Do not administer intramuscularly or intravenously.
- It is not administered to cattle the last 33 days of pregnancy. It is not administered to cattle and sheep that produce milk for human consumption. It is not used in sows at the beginning of pregnancy (1 - 40 days).
- Serious side reactions have been observed in dogs. For this reason Bremamectin does not it is indicated in dogs.

SIDE EFFECTS
Sometimes a temporary swelling can be observed at the injection site disappearing without treatment.

DOSAGE & ADMINISTRATION
- Subcutaneous injection.
- General dosage: 1 ml Bremamectin / 50 kg g.v. (0.2 mg ivermectin / kg g.w., in pigs: 0.3 mg ivermectin / kg g.w.)
- Cattle, sheep: 1 ml Bremamectin/50 kg g.w.
- Pigs: 1.5 ml Bremamectin/50 kg g.w.

RECOMMENDATIONS FOR ADMINISTRATION
One administration is enough. In sheep, the injection should be done after the formation of a fold in the area of ​​the chest at the sole (area without wool). In pigs, it is recommended to administer in a fold of the skin behind the ear. The injection site will be disinfected before administration.

WAITING TIME
- Meat and organs (cattle): 49 days
- Edible tissues (pig, sheep): 28 days
- It will not be used in cattle and sheep that produce milk for human consumption.

Manufactured by:
Bremer Pharma GmbH - Warburg - Germany
name: Bremamectin

description:
Synthetic prostaglandin hormone

COMPOSITION
- D-Cloprostenol (sodium)  75 mcg
- Excipient: Chlorocresol  1 mg
- Other excipients s.q.f.  1 ml

PHARMACODYNAMICS
- LUTEOSYL is a speciality based on a dextrorotatory cloprostenol which is a synthetic analogue of prostaglandin F2a. The dextrorotatory enantiomer is the biologically active luteolytic component of cloprostenol.
- LUTEOSYL is approximately 3.5 times more potent than similar specialities based on racemic cloprostenol. Therefore it can be used proportionally at a lower dose. LUTEOSYL is more efficacious and better tolerated than racemic cloprostenol.
- During the luteinizing stage of the oestrus cycle LUTEOSYL induces a decrease in the number of luteinizing hormone (LH) receptors in the ovary, awhich leads to a rapid regression of the corpus luteum and a decrease in progesterone levels. The anterior part of the pituitary gland increases the levels of follicle stimulating hormone (FSH). This allows a new follicle to mature, oestrus to appear and ovulation.

PHARMACOKINETICS
- The assays carried out in rats indicate that d-cloprostenol is more widely distributed a and more rapidly eliminated than racemic cloprostenol.
- D-cloprostenol reaches a maximum value 5 minutes after intramuscular administration in rats. These values decrease to a level close to zero after approximately 12 h.
- The maximum concentration is observed in the liver after 10-20 minutes. A decrease to values close to 1 x 10⁴ bmp/g is observed after 60-90 minutes. The elimination half-life is 5.7 hours for d-cloprostenol (less than that for racemic cloprostenol - which is 9.4 hours).
- The highest concentration in kidney is obtained after 5 minutes, followed by a reduction to extremely low values 45 minutes after administration. The concentration increases to maximum levels in the ovaries after 5-6 hours. Compared with racemic cloprostenol, the concentration of d-cloprostenol in ovary is 4-5 times higher in the first 20 minutes after administration.
- In the uterus the quantity of d-cloprostenol is 2-5 times that of racemic cloprostenol.
- The maximum concentration in muscle at the administration site is obtained in the first 5 minutes. The same concentration is obtained in other muscles in the same time. A rapid fall is observed after 45-60 minutes.
- A second peak is observed in the inoculation muscle after 2-6 hours.
- In cattle the maximum concentration of d-cloprostenol appears 1.5 hours after administration (1337.9 ± 123.75 pg/ml). A fall is observed from 1.5 hours post-administration. Low levels persist for 24 hours. The elimination constant is Ke = 0.428 hours. The biological half-life is 1 h 37 minutes.
- Bioavailability, calculated in accordance with the AUC, is 11404.23 pg/h/ml. 
- In swine the maximum plasma concentration is reached 10 minutes - 1.3 hours after administration, followed by a decrease to initial values after 5.17 ± 0.33 hours. The elimination half-life is 3.2 ± 0.39 hours. The elimination constant is 0.222 ± 0.03 hours.

TARGET SPECIES
Cows and sows.

INDICATIONS
• Cows:
» Indication for reproduction: synchronization or induction of oestrus. Induction to parturition.
» Therapeutics indications: ovarian dysfunction (persistent corpus luteum, luteal cyst), interruption of gestation including foetal mummification, endometritis/pyometra, delayed uterine involution.

• Sows:
» Indications for reproduction: Induction of parturition.

CONTRAINDICATIONS
Do not use in gestating animals unless it is desirable to induce parturition or therapeutic interruption of pregnancy.

ADVERSE REACTIONS
- In safety studies, at 10 times the therapeutic dose, no adverse reactions are reported. As no specific antidote has been identified, in the case of overdose, symptomatic therapy is advisable.
- If you notice any serious effects or other effects not mentioned in this leaflet,please inform your veterinary surgeon.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
Cows:
- Meat and offal: 1 day
- Milk: 0 hours

Sows:
- Meat and offal: 1 day

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
- LUTEOSYL is only administered by intramuscular route.

» Cows: The recommended dose is 2 ml per animal.
- Oestrus induction (also in cows with weak or silent heat): Administer the product after the presence of corpus luteum has been determined (6th-8th day of the cycle). Heat is normally observed after 48-60 hours. Inseminate 72-96 hours after the previous treatment. If heat is not observed, repeat after 11 days.
- Parturition Induction: Administer the product after the 270th day of gestation. Parturition should occur 30-60 hours after treatment.
- Oestrus synchronization: Administer the product twice (11 days apart). Inseminate artificially 72 and 96 hours after the second injection.
- Ovarian dysfunction: After the presence of corpus luteum has been determined, administer the product and inseminate during the first heat after treatment. If no heat is observed, carry out another gynaecological examination and repeat the injection 11 days after the first treatment.
- Endometritis or pyometra: Administer 1 dose of product. Repeat treatment 10 days later if necessary. Inseminate 72-96 hours after treatment.
- Gestation interruption: Administer the product in the first 150 days of gestation.
- Foetal mummification: Administer 1 dose of product. The foetus is expelled 3 or 4 days later.
- Retarded uterine involution: Administer 1 dose of product and, if indicated repeat treatment once or twice at 24 hour interval.

» Sows: The recommended dose is 1 ml per animal.
- Parturition induction: Administer the product from the 112th day of gestation. Repeat after 6 hours. Alternatively, 20 hours after the initial dose of d-cloprostenol, a myometrial stimulant (oxytocin or carazolol) may be administered. Following the protocol of double administration, in about 70% of cases, parturition occurs 19-30 hours after treatment.

ADVICE ON CORRECT ADMINISTRATION
As with parenteral administration of any substance, basic antiseptic rules should be observed. The injection site must be thoroughly cleaned and disinfected in order to reduce the risk of infection with anaerobic bacteria. Occurrence of anaerobic infections is likely if anaerobic bacteria penetrate the tissue of the injection site. This applies especially to intramuscular injection and in particular to cows. Typical local reactions due to anaerobic infection are swelling and crepitus at the injection site.

STORAGE PRECAUTIONS
- Shelf life: 2 years.
- Store in temperature not exceed 30°C and keep away from light.
- Shelf life after opening: 28 days and store in temperature not exceed 25°C.

SPECIAL WARNINGS
To the animals
- Do not use in gestating animals unless it is desirable to induce parturition or therapeutic interruption of pregnancy.
- Do not use in animals being treated with non-steroidal anti-inflammatories, as the synthesis of endogenous prostaglandins is inhibited.
- The activity of other oxytocic agents can be increased after the administration of Cloprostenol.

To the person
- D-cloprostenol like all F2a prostaglandins can be absorbed through the skin and can produce bronchospasm and abortion.
- Women of child-bearing age, asthmatics and persons with bronchial problems or any other type of respiratory problem must avoid any contact or use disposable plastic gloves when administering the product.
- The product must be handled carefully to avoid accidental self-injection or skin contact.
- Do not eat, drink or smoke while handling the product.
- In case of accidental self-injection seek medical advice and show the label to the physician.
- Seek medical advice immediately in case of any respiratory difficulty caused by accidental inhalation or inoculation.
- In case of accidental skin contact, wash with soap and water immediately.

DISPOSAL PRECAUTIONS
Any unused veterinary medicinal product or waste materials derived from such veterinary medicinal product should be disposed in accordance with local requirements. Ask your veterinary surgeon how to dispose of medicines no longer required. These measures should help to protect the environment.

OTHER INFORMATION
Package sizes: Carton box containing (2, 10, 20 ml) colorless glass (type II) vial equipped with bromobutyl stopper and aluminium cap with an outer label + insert leaflet.

Keep the product out of the reach and sight of children

Reg. M.O.H. No.: 3554/2014

To be supplied only on veterinary prescription.

Distributed in Egypt by:
TABA MEDICAL PHARMA

Manufactured by:
laboratorios syva s.a.u.
Avda. Párroco Pablo Díez, 49-57
24010 León (Spain)
name: Luteosyl

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Ketoprofen 100 mg

Indications:
In horses indicated for:
- The alleviation of inflammation and pain associated with musculo-skeletal disorders and alleviation of visceral pain associated with colic in horses, safe in pregnant mares.

In cattle indicated for:
- The supportive treatment of parturient paresis associated with calving.
- Reducing the pyrexia and distress associated with bacterial respiratory disease when used in conjunction with antimicrobial therapy as appropriate.
- Improving the recovery rate in acute clinical mastitis, including acute endotoxin mastitis, caused by gram negative micro-organisms, in conjunction with antimicrobial therapy.
- Reducing oedema of the udder associated with calving.

Dosage and route of administration: 
- Cattle: 3 ml /100 kg B. wt, once a day, administered by intravenous, deep intramuscular or subcutaneous injection, the dose could be repeated for 3 days.

- Horses:
• Equine colic: 1 ml / 50 kg B. wt, administered by intravenous injection for rapid action, the dose could be repeated if colic occurs again.
• Musculoskeletal disorders: 1 ml / 50 kg B. wt, once a day, administered by intravenous, the dose could be repeated for 3 - 5 days.

- Dogs: 0.2 ml /100 kg B. wt, once a day, administered by intravenous, deep intramuscular or subcutaneous injection, the dose could be repeated for 3 days.

- Cats:
• By oral route: 0.1 ml / 10 kg once a day for 5 days.
• By subcutaneous route: 0.2 ml / 10 once a day for 3 days.
name: Badofen

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml contains
- Ivermectin 1 gm

Properities
- Ivermectin is a broad-spectrum endectocide of the avermectin family. Ivermectin is isolated after purification and hydrogenation of the avermectin-family compounds which are obtained from the fermentation of the soil organism streptomyces avermitilis. Ivermectin is a macrocyclic-lactone derivative which has a broad and potent antiparasitic activity against nematodes and arthropods. It acts by inhibiting nerve impulses. Ivermectin binds selectively and with high affinity to glutamate gated chloride ion channels which ocour in invertebrate nerve and muscle cells. This leads to an increase in the permeability of the cell membrane to chloride ions with hyperpolarization of the nerve or muscle cell, resulting in paralysis and death of the relevant parasites.
- Compounds of this class may also interact with other ligand-gated chloride channels,. such as those gated by the neurotransmiuer gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA). The margin of safety for compounds of this class is atributable to the fact that mammals do not have glutamate-gated chloride channels.
- The macrocyclic lactones have a low affinity for other mammalian ligand-gated chloride channels and they do not readily cross the blood-brain barrier.

Indication:
- Ivectin injectable solution is indicated for the treatment and control of the following species of gastro-intestinal roundworms, lungworms, eyeworms, warbles, mites and lice.
- Gastro-intestinal roundworms (adult and fourth-stage larvae): Ostertagia Ostertagi ( including inhibited O Ostertagi), Ostertagia lyrata, Haemonchus placei, Trichostrongylus axei, Trichostrongylus Colubriformis, Cooperia oncophora, Cooperia punctata, Cooperia pectinata, Bunostomum phlebotomum, Oesophagostomum radiatum, Strongyloides papillosus (adult), Nematodirus helvatianus(adult), Nematodirus spathiger (adult), Trichuris spp. (adult)
- Lungworms (adult and fourth-stage larvae): Dictyocaulus viviparus
- Eyeworms (adult): Thelazia spp.
- Warbles (parasitic stages): Hypoderma bovis, Hypoderma lineatum
- Mange mites: Psoroptes bovis, Sarcoptes scabei var. bovis
- Sucking lice: Linognathus vituli, Haematopinus eurysternus, Solenopotes capillatus
- Ivectin injectable solution may also be used as an aid in the control of the biting louse Damalinia bovis and the mange mite Chorioptes bovis, but Complete elimination may not.

Target species: Cattle & sheep

Dosage & administration:
1 ml per 50 kg (2 mg ivermectin per 10 kg b.w.) by SC injection under the loose skin in front of or behind the shoulder, and repeat after 3 weeks.

Warnings and precautions:
- Care should be taken to avoid the following practices because they increase the risk of development of resistance and could ultimately result in inefective therapy.
- Too frequent and repeated use of anthelmintics from the same class, over an extended period of time.
- Under dosing, which may be due to underestimation of body weight misadministration of the product, or lack of calibration of the dosing device.
- Do not smoke, eat or drink whilst handling the product.
- Do not used for young pet animals.

Contra-indications:
- Do not use in cattle producing milk for human consumption.
- Should not be used for lactating animals.
- Do not administer intravenously or intramuscularly.
- Do not use in non-lactating cows including pregnant heifers within 60 days of calving.

Adverse effects:
At therapeutic doses, ivermectin has no adverse effect on cattle.

Withdrawal time:
- Cattle: 49 days
- Sheep: 42 days

Storage condition:
- Store at temperature not exceeding 30° C, in dry place.
- Keep away from reach of children.

Packaging:
20, 50, 100 ml glass vial with outer label & insert leaflet in carton box.

Manufactured by:
Badr pharma for Pharmaceutical Industries For Mam Egypt Pharmaceuticals
name: Ivectin 1%

description:
Composition
Each ml of contains:
- Florfenicol 300 mg

Indications
NIXFLOR Injectable Solution of synthetic antibiotic is indicated for treatment of bovine respiratory disease (BRID), associated with Pasteurella haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida, and Haemophilus somnus, and for the treatment of bovine interdigital phlegmon (foot rot, acute interdigital necrobacillos, infectious pododermatitis) associated wth Fusobacterium necrophorum and Bacteroides melaninogenrctrs. Also it's indicated for the control of respiratory disease in cattle at high risk of developing BRD associated with associated with Pasteurella haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida, and Haemophilus somnus.

Target species: Cattle

Dosage & administration:
For treatment or bovine respiratory disease (BRD) and bovine interdigital phlegmon (foot rot): administered by intramuscular injection to cattle at a dose rate of 20 mg / kg body weight (1 mL / 15 kgb.wt). A second dose should be administered 48 hours later.

Warnings & Precautions:
- Avoid direct contact with eyes and skin.

Contra-Indications:
- Not be used in cattle producing milk for human consumption.
- Administration to breeding cattle not recommended.
- Not used for calves less than 38 days.
- Should not be used in calves intended for veal production.
- Not used for poultry.

Side Effects
- Transient decrease in appetite and softening of stool.
- Inflammatory lesions at site of injection.

Withdrawal Time:
- Cattle: 30 days

Storage condition:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C and valid to 50 days after opening under storage temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Presentation:
50, 100, 250 and 500 ml glass vials.

MANUFACTURED BY
Arab Company For Medical Product (ARABCOMED) For Al Obour Company
name: Nixflor 30%

description:
Composition:
- Levofloxacin HCL  100 mg
- Tocopherol acetate  100 mg
- Thioglycerol  1 mg
- M-cresol  2 mg
- Excipient to 1 ml

Pharmaceutical Form:
Solution for injection.

Target species: Cattle & Sows

Uses:
- Treatment of soft tissue and skin infection.
- Treatment of urinary tract infection.
- Treatment of respiratory tract infection.

Indications:
Cattle:
- Treatment of respiratory infections caused by sensitive strains of Pasteurella multocida, Mannheimia (Pasteurella) haemolytica and Mycoplasma bovis.
- Treatment of acute mastitis caused by E. coli strains sensitive to Levofloxacin during the lactation period.

Sows:
- Treatment of Metritis-Mastitis-Agalactia Syndrome caused by bacterial strains sensitive to Levofloxacin.

Dosage:
- 1 ml / 20 kg b.wt. or 5ml/kg/day
- by intramuscular injection, however subcutaneous route is recommended.

Contraindications:
- Bacterial infections with resistance to other fluoroquinolones (cross resistance).
- Do not administer to an animal previously found to be hypersensitive to Levofloxacin or other quinolones.

Special precautions for animals:
- Fluoroquinolones should be reserved for the treatment of clinical conditions which have responded poorly, or are expected to respond poorly, to other classes of antimicrobials.
- Whenever possible, fluoroquinolones should only be used based on susceptibility testing official and local antimicrobial policies should
be taken into account when the product is used.
- Use cf the product deviating from the instructions given in the SPC may increase the prevalence of bacteria resistant to the fluoroquinolones and may decrease the effectiveness of treatment with other quinolones due to the potential for cross resistance.
- Efficacy data have shown an insufficient efficacy of the product for the treatment of acute mastitis caused by Gram positive strains.

Adverse reactions:
- Administration by the intramuscular route may cause transient local reactions such as pain and swelling at the injection site and inflammatory lesions which persist at least 12 days after injection. 
- However, in cattle, subcutaneous route was shown to be better tolerated locally than intramuscular route. Therefore, the subcutaneous route is recommended in heavy cattle. For the injections, the neck should be preferred in cattle and pigs.
- No other undesirable effects have been observed in cattle and pigs.

Storage:
- In a dry place away from direct sunlight.
- Shelf life: 2 years
name: Novocyl 10

description:
DIPIRONA, a soluble derivative of pyrazolone, has analgesic and antipyretic action and belongs to the class of non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs. The antipyretic and analgesic action of Dipyrone has its effects at the hypothalamic level, in the thermoregulatory center of body temperature, and influences the synthesis of prostaglandins and proteolytic enzymes. Its injectable use is particularly convenient due to its high solubility in water.

FORMULA:
Each 100 ml of product contains:
- Sodium dipyrone  50 gm
- vehicle q.s.p.  100 ml

INDICATIONS: Indicated for cattle, dogs, goats, horses, cats, sheep and pigs to relieve muscle pain, colic, inflammatory processes, fever and post surgical interventions. Auxiliary in the treatment of pneumonia, bronchitis, nephritis and cystitis, among other infectious processes.

DOSAGE AND INSTRUCTIONS FOR USE: Dipyrone IBASA 50% can be applied intramuscularly or intravenously. The injection site in the animal must be previously disinfected.
- Cattle, goats, horses, sheep and pigs 1 ml per 10 kg of weight (50 mg/kg).
- Dogs and cats: 0.6 ml per 10 kg of weight (30 mg/kg).
- Administer every 12 hours until symptoms disappear or at the discretion of the veterinarian.

CONTRAINDICATIONS:
Dipyrone IBASA 50% is contraindicated in animals hypersensitive to the drug due to the possibility of anaphylactic shock after intravenous administration. The product should not be administered to animals with heart, liver or kidney failure.

ATTENTION:
• GOATS AND SHEEP:
- THE SLAUGHTER OF ANIMALS TREATED WITH THIS PRODUCT MUST BE CARRIED OUT 1 DAY AFTER THE LAST APPLICATION.
- MILK FROM ANIMALS TREATED WITH THIS PRODUCT MUST NOT BE INTENDED FOR HUMAN CONSUMPTION UNTIL 1 DAY AFTER THE LAST APPLICATION OF THIS PRODUCT. 

• EQUINES AND PIGS: SLAUGHTER-THE SLAUGHTER OF THE ANIMALS TREATED WITH THIS PRODUCT SHOULD BE CARRIED OUT 1 DAY AFTER THE LAST APPLICATION. 

• THE USE OF THE PRODUCT UNDER CONDITIONS OTHER THAN INDICATED IN THIS PACKAGE LEAFLET MAY CAUSE THE PRESENCE OF RESIDUES ABOVE THE LIMITS, RENDERING THE FOOD OF ANIMAL ORIGIN UNSUITABLE FOR CONSUMPTION.

STORAGE CONDITIONS:
Keep the product at room temperature (15°C to 30°C). Store away from the reach of children and animals.

SOLD UNDER PRESCRIPTION AND APPLICATION ACCORDING TO THE INSTRUCTIONS OF THE VETERINARY DOCTOR.

Manufactured by
Laboratorio IBASA LTDA
Porto Alegre - RS - Brasil
name: Dipirona

description:
Composition:
Contains per ml:
• Vitamin A  80000 IU
• Vitamin D3  40000 IU
• Vitamin E  20 mg
• Excipients to 1 ml

DESCRIPTION:
- Vitamin A is involved in the process of formation and preservation of function of epithelial tissues and mucous membranes, is important for fertility and is essential for vision.
- Vitamin D3 regulates and corrects calcium and phosphorus metabolism in blood and plays an important role in the uptake of calcium and phosphorus from the intestine. Especially in young, growing animals vitamin D3 is essential for the normal development of skeleton and teeth.
- Vitamin E is, as a fat-soluble intracellular antioxidant, involved in stabilizing unsaturated fatty acids, thereby preventing toxic lipo-peroxides formation. Furthermore, vitamin E protects the Oxygen-sensitive vitamin A from oxidative destruction in this preparation.

INDICATIONS:
UNI-AD3E-VIT is a well-balanced combination of vitamin A, vitamin D3 and vitamin E for calves, cattle, goat, sheep, horse, cats and dogs.

UNI-AD3E-VIT is used for:
- Prevention or treatment of vitamin A, vitamin D3 and vitamin E deficiencies in farm animals.
- Prevention or treatment of stress (caused by vaccination, diseases, transport, high humidity, high temperatures or extreme temperature changes).
- Improvment of feed conversion.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION:
• Cattle and horse: 10 ml
• Calves and foals: 5 ml
• Goat and sheep: 3 ml
• Dogs: 1 - 5 ml
• Cats: 1 - 2 ml
Repeat treatment only on advice of your veterinarian.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD: NIL.

STORAGE:
- Store in a dry, dark place at room temperature
- Keep medicine away from children.

Manufacturing by:
UNIVERSAL ANIMAL CARE (UAC) FOR VETERINARY MEDICINES AND FEED ADOITIVES
name: Uni-AD3E-Vit

description:
Virbazene® is indicated for the treatment of Piroplasmosis caused by Babesia bigemina, B. argentina, B. bovis, B. pergens and Trypanosomiasis caused by T. evansi and T. vivax in cattle and horses.

PRESENTATION
Amber glass vial containing 30ml or 50ml.

FORMULA
Each 100 ml contains:
- Diminazene diaceturate   7 g
- Vehicle q.s.p   100 mL

INDICATIONS
Virbazene is indicated for the treatment of piroplasmosis caused by Babesia bigemina, B. argentina, B. bovis, B. divergens and trypanosomiasis caused by T. evansie T. vivax in cattle and horses.

ROUTE OF ADMINISTRATION AND MODE OF USE
Virbazene should be administered by the deep intramuscular route, according to with the following dosages:
- Piroplasmosis in cattle: 3.5 mg/kg body weight, in a single dose.
- bovine and equine trypanosomiasis: 3.5 mg/kg of body weight, in a dose only.

ATTENTION:
CATTLE:
- SLAUGHTER SLAUGHTER OF TREATED ANIMALS MUST ONLY BE CARRIED OUT 30 DAYS AFTER THE LAST APPLICATION.
- MILK FROM ANIMALS TREATED WITH THIS PRODUCT MUST NOT BE INTENDED FOR HUMAN CONSUMPTION WITHIN 7 DAYS AFTER THE LAST APPLICATION.
- THE USE OF THE PRODUCT UNDER CONDITIONS DIFFERENT FROM THOSE INDICATED IN THIS PACKAGE MAY CAUSE THE PRESENCE OF PRODUCT RESIDUES ABOVE THE APPROVED LIMITS, MAKING THE FOOD OF ANIMAL ORIGIN UNSUITABLE FOR CONSUMPTION.

STORAGE:
Store in a dry and cool place, between 15ºC and 30ºC, away from direct sunlight. and out of reach of children and pets. In this conditions, the product is valid for 2 (two) years after the date of manufacture.

SALE UNDER PRESCRIPTION AND USE UNDER THE GUIDANCE OF THE VETERINARY DOCTOR.

description:
BOVIVAX LSD-N Freeze-dried vaccine of live attenuated Lumpy Skin Disease virus of cattle.

COMPOSITION
Each dose of vaccine contains:
- Live attenuated Lumpy Skin Desease virus, strain Neethling  ≥ 10^3,5 TCID50

INDICATION
Prophylactic immunisation of cattle against Lumpy Skin Disease.

CONTRAINDICATIONS
None

ADVERSE REACTIONS
A limited number of cattle may develop a swelling at the injection site. These swellings will disappear in time leaving no after effects.

DOSAGE & ADMINISTRATION
• Apply usual aseptic procedures.
• The vaccine must be suspended in the sterile diluent provided: by means of a sterile syringe, transfer about 2 to 5 ml of the sterile diluent to the vial containing the freezedried vaccine. Mix thoroughly until the powder is dissolved. Transfer the suspension back to the remaining sterile diluent and mix well again. The vaccine is now ready for use and it must be injected without delay.
• Administer the vaccine subcutaneously, at the dose of 2 ml per animal.

» Vaccination Schedule
• Primary-vaccination:
- Calves from vaccinated mothers: vaccination is carried out from the age of 6 months.
- Calves from unvaccinated mothers: vaccination is carried out from any age.

• Booster: one annual injection.

Note: It is preferable to vaccinate animals before the risk period: early spring.

INTERACTION
No information is available on the safety and efficacy of this vaccine associated with any other veterinary medicinal product. The decision to use this vaccine before or after any other veterinary medicinal product needs to be made on a case by case basis.

INCOMPATIBILITIES
Do not mix with other medicines, except the sterile diluent provided.

OVERDOSE
No adverse reactions other than those reported in section "Adverse reactions" were observed after the administration of 10 vaccine doses.

PREGNANCY & LACTATION
Tolerated

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
- For Person
• Avoid contact with eyes, hands and clothing.
• In case of accidental self-injection, seek medical advice immediately and show the package leaflet or the label to the physician.

- Other Precautions 
• Handle animals as per standard practices.
• Avoid exposure of the reconstituted vaccine to direct sunlight and high temperatures during inoculation.
• Use only clean, antiseptic and/or disinfectant-free equipment for vaccine solution prepa- ration and injection purposes.
• Disinfect the injection site and avoid inadvertent trauma.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
Zero day

STORAGE PRECAUTIONS:
- Store and transport at a temperature between +2°C and +8°C, protect from light.
- After reconstitution: use immediately.

PACK SIZES:
- Vial of 25 doses of freeze-dried vaccine + Vial of 50 ml of MCI Sterile Diluent.
- Vial of 50 doses of freeze-dried vaccine + Vial of 100 ml of MCI Sterile Diluent.
- Vial of 100 doses of freeze-dried vaccine + Vial of 200 ml of MCI Sterile Diluent.

DISPOSAL OF PRODUCTS
Any unused veterinary medicinal product or waste materials derived from such veterinary medicinal products should be disposed of in accordance with local requirements.
name: Bovivax LSD-N

Indication

name: Moksol 20%

description:
COVEXIN 10
CLOSTRIDIAL VACCINE FOR SHEEP AND CATTLE, FOR ANIMAL TREATMENT ONLY.

PRESENTATION
- A fluid adjuvanted vaccine for injection with a precipitate which resuspends on shaking.
- Covexin 10 contains toxoids of Clostridium perfringens (types A, B, C and D). C. novyi (type B), C. septicum, C. tetani, C. sordellii and C. haemolyticum and whole cell culture of C. chauvoei.
- Covexin 10 also contains potash alum adjuvant and 0.015% w/v thiomersal as a preservative.

PRECAUTIONS
This vaccine contains thiomersal at 0.015% w/v. This material may cause a mild allergy reaction in sensitive individual contact. Avoid skin contact.

USES
» For the active immunization of sheep and cattle from 2 weeks of age against diseases caused by Clostridium perfringens type A (enterotoxaemia, gas gangrene), C. perfringens type B (lamb dysentery, enterotoxaemia), C. perfringens type C (enterotoxaemia, struck), C. perfringens type D (enterotoxaemia, pulpy kidney), C. chauvoei (black leg, black quarter, post parturient gangrene), C. novyi type B (black disease, infectious necrotic hepatitis), C. septicum (malignant oedema, braxy), C. tetani (tetanus), C. sordellii (sudden death syndrome), and C. haemolyticum (red water disease).
» The clinical significance of these diseases in cattle and sheep has not yet been established in New Zealand.
» Full protection develops within 14 days of administration of the second dose. Duration of immunity is approximately 12 months from initial vaccination. Studies show that revaccination every 12 months is adequate to generate and maintain immunity. Where high levels of challenge are anticipated, more frequent booster vaccination may need to be considered.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
» Dose
- Sheep and lambs over 2 weeks of age: 1 mL
- Cattle and calves over 2 weeks of age: 2 mL

» Vaccination programme
- The primary course of immunization consists of two injections, allowing an interval of 4-6 weeks between them. An annual booster vaccination is required at intervals of not more than twelve months following the primary course.
- Vaccinations should be completed at least two weeks before maximum immunity is required. This may be either a period of risk or in pregnant animals prior to parturition.
- Previously sensitized ewes/cows should be injected 2-6 weeks before parturition is due to commence. This provides passive protection of the lamb/calf, via the colostrum (Note: The degree of protection passed to offspring from the dam will vary depending on the dam's level of immunity and the amount of colostrum absorbed by the lamb/calf. These factors are affected by the overall vaccination programme, time since dam vaccination, offspring's ability to suckle, suckling frequency, and number of offspring being suckled. Therefore within a herd/flock there may be varying time periods of protection.).
- In lambs passive protection will last for at least 12 weeks against C. tetani, C. novyi, C. perfringens B, C and D and C. sordellii and for up to two weeks against C. septicum, C. perfringens A and C. chauvoei.
- In calves passive protection will last for at least 12 weeks against C. tetani, C. novyi, C. perfringens B, C and D, up to 8 weeks for C. septicum and up to 2 weeks for C. sordellii, C. chauvoei, C. perfringens A and C and C. haemolyticum.
- The vaccine may be used in lambs and calves as young as two weeks of age regardless of serum antitoxin levels acquired from maternal transfer.

» Administration
By subcutaneous injection in the loose skin on the side of the neck, observing aseptic precautions. The container must be shaken well before doses are withdrawn.

DIRECTIONS FOR USE
» Equipment
• Use sharp needles
• Change needles frequently (every 12 to 20 sheep)
• Needles and vaccinating guns should be sterile before starting. Needles can be sterilized by boiling for 10 minutes and storing in methylated spirits.

» Assembly of VAXIPAK and draw-off set
1. Attach end of draw-off tube to the vaccinating gun.
2. Pierce rubber bung of VAXIPAK with draw-off needle, ensuring that plastic overcap snaps into position on the VAXIPAK cap.
3. The plastic cord is provided for hanging COVEXIN 10 in a convenient position e.g. from neck, belt, or rail.

» Vaccination
• Ensure vaccinating gun delivers correct dose.
• Vaccinate only clean, dry animals
• Inject in the anterior (front) half of the neck.
• Inject subcutaneously i.e., between the skin and muscle.
• Part the wool, raise the skin to form a 'tent' and insert the needle into the "tent opening" so that the needle is almost parallel with the neck.

CONTRA-INDICATIONS, WARNINGS, ETC
» Contra-indications
- Do not vaccinate unhealthy sheep or cattle, or animals which may be affected by subclinical disease or physiological stress, without the advice of a veterinarian.
- No information is available on the safety and efficacy of the concurrent use of this vaccine with any other. It is therefore recommended that no other vaccines should be administered within 14 days before or after vaccination with this product.

» Warnings
- Syringes and needles should be sterilized before use and the injection should be made through an area of clean, dry skin, taking precautions against contamination.
- Part-used containers of the vaccine should be discarded at the end of the day's operation, as under field conditions it may be difficult to avoid accidental contamination. Used containers should be disposed of in a landfill or by incineration.
- Use of this product may cause transient local reactions to occur at the injection site particularly where careful vaccination technique has not been used.

» Cattle
Swelling may occur at the site of injection which should resolve within 1-2 months. The incidence and severity may be higher in calves less than one month of age.

» Sheep
Swelling may occur at the site of injection which should resolve within 1-2 months post vaccination.

» Side-effects
As with any vaccine occasional hypersensitivity reactions may occur. In such cases appropriate treatment such as adrenalin or antihistamine should be administered without delay.

WITHHOLDING PERIOD
- Milk: Nil
- Meat: Nil

STORAGE
Store refrigerated between +2°C and +8°C, protected from light. DO NOT FREEZE. Opened Vaxipaks should be discarded within 8 hours of opening.

PACKAGE QUANTITIES
100 mL and 250 mL flexible packs

FURTHER INFORMATION
Should lambing/calving extend over a period of more than six weeks, the duration of transferred colostral protection in the later horn offspring may be shortened. These lambs/calves should be given their first dose of Covexin 10 from two weeks of age. In any animal population there may be a small number of individuals which fail to respond fully to vaccination. Successful vaccination depends upon correct storage and administration of the vaccine together with the animal's ability to respond. This can be influenced by such factors as genetic constitution, intercurrent infection, age nutritional status, concurrent drug therapy and stress.

Manufactured and distributed by:
Schering-Plough Animal Health Limited, 33 Whakatiki Street, Upper Hutt, New Zealand.

COVEXIN is a registered trademark of Schering-Plough Animal Health Limited.
©Schering-Plough Animal Health Limited 2002.
name: Covexin 10

description:
Bovilis BOVIPAST RSP AQUEOUS SUSPENSION FOR SUBCUTANEOUS INJECTION

COMPOSITION:
Each dose (5 ml) aqueous suspension contains:
- At least 10^5.5 TCID50 inactivate BRS-virus (strain EV 908)
- At least 10^7.3 TCID50 inactivated Parainfluenza-3-Virus (strain SF-4-Reisinger), together with 9 x 10^9 cells of inactivated Mannheimia haemolyica (former name: Pasteurella haemolytica) bacteria (serotype A1, A6) propagated under conditions of iron restriction.

Aluminum hydroxide and Quil A are included as adjuvants. Thiomersal is included as a preservative.

INDICATION
For the active immunization of cattle to reduce infection and lesions of Bovine Respiratory Syncytial-Virus, Parainfluenza-3 virus and Mannheimia haemolytica serotype A1 and A6 infections.

ADMINISTRATION
Vaccination dose: 5 ml by subcutaneous injection at the side of the neck.

VACCINATION PROGRAM
- Basic immunization: Animals from approximately 2 weeks of age or over should receive two vaccinations separated by an interval of approximately 4 weeks.
- Booster doses: If booster doses are required, they should be given approximately 2 weeks before each further risk period (e.g. transport, introduction into a herd, change of housing).

SPECIAL PRECAUTION(S) FOR USE
- The basic immunisation should be started in time, so that immunity has fully developed by the beginning of the period of risk. The basic immunization of calves should be completed prior to housing or should be performed in the housing unit under quarantine.
- It is advisable to vaccinate all animals in a herd in order to minimize the infectious potential unless there is a contraindication. Failure to vaccinate individual animals may promote the transmission of pathogens and development of disease
- Respiratory infections in calves are often associated with poor hygiene. Thus, general improvements in hygiene are important to support the effect of vaccination.

CONTRAINDICATIONS AND WARNINGS
- Avoid vaccination of animals with intercurrent diseases, heavy parasitic infestation or in a poor general condition.
- The vaccine contains an adjuvant and therefore vaccination may result in a transient local reaction. Additionally, a transient slight rise in body temperature, lasting o maximum of 3 days, may occur after vaccination.
- As with all vaccines occasionally hypersensitivity reactions may occur.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD: Zero days

STORAGE CONDITIONS / PRECAUTIONS
- The vaccine has to be stored at +2°C to +8°C and must not be used beyond the date of expiry as given on the package and container.
- Broached vials should be used within 10 hours after first opening.
- Shake well before use.
- Protect from sunlight and freezing

PRESENTATIONS
50 ml bottle

Product of INTERVET INTERNATIONAL BOXMEER HOLLAND

FOR ANIMAL TREATMENT ONLY

KEEP OUT OF REACH AND SIGHT OF CHILDREN

Egypt Reg No: 609 M.O.A

Imported by 
Intervet Egypt for Animal Health
Cairo Egypt
name: Bovilis Bovipast RSP

description:
Composition:
Each ml contains:
- Vitamin E (a-tocopherol acetate)  50 mg
- Sodium selenite  0.5 mg
- Solvents ad.  1 ml

Description:
- Vitamin E is a fat-soluble intracellular antioxidant, involved in stabilising unsaturated fatty acids. the main antioxidant property is preventing formation of toxic free radicals and oxidation of the unsaturated fatty acids in the body. these free radicals can be formed in periods of disease or stress in the body. Selenium is an essential nutrient for animals.
- Selenium is a component of the enzyme glutathione peroxidase, which plays an important role in protection of cells by destroy oxidising agents like free radicals and oxidated unsaturated fatty acids.

Indications:
- Vitamin E deficiencies (like encephalomalacia, muscular dystrophy, exudative diathesis, infertility problems) in calves, cattle, goats, sheep and swine.
- Prevention of iron-intoxication after administration of iron to piglets.

Side effects:
No undesirable effects are to be expected when the prescribed dosage regimen is followed.

Dosage & administration:
- For intramuscular or subcutaneous injection.
- Calves, goats and sheep: 2 ml per 10 kg body weight, repeat after 2 - 3 weeks.
- Swine: 1 ml per 10 kg body weight, repeat after 2 - 3 weeks.

Withdrawal times: None

Warning:
Keep out of reach of children

Packing: Vial of 100 ml
name: Sodium selenite & Vit E

description:
Composition:
Each ml contains:
- Diclofenac Sodium  500 mg
- Excipient  q.s. 1 ml

Indications
Diclofenac sodium is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug derived from phenylacetate. Used for the treatment of arthritis, rheumatism and muscle aches. Reduce fever caused by types of bacteria, virus and some other factors.

Dosage and Administration:
» Intramuscular injection once a day, for 2 to 3 days in succession.
- Cattle: 2.5 mg / kg b.w. (5 ml for 100 Kg)
- Pigs: 5 mg / kg b.w. (5 ml for 50 kg)
- Sheep and goats: 2.5 mg / kg b.w. (1.5 ml for 30 kg)

Withdrawal Time:
- Meat: 28 days
- Milk: 7 days

Storage:
Store sealed protected from light.

MFD BY: ÁLCION Laboratorios - Spain
name: Diclo-cion 5%

description:
Flyblock® for protection of cattle against dipterans in the pasture.

Contains in 1 ml: 
- Cyfluthrin 10 mg
- essential oil of citronella

Flyblock is applied for the protection of cattle during the grazing season against infestation of dipterans-gadflies, botflies, mosquitoes, blackflies and zoophilous flies.

ADMINISTRATION.
- Flyblock® is applied on dry intact back skin along the vertebral column from withers to sacral bone once at the dose of 10 ml per animal. Protective action of the preparation starts in 3-4 hours after treatment and continues up to 28 days.
- During the summer period when insects are active the whole herd should be treated simultaneously with the interval of 3-4 weeks. Flyblock® is applied for milk cows after milking.
name: FlyBlock

description:
CONTAINS PER ML:
- Xylazine (base equivalent) 100 mg (present as the hydrochloride)
- methyiparaben  0.9 mg
- propylparaben  0.1 mg
- water for injection
- citric acid and sodium citrate for pH adjustment to 5.5 ±0.3.

TARGET SPECIES
Horses and Cervidae

INDICATION
- As sedative and analgesic for Horse and Cervidae.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION:
Horse:

Cervidae:

description:

Each ml contains:
- Sulfadimidine Sodium  215.8 mg (eq to 200 mg Sulfadimidine)

Target species
Cattle, Horse & Swine.

Indications:
Treatment of infectious diseases germs sensitive to Sulfadimidine and Trimethoprim; e.g., primary and secondary infections of the respiratory tract, the gastrointestinal tract, the urogenital tract, the skin and the claws.
