description:
Composition
Inactivated Parapox ovis virus

Indication
For the prevention and treatment of infectious and / or stress -induced diseases, by stimulating the inmune response in dogs, cats, horses, cattle and pigs. In cattle and horses it is indicated for respiratory herpes virus infections, reducing clinical symptoms and virus excretion. In the cat, it has been shown a reduction of clinical symptoms during calicivirus respiratory virus infection. A reduction of clinical symptoms was detected in dogs, cattle and horse during crowding  associated infectious respiratory disease: in pigs suffering from respiratory diseases and in crowding-associated enteric disease (PWDS). The stimulation of non-specific immune mechanisms begins rapidly within a few hours to 2 days. The duration of action is about 10 to 14 days after the last injection.

Dosage and administration
- The dose for dogs and cats is 1 ml of the resuspended product, regardless of the age and weight of the animal. Subcutaneous injection.
- The dose for horses, cattle and pigs is 2 ml of the resuspended product, regardless of the age and weight of the animal.  Intramuscular injection.

Precautions of storage
- Store at 2° - 8° C. Do not freeze. Use entire contents when first opened.
- Sterilized syringes and needles should be used to administer this immunomodulator.

Packaging 
- 5 x 1 dose vials of immunomodulator. Rehydrate to 2 mL.
- 5 x 2 mL vials of sterile diluent.
name: Zylexis

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Triclabendazole base  100 mg

Indications:
TRICAZANAMED is an anthelmintic used for treatment and control of liver flukes (Fasciola hepatica) infections in sheep, cattle and buffalo, It's highly effective against all stages of fasciola hepatica, one day forms to adult fluke.

Dosage:
- Oral administration by drenching gun.
» Cattle & Buffalo: 6 ml / 50 Kg.b.w once.
» Sheep & Goats: 2.5 ml / 25 Kg.b.w once.

Withdrawal Period: 28 days.

Contraindication:
- The drug is contraindicated in early pregnancy.
- Don't use it in animals producing milk for human consumption.

Side Effects:
It's well tolerated in sheep and cattle at 200 mg / Kg.There is no evidence of teratogenicity or embryotoxicity in rats The safety margin is 20.

Precautions:
- Wash your hands after use.
- Dispose of used containers safely.
- Clean drenching equipment before and after use.

Storage:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C and valid for 28 days after opening at the same temp.

Manufactured By:
Sigma Pharmaceutical Industries For United Biomed

For Veterinary Use Only
name: Tricazanamed

description:
COMPOSITION:
- Magnesium chloride  108 g
- Sodium chloride 39%  45.20 g
- Manganese sulfate  7.60 g
- Zinc sulfate  11.221 g
- Copper sulfate  2.615 g
- Cobalt chloride  92.40 g
- Calcium chloride 36%  103 g
- Phosphoric acid 85% P 30%  235 g
- Purified Water Up to 1 Liter

INDICATIONS:
- UCCMAPHOS is a strong balanced. formula of essential minerals and trace elements in the form of diacid phosphate which are essential to the enzymatic metabolic processes.
- UCCMAPHOS is used in case of mineral deficiency.
- UCCMAPHOS is used to maintain calcium and phosphorus balance.
- UCCMAPHOS is used to avoid cannibalism, bone deformities, rickets, retarded growth and sterility.
- UCCMAPHOS is used to increase egg production, hatchability also to improve the egg shell quality.

description:
Composition:
Each 100 gm contains:
- Oxytetracycline HCl  20 gm (Eq to 18.53 gm Oxytetracycline base).

Indications:
1. Broiler chickens:
- Infectious synovitis caused by
- Mycoplasma synoviae.
- Fowl cholera caused by Pasteurella multocida.

2. Pre-Ruminant animals & Swine: Bacterial enteritis caused by Escherichia coli, and Salmonella choleraesuis.

Dosage & Administration:
For oral administration in the drinking water or as a drench.
- Chickens: 1 gm / 1 L of drinking water for 3 to 5 days.
- Pre-Ruminant animal: 1 gm / 40 kg of body weight every 12 hours, given as a drench in water.
- Swine: 1 gm / 20 kg of body weight every 12 hours, as a drench.

• Medicated water should be freshly prepared.
• The duration of treatment should not exceed five days.

Withdrawal Period
Meat:
- Chickens: 7 days.
- Swine, calves: 10 days.

Storage Condition:
Store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C, away from direct sunlight, in a dry place and keep out of reach of children.

Shelf life: 3 years.
Usage after reconstitution: Within 24 hours and store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C.

M.O.H. Reg. No.:1226/2008

Manufactured by:
ADWIA Co. S.A.E, 10th of Ramadan City
Made in Egypt
name: Oxytetracycline HCL

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Oxytetracycline HCl  3 gm (eq to 2.78 gm base)

Properties:
- Oxytetracyline injectable solution is stable, non-irritating, and adequately absorbed from site of injection.
- Oxytetracycline interferes with the normal development of the protein combination necessary for bacterial growth. So, it acts against a wide range of Gram-positive and Gram-negative organisms and has additional property against certain protozoa such as Anaplasma, Theileria.

Indications:
Oxytetracyline is indicated in infection where broad spectrum activity is required and in case of infections with organisns sensitive to it:
- Enteric infections due to E. coli, Salmonella.
- Respiratory infections due to Mycoplasma spp., Pasteurella spp., especially in cattle
- Anaplasmosis due to protozoa Anaplasma marginade occur in cattle and related ruminants.
- Theileriosis: Due to theileria parva occur in cattle.

Precautions:
- Used cautiously in renal or hepatic impairment.
- Avoid subcutaneous injection in horses.
- Used cautiously in horses exposed to stress or surgery.
- This product should not be diluted with solution of calcium salt as this will cause precipitation.

Animals treated:
Cattle, sheep, goats, horses, foals, lambs.

Dosage and Administration:
- By Intramuscular or subcutaneous injection, 5 - 10 ml / kg (0.17 -0.33 mg /kg ) daily for 3 - 5 days.
- The dose should be given in two equally divided doses at 12 hr intervals.

Withdrawal period:
- Meat: 21 days

Contra-Indications:
- Late pregnancy.
- Neonates up to 4 weeks.
- Not used for animals producing milk for human consumption.

Side Effects:
Photodermatitis may be observed after treatment with oxytetracycline after exposure to intense sunlight or ultraviolet light.

Warning:
Meat produced by animal treated with tetracycline should not be used for human consumption before elapse of 21 days from last injection.

Pack:
One vial of 100 ml injectable solution.

Storage:
Store in a cool and dry place at temperature 15 - 32°C and protect from light.

Manufactured by:
Alexandria Co. for Pharmaceutical and Chemical Industries.

For:
CHEMICAL INDUSTRIES DEVELOPMENT
Giza A.R.E. - G.C.R. 19717

description:
CLAZCOX oral suspension for vet use only.

Composition:
Each ml contains:
- Diclazuil  2.5 mg

Properties:
Diclazuril is an antiprotozoal drug acts on the apicoplast, a plastid obtained by endosymbiosis that is present in apicomplexan parasites, but not present in the vertebrate host. The exact function of the apicoplast is not known; however, it may play a vital role in biosynthesis of amino acids and fatty acids, assimilation of nitrate and sulfate, and starch storage, as has been demonstrated for other plastid organelles, Diclazurilis active against E. ovinoidalis (ninakohlyakimovae) and E. crandalis.

Indications:
CLAZCOX used in the treatment and prophylaxis of coccidiosis caused by E. ovinoidalis (ninakohlyakimovae) and E. crandallis in lambs.

Target species: lambs

Dosage and administrations:
- Lambs: 1 ml / 2.5 kg body weight orally with a drenching gun (as a single administration).

Contraindication:
CLAZCOX oral suspension was given to lambs as a single dose up to 5 folds the therapeutic dose no adverse clinical effects were reported.

Warnings & Precautions:
1- Should not be mixed with other anticoccidials.
2- Operators should wear protective clothing.
3- Shake well before use.
4- Wash hands after use.
5- Product should be protected from frost.

Side effects:
Rarely severe scouring.

Withdrawal time: Nil.

Storage:
- Store at temperature not exceed 30°C.
- Don't freeze & use immediately after opening.

Package:
(HDPE) opaque white plastic bottle with (HDPE) plastic screw cap containing 100-250-500 ml, 1-2-5 liter oral suspension + outer label & outer insert.

Manufactured by:
KIROVEST PHARMACEUTICALS COMPANY.

Waki - Oxytetracycline 5% is the trade name of oxytetracycline ,a broad spectrum antibiotic with bacteriostatic action against a wide range of gram +ve bacteria such as (Strept spp. , Staph spp. & Corynebacterium) and gram -ve bacteria (E. coli , Salmonella spp., Pasteurella spp. & Haemophilus spp.) as well as Mycoplasma spp., Rickettsia , Chlamydia & some protozoa. It produces its antibacterial effects by binding reversibly to bacterial 30s ribosomes resulting in inhibition of protein synthesis.

- FLORICOL Oral Solution is primarily bacteriostatic and used for the treatment of different enteric and respiratory diseases affecting various species caused by a wide range of gram positive and aram negative as well as anaerobic bacteria.
- Florfenicol is the florinated derivative of Thiamphenicol that has greater activity than Chloramphenicol and it dose not cause aplastic anaemia associated with Chloramphenicol due to the absence of P-Nitro group (P-NO2).
- Recently, it has been reported that Florfenicol showed greater activity than Chloramphenicol especially against Salmonella, E. coli, Pasteurella, Shigella spp, Proteus spp, Enterococci, Clostridia spp and Staphylococcus aureus.

- FLORICOL oral solution is indicated as antibacterial.

- Fowl cholera caused by Pasteurella multocida.
- Salmonellosis caused by Salmonella Pullorum.

description:
Composition:
Each mL contains:
- Butafosfan 100 mg
- Cyanocobalamin (vit B12) 0.05 mg

Indication:
• Butophosphan is an organic phosphorus. It is the most important mineral and main component of adenosine triphosphate (ATP)-the source of energy for cells, including working muscles.

• Vitamin B12 or methylcobalamin is necessary for the formation of methionine and its methylation derivative and for polyamine synthesis. Active coenzymes methylcobalamin is necessary for cell proliferation and replication. 

• Therefore, this product is indicated for Cattle, calf, horses, dog, and cat for:
1- Treatment cases of, acute and chronic metabolic disorders, decreased body weight gain, and poor performance.
2- Treatment of phosphorus deficiency as in cases of hypophosphatemia.
3- Supportive treatment in cases of Hypocalcemia to keep the balance of Phosphorus/Calcium ratio. 
4- General tonic.
5- Increase animal’s appetite.
6- Neurologic disorders, as in cases of lameness, rumen stasis.
7- Increase milk production.
8- Treatment Anemia cases as post Babesiosis, parasitic diseases as in Haemonchus contortus.

Mode of administration
- By IV, IM or SC injection.

Dosage:
- Cattle: 5-25 ml / per animal
- Calf: 5-12 ml / per animal
- Dog: 0.5-5 ml / per animal
- Cat: 0.5-2.5 ml / per animal.
• Repetition of the administration as needed daily.
• Chronic diseases: The half of the doses given above.
• Repeat as necessary at intervals of 1-2 weeks, or shorter interval.

Withdrawal time: Nil

Indications:
It acts as an immune stimulant in the cases of:
- Many viral infections, such as: FMD, LSD, BEF and cases of viral diarrhea.
- Many bacterial infections, such as: Clostridia, Pasteurella and udder and uterine diseases resulting from E. Coli infection.

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Tulathromycin  100 mg

Properties:
- Tulathromycin is a semisynthetic macrolide antibiotic of the subclass triamilide, It differs from many other macrolides in that it has a long duration of action that is, in part, due to its three amine groups. Tulathromycin is a bacteriostatic agent and acts by interfering with protein synthesis by reversibly binding to the 50S subunit of the ribosome, It binds at the donor site, thus preventing the translocation process necessary to keep the peptide chain growing.
- Tulathromycin is antibiotic active against most aerobic and anaerobic Gram-positve bacteria and Gram-negative bacteria including Haemophilus spp., Neisseria spp., Pasteurella multocida, Mannheimia haemolytica, Histophilus somni, Moraxella bovis, Actinobacillus pleuropneumoniae. It is also active against atypical mycobacteria, Mycobacterium, Mycoplasma, Chlamydia and Rickettsia spp.

Indications:
» Cattle:
- Tulathromed is indicated for the treatment of bovine respiratory disease (BRD) caused by Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida, Mycoplasma bovis and Histophilus somni. The presence of the disease in the herd should be established before preventive treatment.
- Tulathromed is also indicated for the treatment of infectious bovine keratoconjunctivitis (IBK) Caused by Moraxella bovis.

» Pigs:
Tulathromed is indicated for the treatment of swine respiratory disease (SRD) caused by Actinobacillus pleuropneumoniae, Pasteurella multocida, Mycoplasma hyopneumoniae and Haemophilus parasuis. The presence of the disease in the herd should be established before preventive treatment.
» Tulathromed should only be used if pigs are expected to develop the disease within 2-3 days.

Target Species:
Cattle and pigs.

Dosage and administration:
» Cattle:
- 1 ml Tulathromed per 40 kg B.Wt., once by subcutaneous injection into the neck.
- For treatment of cattle over 300 kg bodyweight, divide the dose so that no more than 2 ml are injected at one site.

» Pigs:
- 1 ml Tulathromed per 40 kg B.Wt., once by intramuscular injection into the neck.
- For treatment of pigs over 80 kg bodyweight, divide the dose so that no more than 7.5 ml are injected at one site.

Warnings and Precautions:
• Do not use in cases of hypersensitivity of the target animals to macrolide antibiotics.
• Do not use simultaneously with other macrolides or lincosamides.

Contra-Indications:
• Do not use in lactating cattle producing milk for human consumption.
• Do not use in pregnant cows or heifers, which are intended to produce milk for human consumption, within 2 months of expected parturition.

Adverse effects:
• Pain and swelling may develop at the injection site.
• Hypersensitivity reactions have occasionally been seen.

Withdrawal periods:
• Cattle (Meat and offal): 22 days.
• Pigs (Meat and offal): 13 days.

Storage:
- Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.
- To be used within 28 days after opening and store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Pack:

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Dexamethazone 2 mg (as sodium phosphate)

Pharmacotherapeutic group:
Corticosteroids for systemic use.

Properties:
- Dexamethasone is a synthetic glucocorticoid with potent anti-inflammatory properties. The pharmacological properties of dexamethasone are well known in animals.
- Parenteral administration of dexamethasone preparations is commonly employed, with the intravenous route causing a prompt but short-lived effect.
- The intramuscular route is most commonly employed.

Indications:
As an anti-inflammatory agent. As supportive therapy, dexamethasone may be used in the management of various rheumatic, allergic, dermatological conditions, and for the treatment of diseases known to be responsive to anti-inflammatory corticosteroids.

Target species:
Dogs, Cats, Cattle, Horses & Pigs.

Dosage and administration:
» Horses, Cattle & Pigs : 1.5 ml / 50 kg b.w.
» Dog & Cat : 0.5 ml / 10 kg b.w.

Route of administration
- Intravenous , intramuscular and intra- articular injection in horses.
- Intramuscular injection in cattle, pigs, dogs and cats.

Warning and precautions:
- Animals receiving corticosteroids should be under close observation.
- Because of the anti-inflammatory action of corticosteroids, signs of infection may be masked and it may be necessary to stop treatment until a further diagnosis is made.
- Don't use in newly born pet animals.

Contraindications:
- Do not use in animals with diabetes mellitus, osteoporosis, heart disease or kidney disease.
- Do not administer to pregnant animal.

Side effects:
- Anti-inflammatory corticosteroids, such as dexamethasone, are known to exert a wide range of side effects. Whilst single high doses are generally well tolerated, they may induce severe side effects in long term use and when esters possessing a long duration of action are administered. Dosage in medium to long term use should therefore generally be kept to the minimum necessary to control symptoms.
- Steroids themselves, during treatment, may cause iatrogenic hyperadrenocorticism (Cushing's disease).
- Steroids may cause enlargement of the liver (hepatomegaly) with increased serum hepatic enzymes.

Drug interaction: None Known.

Withdrawal period
- Meat & offal: 28 days
- Milk: 5 days

Storage:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C, and use after opining immediately.

Package:
Carton box containing one glass vial (type II), containing 20, 30, 50, 100 ml solution with a chlorobutyl rubber stopper with aluminum seal covered with (HDPE) plastic cap, outer label + inner leaflet.

Produced by
Badr pharma for pharmaceutical industries
name: Dexabadr

description:
Composition:
Each ml contains:
- Moxidectin 10 mg

Properties:
The primary mode of action of avermectins like moxidectin is to affect chloride ion channel activity in the nervous system of nematodes and arthropods. The drug binds to receptors that increase membrane permeability to chloride ions. This inhibits the electrical activity of nerve cells in nematodes and muscle cells in arthropods and causes paralysis and death of the parasites. Avermectins also enhance the release of gamma amino butyric acid (GABA) at presynaptic neurons. GABA acts as an inhibitory neurotransmitter and blocks the post-synaptic stimulation of the adjacent neuron in nematodes or the muscle fiber in arthropods. Avermectins are generally not toxic to mammals, since they do not have glutamategated chloride channels and these compounds do not readily cross the blood-brain barrier where mammalian GABA receptors occur.

Indications:
» Cattle (Beef and Non-Lactating Dairy): For treatment and control of gastrointestinal roundworms: Ostertagia ostertagi (adults, fourth-stage larvae, and inhibited larvae), Haemonchus placei (adults), Trichostrongylus axei (adults and fourthstage larvae), T. colubriformis (adults and fourth-stage larvae), Cooperia oncophora (adults), C. pectinate (adults), C. punctate (adults and fourth-stage larvae), C. spatulata (adults), C. surnabad (adults and fourth-stage larvae), Nematodirus helvetianus (adults), Oesophagostomum radiatum (adults and fourth-stage larvae), Trichuris spp. (adults); lungworms: Dictyocaulus viviparous (adults and fourth-stage larvae); grubs: Hypoderma bovis and H. lineatum; mites: Psoroptes ovis (P. communis var. bovis); lice: Linognathus vituli and Solenopotes capillatus; for protection of cattle from reinfection with D. viviparous and O. radiatum for 42 days after treatment, with H. placei for 35 days after treatment, and with O. ostertagi and T. axei for 14 days after treatment.Moxidectin has a persistent effect against Ostertagia for 5 weeks and against Dictyocaulus for 6 weeks.

Target Species:
Cattle (Beef and Non-Lactating Dairy).

Dosage instructions:
» Cattle: 1 ml / 50 kg bodyweight as a single subcutaneous injection.

Warnings & Precautions:
- Do not use in calves to be processed for veal.
- It should not be used in newly born domestic animals.

Contra–Indications:
Do not use in female dairy cattle of breeding age.

Side Effects:
Adverse effects appear to nonexistent or minimal.

Withdrawal Time:
- Meat and offal: 21 days.
- Milk: Not for use in female dairy cattle of breeding age.

Storage condition:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C and used after opening for 40 days when stored at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Packaging:
Carton box containing amber glass vial type II containing 10, 20, 30, 50, 100, 200, 250 & 500 ml with red chlorobutyl rubber stopper capped with flip off aluminum cap with outer label + an insert leaflet.

E.D.A. Reg. No.: 4854/2021 vet
name: Endexonil

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Florfenicol  450 gm

Properties:
- Florfenicol one of antibacterial group it's a synthetic broad-spectrum antibiotic effective against most Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria isolated from domestic animals. Florfenicol acts by inhibiting protein synthesis at the ribosomal level and is bacteriostatic and time-dependent. Laboratory tests have shown that florfenicol is active against the most commonly isolated bacterial pathogens involved in bovine respiratory disease which include Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida and Histophilus somni.
- Florfenicol is considered to be a bacteriostatic agent, but in vitro studies of florfenicol demonstrate bactericidal activity against Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida and Histophilus somni.

Indications:
Preventive and therapeutic treatment of respiratory tract infections in cattle due to Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida and Histophilus somni susceptible to florfenicol. The presence of the disease in the herd should be confirmed before administering preventive treatment.

Target species: Cattle

Dosage and Administration:
- Injectable solution by intramuscular or subcutaneous administration.
» SC route: 4 ml / 45 kg body weight to be administered once only.
» IM route: 2 ml / 45 kg body weight to be administered twice 48 hours apart.
- The injection should only be given in the neck. The dose volume given at any one injection site should not exceed 10 ml.
- To ensure a correct dosage body weight should be determined as accurately as possible to avoid under dosing.

Side effect:
1- A decrease in food consumption and transient softening of the faeces may occur during the treatment period. The treated animals recover quickly and completely upon termination of treatment.
2- Subcutaneous injection of the product at the maximum recommended volume of 10 mL per injection site may cause transient local algesia and clinically obvious swelling at the injection site. Local algesia may persist for some days. Injection site swellings decrease over time but may persist for up to 61 days.
3- Intramuscular injection of the product at the maximum recommended volume of 10 mL per injection site may cause transient local algesia and clinically obvious swelling at the injection site. Local algesia may persist for some days. Injection site swellings decrease over time but may persist for up to 24 days. Inflammatory lesions at the injection site (seen at necropsy) may persist for 37 days after injection.

Warnings:
- The product should be used in conjunction with susceptibility testing and take into account official and local antimicrobial policies.
- Care should be taken to avoid accidental self-injection. In case of self-injection, seek medical advice immediately and show the package leaflet or the label to the physician. Avoid direct contact with skin, mouth and eyes. Wash hands after treatment.

Contraindications:
- Not for use in adult bulls intended for breeding purposes.
- Do not use in case of known hypersensitivity to the active substance or to any of the excipients.

Withdrawal time:
» Meat:
- by SC (at 40 mg/kg body weight, once); 64 days
- by IM (at 20 mg/kg bodyweight, twice);37 days
» Milk: Not permitted for use in lactating animals producing milk for human consumption.

Storage condition:
- Store at a temperature not exceeding 30°C.
- And after opening used within 3 months when stored at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Packing:
Carton box containing colorless (Type II) glass vials containing 20 ml, 25 ml, 30 ml, 50 ml, 100 ml, 250 ml and 500 ml solution closed with bromobutyl rubber stopper and non-re-usable aluminum closure with label a insert leaflet.

Manufactured by:
Badr pharma For Pharmaceutical Industries For SERIO Pharm.

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Florfenicol  10 gm

Properties:
Florfenicol is a thiamphenicol derivative with the same mechanism of action as chloramphenicol. It acts by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis. However, it is more active than either broad spectrum of antibacterial activity that include all organisms sensitive to chloramphenicol, gram-negative bacilli, gram-positive cocci and other atypical bacteria such as mycoplasma. Florfenicol is highly lipophilic, which provides high enough concentrations to treat intracellular pathogens and cross some anatomical barriers.

Indications:
Medphenicol is indicated for the treatment of colibacillosis in broiler chickens caused by E. coli strains.

Target Species:
Broilers chickens

Dosage and administration:
- Route of Administration: Orally via drinking Water.
- 1 ml of Medphenicol per 5 kg body weight for 5 days.

Warnings & precautions:
- After administration of Medphenicol, broiler chickens must not be slaughtered to be used as food source for 5 days.
- This drug should not be used for laying hens.
- The determined method of administration and dosage of this drug must be strictly followed.
- Upon usage of this drug, it should be administered for he minimum required period.

Contraindications:
Not for use in chickens from which eggs are produced for human consumption.

Adverse reactions:
Long term use of Medphenicol may cause bone marrow suppression.

Withdrawal period:
- 5 days.
- Not for use in chickens from which eggs are produced for human consumption.

Storage conditions:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Pack:
HDPE plastic containers containing 10, 100, 500 and 1000 ml oral solution closed by HDPE plastic closure lined with LDPE plastic foam liner with outer label.

description:
COMPOSITION
Each syringe of 3g contains:
Active Ingredients:
- Amoxicillin (as Amoxicillin trihydrate)  200 mg
- Clavulanic acid (as Potassium clavulanate)  50 mg
- Prednisolone  10 mg

Excipients:
- Aluminium Sodium Silicate
- Cetostearyl Alcohol (Type B), emulsifying
- Paraffin, White Soft
- Paraffin, Light Liquid

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
Cream to buff oily intramammary suspension.

TARGET SPECIES
Cattle (lactating cows).

Indications
For the treatment of clinical mastitis caused by the following bacteria susceptible to the combination of amoxicillin and clavulanic acid:
• Staphylococci (including β-lactamase producing strains).
• Streptococci (including S. agalactiae, S. dysgalactiae and S. uberis).
• Escherichia coli (including β-lactamase producing strains).

CONTRAINDICATIONS
Do not use in cases of hypersensitivity to the active substances, or to any of the excipients.

SPECIAL WARNINGS
Do not use in cases associated with Pseudomonas.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
For use in animals
- Swab teat end before treatment, with cleaning towels provided.

Recommendations for prudent use
- The product should be used for treatment of clinical mastitis only.
- Use of the product should be based on susceptibility testing of the bacteria isolated from the animal. If this is not possible, therapy should be based on local (regional, farm level) epidemiological information about susceptibility of the target bacteria.
- Official, national and regional antimicrobial policies should be taken into account when the product is used.
- The combination of amoxicillin and clavulanic acid should be reserved for the treatment of clinical conditions which have responded poorly, or are expected to respond poorly, to other classes of antimicrobials.
- Avoid use of the product in herds where no β-lactamase producing staphylococci strains have been isolated. E.coli mastitis with mild to moderate clinical signs, a non-antimicrobial approach should be the first option. Veterinarians should strive to use narrow spectrum antibiotics if possible. Inappropriate use of the product may increase the prevalence of bacteria resistant to β-lactam antibiotics and may decrease the effectiveness of treatment with β-lactam antibiotics, due to the potential for cross-resistance. Most of the ESBLs and AmpC β-lactamases producing E.coli strains may not be inhibited by the combination of amoxicillin/clavulanic acid.
- The feeding of waste milk containing residues of antibiotics to calves should be avoided up to the end of the milk withdrawal period, except during colostral phase, because it could select antimicrobial resistant bacteria within the intestinal microbiota of the calf and increase the faecal shedding of these bacteria.

For the person
- This product may cause skin and eye irritation. Avoid contact with the skin and eyes. In the event of skin or eye contact rinse with plenty of clean water.
- The cleaning towels supplied with the product contain isopropyl alcohol, which many cause skin or eye irritation in some people.
- The wearing of gloves is recommended during administration of the product and when handling the cleaning towels.
- Penicillins and cephalosporins may cause hypersensitivity (allergy) following injection, inhalation, ingestion, or skin contact.
- Hypersensitivity to penicillins may lead to cross reactions to cephalosporins and vice versa. Allergic reactions to these substances may occasionally be serious.
- Do not handle this product if you know you are sensitised, or if you have been advised not to work with such preparations.
- Handle this product with great care to avoid exposure, taking all recommended precautions.
- If you develop symptoms following exposure such as a skin rash, you should seek medical advice and show the doctor this warning.
- Swelling of the face, lips or eyes or difficulty with breathing, are more serious symptoms and require urgent medical attention.
- Wash hands after use.

Other precautions
- Due to the endocrine-disrupting potential of prednisolone, the product may be dangerous to fish and other aquatic organisms. Consequently treated animals should not have access to watercourses during the first 12 hours after treatment.

ADVERSE REACTIONS
In very rare cases, immediate hypersensitivity reactions may occur (less than 1 animal in 10,000 animals treated, including isolated reports).

PREGNANCY, LACTATION OR LAY
No special precautions

INTERACTIONS
None known

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
- The syringe must only be used once. Partly emptied syringes due to the unsuccessful use should be discarded.
- The content of one syringe should be infused gently into the teat of the infected quarter every 12 hours after each of three consecutive milkings.
- Milk out the infected quarters. After thoroughly cleaning and disinfecting the teat and teat orifice with the cleaning towels provided, gently infuse the contents of one syringe into each affected quarter. Disperse the product by gentle massage of the teat and udder of the affected animal.
- In cases of infections caused by Staphylococcus aureus, a longer course of antibacterial therapy may be required. Therefore overall treatment length must be at the veterinarian’s discretion but should be long enough to ensure complete resolution of intramammary infection.

COMBINATION THERAPY
Combined therapy for the treatment of bovine mastitis. In the situation where systemic treatment as well as intramammary treatment is necessary, especially in cases of serious clinical mastitis Combiclav Injection can be administered in combination with this product.
• Combiclav Injection
- Three injections (24-hour interval) once a day for 3 days.
- Where necessary Combiclav Injection may be administered for an additional two days for a total of 5 daily injections.

• Combiclav LC Intramammary
- Three intramammary infusions (12-hour interval).

Note:
- First injection and infusion should be in the same time.
- To ensure the correct dosage, bodyweight should be determined as accurately as possible to avoid underdosing.

OVERDOSE
No adverse reactions are to be expected from an accidental overdose.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
- Meat & Offal: 7 days
- Milk: 84 hours

Combined Therapy:
When using this product and Combiclav Injection in combination:
- Meat and offal: 42 days
- Milk: 84 hours
From the last treatment of Combiclav Injection following the minimum posology regime.

INCOMPATIBILITIES
Not applicable.

SHELF LIFE
- As packaged for sale: 2 Year

STORAGE PRECAUTIONS
- Do not store above 25°C.
- Store in a dry place.

PACKAGING
- Single dose 3g white LDPE syringes with a white LDPE dual push-fit cap.
- Cartons of 3, 12, and 24 syringes, or buckets of 120 syringes including 3, 12, 24, or 120 individually wrapped teat cleaning towels containing isopropyl alcohol.
- Not all pack sizes may be marketed.

DISPOSAL PRECAUTIONS
- Extremely dangerous for fish and aquatic life. Do not contaminate ponds, waterways or ditches with the product or used container.
- Any unused veterinary medicinal product or waste materials derived from such veterinary medicinal products should be disposed of in accordance with local requirements.
name: Combiclav LC

description:
COMPOSITION
Active Substance(s) mg/ml
- Amoxicillin (as Amoxicillin trihydrate)  140
- Clavulanic acid (as Potassium clavulanate)  35

Excipients
- Butylated Hydroxyanisole 0.08
- Butylated Hydroxytoluene 0.08
- Propylene Glycol Octanoate Decanoate

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
An off-white to cream oily suspension for injection.

TARGET SPECIES
Cattle

INDICATIONS
Combiclav Injection has a broad spectrum of bactericidal activity against the bacteria commonly found in cattle.

(a) In vitro Combiclav Injection is active against a wide range of clinically important bacteria including:
- Gram-positive: Staphylococci (including beta-lactamase producing strains), Streptococci, Corynebacteria, Clostridia, Bacillus anthracis, Actinomyces bovis.
- Gram-negative: Escherichia coli (including beta-lactamase producing strains), Salmonella spp (including beta-lactamase producing strains), Campylobacter spp, Klebsiella spp, Proteus spp, Pasteurella spp, Fusobacterium necrophorum, Bacteroides (including beta-lactamase producing strains), Haemophilus spp, Moraxella spp and Actinobacillus lignieresi.

(b) Treatment of cattle:
- Respiratory infections
- Soft tissue infections (e.g. joint/navel ill, abscesses etc.)
- Metritis and Mastitis.
- Combined Therapy for the treatment of bovine mastitis. In the situation where systemic treatment as well as intramammary treatment is necessary, Combiclav Injection can be administered in combination with Combiclav Lactating Cow Intramammary Suspension.

CONTRAINDICATIONS
- Do not use in cases of hypersensitivity to the active substances or to any of the excipients.
- The product should not be administered to rabbits, guinea pigs, hamsters or gerbils. Caution is advised in its use in other very small herbivores.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
i) for use in animals
- Official and local antimicrobial policies should be taken into account when the product is used.
- Use of the product should be based on susceptibility testing of the bacteria isolated from the animal. If this is not possible, therapy should be based on local epidemiological information.
- Avoid use of the product in herds where no β-lactamase producing Staphylococci strains have been isolated. Veterinarians should strive to use narrow spectrum antibiotics if possible.
- Inappropriate use of the product may increase the prevalence of bacteria resistant to ß-lactam antibiotics and may decrease the effectiveness of treatment with ß-lactam antibiotics, due to the potential for cross-resistance.
- Care should be taken to avoid contaminating the remaining contents of a vial with water.
- Clavulanic acid is moisture sensitive. It is very important therefore, that a completely dry needle and syringe is used when extracting suspension for injection in order to avoid contaminating the remaining contents of the vial with drops of water.
- Contamination will result in obvious beads of dark, brown discolouration corresponding to the introduced water droplets. Material affected in this way should not be used as it may have significantly reduced potency.

ii) For the person
- Penicillins and cephalosporins may cause hypersensitivity (allergy) following injection, inhalation, ingestion or skin contact. Hypersensitivity to penicillins may lead to cross-reactions to cephalosporins and vice versa. Allergic reactions to these substances may occasionally be serious.
- Care should be taken to avoid accidental self-injection.
- Do not handle this product if you know you are sensitised, or if you have been advised not to work with such preparations.
- Handle this product with great care to avoid exposure, taking all recommended precautions.
- If you develop symptoms following exposure such as a skin rash, you should seek medical advice and show the doctor this warning. Swelling of the face, lips or eyes or difficulty in breathing are more serious symptoms and require urgent medical attention.
- Wash hands after use.

ADVERSE REACTIONS
Use of the product may occasionally result in pain on injection and/or local tissue reaction.

PREGNANCY, LACTATION OR LAY
The product may be used safely in pregnant animals.

INTERACTIONS
None known.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
For intramuscular injection at a dosage rate of 8.75 mg/kg bodyweight (1 ml per 20 kg bodyweight) daily for 3-5 days. Shake the vial well before use. After injection, massage the injection site. Use a completely dry sterile needle and syringe. Swab the septum before removing each dose.

Combination between injection and intramammary forms:
• Combiclav Injection
- Three injections (24-hour interval) once a day for 3 days.
- Where necessary Combiclav Injection may be administered for an additional two days for a total of 5 daily injections.

• Combiclav LC Intramammary
- Three intramammary infusions (12-hour interval).

Note:
- First injection and infusion should be in the same time.
- To ensure the correct dosage, bodyweight should be determined as accurately as possible to avoid underdosing.

OVERDOSE
Potentiated penicillin is of a low order of toxicity and is well tolerated by the parenteral route. Apart from occasional injection site reactions, which may occur at the recommended dose, no other adverse effects are to be expected from an accidental overdose.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD(S)
- Meat and offal: 42 days.
- Milk: 60 hours

PHARMACOLOGICAL PROPERTIES
- Pharmacotherapeutic group: Amoxicillin and enzyme inhibitor
- ATC Vet Code: QJ01CR02

PHARMACODYNAMIC PROPERTIES
Amoxicillin MOA:
- The mechanism by which ß-lactam antibiotics bind with proteins associated with developing the bacterial cell wall, resulting in the ultimate lysis of the cell, is well established. In the case of Gram-positive bacteria the ß-lactam can freely pass across the peptidoglycan layer in the aqueous phase to the site of activity at the cytoplasmic membrane. In the case of Gram-negative bacteria there is a hydrophobic barrier outside the peptidoglycan layer. Broad-spectrum ß-lactam antibiotics have the ability to cross this barrier by way of small pores in its structure.
- There are three major mechanisms of resistance available to bacteria: the production of ß-lactamase enzymes, impermeability of the cell wall by modification of the small pores and by modifications of the amino acid sequences at the cytoplasmic membrane interface where the cell wall is constructed.

Clavulanic Acid MOA:
- In the absence of specific inhibitor enzymes with ß-lactamase activity, ß-lactamases either form complexes with the antibiotic or cause a breakdown of the ß-lactam ring. In either case the antibacterial activity is lost.
- Clavulanic acid has a ß-lactam ring in its structure which is recognised by ß-lactamases as a type of “penicillin”. The enzyme/clavulanate interaction is irreversible and results in the depletion of enzymes molecules.

PHARMACOKINETIC PARTICULARS
It has been documented that the pharmacokinetic characteristics of penicillins (including amoxicillin) after intramammary administration indicate rapid elimination of the drug from milk. The mean residence time has a several-fold lower value than the designated elimination half-life and amounts to only 3.4 h. The concentration of the drug in the milk drop relatively quickly and the process is very dynamic.

INCOMPATIBILITIES
In the absence of compatibility studies, this veterinary medicinal product must not be mixed with other veterinary medicinal products.

SHELF LIFE
- As packaged for sale: 1 year.
- After first opening: 28 days.

STORAGE PRECAUTIONS 
- Do not store above 25°C.
- Keep container in outer carton.
- Discard unused material.
- This product does not contain an antimicrobial preservative.
- Once a vial has been broached the contents should be used within 28 days.

PACKAGING
- 50 and 100 ml siliconised, clear, colourless, glass (Type II) vials with nitryl bung secured with aluminium overseal. 
- Not all pack sizes may be marketed.

DISPOSAL PRECAUTIONS
Any unused veterinary medicinal product or waste materials derived from such veterinary medicinal products should be disposed of in accordance with local requirements.

MARKETING AUTHORISATION HOLDER
Norbrook Laboratories Limited
Station Works, Camlough Road
Newry, Co. Down, BT35 6JP
Northern Ireland

Dosage and administration:
- Febantel and pyrantel pamoate work by paralyzing the worms, while praziquantel kills them. EVATRI Deworming Tablet For Dogs is available as a chewable tablet that can be given to dogs of all ages and sizes.
- The recommended dosage of EVATRI Deworming Tablet For Dogs is 1 tablet per 10 kg of body weight. The tablet can be given with or without food. It is important to give the entire tablet to your dog, as breaking it up can reduce its effectiveness.
- EVATRI Deworming Tablet For Dogs is generally safe for dogs to use. However, some dogs may experience side effects, such as vomiting, diarrhea, and loss of appetite.
-  It is safe for use in dogs and puppies over the age of 4 weeks and can be given monthly as a preventative measure or as needed if your pet becomes infected.

description:
COMPOSITION:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Danofloxacin 180 mg (Eq. to 228.4 mg Danofloxacin mesylate)

PROPERTIES:
- Danofloxacin is a synthetic fluoroquinolone antimicrobial agent that possesses potent in vitro activity against Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida, Histophilus somni and Escherichia coli.
- The antimicrobial activity of danofloxacin is based upon the inhibition of microbial DNA gyrase and topoisomerase IV. The inhibitory effect is on the second step of the enzymatic process, uncoupling the breakage and reunion functions. Danofloxacin, in common with other fluoroquinolones, produces a stable complex between the enzyme and DNA. This results in the cessation of DNA replication and transcription. The bactericidal effect is also observed on bacteria in the stationary growth phase.

INDICATION:
- In cattle: Treatment of bovine respiratory disease caused by Mannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida and Histophilus somni sensitive to danofloxacin. For the treatment of acute bovine mastitis caused by Escherichia coil sensitive to danofloxacin.
- In neo-natal calves: Treatment of enteric infections caused by Escherichia coli sensitive to danofloxacin.

TARGET SPECIES:
Cattle.

DOSAGE OF ADMINISTRATION:
Route: Subcutaneously injection or intravenously.

For Whole Product:
- 1 ml / 30 kg body weight as a single injection by the subcutaneous or intravenous route, If clinical signs of respiratory or enteric disease persist 48 hours after the first injection, an additional dose at 6 mg/kg body weight may be administered.
- If clinical signs of acute bovine mastitis persist 36-48 hours after the first injection, the antibiotic treatment strategy should be reviewed. It is recommended to treat animals in the early stages of disease and to evaluate the response to treatment within 36-48 hours.

WARNING & PRECAUTIONS
- It is recommended to treat animals in the early stages of disease and to evaluate the response to treatment within 48 hours.
- When fluoroquinolones have been combined with bacteriostatic antimicrobials, such as tetracyclines and macrolides or phenicols, an antagonism was demonstrated in vitro.
- Use of fluoroquinolones should be based on susceptibility testing and take into account official and local antimicrobial use policies.
- Care should be taken to dose accurately and the product should be used with caution in animals with joint disease or cartilage growth disorders.
- Do not use with newly born pet animals.

CONTRAINDICATIONS
- Do not use in cases of known hypersensitivity to the active ingredient, to other (Fluoro) quinolones or any ingredients product the use of the product not recommended for cows during pregnancy.
- Do not use cases where the pathogen involved is resistant to other fluoroquinolones (due to the potential or cross resistance).
- Not co-administered with nor steroidal and inflammatory agents.

ADVERSE EFFECTS
-In very rare cases in sensitive animals, immediate or delayed anaphylactic shock may occur after the injection.
- Subcutaneous injection of the product induces a moderate inflammatory response in the tissue around the injection site. The resultant lesions may persist for up to 30 days.

WITHDRAWAL TIME
- Meat and offal: 8 days
- Milk: 4 days

STORAGE CONDITIONS
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C and to be used after opening for 28 days at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

PACKAGING
Transparent colorless glass vial (type II) containing 50, 100 ml solution, closed with chlorobutyl rubber stopper and non-reusable aluminum closures with label + insert leaflet.

Manufactured by:
Eva Pharma for pharmaceuticals and medical appliances (Eva Pharma) for EVAPHARMA for Pharmaceutical industries (EVAPHARMA).
name: Danomond

description:
Composition:
Each 1 mi contains:
- Diclazuril  10 mg

Properties:
Diclazuril is an anticoccidial of the benzenescetonitrile group and has anticoccidial activity against Elmerlaspecles.Depending on the coccidia species, diclazuril has a coccidiocidal effect on the asexual or sexual stages of the development cycle of the parasite. Diclazuril treatment will only have limited effect on the intestinal lesions caused by parasitic stages older than 16 days. Treatment with diclazuril causes interruption of the coccidial cycle and of excretion of oocysts for approximately 2 weeks. This allows the animal to bridge the period of decrease of maternal immunity (observed at approximately 4 weeks of age).

Target species:
Sheep (Lambs) & Cattle (Calves).

Indications:
- For the treatment of coccidial infections in lambs caused in particular by the more pathogenic Eimeria species as Eimeria crandallis and Eimeria ovinoidalis.
- Aid in the treatment of coccidiosis in calves caused by Eimeria bovis and Eimeria zuernii.

Dosage & administration:
- Sheep (Lambs): 1 ml / 10 Kg b.wt. as a single oral administration.
- Cattle (Calves): 1 ml / 10 Kg b.wt. as a single dose, 14 days after moving into potentially high risk environment.

Packaging:
1000 ml with an outer label stored at temperature not more than 30°C.

Reg No: 5070/2021
name: Diclacox

description:
Composition:
Each 1 gm contains:
- Oxytetracycline HCl  757 mg (eq. Oxytetracycline base 700 mg)

Properties:
- Oxytetracycline is a broad-spectrum antibiotic. It is mainly active against Gram-positive and Gram negative bacteria, aerobic and anaerobic, mycoplasma, Chlamydia and Rickettsiae.
- It acts by reversibly to the ribosomal subunit 30S receptors to a blockage of the union between aminoacyl-tRNA to the site corresponding to the mRNA-ribosome complex messenger. Then inhibition of the protein synthesis and inhibits bacterial growth.

Indications:
» Broiler chickens:
* Arthritis caused by Staphylococcus aureus.
* Chronic Respiratory Disease (CRD) caused by Mycoplasma gallisepticum.
* Infectious enteritis caused by E. coli.
* Fowl cholera caused by Pasteurella multocida.
* Fowl coryza caused by Haemophilus paragallinarum.
* Gangrenous dermatitis caused by Clostridium spp.
* Typhoid & paratyphoid caused by Salmonella spp.

» Pre – ruminating calves:
* Bovine pneumonia caused by Mycoplasma bovis, Pasteurella haemolytica, P. multocida & Haemophilus somnus.
* Scours, neonatal diarrhea caused by E. coli & Salmonella spp.

Target Species:
Broiler Chickens, pre-ruminating calves.

Dosage and administration:
- by addition to drinking water.

From active ingredient:
» Broiler chickens: 20 mg of oxytetracycline / kg body weight 3-5 days.
» Pre – ruminating calves: 10-30 mg / kg bodyweight 1-2 times daily.

From whole product:
» Broiler chickens: 0.5 gm of product / liter of drinking water 3-5 days.
» Pre – ruminating calves: 2.5 gm - 7.5 gm  of product / 100 kg body weight 1-2 times daily.

Warning and precautions:
- Should be dissolved in water, before use.
- Prolonged or repeated use should be avoided.
- Do not use in laying birds producing eggs intended for human consumption.

Contra indications:
Hypersensitivity to oxytetracycline or any other substance from tetracyclines group.

Side effects:
gastro-intestinal disorder and less frequently, allergic and photosensitivity reactions.

Interaction:
should not be administered with antacids, gels containing aluminium, preparations containing vitamins or minerals as insoluble complexes will be formed, which decreases the absorption of the antibiotic.

Withdrawal period:
- Meat and offal:7 days.
- Eggs: do not use in laying birds producing eggs intended for human consumption.

Storage:
- Keep on cool & dry place not exceeding 30°C.
- Keep out of reach of children.

Manufactured by Eva pharma
name: Chicktetra

description:
Composition:
Each 1 gm contains:
- Doxycycline (as hyclate)  400 mg
- Bromhexine (as hydrochloride)  40 mg

Properties:
- Doxycycline has broad spectrum activity inhibiting both aerobic and anaerobic gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria, mycoplasmas, chlamydiae, rickettsias and some protozoa.
- Bromhexine is a mucoregulator. By activating the secretion of the seromucous glands, It breaks down the network of acid glycoprotein fibres found in mucoid sputum, which are mainly responsible for the characteristic viscosity.

Mechanism of Action:
- Doxycycline inhibits bacterial protein synthesis. Doxycycline binds to the 30S ribosomal subunit, which prevents the tRNA from binding to the ribosome. This prevents the mRNA from being translated into protein, which is essential for bacterial growth and reproduction.
- Bromhexine acts by inhibiting neuraminidase, stabilizing lysosomes, increasing ciliary activity, hydrating mucus, and exhibiting anti-inflammatory effects.

Strength points of Hexacycline:
- Hexacycline Synergistic effect: Doxycycline is a broad-spectrum antibiotic that is effective against a wide range of bacteria, including Mycoplasma gallisepticum, which is a common cause of respiratory infections in poultry. Bromhexine is an expectorant that helps to loosen mucus and clear congestion. When used together, doxycycline and bromhexine can be more effective than either drug alone in treating respiratory infections.
- Hexacycline Improved absorption: Bromhexine can help to improve the absorption of doxycycline, which means that it is effective in the lower doses.
- Hexacycline is effective against a wide range of Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, making it a versatile antibiotic for poultry.
- Hexacycline has a long half-life, meaning it remains in the body for an extended period, providing prolonged protection against bacterial infections.
- Hexacycline Reduced Respiratory Distress: By assisting in clearing mucus and improving airway function, bromhexine may contribute to reducing respiratory distress in affected poultry.

Dose of whole product:
- Broilers chickens: 0.5 gm of the product / 1 liter drinking water

Produced by EVA PHARMA

description:
COMPOSITION:
- Synthetic Oxytocin  10 IU
- Excipient q.s.  1 ml

DESCRIPTION:
Oxytocin is a hormone secreted by the pituitary back lobe gland. Its pre-hormone is synthesized in the endoplasm reticule and it is processed, carried and transported in the granules.

INDICATION:
To induce birth. Uterine atony or inertia. Uterine involution after caesarean operation and decrease of haemorrhage. Expulsion of placenta and exudates after delivery. Beginning of milk secretion after delivery. Agalactia in sows. Chronic pyometra and endometritis, helps the expulsion of exudates. Coadjutant treatment of antibiotic therapy in acute and chronic mastitis helps to expulse residues and drainage.

TARGET SPECIES:
Horse, cattle, sheep, goats, pigs, dogs and cat females (Cows, mares, goats, ewes, sows, cats and bitches).

ADMINISTRATION ROUTE:
Intramuscular, endovenous or subcutaneous route.

POSOLOGY:
» Obstetric (endovenous, intramuscular or subcutaneous route): Cows: 7.5 - 10 ml (75 - 100 IU) per animal. Mares (horse female): 7.5 - 15 ml (75 - 150 IU) per animal. Sows, ewes and goats (pig, sheep and goat females): 3.5 - 5 ml (35 - 50 IU) per animal. Bitches (dog female): 0.5 – 2.5 ml (5 - 25 IU) per animal. Cats: 0.5 - 1 ml (5 - 10 IU) per animal.
» Milk secretion (preferably by endovenous route): Cows and mares (cattle and horse females): 1 - 2 ml (10 - 20 IU) per animal.
» Sows, ewes and goats (pig, sheep and goat females): 0.5 - 2 ml (5 - 20 IU) per animal. Bitches (dog females): 0.2 - 1 ml (2 - 10 IU) per animal. Cats: 0.1 - 1 ml (1 - 10 IU) per animal.
• Administration can be repeated every 30 minutes, according to the veterinarian's criteria.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD:
Not applicable.

SHELF-LIFE:
3 years, from production date.

COMMERCIAL PRESENTATION:
50 ml and 250 ml flasks.
name: Partovet

description:
TOXIPRA PLUS
Inactivated vaccine, Enterotoxaemia, Tetanus ad Blackleg, in injectable suspension.

COMPOSITION PER DOSE (2 ml):
Sufficient amount of toxoids and anacultures to obtain in control animals:
» Clostridium chauvoei 100% protection
» Clostridium perfringens (types B, C and D) ≥ 10 IU of beta antitoxin/ml of serum and ≥ 5 IU of epsilon antitoxin/ml of serum
» Clostridium novyi type B ≥ 3.5 IU of alpha antitoxin/ml of serum
» Clostridium septicum ≥ 2.5 IU of alpha antitoxin/ml of serum
» Clostridium tetani ≥ 2.5 IU of antitoxin/ml of serum. Adjuvant.

- Problems caused by Clostridium infections are becoming more common in farm animals everyday, since these microorganisms are generally found in a saprophytic form in the atmosphere and in the intestine of most animals. 
- Under favourable circumstances (such as sudden changes in diets, excess of proteins in feedstuff, prolonged treatment with antibiotics which provoke the elimination of usual digestive flora, etc.) these microorganisms multiply rapidly and toxins produced by them are absorbed through the intestinal mucus, passing into the blood stream and producing the typical signs of toxaemia (enterotoxaemia).
- This often occurs with Clostridium perfringens B, C and D as well as other Clostridium, such as septicum, novyi and chauvoei which under favourable circumstances may propagate and produce toxins which may give rise to dysentery, haemorrhagic enteritis, pulpy kidney disease, hepatitis, black disease, etc.
- In order to control these processes, it is essential to impede the action of toxins produced by the different Clostridium. Therefore, an effective vaccine must be capable of inducing adequate levels of antitoxin in vaccinated animals.
- TOXIPRA PLUS is a vaccine containing purified toxins and cell antigens, which are duly inactivated and adjuvanted, resulting in a product that induces high levels of specific antibodies, as well as elevated levels of antitoxins. Thus, this product is adequate for the control of different types of clostridiosis.

INDICATIONS:
- Adult Sheep and Goats: To prevent Enterotoxaemia (pulpy kidney disease), Necrotic hepatitis, Blackleg and Tetanus.
- Lambs and Kids: To prevent Dysentery, Haemorrhagic enteritis, Pulpy kidney disease, Blackleg and Tetanus.
- Cattle and Fattening calves: To prevent Enterotoxaemia, Black disease, Necrotic hepatitis, Blackleg and Tetanus.
- Suckling calves: To prevent Haemorrhagic enteritis, Enterotoxaemia and Tetanus.
- Swine: To prevent Necrotic enteritis, Enterotoxaemia (sudden death in sows) and Tetanus.
- Rabbits: To prevent Enterotoxaemia.

ADMINISTRATION ROUTE: 
- Subcutaneous or intramuscular.
- In sheep and goats only vaccinate by subcutaneous route.

DOSAGE:
- Sheep and Goats: 2 ml/adult animal; and 1 ml/young animal.
- Cattle and Fattening calves: 4 ml/animal.
- Suckling calves: 2 ml/animal.
- Swine: 2 ml/adult pig; and 1 ml/piglet.
- Rabbits: 0.5 ml/animal.

Generally, the following vaccination programme is recommended:
- First vaccination: Vaccinate and revaccinate within an interval of 20 to 25 days.
- Booster vaccination: Administer one dose annually.
- Sheep and Goats: In areas where pulpy kidney disease is very prevalent, it is advisable to vaccinate every 6 months (spring and autumn).
- Lambs and Kids: Vaccinate from a few days after birth.
- Fattening calves: Apply a preventive vaccination at the beginning of the fattening period. In herds where symptoms of enterotoxaemia appear, an emergency vaccination can be applied, revaccinating at 8 to 10 days.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD: 0 days.

OBSERVATIONS:
- A sporadic anaphylactic reaction may appear in some sensitive animals. In such a case administer an antihistaminic.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS:
- It is advisable to administer the vaccine at a temperature between +15 and +25°C.
- Shake before and during administration.
- Store at +2 to +8 °C, avoiding freezing.

PACKAGING: 
100 ml bottle.

Fax (34) 972 43 06 61.

G.O.V.S Reg. n 435/2019 in Egypt
Under veterinary prescription
FOR VETERINARY USE ONLY

• Shake the bottle well before use.
• Repeat treatment after 21 days.

description:
COMPOSITION
Each 1 ml contains:
- Florfenicol 450 mg

PROPERTIES
• A broad-spectrum antibiotic that acts against the 50S ribosome of bacteria with (79%) or more bioavailability after intramuscular injection in cattle.
• Active against gram-negative bacilli, gram-positive cocci sensitive to chloramphenicol, and other atypical bacteria such as mycoplasma.
• More active than either chloramphenicol or thiamphenicol and doesn't induce aplastic anemia like chloramphenicol.
• Highly lipophilic, which provides high enough concentrations to treat intracellular pathogens and cross some anatomic barriers.
• The half-life is (18 hours) after IM injection, and 27 hours after 40 mg/kg subcutaneously.
• Eliminated through hepatic metabolism, and inactive metabolites are excreted in the urine.
• Competitive antagonism may occur when co-administered with macrolide antibiotics, since they share the same site of action.

INDICATION
• Bovine respiratory disease (BRD) associated with: Histophilus somni, Pasteurella multocida, Mannheimia haemolytica, Mycoplasma bovis.
• Foot rot, acute interdigital necrobacillosis and infectious pododermatitis associated with Fusobacterium necrophorum and Bacteroides melaninogenicus.
• Infectious bovine keratoconjunctivitis caused by Moraxella bovis.

DOSAGE & ADMINISTRATION
Cattle:
- IM: 2 ml / 45 kg b.wt. repeated after 48 hours.
- SC: 4 ml / 45 kg b.wt. to be administered once only.

Sheep:
- IM: 2 ml / 45 kg b.wt once daily for 3 days.
name: Aquafloril

description:
Composition:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Nitroxynil 34 gm (as eglumine)
- Clorsulon 6.7 gm
- Ivermectin 0.67 gm

Properties:
- Ivermectin is Ivermectin is a broad-spectrum endectocide of the avermectin family.
- Ivermectin is a macrocyclic-lactone derivative which has a broad and potent anti parasitic activity against nematodes and arthropods.
- Ivermectin acts by inhibiting nerve impulses which binds selectively and with high affinity to glutamate-gated chloride-ion channels which occur in invertebrate nerve and muscle cells. This leads to an increase in the permeability of the cell membrane to chloride ions with hyper polarization of the nerve or muscle cell, resulting in paralysis and death of the relevant parasites. Compounds of this class may also interact with other ligand-gated chloride channels, such as those gated by the neurotransmitter gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA). The margin of safety for compounds of this class is attributable to the fact that mammals do not have glutamate-gated chloride channels. The macrocyclic lactones have a low affinity for other mammalian ligand-gated chloride channels and they do not readily cross the blood-brain barrier.
- Clorsulon is a compound of A benzenesulfonamide family which is recommended for treatment and control of adult forms of Fasciola hepatica& Fasciola gigantic (Liver fluke) in cattle
- Clorsulon inhibits glycolytic enzymes of Fasciola hepatica (3-phosphoglycerate kinase and phosphoglyceromutase). This enzymatic inhibition effectively blocks the Embden-Myerhof glycolytic pathway and thereby deprives the fluke of its main source of metabolic energy.
- Nitroxynil is a halogenated phenol which is effective against Fasciola hepatica with some activity against gastrointestinal nematodes (Haemonchus contortus). Its mode of action is as an uncoupler of oxidative phosphorylation.
- Ivernitrosulon when used as recommended dose level, it is effective against sensitive strains of the internal and external parasites.

Indications:
- Treatment and control of sensitive gastro-intestinal roundworms, liver flukes (early immature, immature and adult), lungworms, eye worms, sucking and biting lice, mites, screw worm fly and cattle tick.
- Controls 2-week old fluke.
- Controls tricabendazole resistant external parasites.

• Internal parasites:
- Gastro-intestinal round worm: Adult and Immature stages of: Ostertagia ostertagi -(including third and fourth stage larvae and inhibited immatures) Haemonchus placei- Barber’s pole worm - Trichostrongylus axei- Stomach hair worm (including third and fourth stage inhibited larvae)-Trichostrongylus colubriformis- Intestinal hair worm- Ostertagia lyrata-Stomach worm -Cooperia spp-Small intestinal worm (including third and fourth stage inhibited larvae)- Oesophagostomum radiatum - Nodule worm (including third and fourth stage larvae)- Bunostomum phlebotomum(including third and fourth stage inhibited larvae) and Adult stages of:Whipworm- Trichuris spp-Nematodirus spp-Strongyloides papillosus-Thin necked intestinal worm.
- Early immature (including 2-week old), immature and adult liver fluke: Fasciola hepatica.
- Lungworm (adult and immature including inhibited stages): Dictyocaulus viviparus.

• External parasites:
- Eye worm (adult stages): Thelazia spp.
- Sucking Lice: Haematopinus eurysternus-short nosed sucking louse, Solenopotes capillatus-little blue sucking louse, Linognathus vituli-long nosed sucking louse.
- Cattle tick: Boophilus microplus.
- Mites: Sarcoptes scabiei var bovis.
- Biting lice: Bovicola (Damalinia) bovis.

Sustained activity:
Ivernitrosulon effectively control infection with Ostertagia spp.and Cooperia spp. acquired up to 7 dayes after treatment and Dictyocaulus viviparous and chrysomya bezziana up to 14 days after treatment.

Target species:
Cattle (Beef and non-lactating dairy cattle)

Dosage of administration:
- Cattle: 1.5 ml / 50 kg BW by subcutaneous injection only (Inject high on the neck behind the ear).

Warning & precautions:
- Sterilize all injection apparatus by boiling (or equivalent) before use.
- Avoid use strong disinfectant on apparatus.
- Maintain cleanliness at all times.
- Keep needle sharp and clean.
- Use shortest needle possible, certainly not exceeding 15 mm.
- As far as possible avoid injection of animals during wet weather or under dustily conditions.
- This product should be injected only under the skin.

Contra–Indications:
- Do not used intravenously or intramuscularly.
- Do not used in cattle which are producing or may in the future produce milk where the milk or milk products may be us for human consumption.
- Do not re-treat animals for 120 days (4 months) after last treatment.

Withdrawal time:
- MEAT: Do not use less than 56 days before slaughter for human consumption.
- MILK: Do not use in cattle which are producing or may in the future produce milk where the milk or milk products may be used for human consumption

Storage conditions:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C, away from light and to be used for 3 months after opening at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Packaging:
Carton box containing amber glass (type II) vials contains 20, 50, 100, 250, 500 ml and 1 L solution closed with bromobutyl rubber stopper and non-reusable aluminum closure with an outer label and insert.

Manufactured by:
Eva Pharma For Pharmaceuticals and medical appliances (Eva Pharma)

COMPOSITION:

INDICATIONS AND PROPERTIES:
- Ampicillin is indicated for the treatment of infections caused by E.coli, Clostridium, Salmonella, Brucella, Proteus, Klebsiella, Strepto and Staphylococci, Corynebacterium, Haemophilus, Pasteurella, and Shigella in the different animals.

description:
Composition:
Each 100 gm contains:
- Spiramycin adipate  207 MIU

Properties:
Spiarmycin is a macrolide antibiotic that acts by interfering protein synthesis by reversibly binding to the 50S subunit of the ribosome. Spiarmycin is active against most aerobic and anaerobic gram-positive bacteria. In general, macrolides are not active against gram negative bacteria, but some strains of Pasteurella, Haemophilus, and Neisseria spp may be sensitive. Macrolides are active against atypical mycobacteria, Mycobacterium, Mycoplasma, and Chlamydia, and Rickettsia spp, but not against protozoa or fungi, Bacteroides fragilis strains are moderately susceptible to macrolides.

Indications:
- Treatment of Enzootic pneumonia caused by Mycoplasma hypopnemoniae.

Target species:
Pigs

Dosage and administration:
- Route of administration: Orally via drinking water
- For whole product: 384 mg of the product \ 10 kg body weight daily, for 5 days.

Warnings & Precautions:
- Pigs with acute infections and reduced water intake should first be treated with suitable parenteral medication.
- The use of the drug under conditions other than those recommended in the leaflet may increase the prevalence of bacterial resistance to spiramycin and decrease the efficacy of treatment with other macrolides as a consequence of the appearance of cross- resistance.
- Spiramycin can cause hypersensitivity (allergy) reactions after inhalation, ingestion, or skin contact. People with known hypersensitivity to macrolides should avoid all contact with veterinary medicinal product.
- During handling, wear a dust, gloves, work overalls and safety glasses.
- Wash your hands after using the product.
- Do not smoke, eat or drink while handling the product.

Contraindications:
- Do not use in cases of known hypersensitivity to spiramycin, other macrolides or any excipients.
- Do not use in animals with liver failure or biliary obstruction.
- Do not administer simultaneously with antimicrobials with a similar mode of action, which act by binding to the 50S subunit of bacterial ribosomes, such as florfenicol, lincosamides and other macrolides.

Adverse reaction:
- Gastrointestinal disturbance and allergic- type reactions can occur in animals with hypersensitivity to macrolides on very rare occasions.

Withdrawal time:
Meat and offal: 9 days

Storage conditions:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C. used immediately after opening and reconstitution.

Pack:
Transparent plastic (LDPE) bag containing 20, 25, 30, 50, 75, 100 gm powder in (HDPE) plastic jar sealed with aluminum seal closed by (HDPE) plastic cap with outer label containing data and insert.

Manufactured by:
Eva Pharma for pharmaceuticals and medical appliances (Eva Pharma)

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Flumequine  360 mg

Properties:
Flumequine is a synthetic anti-infectious agent of the quinolone family. It acts at the level of nucleic acids by blocking the replication of the DNA of the bacteria. The molecular target is DNA-gyrase. involved in the spiral winding of DNA. it has a dose-dependent bactericidal activity against Gram-negative bacteria. It active against a wide range of gram-negative organisms and several gram-positive aerobes. This includes E.coli, Salmonella, Klebsiella, Enterobacter, Proteus and generally Pseudomonas aeruginosa. Also, have significant activity against Mycoplasma and Chlamydia spp.

Target species:
Broiler chicken

Indications:
- Treatment of Infectious coryza caused by Avibacterium puragallinarum.
- Avian chlamydiosis caused by Chlamydia psittaci.

Dosage & administration:
• Route of administration: Taken orally in drinking water.
• For whole product: 1 ml of product / 3 liters of drinking water for 5 days.

Warnings & precautions:
- The use of quinolones should be based on antimicrobial susceptibility testing whenever possible. and should take into account the official and local antibiotic use policies.
- Use of the product outside the recommendations of the leaflet may increase the prevalence of quinolone-resistant bacteria and may decrease the effectiveness of treatment with other (Fluoro) quinolones given possible cross-resistance.

Contra-indications:
- Do not combine with trimethoprim or sulfonamides.
- Do not use in case of known hypersensitivity to quinolones.
- Do not use in poultry producing eggs.

Side effects:
- No adverse effects of flumequine were reported.

Withdrawal time:
- Meat and offal: 2 days
- Eggs: 4 weeks
*Do not use in species for human consumption.

Storage conditions:
- Store at temperature not exceeding 30⁰C.
- In use after opening up to 3 months at temperature not exceeding 30⁰C.

Packaging:
HDPE bottle closed with polypropylene (screw fit) cap with containing of 100 ml or 1000 ml solution. With an outer label.

Manufactured by:
EVA Pharma For Pharmaceuticals and Medical appliances for EVAPHARMA for Pharmaceutical Industries (EVAPAHRMA)
name: Septiquine

description:
COMPOSITION
Each 100 ml contains:
- Oxytetracycline HCl  5.4 gm (Eq. to oxytetracycline base 5 gm)

PROPERTIES
Oxtetracycline is a broad spectrum antibiotic with bacteriostatic action against Gram-positive and Gram-negative germs such as E. coli, Pasteurella, Salmonella, Brucella, Streptococcus, Clostridium, Haemophilus, Corynebacterium, Anthrax, Staphylococcus. Rickettsia, Mycoplasma, spirochaetes, and Actinomyces. Oxtetracycline inhibits protein synthesis in susceptible bacteria. Inside the cell it binds irreversibly to receptors on the 30S subunit of the bacterial ribosome where it interferes with the binding of the amino-acyl transfer RNA to the receptor site on the messenger RNA ribosome complex. This effectively prevents the addition of the amino acids to the elongating peptide chain, inhibiting protein synthesis.

TARGET SPECIES
Cattle, sheep and pigs.

INDICATIONS
- Atrophic rhinitis caused by Bordetella bronchiseptica, Mannheimia haemolytica and Pasteurella multocida.
- Navel/joint ill caused by Arcanobacterium pyogenes, E.coli or Staphylococcus aureus.
- Mastits caused by Corynebacterium pyogenes, E. coli, Staphylococcus aureus, Streptococcus agalactiae or Streptococcus uberis.
- Metritis caused by E. coli or Streptococcus pyogenes.
- Pasteurellosis and infections of the respiratory tract caused by Mannheimia haemolytica and Pasteurella multocida.
- Septicaemia caused by Salmonella dublin and Streptococcus pyogenes.
- Erysipelas caused by Erysipelothrix rhusiopathiae.

DOSAGE & ADMINISTRATION
Route of administration: By intramuscular or slow intravenous injection in cattle and by intramuscular injection in pigs and sheep.

For Active ingredient:
- Cattle: 4 mg oxytetracycline / Kg.b.wt. daily for 3-5 days.
- Sheep: 4-9 mg oxytetracycline / Kg.b.wt. daily for 3-5 days.
- Pigs: 4-9 mg oxytetracycline / Kg.b.wt. daily for 3-5 days.

For whole product:
- Cattle: 4 ml of product / 50 kg.b.wt. daily for 3-5 days.
- Sheep: 4-9 ml of product / 50 kg.b.wt. daily for 3-5 days.
- Pigs: 4-9 ml of product / 50 kg.b.wt. daily for 3-5 days.

WARNINGS & PRECAUTIONS
- When the intravenous route is used in cattle, no more than two consecutive daily injections are administered.
- If the volume of product to be administered is greater than 20 ml it should be divided and injected into two sites.
- Dilution with solutions of calcium salts will cause precipitation and must be avoided.
- Do not use in sheep producing milk for human consumption.
- Use of the product should be based on susceptibility testing of the bacteria isolated from the animal. If this is not possible, therapy should be based on local (regional, farm level) epidemiological information about susceptibility of the target bacteria.
- The use of tetracycline during the period of tooth development, including late pregnancy may lead to tooth discoloration.
- Any unused veterinary medicinal product or waste materials derived from such veterinary medicinal products should be disposed of in accordance with local requirements.

Precautions for the person:
- Wash hands after use. In case of contact with eyes or skin, wash immediately with plenty of water as irritation may occur.
- Take care to avoid accidental injection.

CONTRA-INDICATIONS
- Contraindicated in animals suffering from renal or hepatic damage.
- Contraindicated in animals with known hypersensitivity to oxytetracycline.

SIDE EFFECTS
- Mild irritation (oedematous swelling) at the injection site following intramuscular administration is observed in cows.

WITHDRAWAL TIME
Cattle:
- Meat: 18 days.
- Milk: 84 hours (from the 7th milking in caws milked twice daily).

Sheep:
- Meat: 15 days.
- Milk: Do not use in sheep producing milk for human consumption.

Pigs:
- Meat: 15 days.

STORAGE CONDITIONS
Store at temperatures not exceeding 30°C away from direct sunlight in dry place.

PACKAGINGS
10, 20, 30, 50, 100, 200, 250 & 500 ml in glass vials with rubber stopper and aluminum flip off seal with plastic cap with outer label & insert leaflet in carton box.
