description:
Composition:
- Tylosin tartarate  110 gm (eq. to Tylosin 100 gm)

Properties:
Tylosin is a macrolide antibiotic which acts by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis through binding to 50S ribosomal subunits within cell wall. It has antibacterial spectrum that is essentially against gram +ve bacteria including (Actinomyces spp. Erysipelothrix rhusiopathiae), certain gram –ve bacteria including Pasteurella spp and Fusobacterium necrophorum) and certain Spirochetes (as Treponema hyodysenteriae).

Indications:
- Pre ruminant Calves: Treatment of pneumonia caused by Mycoplasma spp when the disease has been established in the herd.
- Broiler Chickens: Treatment of chronic respiratory diseases (CRD) caused by Mycoplasma gallisepticum and Mycoplasma synoviae when the disease has been established in the flock. Treatment and prevention of necrotic enteritis caused by Clostridium perfringens when the disease has been established in the flock.
- Turkeys: Treatment of infectious sinusitis caused by Mycoplasma gallisepticum. when the disease has been established in the flock.

Target species:
Broiler Chickens, pre ruminate Calves, Turkeys.

Dosage and administration:
- by addition to drinking water.

» From active ingredient
- Pre ruminant Calves: 10 – 20 mg tylosin per kg BW twice daily for 7 – 14 days.
- Turkeys: 75 – 100 mg tylosin per kg BW per day for 3 – 5 days.
- Broiler Chickens: 75 – 100 mg tylosin per kg BW per day for 3 – 5 days.

» From whole product
- Pre ruminant Calves: 0.54 gm - 1.08 gm  of product per 50 kg BW twice daily for 7 – 14 days.
- Turkeys: 0.81 gm – 1.082 gm / 10 kg BW (1 liter)  per day for 3 – 5 days.
- Broiler Chickens: 0.81 gm – 1.082 gm / 10 kg BW (1 liter)  day for 3 – 5 days.

Contra indications:
It shouldn’t be used in layers producing eggs for human consumption.

Drug interactions:
Because tylosin is related to macrolides group, it interacts with Clindamycin (increase antagonism of effect).

Side effects:
Diarrhoea, epigastric pain.

Withdrawal period:
- Pre ruminant Calves (meat and offal): 12 days.
- Turkeys (meat and offal): 2 days, Turkey (eggs): Zero days.
- Broiler Chickens (meat and offal): 1 day, Chicken (eggs): Zero days.

Manufactured by Eva pharma
name: Tylosol

description:
Compostion:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Tilmicosin phosphate 250 mg (Eq. to Tilmicosin base 224.66 mg)

Properties:
Tilmicosin is a mainly bactericidal semi-synthetic antibiotic of the macrolide group. It is believed to affect protein synthesis. It has bacteriostatic action but at high concentrations it may be bactericidal. This antibacterial activity is predominantly against Gram-positive microorganism with activity against certain Gram-negative ones and Mycoplasma of a bovine and ovine origin. In particular its activity has been demonstrated against the following micro-organism: Mannheimia, Pasteurella, Actinomyces (Corynebacterium), Fusobacterium, Dichelobacter, Staphylococcus, and Mycoplasma organisms of bovine and ovine origin.

Indications:
• Broiler chickens: For the treatment of respiratory disease in chicken flocks as Chronic respiratory disease, Infectious sinusitis caused by Mycoplasma gallisepticum and Infectious synovitis caused by M. synoviae.
• Turkeys: For the treatment of respiratory disease in turkey flocks as Chronic respiratory disease, Infectious sinusitis caused by Mycoplasma gallisepticum and Infectious synovitis caused by M. synoviae.
• Calves (non ruminating): For the treatment of bovine respiratory disease as Enzootic Pneumonia and Shipping Fever Pneumonia caused byMannheimia haemolytica, Pasteurella multocida, Mycoplasma bovis.
• Pigs: For the treatment of respiratory disease in pig herds, as: Enzootic pneumonia caused by Mycoplasma hyopneumoniae, Pasteurellosis caused by Pasteurella multocida, Pleuropneumonia caused by Actinobacillus pleuropneumoniae.

Target species:
Broiler chickens, Turkeys, Calves (non ruminating) and Pigs.

Dosage and Administration:
- Route of administration: Orally via drinking water or milk replacer in calves.
• Pigs: 6.67 -8.9 ml of the product /100 kg B.W. for 3 – 5 days.
• Broiler chickens (except hens producing eggs for human consumption): 0.6 – 0.9 ml of the product / liter for 3 days.
• Turkeys: 0.6 -1.2 ml of the product / liter for 3 – 5 days.
• Calves (non ruminating): 1.1 ml of the product every 20 kg bodyweight, twice daily for 3 – 5 consecutive days.

Warning & Precautions:
• Must be diluted before administration to animals.
• Pigs, broiler chickens and turkeys: Water consumption should be monitored in order to guarantee adequate dosing. In case water consumption does not match quantities for which recommended concentrations were calculated, the concentration of Tilmicosin has to be adapted in a way that the recommend dosage will be taken up by the animals or different medication should be considered.
• For oral use only, Contains disodium edetate; do not inject.
• Severely ill individuals tend to drink less and may need simultaneous treatment, preferably by parenteral medication.
• The use of the product should be based on susceptibility tests.
• Medicated drinking water or milk replacer should be prepared fresh every 24 hours.

Contra–Indications:
- Do not allow horses and other equines access to drinking water containing tilmicosin.
- Do not use in case of hypersensitivity to tilmicosin or to any of the excipients.
- Do not administer to ruminating animals with active rumen function.
- Not authorised for use in laying birds producing eggs for human consumption.
- Do not use within 14 days of onset of the laying.
- Not authorised for use in lactating animals producing milk for human consumption.

Adverse Effects:
In very rare cases (less than 1 animal in 10,000 animals, including isolated reports), a decrease in water intake has been observed.

Withdrawal time:
Meat and offal of:
- Broiler chickens: 12 days.
- Turkeys: 19 days.
- Calves: 42 days.
- Pigs: 14 days.

Storage conditions:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C and to be used after opening for 28 days at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Packaging:
Opaque white HDPE plastic bottle contains 500 ml solution closed by white plastic HDPE cap and white LDPE foam lined with red HDPE plastic film with an outer label and insert.

Manufactured by Eva Pharma For medical appliances (Eva Pharma)
name: Tilmicosin

description:
Composition:
Each ml contains:
- Spiramycin  1 MIU

Properties:
Spiramycin is a macrolide antibacterial that has a bacteriostatic action against Mycoplasma, Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria. It is active against Mannheimia haemolytica and Pasteurella multocida. It acts on the synthesis of bacterial proteins by binding to the 50S ribosome subunit and prevents the translocation step. Spiramycin is able to reach such high concentrations in tissues that it can penetrate cells to bind to the 50S ribosome subunit.

Target species:
Non-lactating Cattle.

Indications:
- Treatment of Enzootic pneumonia caused by Pasteurella multocida, Mannheimia haemolytica & Mycoplasma bovis.
- Treatment of shipping fever pneumonia caused by Mannheimia haemolytica.
- Treatment of Mycoplasmal pneumonia caused my Mycoplasma bovis.

Dosage and administration:
- Route of administration: Intramuscular Injection.
- For whole product: 1 ml product per 10 kg B.wt. twice 48 hours apart.

Warnings and precautions:
- Do not administer more than 15 ml per injection site.
- Use of this product should be based on susceptibility testing of bacteria from the animal.
- The live weight should be determined as accurately as possible to avoid overdose.
- Don’t use products containing benzyl alcohol for newly born pets/domestic animals.

Contraindications:
- Do not use in case of known allergy to spiramycin or any other substance of the macrolide group.
- Do not use intravenously.
- Not to be used for animal lactating milk.

Side effects:
- A slight agitation reaction of the animal may be observed after the injection.
- No teratogenic effects were reported in mouse studies.
- Its use during breastfeeding and pregnancy does not seem to pose any particular problem.

Withdrawal time:
- Meat and offal: 68 days.
- Milk: The use is not allowed in animals producing milk intended for human consumption.

Storage conditions:
- Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.
- Used after opening for 1 month when stored at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Packaging:
Carton box containing an amber Type II glass vial of 100 ml solution, closed with bromobutyl rubber stopper and crimped with flip-off aluminum cap. with an outer label and insert leaflet.

Manufactured by:
Eva Pharma for pharmaceuticals and medical appliances (Eva Pharma)
name: Captalide

Dose

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contain:
- Toltrazuril 25 mg

Properties:
- Toltrazuril induces changes in the fine structure of coccidial development stages that are mainly due to the swelling of the endoplasmic reticulum and of the Golgi apparatus and to abnormalities in the perinuclear space and disturbances in nuclear division. Toltrazuril also causes a reduction of enzymes in the respiratory chain of the parasites.
- Pharmacodynamic studies in laboratory animals indicated that toltrazuril had no anticoagulant, fibrinolytic, analgesic, diuretic or anticonvulsant effect. It had no effect on gastrointestinal transit time. Oral doses of up to 30 mg/kg bw. had no haemodynamic or cardiac effects in anaesthetised dogs although 100mg/kg bw caused a slight tensor effect as reflected by an increase in peripheral resistance.

Indications:
- For the treatment and control of coccidiosis, Toltrazuril is effective against all intestinal stages of susceptible coccidia.
- To assist in the development of natural immunity to coccidiosis in breeder and layer replacer stock exposed to continuous challenge of virulent strains of coccidian.

Target species:
Broilers and Broiler Breeders.

Dosage & administration:
- Orally in drinking water.
» Active ingredient: 7 mg / kg body weight.
» Whole product: 280 ml / 100 kg body weight in drinking water for 25 successive days (2.5-3 ml/L).

Warnings & precautions:
This product is compatible with antibiotics such as enrofloxacin, ampicillin, tetracycline, tiamulin and tylosin.

Contra–indication:
Not to be used with chickens produces eggs for human consumption.

Side–effects:
No side effects in the recommended dose.

Withdrawal time:
21 day

Storage:
Stored at temp. not exceed 30°C.

Manufactured by Eva pharma

description:
COMPOSITION
Each 1 ml contains:
- Imidocarb Dipropionate  121.15 mg (Equivalent to Imidocarb 85 mg)

TARGET SPECIES
Cattle, dogs and horses.

INDICATION
» Cattle: For the treatment and prevention of bovine babesiosis (Redwater fever - Babesia divergens infection).
» Dogs: For the treatment of babesiosis.
» Horses: For the treatroent of babesiosts (piroplasmosis) caused by Babesia caballi and Babesia equi.

ROUTE OF ADMINISTRATION
- Subcutaneous only for Cattle.
- Intramuscular or Subcutaneous for Dogs and Horses

DOSE OF ACTIVE SUBSTANCE(S)
» Cattle:
- Treatment: 0.85 mg Imidocarb base per 1 kg body weight.
- Prevention: 2.125 mg Imidocarb base per kg body weight.

» Dogs: 6.6 mg per Imidocarb dipropionate kg body weight, repeat the dose in 2 weeks, for a total of 2 treatments.

» Horses:
A) Babesia caballi: 2 mg Imidocarb base per kg body repeat once after 24 hours.
B) Babesia equi: 4 mg Imidocarb base per kg body weight, repeat dosage 4 times at 72 hours intervals.

DOSE OF WHOLE PRODUCT
» Cattle:
- Treatment: 1 ml per 100 kg body weight
- Prevention: 2.5 ml per 100 kg body weight

» Dogs: 0.54 ml per 10 kg body weight, repeat the dose in 2 weeks, for a total of 2 treatments.

» Horses:
A) Babesia caballi: 0.2 ml per 10 kg body weight, repeat once after 24 hours.
B) Babesia equi: 0.5 ml per 10 kg body weight, repeat dosage 4 times at 72 hours intervals.

STORAGE
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C away from light and use immediately after opening.

PACKS
Carton box containing amber glass (type I) vial with bromobutyl rubber stopper and aluminum flip off containing 10 ml solution for injection with inner leaflet + outer label.

E.D.A. Reg. No.: 4898/2021

Manufactured by
Delta Grand Pharma for pharmaceutical industries - DGP FOR EGYPTIAN INT. PHARMACEUTICAL INDUSTRIES CO. (EIPICO)
10th OF RAMADAN CITY, INDUSTRIAL AREA B1, P.O. BOX: 149 TENTH, EGYPT
name: Epicocarb

description:
COMPOSITION:
Each 100 ml contains:
- Ivermectin  2 gm

PROPERTIES:
Ivermectin is a member of the macrocyclic lactones class of endectocides bind selectively and with high affinity to glutamate-gated chloride ion channels which occur in invertebrate nerve and muscle cells. This leads to an increase in the permeability of the cell membrane to chloride ions with hyperpolarization of the nerve or muscle cell, resulting in paralysis and death of the parasite.

TARGET SPECIES:
Cattle, sheep and pigs.

INDICATIONS:
Cattle:
- Gastrointestinal roundworms (adult and afourth-stage larvae): Ostertagia spp. (including inhibited O. ostertagi),Haemonchus placei, Trichostrongylus axei, T. colubriformis. Cooperia spp., Bunostomum phlebotomum, Oesophagostomum radiatum, Strongyloides papillosus (adult), Nematodirus helvetianus (adult), N. spathiger (adult), Trichuris spp (adult).
- Lungworms (adult and fourth-stage larvae): Dictyocaulus viviparous.
- Eye worms (adult): Thelazia spp.
- Warbles: Hypoderma bovis, H. lineatum.
- Mange mites: Psoroptes bovis Sarcoptes scabiei var. bovis.
- Sucking lice: Linognathus vituli, Solenopotes capillatu.

Sheep:
- Gastrointestinal round worms (adult and fourth-stage larvae): Ostertagia circumcincta including inhibited larvae, O, trifurcate, Haemonchus contortus including inhibited larvae, Trichostrongylus axei (adults), T. colubriformis and T. vitrinus (adults), Cooperia curticei, Oesophagostomum columbianum, O. venulosum (adults), Nematodirus filicollis, Chabertia ovina, Trichuris ovis (adults).
- Lungworms: Dictyocaulus filaria (adult and fourth-stage larvae), Protostrongylus rufescens (adults), Nasal Bots (all larval stages), Oestrus ovis.

Pigs:
- Gastrointestinal roundworms (adult and fourth-stage larvae): Ascaris suum, Hyostrongylus rubidus, Oesophagostomum spp., Strongyloides ransomi (adult and somatic larval stages).
- Lungworms: Metastrongylus spp. (adults).
- Lice: Haematopinus suis.
- Mange mites: Sarcoptes scabiei var. suis.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION:
Route: Single S/C injection.

For Active Ingredient:
- Cattle: 200 mog ivermectin/kg.bwt
- Sheep: 200 mcg ivermectin/kg.bwt
- Pigs: 300 mcg ivermectin/kg.bwt

For Whole product:
- Cattle & Sheep: 0.01 ml / kg.b.wt
- Pigs: 0.015 ml / kg.b.wt.

WARNINGS AND PRECAUTIONS
- Care should be taken to avoid the following practices because they increase the risk of development of resistance and could ultimately result in ineffective therapy: Too frequent and repeated use of anthelmintics from the same class, over an extended period of time.
- Resistance to ivermectin has been reported Teladorsagia circumcincta in sheep and Ostertagia ostertagi in cattle. Therefore, the use of this product should be based on local (regional, farm) epidemiological information about susceptibility of these helminth species and recommendations on how to limit further selection for resistance to anthelmintics.
- Pharmamectin can be used concurrently without adverse effects with foot and mouth disease vaccine or clostridial vaccine, given at separate injection sites.
- In the absence of compatibility studies, this veterinary medicinal product must not be mixed with other veterinary medicinal products.

CONTRADICTIONS:
- Do not use in lactating cows or sheep producing milk for human consumption.
- to Should not be used in other species as severe adverse reactions, including fatalities in dogs, may occur.

SIDE EFFECTS:
- Cattle: Transient discomfort has occasionally been observed in cattle following subcutaneous administration. A low incidence of soft tissue swelling at the injection site has been observed.
- Sheep: Discomfort, sometimes intense but usually transient, has been observed in some sheep immediately following subcutaneous administration.
- Pigs: Mild and transient discomfort has occasionally been observed in pigs following subcutaneous injection.

WITHDRAWAL TIME:
- Cattle:
- Meat and offal: 49 days.
- Do not use in lactating cows producing milk for human consumption.
- Do not use in non-lactating dairy cows including pregnant dairy heifers within 60 days of calving.

Sheep:
- Meat and offal: 42 days.
- Do not use in lactating sheep producing milk for human consumption.
- Do not use in sheep within 60 days of lambing where milk is to be used for human consumption.

Pigs:
- Meat and offal: 28 days.

STORAGE AND CONDITIONS:
Store at temperature not exceed 30°C and used immediately after opening.

PACKAGING:
An amber glass vials type (II) containing 10 ml Injectable solution, and 20 ml Injectable solution, 50 ml Injectable solution, 100 ml Injectable solution and 200 ml Injectable solution with red chlorobutyl rubber stoppers capped with flip off Aluminium cap with outer label and and insert leaflet inside carton box.

Manufacture by
Badr pharma for pharmaceutical Industries for Raa Co.

General Manager: Dr. Mohamed Raouf

description:
A synergistic influence to augment nutrient utilization.

Composition:
Each 1 liter contains:
• Cellulase  100000000 U
• Xylanase  1500000 U
• Lipase  6500 U
• a-Amylase  250000 U
• Protease  400000 U
• Pectinase  30000 U
• Water (carrier) up to 1 liter

Role of Enzymes:
• Cellulase: Acts on fibers and helps in digestion and thereby reduces the viscosity and subsequent diarrhea /loose droppings.
• Amylase: Acts on starch rich components in the feed and converts into glucose.
• Arabinase: Breaks the Non-Starch Polysaccharides and produces Glucose.
• Pectinase: Exhibits specific action on fibrous feeds containing Pectin and releases sugars like Rhamnose, Xylose, Arabinose, Galactose and Fructose.
• Protease: Acts on all simple and bound Proteins and makes them better available for digestive system to be absorbed into the blood stream.
• Lipase: Acts on Lipids / Fats / Oils and breaks them into smaller chain fatty acids and glycerides for better utilization by the body.
• Xylanase: Specifically acts on commonly used deoiled rice bran, wheat and sunflower cake and releases sugars to be used as source of energy. It also reduces the viscosity of digestive track by attacking the long chain arabinoxylans and thereby prevents wet droppings.
• a-Galactosidase: Acts on galacto - olligosaccharides in soya and reduces viscosity and improves digestibility.
• B-Glucosidase: Breaks cellulose and oligosaccharides.

Dosage and administration:
Poultry: 1 ml / 1 liter of drinking water.

Storage condition:
Store at a dry place away from the reach of children.

Manufactured by:
Tex Biosciences (P) Ltd.
Chennal - India

Sole Agent in Egypt:
ELNEHESI VET
Tanta, Elfateh St., Borg Elsalam
Tel: +2 0403407133

- Do not use in cases where the pathogen involved is resistant to marbofloxacin and other fluoroquinolone (cross-resistance).
- Do not administer to animals known to be hypersensitive to marbofloxacin, otherquinolones, or to any of the excipients.

Side Effects:
Transient local reactions such as oedema, pain and swelling at the injection site and inflammatory lesions which may persist for 6 days.

Warnings:
- Fluoroquinolones should only be used based on susceptibility testing.
- Use of the product deviating from the instructions given in the SPC may increase the prevalence of bacteria resistant to the fluoroquinolones and may decrease the effectiveness of treatment with other quinolones due to the potential for cross resistance.

Withdrawal:
6 days for meat and offal.

Storage:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Composition:
Each 150 gm contains:
- Lincomycin Hydrochloride 38 gm (Eq. to Lincomycin base 33.3 gm).
- Spectinomycin sulfate tetrahydrate 100 gm ( Equivalent to Spectinomycin base 66.7 gm )

Indication:
- Chickens: Lincospect is indicated for the treatment of airsacculitis caused by Mycoplasma synoviae or Mycoplasma gallisepticum susceptible to Lincomycin-Spectinomycin combination.
- Lincospect also aids in the control of chronic respiratory disease caused by E. coli and Mycoplasma gallisepticum susceptible to Lincomycin-Spectinomycin combination.
- Turkeys: Lincospect is indicated for the treatment of airsacculitis caused by Mycoplasma meleagridis susceptible to Lincomycin-Spectinomycin combination

Dose:
- To be add to drinking water
- One pack (150 gram) / 200 liter of drinking water for 3 – 5 days ( 166.5 ppm Lincomycin + 333.5 ppm Spectinomycin )

Contra-Indications:
- Not used for Rabbits, hamsters, guinea pigs, horses and adult ruminants.
- Not used for laying hens.
- To be used under veterinarian supervision

Warnings:
- Medicated water should be used within 24 hour.
- Medicated water should be the sole source of water.
- Kaolin decreases absorption of Lincospect.

Withdrawal: 7 days.

Storage:
Store tightly closed, in dry and dark place below 30°C.
name: Lincospect

description:
Composition:
Each 1 gm contains:
- Colistin sulfate 250 mg (Eq. to 6 MIU Colistin)

Indication:
Colivet forte is indicated for the treatment and metaphylaxis of gastrointestinal infections due to non-invasive colistin-sensitive E.coli . The presence of the disease in the flock must be established before proceeding to metaphylactic treatment.

Dosage:
- Route of administration: Orally via drinking water.
- Poultry: 1 gm Colivet forte / 8 liters drinking water for 3 – 7 consecutive days.
- Non- ruminant Calves and Lambs: 1 gm Colivet forte/ 60 kg body weight dissolved in drinking water for 3 – 7 consecutive days.
- Duration of treatment should be limited to minimum time necessary for the treatment of the disease.
- Treatment duration should not exceed 7 days.

Contra-Indications:
Don’t use in horses, particularly in foals since colistin due to a shift in gastrointestinal microflora balance could lead to the development of antimicrobial associated colistin (Colitis X), typically associated with Clostridium difficile which may be fatal.

Withdrawal:
Meat: 1 day.

Storage:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.
name: Colivet forte

description:
Composition:
Each 1 gm contains:
- Neomycin sulfate 715 mg (Eq to 500 mg Neomycin base)

Indication:
Treatment of bacterial enteritis caused by organisms susceptible to neomycin.

Dose:
» Broilers Chickens – Layers – Turkeys : 1.5 gm Newcin forte / 10 liter of drinking water for 3 – 5 days.
» Calves: 1.5 gm Newcin forte/ 100 kg b.wt dissolved in drinking water for 3 – 5 days.

Contra-Indications:
Contraindicated in animals with history of hypersensitivity for neomycin

Side Effects:
Ototoxicity and nephrotoxicity, diarrhea or intestinal malabsoprtion are side effects of neomycin if used incorrectly

Warnings:
The product should not be used to treat non-specific enteric infections in groups of food-producing animals.
Selection of treatment should be confirmed by bacterial culture and sensitivity test.

Withdrawal:
» Meat:
Broilers : 5 days
Layers : 14 days
Turkeys : 14 days
Calves: 30 days
Milk : 35 days

» Egg: 10 days

Storage:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C in dry place.
name: Newcin forte

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Difloxacin HCl 109 mg (Equivalent to difloxacin 100 mg)

Indication:
Diquinol oral solution is indicated for the treatment of microbial infections caused by Difloxacin sensitive organisms such as: E.coli, salmonella, Staphylococci, Haemophilus, Pasteurella and Streptococcus. CRD and CCRD infections in poultry and turkey as well as bacterial infections in other animals.

Dose:
» Chickens – Turkeys: 1 ml Diquinol / 1 liter (10 mg/kg) by addition to drinking water, for 5 days.
» Dogs: 1 ml Diquinol / 20 Kg (5 mg/kg), should be given once a day for at least 5 days.

Contra-Indications:
- Not to be used in layers.
- Not to be used for adult ruminants.

Withdrawal:
Chicken & Turkeys: Meat: 24 hours.

Storage:
Store in a dry place at temp, not exceed 30°C.
name: Diquinol

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Oxytetracycline (as HCl) 30 mg

Indication:
- Shipping fever pneumonia cause by Pasteurella multocida and Mannheimia haemolytica and Mycoplasma bovis in cattle.
- Anaplasmosis caused by Anaplasma marginale in cattle.
- Theileriosis caused by Theileria parva in cattle.
- Listeriosis caused by Listeria monocytogenes in ruminants.
- Pneumonia caused by Pasteurella haemolytica in sheep and goat
- Control of enzootic abortion in sheep caused by Chlamydia abortus
- Chlamydial conjunctivitis caused by Chlamydia spp. in dogs and cats
- Ehrlichiosis caused by Neorickettsia (Ehrlichia) risticii in horses.

Dose:
1 – 5 ml Oxyvet-Pharma 3% / 15 kg b.wt for 3 – 5 days by intramuscular or intravenous injection.

Contra-Indications:
- Not to be used in animals with hypersensitivity to tetracyclines.
- Avoid subcutaneous injection or concurrent corticosteroids in horses.
- Not to be used in sheep producing milk for human consumption.
- Not to be used before last half of pregnancy

Side Effects:
- May cause vomiting and diarrhea.
- Photodermatitis.
- Transient swelling at site of injection.

Warnings:
- Administrated with extreme caution in pregnancy, and to be used only in the last half of pregnancy.
- Oxytetracycline used cautiously in animals with renal or hepatic impairment, and to be used lower than normal doses with monitoring of renal and hepatic function.
- Avoid subcutaneous injection or concurrent corticosteroids in horses.

Withdrawal:
- Cattle: 35 Days for meat and 6 days for milk.
- Sheep: 14 days for meat.

Storage:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.
name: Oxyvet-Pharma 3%

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Clindamycin HCl 27.15 mg (Eq. to Clindamycin 25 mg)

Indication:
Clindaclear is indicated for the treatment of necrotic enteritis, staphylococcosis and toxoplasmosis

Dose:
1 ml Clindaclear / 5 kg b.wt. (2 ml Clindaclear / 1 liter drinking water ) (5 mg Clindamycin / 1 kg b.wt.) daily for 3 – 5 days).

Contra-Indications:
- Clindamycin or lincomycin hypersensitivity.
- Horses, ruminants.
- Concurrent use with chloramphenicol and macrolides.

Side Effects:
Occasional vomiting, diarrhea and inappetence.

Warnings:
Care in animals with hepatic or renal impairment.

Storage:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.
name: Clindaclear

description:
Composition:
Each 1 gm contains:
- Sulphaquinoxaline sodium 200 mg
- Sulphadimidine sodium 250 mg
- Diaveridine 50 mg
- Vit. K3 20 mg

Indication:
- Coccidiosis in broiler chickens caused by Eimeria tenella, E. necatrix, E. acervulina, E. maxima, and E. brunetti.
- Coccidiosis in turkeys caused by Eimeria meleagrimitis and E. adenoeides.
- Fowl typhoid caused by Salmonella gallinarum in broiler chickens and turkeys.

Dose:
To be added to drinking water: 1.35 gm Coccimix per 1 liter of drinking water for 3 days, suspend the treatment for 2 days and resume the treatment for another 3 days.

Contra-Indications:
- Not used in layers.
- Sulfonamides hypersensitivity.

Side Effects:
Crystalluria, hematuria and renal tubule blockage can occur.

Warnings:
- Sulphaquinoxaline isn’t used for birds producing eggs or for cattle producing milk and must stop using it before slaughtering the animal if the animal producing meat for human consumption by 10 days.
- Care in renal impairment.

Withdrawal:
Meat: 10 days

Storage:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.
name: Coccimix

description:
Composition:
Each 1 gm contains:
- Amprolium HCl 500 mg (Eq. to Amprolium 442.1 mg)

Indication:
- Coccidiosis in broiler chickens caused by Eimeria tenella and E. acervulina.
- Coccidiosis in turkeys caused by Eimeria meleagrimitis and E. adenoeides.
- Coccidiosis In calves caused by Eimeria bovis and E. zurnii.
- Coccidiosis In sheep caused by Eimeria crandallis and E. ovinoidalis.

Dose:
• To be added to drinking water.
» Broiler Chickens – Turkeys:
- Prevention: 13.5 gm Amproxin per 100 liters of drinking water for 7- 14 days.
- Treatment: 27 gm Amproxin per 100 liters of drinking water for 5 – 7 days.

» Calves:
- Prevention: 1 gm Amproxin per 88.42 kg B.Wt. for 21 days.
- Treatment: 1 gm Amproxin per 44.21 kg B.Wt. for 5 days.

» Sheep:
- Prevention: 1 gm Amproxin per 8.84 kg B.Wt. for 21 days.
- Treatment: 1 gm Amproxin per 8.84 kg B.Wt. for 5 days.

Contra-Indications:
- Excessive thiamine in the diet can reduce or reverse the anticoccidial activity of the drug.
- It shouldn’t be used in calves processed for veal.
- Don’t administer to turkeys before the age of 8 – 10 weeks.

Side Effects:
Prolonged high dosages cause thiamine deficiency.

Withdrawal:
- Calves & sheep: 5 days.
- Broiler chickens & Turkeys: 3 days.
- Eggs of laying hens: 10 days.

Storage:
Store at temp. not exceeding 30°C in dry place.
name: Amproxin 50%

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Salinomycin sodium 60 mg (Eq. to Salinomycin 58.2 mg)

Indication:
Prophylaxis of coccidiosis in broiler chickens caused by Eimeria tenella, E. necatrix, E. acervulina, E. maxima, E. brunetti and E. mivati.

Dose:
- To be mixed with feed.
- 1 kg Mixalin per tonne feed.

Contra-Indications:
- Not to be used in laying hens.
- Use within 7 days of administration of tiamulin.

Warnings:
- Toxic to horses, dogs and turkeys.
- Not to be used for the treatment of outbreak of coccidiosis.
- Operator should wear suitable protective clothing.

Withdrawal: 5 days

Storage:
Store at temp. not exceeding 30°C in dry place.
name: Mixalin Premix

description:
Composition:
Each 1 gm contains:
- Erythromycin thiocyanate 216 mg

Indication:
For the treatment of Chronic Respiratory Disease (CRD) in chickens caused by Mycoplasma organisms.

Dose:
127.5 gm Erythrovet 20% per 100 liter of drinking water per day for 1 – 5 days.

Contra-Indications:
- Any medicated drinking water which is not consumed within 24 hours should be discarded.
- Do not eat, drink or smoke while preparing the diluted formulation or while animals are being treated.
- Wash hands and exposed skin after use.
- The water system to which the product is added must be in good working order and the header tanks and troughs must be free of dust, algae and other particulate matter.

Withdrawal:
- Meat: 6 days from the last treatment.
- Eggs: 6 days from the last treatment.
- Eggs for human consumption must not be taken during treatment.

Storage:
Store at temp. not exceeding 30°C in dry place.
name: Erythrovet 20%

description:
Composition:
Each 1 gm contains:
- Chlortetracycline hydrochloride 200 mg (Eq. to Chlortetracycline 186 mg)

Indication:
Chloracline is a broad spectrum antibiotic active against wide variety range of organisms including both Gram – & Gram + , anaerobic and aerobic bacteria, mycoplasma, rickettsiae, chlamydiae and even some protozoa (amebae) in poultry and different animals. Chloracline is effective in the treatment and control of Colisepticaemia, Fowl cholera, Infectious Coryza (Haemophilus paragallinarum), Chronic Respiratory Disease (CRD), Enteritis (E. coli, Clostridium spp, Salmonella spp), Duck septicaemia, Omphalitis, Spirochetes, Listeriosis specially (acute and subacute forms), and Chlamydiosis. Chloracline is also useful in the treatment and control of secondary bacterial infections associated with coccidiosis (Eimeria spp) and viral infections in poultry. Chloracline is also recommended for the treatment and control of bacterial diarrhea (scoure), pneumonia, navel and joint ill in calves.

Dose:
- Poultry & Rabbits: 0.5 – 1 g Chloracline / liter drinking water for 3 – 5 days. ( 10 mg Chlortetracycline / kg B.Wt ) for 3 – 5 days.
- Calves – Lambs – Horses: 2.5 – 5 g Chloracline / 50 kg B.Wt. in drinking water for 3 – 5 days. ( 5 – 10 mg Chlortetracycline / kg B.Wt. ) every 12 h for 3 – 5 days.

Warnings:
Not to be used in Ruminant with functional rumen and laying hens.

Withdrawal:
- Poultry: 3 days.
- Non ruminating calves: 15 days

Storage:
Store tightly closed, in dry and dark place below 30°C.
name: Chloracline

description:
Composition:
Each 1 gm contains:
- Diclazuril 2 mg

Indication:
- Broiler chickens caused by Eimeria tenella, E. necatrix, E. acervulina, E. maxima, E. brunetti and E. mivati.
- Turkeys caused by Eimeria adenoeides, E. gallopavonis and E. meleagrimitis.
- Rabbits caused by Eimeria intestinals, E. media, E. magna, E. irresidua and E. perforans.

Dose:
- To be mixed with feed.
- 0.5 kg Diclomix per tonne feed.

Contra-Indications:
- Not to be used in layers.
- Not to be used in breeding turkeys.

Warnings:
- Shouldn’t be used with other anticoccidials.
- Shouldn’t be used with tilmicosin and tiamulin.

Withdrawal:
- Broiler chickens: Zero days.
- Turkeys: Zero days.
- Rabbits: 1 day.

Storage:
Store at temp. not exceeding 30°C in dry place..
name: Diclomix

description:
Composition:
Each 1 gm contains:
- Doxycycline Hyclate 500 mg (Eq. to Doxycycline base 433 mg)

Indication:
Doxin forte is indicated for treatment of Treatment of respiratory tract infections associated with Mycoplasma gallisepticum.

Dose:
- Used by dissolving in drinking water.
- Broiler Chickens & Turkeys : 1 gm Doxin forte per 5 liters of drinking water daily for 3 – 5 consecutive days.

Contra-Indications:
- Used only in broiler chickens and not used for 10 days before slaughtering
- Don’t use in laying chickens and turkeys producing eggs for human consumption
- Don’t use in cases of hypersensitivity to the active substance or to any of the excipients.
- Do not use when tetracycline resistance has been detected in the herd/flock due to the potential for cross-resistance.
- Do not use in animals with impaired liver or kidney function.

Side Effects:
Tetracyclines may in very rare cases induce photosensitivity and allergic reactions.

Warnings:
- Do not administer concurrently with feed overloaded with polyvalent cations such as Ca2+, Mg2+, Zn2+ and Fe3+ because the formation of doxycycline complexes with these cations is possible. It is advised that the interval between administration of other products containing polyvalent cations should be 1-2 hours because they limit the absorption of tetracycline.
- Do not administer together with antacids, kaolin or iron preparations.
- Do not administer in conjunction with bactericidal antibiotics such as beta- lactames as tetracyclines are bacteriostatic antimicrobials.
- Doxycycline increases the action of anticoagulants.

Withdrawal:
- Broiler chicken: 10 days
- Turkey: 12 days

Storage:
Store at temp. not exceeding 30°C in dry place.
name: Doxin Forte

description:
Composition:
Each 1 gm contains:
- Clopidol 250 mg

Indication:
- Avicoccin is indicated for the prevention of caecal and intestinal coccidiosis in broilers as well as in layers and breeders Up to 16 weeks of age.
- It is also used for prevention of rabbit coccidiosis.
- Avicoccin improves weight gain and feed efficiency as well.

Dose:
- Poultry: 500 gm Avicoccin ( 125 g. Clopidol / 1 tonne of feed ) continuously starting from the first day of age.
- Rabbits: 800 gm Avicoccin ( 200 g. Clopidol / 1 tonne of feed ) continuously.

Contra-Indications:
Do not use for chickens after 16 weeks of age.

Withdrawal:
5 days.

Storage:
Store at temp. not exceeding 30°C in dry place.
name: Avicoccin Premix

description:
Composition:
Each 1 gm contains:
- Maduramicin ammonium 10 mg (Eq. to 9.8 mg maduramicin)

Indication:
- Maduramix is used as an aid in the prevention of coccidiosis caused by Eimeria necatrix, E. tenella, E. acervulina, E. brunetti, E. maxima and E. mivati sensitive to maduramicin ammonium in broiler chickens.
- Maduramix is used as an aid in the prevention of coccidiosis caused by Eimeria melagrimitis, E. gallopavonis, E. adenoids, E. meleagridis and E. dispersa sensitive to maduramicin ammonium in turkeys.

Dosage:
500 gm of Maduramix / tonne of complete feed continuously up to 5 days before slaughtering.

Contra-Indications:
- Not used for layers or breeders.
- Not used for any host rather than broiler chickens and turkeys.
- Do not mix with or into feeds containing any other anticoccidial.
- Prevent horses, donkeys, mules and ponies from feed containing maduramicin as it its toxic and fatal to all equines.
- Not used with tiamulin.

Side Effects:
Overdosage may cause inappetence.

Warnings:
- The required dose should be carefully weighed and mixed well with feed.
- Operators should wear suitable protective clothing.

Withdrawal:
5 days.

Storage:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C in dry place.
name: Maduramix Premix

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Diclazuril 10 mg

Indication:
Diclosol is indicated for the control of different types of coccidiosis in poultry, turkey, rabbit and lambs.

Dose:
» Poultry: Add 1 ml Diclosol per 4 liters of drinking water (2.5 ppm) for 48 hrs.
In severe cases: Add 1 ml Diclosol per 2 liters of drinking water (5 ppm) for 48 hrs.

» Lambs: 1 ml Diclosol /10 kg. b.wt (1mg diclazuril / 1kg) to be given orally daily for 3 – 5 days.

Contra-Indications:
Not to be used for laying hens.

Side Effects:
Excessive use of diclazuril rarely causes severe scouring.

Withdrawal:
3 days.

Storage:
Store in a dark place at a temperature below 30°C.
name: Diclosol

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Flumequine 200 mg

Indication:
- Colibacillosis caused by E. coli in poultry, young calves and foals.
- Infectious coryza caused by Haemophilus paragallinarum in poultry.
- Fowl cholera caused by Pasteurella multocida in poultry.
- Pullorum disease caused by Salmonella pullorum in poultry.
- Fowl typhoid caused by Salmonella gallinarum in poultry.

Dose:
- To be added to drinking water.
- 6 ml Flume – Forte per 100 kg body weight for 3 – 5 days.

Warnings:
- Not used in laying hens.
- Not mix with solid feed.

Withdrawal:
Meat: 2 days.

Storage:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.
name: Flume Forte

description:
Composition:
Each 1 gm contains:
- Clopidol 250 mg

Indication:
- Prevention of caecal and intestinal coccidiosis caused by E. tenella, E. acervulina, E. mitis, E. necatrix, E. maxima and E. brunetti in Broiler chickens and breeders up to 16 weeks of age.
- Prevention of rabbit coccidiosis caused by E. stiedae, E. flavescens, E. piriformis, E. magna, E. perforans, E. irresidua, E. media and E. intestinalis.

Dose:
- To be mixed with feed.
- Broiler Chickens: 500 gm Clopimix / tonne feed.
- Rabbits: 800 gm Clopimix / tonne feed.

Contra-Indications:
- Not to be used in broiler chickens after 16 weeks of age.
- Not to be used in layers.
- Not to be used in breeding hens.
- Not mixed with other anticoccidials.

Warnings:
Shouldn’t be mixed with other anticoccidials.

Withdrawal:
5 days.

Storage:
Store at temperature not exceed 30°C.
name: Clopimix Premix

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Bromhexine HCl 10 mg
- Menthol 20 mg

Indication:
Mucolin–M is indicated as co-therapy in conditions of respiratory tract infections associated with retention of mucoid secretions such as bronchitis and bronchopneumonia in different animal species.

In poultry:
- In cases of post vaccination reactions due to IB, ND & ILT vaccines.
- To increase the efficiency of antibiotics due to presence of bromhexine.
- It can be used during heat stress and in hot spells when chickens have difficulty in breathing due to the presence of menthol which has cooling and refreshing sensation.

Dose:
- 0.5 – 1 ml / 10 kg B.wt. ( 0.5 – 1 ml per 1 liter of drinking water ), ( 0.5 – 1 mg / 1 kg B.wt.) for 3 – 5 days.
- In cases of heat stress, it is recommended to use spray method beside drinking water therapy.

Contra-Indications:
Not to be used for dairy cattle.

Withdrawal:
1 day.

Storage:
Store tightly closed, in dark place below 30°C.
name: Mucolin-M

description:
Composition:
Each 1 gm contains:
- Bromhexine HCl 10 mg

Indication:
Mucolin–M is indicated as co-therapy in conditions of respiratory tract infections associated with retention of mucoid secretions such as bronchitis and bronchopneumonia in different animal species.

In poultry:
- In cases of post vaccination reactions due to IB, ND & ILT vaccines.
- To increase the efficiency of antibiotics due to presence of bromhexine.
- It can be used during heat stress and in hot spells when chickens have difficulty in breathing due to the presence of menthol which has cooling and refreshing sensation.

Dose:
0.5 – 1 gm / 10 kg B.wt. ( 0.5 – 1 gm per 1 liter of drinking water ), ( 0.5 – 1 mg / 1 kg B.wt.) for 3 – 5 days.

Contra-Indications:
- Not used in cows producing milk for human consumption.
- Severe verminous bronchitis, pulmonary edema.

Warnings:
Avoid contact with skin and eyes.

Withdrawal:
1 day.

Storage:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C in dry place.
name: Mucolin-M

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Albendazole 200 mg

Indication:
Albendazole 20% is indicated for control of different types of worms and adult liver fluke in cattle, including:
- Roundworms: Ostertagia, Chabertia, Haemonchus, Trichostrongylus, Nematodirus, Oesophagostomum, Bunostomum, Cooperia and Strongyloides spp. It is usually effective against inhibited larvae of Cooperia and Ostertagia
- Lungworms: Dictyocaulus viviparus
- Tapeworms: Moniezia spp.
- Adult liver fluke: Fasciola hepatica.
- Albendazole 20% is ovicidal and will kill fluke and roundworm eggs, thus reducing pasture contamination.

Dose:
• To be given orally and shake well before use.
- For the control of roundworms, lungworms, tapeworms and fluke and roundworm eggs: 3.75 ml Albendazole 20% – Pharma Swede 100 kg bodyweight
- For the additional treatment of adult liver fluke (chronic fascioliasis) in cattle: 5 ml Albendazole 20% – Pharma Swede 100 kg bodyweight.
• The dose should be repeated after 21 days.

Contra-indications:
- Not to be used in animals with known hypersensitivity to the active ingredient.
- Concurrent administration of other ruminal boluses.

Side effects:
May cause GI effects (including hepatic dysfunction) and rarely blood dyscrasias.

Warnings:
- Operators should wear suitable protective clothing.
- Shake well before use.
- The use of the product in breeding bulls or pregnant cattle is not expected to interfere with their reproductive performance.

Withdrawal periods:
14 days for meat and offal and 3 days for milk.

Storage:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C.
name: Albendazole 20%

description:
COMPOSITION:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Sulfaquinoxaline sodium 34.88 mg (Equ. to Sulfaquinoxaline 32.5 mg)
- Pyrimethamine 9.8 mg

INDICATIONS:
• Thaminacox is indicated for the treatment of coccidiosis in broiler chickens and turkeys due to infection with Eimeria species.

DOSAGE:
1.5 ml Thaminacox per 1 liter of drinking water for 2 consecutive days repeated for another 3 days after 3 days.

PACKS: 1L
name: Thaminacox

description:
COMPOSITION:
Each 1 gm contains:
- Tylosin (as tartrate)  0.83 gm

INDICATIONS:
Broiler chickens and turkeys:
• For the control of Mycoplasma synoviae airsacculitis in broiler chickens and Mycoplasma gallisepticum broiler chickens and turkeys.
• As an aid in the control of outbreaks of necrotic enteritis caused by Clostridium perfringens in broiler

DOSAGE:
» 0.6 gm of Tylomedizen / liter of drinking water for 3-5 days.

PACKS: 100 gm
name: Tylomedizen

description:
COMPOSITION:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Diclazuril 10 mg

INDICATIONS:
» Broiler Chickens: For the prevention of coccidiosis caused by Eimeria tenella, E. necatrrix, E. acervulina, E. brunette, E. mitis and E. maxima.
» Turkeys: For the prevention of coccidiosis caused by Eimeria adenoids, E. gallopavonis, E. meleagrimitis and E. dispersa.
» Lambs: For the treatment and prevention of coccidial infections in lambs caused in particular by the more pathogenic Eimeria species, Eimeria crandallis and Eimeria ovinoidalis.

DOSAGE:
1 ml / 1 liter of drinking water.

PACKS:
100 ml, 1L
name: Medclazoril

description:
COMPOSITION:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Sulphadiazine sodium 218.45 mg (Equ. to sulphadiazine base 200 mg)
- Trimethoprim 40 mg

INDICATIONS:
• Colibacillosis caused by E.coli in broiler chickens, young calves and foals.
• Infectious coryza caused by Haemophilus paragallinarum in broiler chickens.
• Turkey coryza caused by Bordetella avium in turkeys.
• Fowl cholera caused by Pasteurella multocida in broiler chickens.
• Pullorum disease caused by Salmonella pullorum in broiler chickens.
• Fowl typhoid caused by Salmonella gallinarum in broiler chickens.

DOSAGE:
» Broiler Chickens and Turkeys: 3 ml / 5 Liter or 1 ml  / 16 Kg Bwt for 3-5 days.
» Calves and Foals: 1 ml / 8 kg B.wt. for 3-5 days.

PACKS:
250 ml, 500 ml

inhibit essential protein biosynthesis by selective binding to bacterial ribosomaRNA

description:

COMPOSITION

- Solvent.

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
Freeze-dried tablet and solvent.

IMMUNOLOGICAL PROPERTIES
Vaccine virus in 7-10 days induces speciﬁc immunity in poultry, which prevents vaccinated chicks against Viral Arthritis/Tenosynovitis for up to 3 months.

TARGET SPECIES
Poultry.

INDICATIONS
Preventive immunization against Viral Arthritis/Tenosynovitis.

INTERACTIONS
- Do not mix with other medicinal and preventive preparations.
- Do not administer with the vaccine against Infectious Bursal Disease at the same day.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS (DURING LAYING PERIOD)
- Do not vaccinate birds 2 weeks before start of laying period.
- ROUTEOF ADMINISTRATION AND DOSAGE
- Shake the vials thoroughly before use, warm the vaccine to room temperature (20-25°C).

VACCINE » SOLVENT
- 500 doses » 100 ml
- 1000 doses » 200 ml
- 2000 doses » 400 ml

The vaccine is administered to chickens at a dose of 0.5 ml subcutaneously in the lower third of the neck or intramuscularly in the pectoral muscle:
- broilers under the age of 2 weeks;
- for parent flocks and birds of egg-laying breeds at any age, but no later than 4 weeks before the start of egg-laying.

WITHDRAWALPERIOD
0 days.

SELF LIFE
24 months. Vaccine should be used within 10 hours after dissolving.

STORAGE CONDITIONS
Store vaccine in dry, dark places, out of reach of children, at +2 to +8°С. Do not freeze! When transporting the vaccine, temperature fluctuations in the range from 0 to 20°C are allowed for 5 days, which does not cause a negative impact on the quality of the drug.

- 10 vials of 1000 doses
- 10 vials of 2000 doses

name: Polimun Reo 1133

description:
Live vaccine against Avian Encephalomyelitis and Fowl Pox

COMPOSITION
» One dose of vaccine contains:
- virus of Avian encephalomyelitis, strain Calnek 1143 ≥ 102,5 EID50;
- virus of Fowl pox, strain Cutter ≥ 102,8 EID50.
» Solvent.

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
Freeze-dried tablet and solvent.

IMMUNOLOGICAL PROPERTIES
- Vaccine induces the formation of the protective antibodies in 2-3 weeks after vaccination and protects birds from infection throughout all egg-laying period. The reaction to the fowlpox virus inoculation can occur 5-7 days post vaccination and is characterized by swelling or formation of a nodular lesion or scab of the bird’s wing web at the site of inoculation. Swelling and scabs will disappear at about 2 weeks following inoculation and show that the vaccination was successful.
- Vaccine does not have therapeutic properties.

TARGET SPECIES
Chickens, turkeys.

INDICATIONS
To protect against specified diseases, vaccinate chickens older than 8 weeks, and turkeys at the age of over 18 weeks.

CONTRAINDICATIONS
Do not vaccinate exhausted and sick chickens as well as birds younger than the specified age.

PRECAUTIONS
- Do not use the vaccine from vials with cracks, without labels, with violation of sealing, and when the vaccine was not dissolved as well as a vaccine that is not used within six hours after reconstitution or with an expired date.
- Do not use the solvent from vials with cracks, without labels, with violation of sealing, or when its color or consistency are changed.

INTERACTION WITH DRUGS
Not studied, so administration concurrently with other vaccines is not recommended.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
Do not administer 28 days before the start of and during the egg-laying period.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION  
- Vial of vaccine of 1000 doses should be dissolved in 10 ml of solvent (500 doses in 5 ml) before use.
- Vaccine should be administered by the wing-web pierce method with a double needle applicator. For administering the vaccine hold the bird and spread the underside of one wing outward. Insert the double needle applicator into the vaccine bottle, wetting or charging both needles. Pierce the web of the exposed wing with the double needle applicator charged with the vaccine. During vaccination avoid hitting large blood vessels. All birds in the poultry house must be vaccinated at once.

ADVERSE EFFECTS
When using the drug in accordance with the leaflet-instruction, adverse effects are not observed.

OVERDOSE
The use of ten doses of vaccine does not adversely affect healthy birds.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
14 days.

SPECIAL WARNINGS FOR PERSONS
- Follow the rules of aseptic, personal hygiene and safety during vaccination.
- In the case of accidental self-injection, you should immediately seek medical assistance, having the leaflet (instruction) to this drug.

DISPOSAL
The expired vaccine and vaccine unused within 6 hours after reconstitution, the empty vials, and applicator’s needles should be decontaminated by boiling for 30 minutes.

SHELF LIFE
- 18 months for both vaccine and solvent.
- Vaccine should be used within 6 hours after reconstitution.

STORAGE AND TRANSPORT CONDITIONS
- Store vaccine in dark place out of the reach of children, at +2 to +8°C or at minus 20°C.
- Solvent is stored in dark place out of the reach of children, at +2 to +8°C.

PACKAGE
- 5 vials of 500 doses
- 5 vials of 1000 doses

Biotestlab Ltd.
Made in Ukraine

description:
Live vaccine against Infectious Bursal Disease (Gumboro) target titer 800

COMPOSITION
» One dose of vaccine contains live virus, obtained on SPF chicken embryos:
- Virus of Infectious Bursal Disease, strain MV/5 ≥ 10² EID50.

- Peptone or L-HB - 120 mg in a vial

PHARMACEUTICALFORM
Freeze-dried tablet.

IMMUNOLOGICALPROPERTIES
The vaccine protects vaccinated birds against infectious bursal disease. Has no therapeutic properties.

TARGET SPECIES
Chickens.

INDICATIONS
- Preventive immunization of clinically healthy chickens against Infectious Bursal Disease.
- Active immunization of chickens with a level of maternal antibodies in ELISA IDEXX not higher than 800.

INTERACTIONS
Administration simultaneously with other vaccines is not recommended.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
The vaccine does not inﬂuence egg laying, fertility, or egg incubation.

ROUTE OF ADMINISTRATION AND DOSAGE:
- Dosage – 1 dose per 1 bird.
- The vaccine is administered by drinking.
- The day before the vaccine is administered, the volume of water in liters that the bird drinks within 2 hours is determined.
- On the day of vaccination, the vials containing the vaccine are dissolved in drinking water at room temperature. The vaccine is diluted in such a way that one dose of vaccine for one bird is contained in the volume of water for drinking determined the day before vaccination. Vaccination should preferably be carried out in the morning. Depending on humidity and air temperature, the water supply for broilers will be shut off in 0.5-3 hours and in 1-4 hours for egg-laying birds.

NOTE
The vaccine is of tissue-origin, so when it is dissolved in the vial, small tissue residues from homogenized tissues of the embryos can be observed.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
0 days.

SELF-LIFE
24 months. The vaccine should be used within 2 hours after dissolving.

name: Polimun IBD

description:
Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Dexamethasone Na phosphate 2 mg (Equ to 1.52 mg dexamethasone base)

Properties:
- Dexamethasone isa synthetic analogue of prednisolone, which has more potent anti-inflammatory properties compared to older corticosteroids, The dosage of dexamethasone required is markedly lower than that of prednisone and prednisolone.
- Dexamethasone stimulates synthesis of enzymes required to decrease the inflammatory response. its primary efficacy is that of a strong anti-inflammatory as well as anti-allergic agent.

Indications:
Arabdexin Injectable solution is indicated as an aid tor the treatment of bovine ketosis and as an anti-inflammatory agent for dogs, cats and horses. Dogs and cats inflammatory conditions include arthritis, tendonitis and nonspecific dermatitis. Equine inflammatory conditions include bursitis, carpitis, tendonitis, myositis and sprains. If bony changes exist in any of these conditions, a response to treatment may be diminished.

Dosage:
» Horses and cattle: 1 ml per 25 kg bodyweight by I.V or I.M injection, the dose could be repeated if necessary
» Dogs and cats :1 ml per 10 kg bodyweight by IV or IM injection, the dose could be repeated if necessary.

Contra-indications:
1- Not used in cases of renal disease, laminitis osteoporosis,congestive heart failure and diabetes mellitus.
2- Not used in pregnant animals. Administration in late pregnancy may cause early parturition or abortion.
3- Not used in cases of viral infection during viraemic stage.
4. Not used for calves intended for veal production.
5- Not used for dairy cattle.

Side effects:
1. Use of the product in horses could induce laminitis and therefore careful observations during treatment should be made.
2- Corticosteroids may delay wound healing and the immune-suppressant actions may weaken resistance to or exacerbate existing infections thus anti-bacterial drug cover is usually required when steroids are used.
3- Polydipsia ,polyuria, polyphagina, hypokalamemia calcinosis cutis, gastrointestinal ulcers and decreased milk production may be noticed during therapy.
4- Treatment by dexamethasone may cause Cushing syndrome.

Warning:
- In Prolonged treatment care should be taken to withdraw dose gradually.
- Arabdexin not used for domestic animals newborn.

Withdrawal period:
- Cattle Meat: 21 days.

Storage:
store at temperature not exceeding 30°C away from sun light and used after opening for 30 days when stored at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Packaging :
Carton box containing amber glass (type III) glass vial 30, 50,100 ml with elastic opaque chlorobutyl rubber stopper and sealed with aluminnm with printed yellow plastic flip off (type HDPE) with outer label and insert leaflet.

M.O.H. Reg. No: 3509/2013

Manufactured by:
The Arab Company For Gelatin and Pharmaceutical Products (Arab Caps)

Distributed by: Elu-vet Trading

description:
INACTIVATED VACCINE AGAINST SALMONELLA ENTERITIDIS, SALMONELLA TYPHIMURIUM, SALMONELLA GALLINARUM

COMPOSITION
In one dose before inactivation:
- Salmonella еnteritidis strain SE-15 ≥ 10⁸ CFU
- Salmonella typhimurium strain ST-15 ≥ 10⁸ CFU
- Salmonella gallinarum strain SG-15 ≥ 10⁸ CFU

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
Emulsion.

IMMUNOLOGICAL PROPERTIES
Vaccine induces the formation of active protective immunity against Salmonella enteritidis, Salmonella typhimurium, Salmonella gallinarum. Sustained immunity is formed 4 weeks after the booster vaccination and retains throughout the productive period.

TARGET SPECIES
Chickens.

INDICATIONS
For preventive vaccination of the broiler breeders,laying hens breeders, and the laying hens against salmonellosis, caused by Salmonella enteritidis, Salmonella typhimurium, Salmonella gallinarum.

INTERACTIONS
Not determined.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
The vaccine does not affect egg production, fertilization, and egg incubation.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
- The vaccine is used at a dose of 0.5 ml per head by subcutaneous injection in the lower neck area or between the wings.
- It is advisable to vaccinate broiler breeders at 9-12 weeks of age, with re-vaccination at the age of 17-20 weeks.
- Laying hens breeders and laying hens are vaccinated at 9-12 weeks of age, with booster vaccination at the age of 16-17 weeks. The minimum interval between vaccinations should be at least 4 weeks. Re-vaccination shall be carried out no later than 3 weeks before the onset of the egg-laying period.

ADVERSE EFFECTS
At the injection sites, a local reaction in the form of swelling of 5-10 mm in size is possible, which disappears within 2-3 weeks.

OVERDOSE
The use of two doses of the vaccine does not adversely affect the birds.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
Do not vaccinate 21 days before slaughter.

SHELF LIFE
18 months. Once vial opened, the vaccine should be used immediately.

STORAGE CONDITIONS
- tore in dark places, out of the reach of children, at +2 to +8°C.
- Do not freeze!

PACKAGE AND PRESENTATION
Polymer vials of 500 and 100 doses, closed with rubber stoppers and aluminum caps.

PACKAGE
- 500 doses

FREEZE-DRIED TABLET AND SOLVENT

One dose of vaccine contains virus.
- Virus of Fowl Pox, strain Cutter ≥ 10^2,8 TCD50.
- Solvent.

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
Freeze-dried tablet and solvent.

IMMUNOLOGICAL PROPERTIES
Vaccine induces the formation of protective antibodies in 2-3 weeks after vaccination and protects birds from infection during all period of egg-laying. Chicks obtained from vaccinated birds stay protected during first weeks of life.

TARGET SPECIES
Chickens, turkeys.

Preventive immunization of chickens starting from 8 weeks of age and turkeys from 18 weeks of age against Fowl Pox.

INTERACTION WITH OTHER PREPARATIONS
Simultaneous administration with other vaccines is not recommended.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
Do not administer 28 days before the start of and during the laying period.

- Vial of the vaccine with 1000 doses should be dissolved in 10 ml of solvent (500 doses in 5 ml) before use.
- The vaccine should be injected by the method of the puncture into the membrane of the wing with a double-needle vaccinator. Before immunization, the vaccinator's needles should be dipped into the vaccine, taken out and punctured the membrane into the internal part of the wing. - In case of coercive molting after finishing of the egg-laying period the revaccination is done in previously described manner.

SIDE EFFECTS
The reaction to the vaccine inoculation may occur in 3-7 days after immunization and is characterized by the indurations under the skin and pockmarks on the outer and inner surfaces of the membrane of the bird wing at the puncture site, which disappear within two weeks.

name: Polimun ND Clone 124+IB H120

description:
Inactivated vaccine against Newcastle disease, egg production decline syndrome, and infectious bronchitis in chickens

COMPOSITION
One dose of the vaccine (0.5 ml) contains inactivated antigens that induce the formation of specific antibodies in titers:
» Newcastle disease virus, strain La Sota - ≥ 4.5 log2 HI*;
» Egg Drop Syndrome virus, strain EDS-76 - ≥ 7 log2 HI.
» Avian Infectious Bronchitis viruses:
- strain M-41 (Massachusetts group) - ≥ 5 log2 HI;
- strain BK-07 (group 793B) - ≥ 4 log2 HI;
- strain VAR2/V2 (VAR2 group) - ≥ 4 log2 HI.

*HI – antibody titer determined using hemagglutination-inhibition (HI) test.

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
Emulsion.

IMMUNOBIOLOGICAL PROPERTIES
The vaccine induces the formation of specific immunity in poultry against Newcastle disease (starting from the 21st day), infectious bronchitis caused by classical strains of the Massachusetts group and variant strains (BK-07, VAR2/V2), and egg drop syndrome in chickens (starting from 28th day), which lasts for life. Does not have therapeutic properties.

TARGET SPECIES
Chickens.

INDICATIONS
Preventive immunization against Newcastle Disease, Avian Infectious Bronchitis, and Egg Drop Syndrome in laying hens and parent flocks.

CONTRAINDICATIONS
It is not allowed to vaccinate weak and sick chickens.

INTERACTIONS
Do not mix with other preventive drugs and do not use simultaneously with medications.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
Do not vaccinate birds during the laying period.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
The vaccine is administered 0.5 ml intramuscularly (into the thigh or pectoral muscles) or subcutaneously (in the lower part of the neck) to hens aged 90-100 days, but no later than 30 days before the start of the egg-laying period. To create a more intense immune response, it is recommended to pre-vaccinate birds, at least 4 weeks in advance with live vaccines against Newcastle disease and avian infectious bronchitis according to the vaccination schedule accepted on the farm.

SIDE EFFECTS
The vaccine does not cause a clinically significant reaction after administration. The slight swelling that may form in some birds at the injection site disappears within 2-3 weeks.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
0 days.

SHELF LIFE
24 months. 10 hours after the first dose has been withdrawn from the vial.

STORAGE & TRANSPORT CONDITIONS
Store vaccine in dark places, out of reach of children at +2 to +8°С. Do not freeze!

PACKAGE
- Glass or plastic bottles of 10 doses.
- Glass or plastic bottles of 20 doses.
- Glass or plastic bottles of 100 doses.
- Glass or plastic bottles of 400 doses.
- Glass or plastic bottles of 500 doses.
- Glass or plastic bottles of 1000 doses.

SALE RULES
Without a prescription.

Biotestlab Ltd.
Made in Ukraine

description:
Live vaccine against Newcastle Disease

COMPOSITION
One dose of vaccine contains live virus, obtained on SPF chicken embryos:
- Virus of Newcastle Disease, strain La Sota clon DK-124 ≥ 10⁶ EID50.

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
Lyophilisate

IMMUNOLOGICAL PROPERTIES
Vaccine provides protection in vaccinated birds against Newcastle Disease.

TARGET SPECIES
Poultry, chickens, turkeys.

INDICATIONS
Preventive immunization of clinically healthy birds against Newcastle Disease.

INTERACTIONS
Do not mix with other medicinal and preventive preparations.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
No contraindications.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
- Vaccine can be administered with one of the methods: orally with drinking water, nasally, or with coarse spray.
- In non-endemic areas: It is recommended to administer first vaccination at 15-21 days of age.
- In endemic areas for vaccination of day-old chicks, the vaccine can be used by nasal or coarse spray methods, with following booster immunizations at 18-21 days of age.

» Oral Method
• Chicks:
- Up to 25 days of age: 5 ml per bird
- 25 – 45 days of age: 7.5 ml per bird
- From 45 days of age: 10 ml per bird
• Adult bird: 15 ml per bird
* Vaccine is dissolved in cool and clean water, which should not contain ions of chlorine and iron, with a neutral рН level, one dose per bird. For stabilization of vaccine add 0.2% of dried non-fat milk. The diluted vaccine should be administered to the bird in the morning. Do not administer drinking water to birds during 1-3 hours before vaccination.

» Nasal Method
• Chicks
- 100 doses – 10 ml
- 1000 doses – 100 ml
- 2500 doses – 250 ml
- 5000 doses – 500 ml
* Vaccine is dissolved in distilled or cool boiled water. For bird of all age groups administer 2 drops to the nostril at the same time the second nostril should be closed with your finger; in the case of nasal airway impassability the same amount of vaccine should be administered into the bird’s eye.

» Coarse Spray Method
• Chicks up to one month of age: 1000 doses in volume 250-500 ml
• For adult birds: 1000 doses in volume 500-1000 ml
* Vaccine is dissolved in boiled and cool water, which should not contain ions of iron and chlorine. Vaccination is carried out using a sprayer.
* Spraying is done from a distance of 30-40 cm above the birds. Approximate rate of vaccination 1000 heads per 1 minute.
* After spraying the vaccine leave the day old chicks to dry off for 20 minutes.

WITHDRAWALPERIOD
0 days.

SELF-LIFE
24 months. Vaccine should be used within 2 hours after dissolving.

STORAGE CONDITIONS
Store vaccine in dry, dark places, out of the reach of children, at +2 to +8°C.

PACKAGE
- 10 vials of 50 doses
- 10 vials of 100 doses
- 10 vials of 500 doses
- 10 vials of 1000 doses
- 10 vials of 2000 doses
- 10 vials of 5000 doses

description:
Live vaccine against Infectious Bronchitis

COMPOSITION
One dose of vaccine contains live virus, obtained on SPF chicken embryos:
- Virus of Infectious Bronchitis, strain H-120 ≥ 3,51 lg EID50.

PHARMACEUTICALFORM
Freeze-dried tablet

IMMUNOLOGICAL PROPERTIES
Vaccine virus in 7-10 days induces specific immunity and prevents vaccinated chicks against disease during 5-6 weeks.

TARGET SPECIES
Chickens

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
The vaccine does not influence egg laying, fertility or egg incubation.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
» Intraocular Method
- The intraocular method is used for day-old chicks. The lyophilized vaccine is dissolved at the rate of 1000 doses of the vaccine in 30-50 ml of water (the exact amount of water depends on the type of dropper used).
- Holding the bird in one hand, place it under the dropper so that one drop falls into the eye. The quality of the use of the vaccine is monitored by the color of the conjunctiva in blue.

» Spray Method
- An automatic sprayer or a manually controlled sprayer is used to spray the vaccine. When using a manual sprayer, it is important to apply the vaccine to the birds twice.
- Calibrate the automatic sprayer (or manually operated sprayer) to spray droplets of the appropriate size. Before carrying out the vaccination, check the correspondence of the size of the drops and the uniformity of the application of the solution by spraying it on any contrasting surface.
- The number of doses of the drug is chosen depending on the number of birds to be vaccinated. Pour the vaccine solution into the spray tank and mix gently.
- The vaccine solution is replenished every 1.5-2 hours. It is necessary to monitor the operation of the outlet and the temperature of the water (10-20°С). Spraying is carried out from a height of about 40 cm above the heads of the birds. As a result of spraying, the bird should be completely wet.

• Vaccination by the large-drop method:
- Chickens are vaccinated from the age of one day. 200-300 ml of water is required for every 1000 doses. The size of the drops is 150-250 µ. After spraying, keep the birds for 15-20 minutes in a closed, well-heated room away from drafts until completely dry.

• Vaccination by the droplet method:
- Chickens are vaccinated no earlier than 12 days of age. 400-500ml of water is required for every 1000 doses.
- The size of the drops is 100-150 µ. Gather the birds in one side of the aviary, turn off the ventilation and heating of the room, turn on the light. Spray the vaccine.
- Turn on the ventilation 10-20 minutes after the end of the spraying process.

• Vaccination check:
The quality of vaccination is controlled by the presence of blue dye on the feathers of the birds, to make sure that the birds are completely wet, run your hand over them.

» Method Of Drinking
- The day before the vaccine is administered, the volume of water in liters that the bird drinks for 1-1.5 hours is determined. Vaccination should preferably be carried out in the morning.
- On the day of vaccination, the vaccine is diluted in such a way that a predetermined volume of drinking water contains one dose of vaccine for one bird. Before vaccination, shut off the water supply for 1-3 hours.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
0 days.

SHELF LIFE
18 months.

STORAGE CONDITIONS
Store vaccine in dry, dark places, out of the reach of children, at +2 to +8⁰C.

PACKAGE
- 10 vials of 500 doses
- 10 vials of 1000 doses
- 10 vials of 2000 doses
- 10 vials of 5000 doses

name: Polimun IB Н120

description:
Live vaccine against Newcastle disease and infectious bronchitis in chickens

COMPOSITION
Active substances per dose:
The vaccine contains chicken embryo-derived viruses produced on SPF chicken embryos:
- Newcastle disease virus, La Sota strain, ≥ 10⁶ EID50
- Infectious bronchitis virus, H-120 strain, ≥ 10^3.5 EID50

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
Lyophilizate.

IMMUNOBIOLOGICAL PROPERTIES
- The vaccine provides protection for vaccinated poultry against Newcastle disease and infectious bronchitis in chickens.
- The intensity and duration of immunity depend on the clinical condition and housing conditions of the poultry before and after vaccination.
- It does not possess therapeutic properties.

BIRD SPECIES
Chickens.

INDICATIONS FOR USE
Prevention of Newcastle disease and infectious bronchitis in chickens.

SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS 
No contraindications for use during laying period.

ADMINISTRATION AND DOSAGE
• The vaccine is administered to poultry using one of the following methods: drinking water, intranasally, or by coarse spray. Drinking water is used for reconstitution and dilution.
• The optimal vaccination (revaccination) schedule for poultry in farms is determined based on the epizootic situation and the intensity of immunity.
• The effectiveness of immunization against Newcastle disease in vaccinated poultry is determined by the results of AGID in blood serum, expressed as a percentage. Blood serum samples are collected 2-3 weeks after vaccination.
• Group immunity is considered to be formed when 80% or more of the tested sera show the following antibody titers after vaccination: In chicks up to one month of age: 1:8 and above; In chicks from 30 to 60 days of age: 1:8 - 1:16 (dominant) and above; In young birds from 60 to 140 days of age: 1:16 - 1:32 (dominant) and above; In adult birds: 1:32 - 1:64 (dominant) and above.
• If the effectiveness of immunization is less than 80%, revaccination of the poultry is required.
• The initial vaccination of poultry is recommended at 15-21 days of age. After a single administration, the vaccine induces an immune response lasting approximately 6 weeks.
• In regions affected by Newcastle disease, the vaccine can be used intranasally or by coarse spray for vaccination of day-old chicks, with subsequent revaccination at 18-21 days of age.

» Drinking water method
- On the day of vaccination, the contents of the vaccine vials are dissolved in clean room temperature drinking water. The vaccine is diluted in a way that one vaccine dose for one bird is contained in the specified volume of drinking water one day before vaccination.
- Drinkers should be thoroughly cleaned before vaccination without adding disinfectant solutions.
- For better vaccination performance, it is recommended to use an indicator dye such as "INDIGO MAX" or other similar dyes of equivalent quality.

» Intranasal method
- The vaccine is dissolved in room temperature drinking water at a rate of 10 ml for 100 doses, 100 ml for 1000 doses, 250 ml for 2500 doses, and 500 ml for 5000 doses. Two drops are instilled into the nostril of birds of all age groups, while the second nostril is closed with a finger. If the nasal airways are not permeable, the same volume of vaccine should be instilled into the bird's eye.

» Coarse spray method
- The vaccine is dissolved in chlorine- and iron-free drinking water at a rate of 250-500 ml for chicks up to one month of age and 500-1000 ml for older birds for 1000 doses. Vaccination is carried out using a sprayer that maintains constant pressure and has a calibrated nozzle. The vaccine is sprayed from.

SYMPTOMS OF OVERDOSE:
In case of a 10-fold overdose, the vaccine does not cause Newcastle disease or infectious bronchitis in chickens.

EMERGENCY MEASURES:
There are no specific emergency measures required in case of overdose with this vaccine. However, it is always recommended to consult with a veterinarian or healthcare professional for guidance.

WAITING PERIOD:
There is no waiting period required after vaccination with this vaccine. The poultry can be used for consumption or production immediately after vaccination.

STORAGE & TRANSPORTATION CONDITIONs
- The vaccine should be stored in a dark place at a temperature between 2°C and 8°C. Freezing and storing the vaccine at a temperature of -20°C for the duration of its shelf life does not have a negative impact on its quality.
- Temperature fluctuations within the range of -5°C to +14°C during transportation are acceptable for up to 21 days. Such temperature fluctuations do not adversely affect the quality of the vaccine.
- It's important to follow the storage and transportation instructions to ensure the vaccine remains effective and maintains its quality.

PACKAGE
- 10 vials of 2000 doses
- 10 vials of 2500 doses
- 10 vials of 5000 doses

Biotestlab Ltd.
Made in Ukraine

description:
Live vaccine against Newcastle disease

COMPOSITION
Active substances:
- Newcastle disease virus, strain "La Sota" ≥ 10⁶ EID50 per dose, obtained on SPF chicken embryos.

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
Lyophilisate.

IMMUNOBIOLOGICAL PROPERTIES
- The vaccine provides protection for vaccinated birds against Newcastle disease.
- The intensity and duration of immunity depend on the clinical condition and on the conditions of the birds before and after vaccination.
- Has no medicinal properties.

TARGET SPECIES
Poultry.

INDICATIONS
For the prevention of Newcastle disease in poultry.

PRECAUTIONS FOR USE
- It is not allowed to vaccinate weakened birds, as well as birds with clinical signs of the disease.
- Do not use a vaccine two hours after reconstitution, or an expired vaccine.
- Do not mix with other medicinal and preventive products.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
No contraindications during the egg-laying period.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
- The vaccine is administered to birds by one of the methods: orally with drinking water, intranasally or by coarse spraying.
- The optimal timing of vaccination (revaccination) of poultry in farms is determined depending on the epizootic situation and the intensity of immunity.
- According to the results of the study of blood sera in HI test, the effectiveness of immunization of vaccinated birds is determined in percent. Blood sera are taken 2-3 weeks after vaccination.

- Group immunity is considered formed, and birds are immune to Newcastle disease if 80% or more of the studied blood serum samples have the following antibody titers after vaccination:
• in chickens under the age of one month – 1:8 and above;
• in chickens from 30 to 60 days of age – 1:8-1:16 (dominating) and above;
• in young birds aged 60 to 140 days – 1:16-1:32 (dominating) and above;
• in adult birds – 1:32-1:64 (dominating) and above.

- If the immunization success rate after vaccination is less than 80%, the birds should be revaccinated.
- The first vaccination of birds is recommended at 15-21 days of age. After a single dose, the vaccine induces an immune response lasting about 6 weeks.
- In endemic areas the vaccine can be used by intranasal or coarse spray methods for vaccination of day-old chicks, with following booster immunizations at 18-21 days of age.

» Oral method
- On the day of vaccination, the contents of the vials with the vaccine are dissolved in clean, drinking water cooled to room temperature. The vaccine is diluted in such a way that one dose of the vaccine per bird is contained in the volume of drinking water determined the day before vaccination.
- Water, used for vaccination should not contain chlorine and iron ions as well as residues of antibiotics and disinfectants. Before vaccination, drinkers should be thoroughly washed without the use of disinfectant solutions.
- For better vaccination, it is recommended to use INDIGO MAX, an indicator dye, or another of similar quality.

» Intranasal method
- The vaccine is dissolved in distilled or boiled cooled water at the rate of: 100 doses – 10 ml, 1000 doses – 100 ml, 2500 doses – 250 ml, 5000 doses – 500 ml. For birds of all age categories, 2 drops are instilled into the nostril; while the second nostril is closed with a finger; in case of nasal congestion, the same volume of vaccine should be instilled into the bird's eye.

» Coarse spray method
- The vaccine is dissolved in boiled chilled water that does not contain iron and chlorine ions, at the rate: for chickens up to one month of age, 1000 doses in a volume of 250 to 500 ml, for adult birds 1000 doses in a volume of 500 to 1000 ml. The vaccination is carried out using a sprayer with a calibrated nozzle and constant pressure support. Spray the vaccine from a distance of 30-40 cm above the birds' heads. The approximate vaccination rate is 1000 heads per 1 minute. After spraying the vaccine, the day-old chicks are left to dry for 20 minutes.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
Zero days.

SHELF LIFE
24 months. After reconstitution, the vaccine should be used within 2 hours.

STORAGE CONDITIONS
Store in a dark place, out of the reach of children, at a temperature of 2 to 8°C.
Do not freeze!

PACKAGE
- 1000 doses
- 2000 doses
