description:
Live vaccine against avian infectious bronchitis from strain VAR2/V2.

COMPOSITION
Active ingredients per dose:
- Infectious bronchitis virus, strain VAR2/V2 ≥ 3.5 lg EID50 obtained on SPF chick embryos.

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
Lyophilizate.

IMMUNOBIOLOGICAL PROPERTIES
The vaccine stimulates the formation of specific immunity in birds within 14 days after vaccination and protects vaccinated chickens from infectious bronchitis for 6-8 weeks. The vaccine does not have any medicinal properties.

POULTRY SPECIES
Chickens.

INDICATIONS FOR USE
Prevention of infectious bronchitis in chickens, starting from the first day of life.

CONTRAINDICATIONS
- It is forbidden to vaccinate birds that are in the incubation period of infectious disease, in a state of exhaustion, affected by helminths, as well as birds that are in a stressful state caused by transportation, environmental exposure, or in another immunosuppressive state.
- The strength of immunity may be insufficient if the vaccine was not used according to the instructions.

INTERACTIONS
Can be used from one day of age in combination with the Newcastle disease vaccine.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
- Do not administer the vaccine to hens 4 weeks before the start and during the egg-laying period.
- Forced vaccination during the laying period does not lead to a decrease in productivity. A temporary drop in egg production can be caused by stress.
- The vaccine should be protected from direct sunlight and used within 2 hours of reconstitution.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
• Vaccination and revaccination are carried out by one of the following methods: spraying, intraocular administration, or drinking water.
• For the prevention of infectious bronchitis in chickens, intraocular and spray methods are most effective.

» INTRAOCULAR METHOD
- It is used in chickens from one day of age. The lyophilized vaccine is dissolved at the rate of 1000 doses of the vaccine in 30-50 ml of water (the exact amount of water depends on the type of dropper used).
- Holding the bird in one hand place it under the drip so that one drop gets into the eyes. The quality of the vaccine administration is controlled by the blue-colored conjunctiva.

» SPRAY METHOD
- To spray the vaccine, either an automatic sprayer or a manually operated sprayer is used. When using a manual sprayer, it is important to spray the birds twice.
- The number of doses of the drug is chosen depending on the number of birds to be vaccinated. Pour the vaccine solution into the spray bottle and stir gently.
- The vaccine solution is replenished every 1.5-2 hours. It is necessary to monitor the operation of the outlet nozzle and the water temperature (10-20°C).
- Spraying is carried out from a height of about 40 cm above the heads of birds. As a result of spraying, the birds should be completely moistened.

» LARGE-DROP SPRAYING (COARSE SPRAY):
- Chickens are vaccinated from the age of one day. For every 1000 doses, 200-300 ml of water is required. The droplet size is 150–250 µ. After spraying, the birds are kept for 15-20 minutes in a closed, well-heated room, away from drafts, until completely dry.

» SMALL-DROP SPRAYING:
- Chickens are vaccinated no earlier than 12 days of age. For every 1000 doses, 400-500 ml of water is required. The droplet size is 100–150 µ. Gather the birds in one part of the poultry house, turn off the ventilation and heating of the room, and turn on the lights. Spray the vaccine. Turn on ventilation 10-20 minutes after the end of the spraying process.

» VACCINATION CHECK
- The quality of vaccination is controlled by the blue staining of bird feathers. Run your hand over the birds to make sure the birds are completely wet with the vaccine.

» DRINKING METHOD
- The day before the vaccine is used, the volume of water in liters is determined, which the birds drink within 1-1.5 hours. It is advisable to vaccinate in the morning.
- On the day of vaccination, the vaccine is diluted so that a predetermined volume of drinking water contains one dose of vaccine per bird. Before vaccination, turn off the water supply 1-3 hours before the start.

WITHDRAWALPERIOD
0 days.

SHELF LIFE
24 months. Two hours after reconstitution.

STORAGE & TRANSPORTATION CONDITIONS
- In a dark place, out of reach of children, at a temperature of 2 to 8°C.
- Freezing and storage of the vaccine during the expiration date at a temperature of minus 20°C does not adversely affect the quality of the drug.

PACKAGE
- 10 vials of 50 doses
- 10 vials of 100 doses
- 10 vials of 300 doses
- 10 vials of 500 doses
- 10 vials of 1000 doses
- 10 vials of 2000 doses
- 10 vials of 5000 doses

description:
Live vaccine against Infectious Bronchitis

COMPOSITION
One dose of the vaccine contains obtained on SPF chickens embryos:
- Avian Infectious Bronchitis virus both strains H-120 and BK-07 ≥ 10^3,5 EID50 totally per dose

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
Freeze-dried tablet

IMMUNOLOGICAL PROPERTIES
Vaccine virus in 7-10 days induces specific immunity and prevents vaccinated chicks against disease during 6-7 weeks.

TARGET SPECIES
Chickens

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
The vaccine does not influence egg laying, fertility or egg incubation.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
- The number of vaccine doses in the bottle is indicated on the label.
- Poultry from the age of 1 day are vaccinated in incubator conditions or in poultry houses in prosperous farms by one of the following methods: intraocularly, by the spray method or by the drinking method.

WARNING!!!
FOR THE PREVENTION OF INFECTIOUS BRONCHITIS IN CHICKENS, THE INTRAOCULAR AND SPRAY METHODS ARE CONSIDERED THE MOST EFFECTIVE.

Note before vaccination:
- Use clean equipment in good condition that does not contain residual disinfectants.
- The water temperature should be 10-20°C.
- Water for dissolving the vaccine should not contain chlorine and iron ions, as well as antibiotics and disinfectants.
- For better quality of vaccination, it is recommended to use indicator-stabilizer "INDIGO" or others similar in quality.
- The vaccine is dissolved by adding 5-8 ml of cooled clean drinking or boiled water to the bottle with the vaccine and shaking thoroughly until the lyophilisate is completely dissolved.
- The resulting solution is used to prepare working solutions for each of the following methods of using the drug.

INTRAOCULAR METHOD
- The intraocular method is used for day-old chicks. The lyophilized vaccine is dissolved at the rate of 1000 doses of the vaccine in 30-50 ml of water (the exact amount of water depends on the type of dropper used).
- Holding the bird in one hand, place it under the dropper so that one drop falls into the eye. The quality of the use of the vaccine is monitored by the color of the conjunctiva in blue.

SPRAY METHOD
- An automatic sprayer or a manually controlled sprayer is used to spray the vaccine. When using a manual sprayer, it is important to apply the vaccine to the birds twice.
- Calibrate the automatic sprayer (or manually operated sprayer) to spray droplets of the appropriate size. Before carrying out the vaccination, check the correspondence of the size of the drops and the uniformity of the application of the solution by spraying it on any contrasting surface.
- The number of doses of the drug is chosen depending on the number of birds to be vaccinated. Pour the vaccine solution into the spray tank and mix gently.
- The vaccine solution is replenished every 1.5-2 hours. It is necessary to monitor the operation of the outlet and the temperature of the water (10-20°С). Spraying is carried out from a height of about 40 cm above the heads of the birds. As a result of spraying, the bird should be completely wet.

LARGE-DROP METHOD:
- Chickens are vaccinated from the age of one day. 200-300 ml of water is required for every 1000 doses. The size of the drops is 150-250 µ. After spraying, keep the birds for 15-20 minutes in a closed, well-heated room away from drafts until they dry completely.

SMALL-DROPLET METHOD:
- Chickens are vaccinated no earlier than 12 days of age. 400-500ml of water is required for every 1000 doses.
- The size of the drops is 100-150 µ. Gather the birds in one side of the aviary, turn off the ventilation and heating of the room, turn on the light. Spray the vaccine.
- Turn on the ventilation 10-20 minutes after the end of the spraying process.
• Vaccination check: The quality of vaccination is controlled by the presence of blue dye on the feathers of the birds, to make sure that the birds are completely wet, run your hand over them.

METHOD OF DRINKING
- The day before the vaccine is administered, the volume of water in liters that the bird drinks for 1-1.5 hours is determined. Vaccination should preferably be carried out in the morning.
- On the day of vaccination, the vaccine is diluted in such a way that a predetermined volume of drinking water contains one dose of vaccine for one bird. Before vaccination, shut off the water supply for 1-3 hours.

CONTRAINDICATIONS
It is not recommended to vaccinate poultry that:
- is in the incubation period of an infectious disease;
- is in a state of exhaustion;
- is affected by helminths;
- is in a state of stress caused by transportation, exposure to or in another immunosuppressive state.
• The immune system may not be sufficiently strong in cases where the vaccine was not administered in accordance with the leaflet.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
0 days.

SHELF LIFE
18 months.

STORAGE CONDITIONS
Store vaccine in dry, dark places, out of the reach of children, at +2 to +8⁰C.

PACKAGE
- 10 vials of 50 doses
- 10 vials of 500 doses
- 10 vials of 1000 doses
- 10 vials of 2000 doses
- 10 vials of 5000 doses

Biotestlab Ltd.
Made in Ukraine
name: Polimun IB Multi

description:
Live vaccine against Infectious Bursal Disease (Gumboro)

COMPOSITION
One dose of vaccine contains live virus, obtained on SPF chicken embryos:
- Virus of Infectious Bursal Disease, strain MV/20 ≥ 10² EID50.

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
Freeze-dried tablet.

IMMUNOLOGICAL PROPERTIES
Vaccine virus in 1-2 weeks induces specific immunity in vaccinated birds against Infectious Bursal Disease.

TARGET SPECIES
Chickens.

INDICATIONS
Preventive immunization of healthy chickens starting from the first day of age against Infectious Bursal Disease.

INTERACTIONS
Administration simultaneously with other live vaccines is not recommended.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
The vaccine does not inﬂuence egg laying, fertility or egg incubation.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
Before using the vaccine, add 5.0-8.0 ml of clean, chilled to room temperature drinking water into the vial, and shake vigorously for 1 minute until the lyophilisate is completely dissolved. The vaccine is dissolved in water at the rate that 1 dose of the vaccine is in the predetermined water volume (check the day before vaccination), for one bird. Water for the vaccine solution intake should not contain chlorine and iron ions, as well as antibiotics and disinfectants. Water nipple drinkers should be thoroughly washed before vaccination without the addition of disinfectants. For a better vaccination, it is recommended to use the INDIGO dye indicator or others of similar quality.

NOTE
The vaccine is of tissue-origin, so when it is dissolved in the vial, small tissue residues from homogenized tissues of the embryos can be observed.

WITHDRAWALPERIOD
0 days.

SELF LIFE
18 months. Vaccine should be used within 2 hours after dissolving.

STORAGE CONDITIONS
Store vaccine in dry, dark places, out of the reach of children, at +2 to +8°С.

PACKAGE
- 10 vials of 500 doses
- 10 vials of 1000 doses
- 10 vials of 2000 doses
- 10 vials of 5000 doses

Biotestlab Ltd.

name: Polimun IBD Light

description:
COMPOSITION
One dose of vaccine contains:
- Inactivated agent of rabbit Hemorrhagic Disease, strain BG-04 from 640 to 1280 HAU.

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
Suspension.

IMMUNOLOGICAL PROPERTIES
Protects rabbits from Hemorrhagic Disease for 12 months, induces formation of protective antibodies 4-14 days after vaccination.

TARGET SPECIES
Rabbits.

INDICATIONS
Preventative immunization of rabbits against Hemorrhagic Disease.

INTERACTION WITH OTHER PREPARATIONS
Do not mix with other medicinal and preventative preparations. Dehelmintiation of rabbits is to be performed 2 weeks prior to or 2 weeks after vaccination. The vaccine can be used simultaneously with the vaccine against Myxomatosis LAPIMUN MIX which is administered at the opposite side.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
It is not recommended to vaccinate females 7 days prior to the parturition, because of the "mechanical" abortions that may occur due to animals’ stresses.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
- Route of injection: Subcutaneously, behind the shoulder blade.
» Rabbits in non-endemic areas: Single dose(1 ml), at the age of 10 weeks.
» Rabbits at threat of early infection: Single dose(1 ml), at the age of 4 weeks.
• Re-vaccination is carried out every 12 months.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
0 days.

SELF LIFE
24 months. Vaccine should be used within 7 days after opening.

STORAGE CONDITIONS
Store vaccine in dry, dark places, out of the reach of children, at +2 to +8°С. Do not freeze!

PACKAGE
- 10 vials of 10 doses
- 10 vials of 100 doses

Biotestlab Ltd.
Made in Ukraine
name: Lapimun Gem

description:
COMPOSITION
One dose of vaccine contains inactivated by formaldehyde:
- virus of Rabbit Hemorrhagic Disease, strain BG-04 ≥ 640 HAU
- virus of Rabbit Hemorrhagic Disease, strain GBK-2 ≥ 640 HAU

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
Suspension.

IMMUNOLOGICAL PROPERTIES
The vaccine protects rabbits against Rabbit Hemorrhagic Disease caused by a calicivirus, for 12 months, and induces the formation of protective antibodies within 4-14 days post-vaccination. It has no therapeutic properties.

TARGET SPECIES
Rabbits.

INDICATIONS
Preventative immunization of rabbits against Hemorrhagic Disease, caused by a calicivirus.

CONTRAINDICATIONS
The vaccine is not administered to exhausted and sick rabbits.

PRECAUTIONS
Follow the rules of asepsis. Do not use the vaccine from vials with cracks, unlabeled, with violation of sealing, and when the vaccine has not been used for seven days after the first opening or expired.

INTERACTIONS
The vaccine can be used simultaneously with the vaccine against Myxomatosis of rabbits LAPIMUN МІХ, which is administered at the opposite side of the body into the area of the shoulder blades or thighs.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
- It is not recommended to vaccinate females 7 days prior to the parturition, because of the abortions that may occur due to animals’ stresses.
- Lactating females are vaccinated, regardless of the term of parturition.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
- The vaccine is administered to healthy rabbits subcutaneously behind the shoulder blade in a dose of 1 ml per head.
- In a hemorrhagic disease-free farm, rabbits are vaccinated once, starting at 30 days of age. If a threat of early infection occurs, rabbits are vaccinated once from 4 weeks of age.
- Rabbits of commercial herds are vaccinated once a year. Animals of the parent herd, with intensive use, are vaccinated twice with an interval of 6 months.

ADVERSE EFFECTS
In disadvantaged farms after immunization, the death of those animals that were in the incubation period or were infected with the epizootic virus of Rabbit Hemorrhagic Disease is possible.

OVERDOSE
The use of 2 doses of the vaccine does not cause Rabbit Hemorrhagic Disease in rabbits.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
0 days.

SPECIAL WARNINGS
- Follow the rules of asepsis, personal hygiene and safety during vaccination.
- In the case of accidental self-injection, you should immediately seek medical assistance, having the leaflet (instruction) to this drug.

DISPOSAL MEASURES 
The expired or unused vaccine, the empty vials and needles should be decontaminated by boiling for 30 minutes.

SHELF LIFE
24 months. The vaccine should be used within 7 days after first opening.

STORAGE CONDITIONS
Store vaccine in dark places, out of the reach of children, at +2 to +8°С.

PACKAGE
- 10 vials of 10 doses
- 10 vials of 20 doses
- 10 vials of 50 doses
- 10 vials of 100 doses

Biotestlab Ltd.
Made in Ukraine
name: Lapimun Gem-2

description:
COMPOSITION
Vaccine contains two components with an equal amount of doses:
• Suspension of inactivated agent of rabbit Hemorrhagic Disease, strain BG-04 from 640 to 1280 HAU in one dose, as a solvent for freeze-dried tablet.
• Freeze-dried tablet of vaccine virus of Myxomatosis, strain MAV/RK – 13/20 ≥ 104,0 EID50 in one dose.

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
Freeze-dried tablet and suspension.

IMMUNOLOGICAL PROPERTIES
Vaccine protects rabbits from Hemorrhagic Disease and Myxomatosis during 8-10 months, induces formation of protective antibodies in 7-14 days after vaccination.

INDICATIONS
Preventative immunization of rabbits against Hemorrhagic Disease and Myxomatosis.

INTERACTIONS
Do not mix with other preparations, with components of other vaccines against rabbit disease and components of other batches of LAPIMUN GEMIX vaccine. Dehelmintization of rabbits is to be performed 2 weeks prior to or 2 weeks after vaccination.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
It is not recommended to vaccinate females 7 days before the parturition, because of "mechanical" abortions that may occur due to animals’ stresses.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
- After shaking, using a syringe, vaccine component in suspension form is transferred into the vial with freeze-dried component.
- Route of injection: Subcutaneously, behind the shoulder blade.

» Rabbits in non-endemic areas: Single dose(1 ml), at the age of 10 weeks.
» Rabbits at threat of early infection: Single dose(1 ml) at the age of 4 weeks and revaccination at the age of 4 months.

• Re-vaccination is carried out every 8 months.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
0 days.

SELF LIFE
18 months. Vaccine should be used within 3 hours after dissolving.

STORAGE CONDITIONS
Store vaccine in dry, dark places, out of the reach of children, at +2 to +8°С. Do not freeze!

PACKAGE
- 5 vials of 10 doses
- 5 vials of 100 doses

Biotestlab Ltd.
Made in Ukraine
name: Lapimun Gemix

description:
Live vaccine against Myxomatosis

COMPOSITION
One dose of vaccine contains:
- Virus of Myxomatosis, strain MAV/RK – 13/20 ≥ 10⁴ EID50.

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
Freeze-dried tablet, or freeze-dried tablet and solvent.

IMMUNOLOGICAL PROPERTIES
Induces postvaccinal protection in healthy rabbits on 4-9th day after vaccination that lasts for 8-10 months.

TARGET SPECIES
Rabbits.

INDICATIONS
Preventative immunization of rabbits against Myxomatosis.

INTERACTIONS
The vaccine can be used simultaneously with the vaccine against Hemorrhagic Disease LAPIMUN GEM which is administered at the opposite side. Dehelmintisation of rabbits is to be performed 2 weeks prior to or 2 weeks after vaccination.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
No contraindications during gestation period.

PREPARATION OF VACCINE
- 10 doses vaccine dissolved in 10 ml Solvent.
- 100 doses vaccine dissolved in 100 ml Solvent.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
- Just before use vaccine should be dissolved in Solvent for Live Vaccines or in sterile saline solution at the rate of 1 ml per one dose.
- Route of injection: Subcutaneously, behind the shoulder blade.

» Rabbits in non-endemic areas: Single dose(1 ml), at the age of 10 weeks.
» Rabbits in endemic areas: First dose(1 ml) at the age of 4 weeks with revaccination at the age of 4 months.
» Adult rabbits: The last 7 days before mating.

• In the future the vaccination of animals is carried out every 8 months.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
0 days.

SELF LIFE
24 months. Vaccine should be used within 3 hours after dissolving.

STORAGE CONDITIONS
Store vaccine in dry, dark places, out of the reach of children, at +2 to +8°С. Do not freeze!

Biotestlab Ltd.
Made in Ukraine
name: Lapimun Mix

description:
COMPOSITION
The vaccine consists of two components with the same number of doses:
» Inactivated viruses of Rabbit Hemorrhagic Disease (in form of suspension)
- strain BG-04 ≥ 640 HAU in one dose
- strain GBK-2 ≥ 640 HAU in one dose

» Live vaccine virus of Rabbit Myxomatosis (freeze-dried)
- strain “MAV/RK–13/20” ≥ 10⁴ TCD50 in one dose.

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
Suspension and freeze-dried tablet.

IMMUNOLOGICAL PROPERTIES
The vaccine protects rabbits against Hemorrhagic Disease and Myxomatosis for 8-10 months, and protective antibodies are formed in 7-14 days post-vaccination.

TARGET SPECIES
Rabbits.

INDICATIONS
Preventative immunization of rabbits against Hemorrhagic Disease (RHD) and Myxomatosis.

INTERACTION WITH OTHER DRUGS
Do not mix with medicinal and prophylactic drugs including those against diseases of rabbits and components of other batches of the vaccine LAPIMUN GEMІХ-3 against Rabbit Hemorrhagic Disease and Myxomatosis of rabbits.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
To avoid abortions due to animals’ stresses it is not recommended to vaccinate females 7 days prior to the parturition.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
- After shaking, the vaccine component in suspension form is transferred using a syringe into the vial with the freeze-dried component. After dissolution, the vaccine is administered to clinically healthy rabbits starting from 28 days of age subcutaneously behind the shoulder blade at a dose of 1 ml with booster vaccination at the age of 4 months.
- In the case of an early infection threat, all rabbits that are 28 days old and older are vaccinated regardless of the timeframe of the previous vaccination, with booster vaccination in three months with the vaccine LAPIMUN GEMІХ-3 or LAPIMUN MІХ – live vaccine against the rabbit myxomatosis.
- Booster vaccination of rabbits is carried out every 8 months.
- Vaccinated animals of the parent herd, with intensive use, are to be revaccinated at an interval of 6 months.

WITHDRAWALPERIOD
0 days.

SHELF LIFE
24 months. The vaccine should be used within 3 hours after dissolving.

STORAGE CONDITIONS
Store vaccine in dark places, out of the reach of children, at +2 to +8°С.

PACKAGE
- 5 vials of 10 dose

Biotestlab Ltd.
Made in Ukraine

description:
COMPOSITION:
- Lincomycin HCl  222 mg base 
- Spectinomycin sulphate  444 mg base
- Sodium benzoate up to 1 gm

TARGET SPECIES:
Pigs and poultry.

THERAPEUTIC INDICATIONS:
- Pigs: treatment of pig dysentery.
- Poultry: prevention and treatment of chronic airsacculitis.

CONTRA-INDICATIONS: 
The administration of Spectolikel 100 to species other than pigs and poultry is contra-indicated.

DOSAGE:
» Pigs: During 1 week daily 1 package of 150 g dissolved in 1600 L drinking water or 1 measuring spoon of 10 g per 105 L drinking water.

» Poultry:
1. Preventive treatment:
- during the first 3 to 5 days: 1 package of 150 g dissolved in 200 L drinking water (or 1 measuring spoon of 10 g per 13 L drinking water).
- during the 4th week of their life or during periods of stress (e.g. vaccination): during 1 to 3 days 1 package of 150 g dissolved in 200 L drinking water (or 1 measuring spoon of 10 g per 13 L) during 12 h, and Unmedicated water is administered the rest of the day.

2. Curative treatment: From the first symptoms on, give for 5 to 10 days daily 1 package of 150 g dissolved in 160 L drinking water or 1 measuring spoon of 10 g per 10 L drinking water.

MODE OF ADMINISTRATION:
Water soluble powder for oral administration in the drinking water or feed.

SIDE EFFECTS:
- Sometimes mild diarrhoea may occur.
- Following long term administration fungal infections may arise.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
- It is advised to prepare fresh solutions daily.
- Incompatibilities: The powder is incompatible with alkaline products (e.g. sodium carbonate).
- Use during pregnancy: Spectolikel 100 can be used during pregnancy without any danger.
- Interactions with other drugs: the activity of the powder is hampered by concomitant administration of kaolin.
- Measurement in case of overdosing: when diarrhoea occurs, stop the therapy. 

PACK SIZE:
150 g, 1.5 kg

KELA N.V. – Belgium
name: Spectolikel 100

description:
MEVAC™ Eli-Var2 Live-attenuated freeze-dried vaccine for immunization of commercial chicken against Newcastle Disease and Avian Infectious Bronchitis Virus.

COMPOSITION
- Live-attenuated NDV VG/GA (ME/NDV2] and IBV variant-2 GI-23 [Eg/1212B) strains propagated in SPF embryonated chicken eggs and freeze-dried under vacuum conditions.
- Each dose contains 6 and 3 log10 EID50 from NDV and IBV fractions, respectively, at release.

TARGET SPECIES
Chickens

INDICATIONS
Active immunization of commercial chickens against Newcastle Disease and Avian Infectious Bronchitis Virus.

CONTRAINDICATIONS
Vaccinate healthy animals only.

SPECIAL WARNING(S)
• For safe use in target species
- The vaccine virus can spread to unvaccinated birds. Infection of unvaccinated birds with the vaccine virus from vaccinated birds does not induce any sign of disease.

• For the person
- Personal protective equipment consisting of respiratory and eye protection should be worn when handling the veterinary medicinal product.

ADVERSE EVENTS
- Chickens: very rare.
- Reporting adverse events is important. It allows continuous safety monitoring of a product. If you notice any side effects, even those not already listed in this package leaflet, or you think that the medicine has not worked, please contact, in the first instance, your veterinarian. Alternatively, you can report to the marketing authorization holder.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
The vaccine should be administered via eye drop, spray, or drinking water as a one-dose/bird.

CORRECT ADMINISTRATION
- Birds can be vaccinated from one day of age onwards endemic areas.
- The most suitable vaccination program shall be justified by a veterinary surgeon according to the health conditions of each farm and area.
- Vaccine shall be reconstituted with sterile water free from disinfectant and/or antiseptic.
- Shake the reconstituted lyophilisate until complete resuspension before administration.
- Use the entire contents when first opened.
- Do not administer less than the recommended dosage.
- An overdose should be administered if the number of birds does not coincide with the number of doses of available vials.

» Individual vaccination:
• Eye-drop (ocular route)
- Reconstitute the lyophilisate pellet corresponding to 1,000 doses into 3 to 5 ml of non-chlorinated water and subsequently dilute it into 30-50 ml of non-chlorinated water.
- Use a calibrated dropper distribute 30-50 ul- drops. Place one drop of the vaccine solution on the eye of each bird, allow the drop to spread, and release the bird.

» Mass vaccination:
• Spray (respiratory route)
- Reconstitute the lyophilisate pellet corresponding to 1,000 doses into 3 to 5 ml of non-chlorinated water and subsequently dilute it into the volume of non-chlorinated water according to the type of sprayer used (pressure-sprayer or sprayer with rotary cone).
- Spray the vaccine solution above the birds using a spray capable of producing micro-droplets (mean diameter 80 - 100 µm). Make sure that birds are closely confined together during spraying. The ventilation system of the poultry house should be inoperative during the spray administration.

• Drinking water (oral route)
- Reconstitute the lyophilisate pellet corresponding to 1,000 doses into 3 to 5 ml of non-chlorinated water and subsequently dilute it into the volume of non-chlorinated drinking water to be consumed within one to two hours.
- When using mains water, treat all water to come into contact with the vaccine with skimmed milk powder at a rate of 2.5 g per liter to neutralize traces of chlorine.
- Distribute the vaccine solution at the time of use to birds.
- Birds should be deprived of water for two hours before vaccination.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
Zero days.

STORAGE PRECAUTIONS
- Keep out of the sight and reach of children.
- Store and transport refrigerated (+2°C to +8°C).
- Do not freeze.
- Store in the original package.
- Keep the vial in the outer carton.
- Protect from light.
- Store in a dry place.
- Protect from direct sunlight.
- Do not use this veterinary medicinal product after the expiry date which is stated on the vial.
- Shelf life: 24 months after manufacturing date.
- Shelf life after reconstitution according to directions: 3 hours.

DISPOSAL PRECAUTIONS
Dispose of waste material by boiling, incineration, or immersion in an appropriate disinfectant approved for use by the competent authorities.

MANUFACTURER
Middle East for Vaccines (MEVAC™), Second Industrial Zone, Extension Part No. 21,22,24,25 El Salhya El Gdeda, 44813, El Sharkya Governorate, Egypt.

Classification Of Product
Veterinary medicinal product subject to prescription.

Date of which the package leaflet was last approved
08/01/2022

Market Authorization Holder
Middle East for Vaccines (MEVAC™)
114 Ammar Ibn Yasser St. Masr El-Gedida, 11843, Cairo, Egypt.

Tel +202 26229152
Fax: +202 26217228
E-mail: marketing@me-vac.com

Marketing authorization number
Egypt: 920

Other information
MEVAC™ Eli-Var2 is packed and presented in a cardboard box containing 10 glass vials of 6 ml, 8 ml, or 10 ml. Contents per vial: 500, 1,000, 2,500, or 5,000 doses. Not all pack sizes may be marketed.

description:
Composition:
- Cefalonium dihydrate  250 mg

Indications:
For the treatment of subclinical mastitis at drying-off caused by Staphylococcus aureus, Streptococcus agalactiae, Streptococcus dysgalactiae, Streptococcus uberis, Trueperella pyogenes, E.coli and Klebsiella spp, susceptible to cefalonium.

Target Species: Cattle (dry cows).

Administration route:
- For intramammary use.
- The intramammary syringe must only be used once.
- The contents of one intramammary syringe should be infused into the teat canal of each quarter immediately after the last milking of the lactation.
- Do not bend the nozzle.
- Avoid contamination of the nozzle after removing the cap. Before infusion, the teat should be thoroughly cleaned and disinfected.

Withdrawal time:
• Milk:
- 96 hours after calving if the dry period is longer than 54 days.
- 58 days following the treatment if the dry period is less than or equal to 54 days.
• Meat: 21 days.
name: Terrexine DC

description:
Spectramast® LC Is an Oil-based Sterile Suspension Containing 125 mg of Ceftiofur (As Ceftiofur Hydrochloride) Per 10 Ml Disposable Syringe. Ceftiofur Is a Broad-spectrum Cephalosporin Antibiotic That Exerts Its Effect by Inhibiting Bacterial Cell Wall Synthesis. Like Other Β-lactam Antimicrobial Agents, the Cephalosporins Inhibit Cell Wall Synthesis by Interfering with the Enzymes Essential for Peptidoglycan Synthesis. This Effect Results in Lysis of the Bacterial Cell and Accounts for the Bactericidal Nature of These Agents.

Ues
For use in lactating dairy cows for (1) the treatment of clinical mastitis caused by Escherichia coli, Streptococcus dysgalactiae and coagulase negative staphylococci and (2) the treatment of diagnosed subclinical mastitis associated with coagulase-negative staphylococci and Streptococcus dysgalactiae. Cows with systemic clinical signs caused by mastitis should receive other appropriate therapy under direction of a licensed veterinarian. Note: To limit the development of antimicrobial resistance, treatment of subclinical mastitis with SPECTRAMAST LC should be initiated under veterinary oversight and only after a diagnosis has been supported by a positive culture or other pathogen-specific diagnostic test.

Dosage and administration 
Infuse one (1) syringe (10 mL) into each infected quarter. Repeat this treatment once in 24 hours.

Directions for use
Wash teats thoroughly with warm water containing a suitable dairy antiseptic. Dry the teats thoroughly. Milk out the udder completely. Using an alcohol swab provided, wipe off the end of the affected teat using a separate swab for each teat. Choose the desired insertion length (full or partial) and insert tip into the teat canal; push plunger to dispense the entire contents, massage the quarter to distribute the solution into the milk cistern. Following infusion it is advisable to dip all teats in an approved teat dip.

Contraindications 
As with all drugs, the use of SPECTRAMAST LC sterile suspension is contraindicated in animals previously found to be hypersensitive to the drug.

Cautions 
Cows with systemic clinical signs caused by mastitis should receive other appropriate therapy under the direction of a licensed veterinarian. Do not reuse. If redness, swelling and/or abnormal milk persists, discontinue use and consult a veterinarian. It is recommended that milk cultures be used to aid in decision-making for clinical mastitis therapy.

Warnings
(1) Milk taken from treated cows during treatment and within 96 hours after the latest treatment must not be used as food.
(2) No meat withdrawal period is required when this product is used according to label directions and dosage.
(3) To limit the development of antimicrobial resistance: SPECTRAMAST LC should only be used to treat individual cases of clinical and subclinical mastitis. The choice of this product as the most appropriate treatment should be confirmed by clinical experience supported where possible by pathogen culture and drug susceptibility testing. To assure responsible antimicrobial drug use, subclinical mastitis should be diagnosed using a positive culture or other diagnostic test that identifies the pathogen, in addition to appropriate veterinary medical evaluation prior to treatment. The extra label use of this product is not recommended.
(4) Penicillins and cephalosporins can cause allergic reactions in sensitized individuals. Topical exposure to such antimicrobials, including ceftiofur, may elicit mild to severe allergic reactions in some individuals. Repeated or prolonged exposure may lead to sensitization. Avoid direct contact of the product with the skin, eyes, mouth and clothing. Sensitization of the skin may be avoided by wearing latex gloves.
(5) Persons with a known hypersensitivity to penicillin or cephalosporins should avoid exposure to this product.
(6) In case of accidental eye exposure, flush with water for 15 minutes. In case of accidental skin exposure, wash with soap and water. Remove contaminated clothing. If allergic reaction occurs (e.g., skin rash, hives, difficult breathing), seek medical attention.

Storage Precautions
Store between 15 and 25°C. Store PLASTETS in carton or pail until used. Protect from light.

Presentation
SPECTRAMAST LC is available in cartons of 12 and pails of 144 x 10 mL PLASTET disposable syringes, with one individually wrapped 70% isopropyl alcohol pad per PLASTET.

Presentation
Available in cartons of 12 and pails of 144 x 10 mL PLASTET disposable syringes, with one individually wrapped 70% isopropyl alcohol pad per PLASTET.
name: Spectramast LC

description:
Composition
Each 100 ml contains:
- Clindamycin hydrochloride  2.715 gm (equi to Clindamycin base 2.5 gm)

Properties
- Clindamycin is mainly a bacteriostatic antibiotic belonging to the group of lincosamides.
- Clindamycin is a chlorinated analogue of lincomycin. It works by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis. The reversible coupling to the sub-unit 50-S bacterial ribosome inhibits translation of amino acids linked to the TRNA, thereby preventing elongation of the peptide chain. That is why the mode of action of clindamycin is predominantly bacteriostatic.

Indications
• Cats: For the treatment of infected wounds and superficial pyoderma caused by clindamycin-sensitive species of Staphylococcus spp. and Streptococcus spp.
• Dogs: For the treatment of infected wounds, superficial pyoderma and oral cavity/dental infections caused by or associated with clindamycin-sensitive species of Staphylococcus spp., Streptococcus spp., Bacteroides spp., Fusobacterium necrophorum, and Clostridium perfringens.
- Adjunctive treatment of mechanical or surgical periodontal therapy in the treatment of infections of the gingival and periodontal tissues.
- For the treatment of osteomyelitis caused by Staphylococcus aureus.

Target species
Cats and dogs

Dosage and Administration
• Cats:
Infected wounds, superficial pyoderma: approximately 0.5 ml Clindamed 2.5 % oral solution / kg of body weight / 24h or 0.25 ml Clindamed 2.5 % oral solution /kg / 12h for 7 to 10 days

• Dogs:
Infected wounds, superficial pyoderma and oral cavity/dental infections: approximately 0.5 ml Clindamed 2.5 % oral solution / kg of body weight / 24h or 0.25 ml Clindamed 2.5 % oral solution /kg / 12h for 7 to 10 days.

Treatment of bone infections (osteomyelitis): approximately 0.5 ml Clindamed 2.5 % oral solution / kg of body weight every 12 hours during a period of 28 days minimum

Warnings & Precautions
- The treatment should be stopped if no therapeutic effect is observed after 4 days
- Inappropriate use of the product may increase the prevalence of bacteria resistant to clindamycin. Whenever possible, clindamycin should only be used based on susceptibility testing.
- In case of administration of high doses of clindamycin or during prolonged therapy of one month or greater, tests for liver and renal functions and blood counts should be performed periodically.

Contra Indications
- Do not use in rabbits, hamsters, guinea pigs, chinchillas, horses or ruminants because ingestion of clindamycin by these species may cause severe gastrointestinal disorders.
- Do not use in cases of hypersensitivity to either clindamycin or lincomycin, or to any of the excipients.

Side Effects
- Vomiting and diarrhoea are occasionally observed.
- Clindamycin sometimes causes the overgrowth of non-sensitive organisms such as resistant clostridia and yeasts.

If super infection occurs, the treatment should be stopped and appropriate measures should be taken based on the clinical situation

Withdrawal time
Not applicable

Storage condition
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C and used after opening for 40 days at temperature not exceeding 30°C.

Packaging
10, 15 & 20 ml
name: Clindamed 2.5%

description:

- Excipient q.s.p.  100 ml

INDICATIONS

CONTRAINDICATIONS:
Do not administer to equines.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
» 10,000 to 20,000 IU of vitamin A, 500 to 2000 IU of vitamin D3 and 1 to 50 mg of vitamin E per kg of live weight, intramuscularly, in a single administration, as an indicated and per animal:
- Adult cattle: 8 to 10 ml.
- Adult pigs, calves, sheep, goats: 2 to 4 ml
- Lambs, kids, piglets, adult rabbits: 1 ml Single

» For ease of injection, the solution may be warmed up to the animal's body temperature.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
Animals for slaughter: 60 days.

STORAGE PRECAUTIONS
Store in its original packaging at a temperature not exceeding 25°C.

PACKAGING
Bottles of 20 ml, 50 ml, 100 ml, 250 ml.
name: Cofavit 500

description:
Composition:
Each 100 gm contains:
- Spiramycin (as adipate)  150 MIU

Properties:
- Spiramycin is bacteriostatic antibiotic at usual doses and bactericidal at high doses.
- It acts by inhibiting the biosynthesis of bacterial proteins, by binding to the ribosomal 50 S subunit.

Its broad-spectrum includes:
» Gram positive bacteria: Streptococcus, Staphylococcus, Clostridium, Diplococcus preumonia and Erysipelothrix rhusiopathiae.
» Gram negative bacteria: Neisseria, Haemophylus.
» Mycoplasma spp.
» Protozoa: Toxoplasma spp., Treponema hyodisenteriae.

Indications:
Pigs:
- Enzootic pneumonia caused by Mycoplasma hyopneumonia.
- Atrophic rhinitis caused by Pasteurella multocida, bordetella bronchiseptica.
- Pleuropneumonia caused by actinobacillus pleuropneumoniae.
- Toxoplasmosis caused by Toxoplasma gondii.

Target Species: Pigs

Dosage & administration:
Pigs: 0.66 gm of Suano 150 / 10 kg bodyweight per day for 3-5 days

Warnings & Precautions: None

Contra-Indications:
Do not use in case of known allergy to spiramycin or any other substance of the macrolide group.

Side Effects:
Intestinal dysbacteriosis (change in the quantitative ratios of the normal inhibited microflora) in some cases.

Withdrawal Time:
Pigs (Meat and offal): 21 days.

Storage condition:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C in a dry place and used after opening for 50 days at temperatures not exceeding 30°C in a dry place and used immediately after reconstitution.

E.D.A. Reg. No.: 2152/2019 Vet.

description:
COMPOSITION
Each ml contains:
Active substance(s):
- Metamizole (as sodium salt monohydrate)  463 mg

Excipient(s):
- Benzyl alcohol (E1519)  10.4 mg
- Water for injections

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
Solution for injection.

TARGET SPECIES
Cattle, pigs, horses, dogs and cats.

INDICATIONS
In cattle, pigs, horses, dogs and cats:
- Reduction of visceral pain, especially those associated with spasms.

CONTRAINDICATIONS
• Do not use the drug in the following cases:
- hematopoietic lesions,
- gastrointestinal ulcerations or chronic gastrointestinal disorders,
- renal failure,
- asthma.
• Do not use if you are hypersensitive to the active substance or to any of the excipients.

SPECIES-SPECIFIC WARNINGS
In equines, this specialty can induce a positive reaction during doping controls.

SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS
» For animals: Injection of the solution may produce irritation of the subcutaneous tissue, however without necrosis or suppuration. Intramuscular injections must therefore be carried out under strict aseptic conditions.
» For the person: In case of accidental self-injection, seek immediate advice from a doctor and show the package leaflet or labelling.
» Other precautions: No.

UNDESIRABLE EFFECTS
- Cardiovascular shock if intravenous injection is too rapid.
- Irritation, intestinal haemorrhage, renal failure.
- In dogs, local reactions at the injection site and splenomegaly.
- In cats, hypersalivation, lethargy.

PREGNANCY, LACTATION OR LAYING
Use in pregnant females is not recommended.

DRUG INTERACTIONS
Do not use in combination with barbiturates, glucocorticoids, neuroleptics, diuretics, phenylbutazone, or chlorpromazine.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
- Routes of administration: strict slow intravenous, intramuscular.
» Equines, pigs: 23 to 46 mg of metamizole per kg of body weight, corresponding to 5 to 10 ml of solution per 100 kg of body weight.
» Cattle: 23 mg of metamizole per kg of body weight, corresponding to 5 ml of solution per 100 kg of body weight.
» Dogs, cats: 92.6 mg to 185.2 mg metamizole per kg body weight, corresponding to 1 ml of solution per 2.5 to 5 kg of body weight.
- The effect of the product sets in 5 to 10 minutes after the injection and persists for about 1 hour. If the pain and agitation of the animal recur after the effect of the product has died off, the injection can be repeated.
- In the event of multiple renewals of the injection of the product, long-acting metabolites will accumulate; therefore, the dosage should be reduced accordingly.
- The intravenous route will be preferred for urgent procedures.
- When injecting intramuscularly, it is preferable to divide the total dose at several points.

OVERDOSE
- Risk of leukocyte depression with repeated administrations.
- From 1000 mg/kg, sedation, convulsions, hypersalivation, vomiting, cardiovascular collapse, coma and respiratory arrest.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD
» Cattle:
- Meat and offal: 18 days.
- Milk: If a withdrawal time for milk is not determined, do not use in female fluid milk producers, in lactation or during the dry period, or in future fluid milk producers within 2 months prior to parturition.

» Pigs: Meat and offal: 15 days.

» Horses:
- Meat and offal: 15 days.
- Milk: In the absence of MRLs for milk, do not use in female fluid milk producers, lactating or dry periods, or in future fluid milk producers within 2 months prior to parturition.

PHARMACOTHERAPEUTIC GROUP
Other analgesics, pyrazoles.
ATC-vet code: QN02BB02.

PHARMACODYNAMIC PROPERTIES
- Metamizole (noramidopyrine or dipyrone) is an NSAID of the pyrazole family, with antispasmodic properties. It is a powerful non-morphine analgesic.
- Analgesic, it acts directly at the level of the nerve centers of pain.
- Antipyretic and anti-inflammatory, it accelerates the return to a normal state during painful febrile and inflammatory syndromes.
- Spasmolytic, it acts on smooth muscle fibers as well as on striated muscle fibers in spastic states caused by pain, inflammation or trauma. This action is accompanied by a vaso-dilator effect that simultaneously ensures better irrigation of the affected areas.

PHARMACOKINETIC PROPERTIES
- The maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) appears 1 hour after intramuscular administration.
- Metamizole is detectable in plasma only very soon after intravenous injection. It is rapidly converted by hydrolysis to an active metabolite, 4-MAA (= 4-methylaminoantipyrine).
- This main metabolite as well as its own metabolites are weakly bound to plasma proteins (58% for 4-MAA). 4-MAA and its metabolites diffuse rapidly into tissues and pass into human milk.
- The volume of distribution of 4-MAA in horses is approximately 1.85 L/kg.
- 4-MAA is metabolized in the liver. The main route of metabolism is acetylation by cytochrome P450-dependent enzymes. It is either directly involved in 4-MAA or its demethyl metabolite. Acetylated and demethylated 4-MAA undergoes a 2nd sulfo or glucuroconjugation reaction.
- Elimination is mainly urine. 90% of the administered dose is eliminated by the kidney. In horses, the elimination half-life of 4-MAA after intravenous administration averages 4.85 h.

MAJOR INCOMPATIBILITIES
Not known.

SHELF LIFE
- As packaged for sale: 3 years.
- After first opening: 28 days.

STORAGE PRECAUTIONS
No special storage precautions.

PACKAGING
Coloured glass bottle type II Chlorobutyl cap Aluminium capsule
- Box of 1 vial of 20 ml
- Box of 1 vial of 100 ml
- Not all presentations may be marketed.

DISPOSAL PRECAUTIONS
Empty packaging and any remaining product must be disposed of in accordance with current practices governed by waste regulations.

Marketing authorisation holder
VETOQUINOL, MAGNY VERNOIS, 70200 LURE
name: Calmagine

name: Imiplex

description:
Anthelmintic (Avermectin)

Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Eprinomectin  10 mg

Properties:
- Eprinomectin is a member of the macrocyclic lactone class of endectocides. Compounds of the class bind selectively and with high affinity to glutamate-gated chloride ion channels which occur in invertebrate nerve or muscle cells. This leads to an increase in the permeability of the cell membrane to chloride ions with hyperpolarization of the nerve or muscle cell, resulting in paralysis and death of the parasite. Compounds of this class may also interact with other ligand-gated chloride channels, such as those gated by the neurotransmitter gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA).
- The margin of safety for compounds of this class is attributable to the fact that mammals do not have glutamate-gated chloride channels; the macrocyclic lactones have a low affinity for other mammalian ligand-gated chloride channels, and they do not readily cross the blood-brain barrier.

Indications:
» Gastrointestinal roundworms:
- Adult, immature and Inhibited L4 brown Stomach Worm (Ostertagia spp, including Ostertagia ostertagi, Ostertagia Leptospicularis, Ostertagia lyrata).
- Adult, immature and Inhibited L4 Barbers Pole Worm(Haemonchus contortus).
- Adult and immature Stomach Hair Worm (Trichostrongylus axei).
- Adult and immature Intestinal Hair Worm (Trichostrongylus colubriformis).
- Adult, immature and Inhibited L4 Small Intestinal Worm (Cooperia spp. Including Cooperia oncophora, Cooperia punctata, Cooperia curticei).
- Adult and immature Thin Necked Intestinal-Worm (Nematodirus helvetianus).
- Adult and immature Hookworm(Bunostomun phlebotomum).
- Adult and immature Nodule worm (Oesophagostomum radiatum).
- Adult Whipworm (Trichuris spp).

» Lungworms:
- Adult and immature Dictyocaulus filaria.

Target Species:
Cattle

Dosage & administration:
- Single administration 1 ml of product / 50 kg bodyweight by subcutaneous injection in the anterior of the neck.

Warnings & Precautions:
• Do not use in newborn domestic animals.
• Must not be mixed with other veterinary medicinal products.
• Care should be taken to avoid the following practices because they increase the risk of development of resistance and could ultimately result in ineffective therapy:
- Too frequent and repeated use of anthelmintics from the same class, over an extended period of time.
- Underdosing, which may be due to underestimation of bodyweight, misadministration of the product, or lack of calibration of the dosing device (if any).
- Very toxic to aquatic and invertebrate organisms, may cause long-term effects to the environment. Harmful to the soil environment. Harmful to terrestrial vertebrates. Avoid contamination of any water supply with product or empty container. Avoid release into environment. Collect spillage.

Contra-Indications:
- Do not use in other animal species.
- Do not use in case of hypersensitivity to active substance or to any of the excipients.
- Not to be used in animals weighing less than 88 kg.

Side Effects:
- Following treatment, moderate to severe swelling at the site of injection is very common. Typically, the swelling resolves within 7 days, but induration (hardness) may persist for in excess of 21 days. Swelling may be associated with mild to moderate pain.
- This reaction disappears without any treatment and does not impair the safety or efficacy of the veterinary medicinal product.

Withdrawal Time:
• Meat and offal: 14 days
• Where intra muscular injection has occurred, animals producing meat or offal for human and/or animal consumption must not be sold for slaughter during or within 91 days of treatment.
• Milk: Nil

Storage condition:
Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C, and used immediately after opening.

Packaging:
Carton box containing amber glass vial (type II) containing 25, 50, 100, 150, 200, 250 and 500 ml solution with chlorobutyl rubber stopper and (HDPE) flip-off and aluminium cap with an outer label + insert leaflet.

MANUFACTURED BY
Delta Grand Pharma For Pharmaceutical Industries - DGP For Panax Pharma
name: Paneprino

description:
Anthelmintic (Avermectin)

Composition:
Each 1 ml contains:
- Eprinomectin  5 mg

Indication:
Eprinex Pour-On was the first topical application product with zero milk withdrawal that effectively treats gastrointestinal Roundworms, Lungworms, Eye Worms, Warbles, Mange mites and Sucking Lice.

Administration:
- Administer only by the topical application at the dose rate of 1 ml of Eprinex Pour-On for Beef and Dairy Cattle per 10 kg of body weight, corresponding to the recommended dose rate of 0.5 mg eprinomectin per kg body weight.
- The product should be applied along the backline in a narrow strip extending from the withers to the tailhead.

Withdrawal period:
- Meat and offal: 15 days.
- There is no milk withdrawal.

name: Servac flu H5N1

description:
Composition:
Each 1 gm contains:
- Amprolium HCl  200 mg

Properties:
- Amprolium is an anticoccidial agent that acts as competitive inhibitor of thiamine in the parasite metabolism, and interferes with the metabolism of glucides necessaries for coccidian multiplication and survival.
- It was shown that the uptake of thiamine by schizonts of Eimeria tenella and by host intestinal cells can occur through passive diffusion or by an active, energy- and ph-dependent process. Amprolium competitively inhibited both systems; however, the parasite was shown to be more sensitive to amprolium than the host.
- As shown with Eimeria maxima inoculated chicken, the administration of Amprolium resulted in a proportion of morphologically abnormal macrogametes and oocysts which maybe considered the reason for a reduced sporulation rate.

Indications:
Treatment of intestinal coccidiosis in chickens (broilers, pullets, layers, breeder hens) caused by Eimeria (E. acervulina, E. maxima, E. mitis, and E. tenella) and turkeys caused by (E. meleagrimitis, E. adenoeides, and E. gallopavonis) susceptible to amprolium.

Target species:
Chickens (broilers, pullets, layers, breeder hens) and turkeys.

Dosage & Administration:
- Route of administration: Orally in drinking water.
- 1 gm of the product / 10 kg body weight Eq to 20 mg amprolium / kg b.w.(1 gm /1 liter drinking water) daily for 5 - 7 consecutive days.

Contraindications:
None known.

Warnings:
- As with any antiparasiticide, frequent and repeated use of antiprotozoals from the same class may lead to the development of resistance.
- In case of detection a lack of efficacy during treatment.communicate it to the national competent authorities.

Precautions:
- The product is not intended for a preventive use.
- This product should be reserved in case of coccidiosis outbreaks due to non-availability of vaccine, in case of lack of efficacy of vaccine and in vaccinated flocks if a severe coccidial challenge is diagnosed before immunity has fully developed.

Adverse reactions: None known.

Interactions:
The efficacy of amprolium may be reduced during a simultaneous administration of products containing vitamin B-complex.

Withdrawal time:
» Chickens (broilers, pullets, layers, breeder hens):
- Meat & offal: Zero days..
- Eggs: Zero days.Turkeys: Meat & offal: Zero days.

Storage condition:
Store before opening for 3 years in a temperature not exceeding 30°C, in dry place and after opening for 6 months in a temperature not exceeding 30°C, in dry place and after reconstitution for 24 hours in a temperature not exceeding 30°C, away from direct sunlight & keep out of reach of children.

M. O. H. Reg. No.: 1722/2001 (Vet.)

Manufactured by:
ADWIA Co. S.A.E. 10th of Ramadan City.

Made In Egypt
name: Amprolium 20%

description:
Composition:
Each 108 gm contains:
- Tylosin Tartrate 108 gm (Eq. to Tylosin Base 100 gm).

Indications:
- Chickens: treatment of chronic respiratory disease (CRD) caused by Mycoplasma gallisepticum sensitive to tylosin in broiler and replacement chickens.
- Turkeys: treatment of Infectious Sinusitis caused by Mycoplasma gallisepticum sensitive to tylosin.
- Swine: treatment of Swine Dysentery caused by Serpulina hyodsenteriae or other pathogens sensitive to tylosin.

Target species:
Chickens, Turkeys & Swine.

Dosage & administration:
Mixing Directions:
- Chickens & Turkeys: to make a solution of 2 grams / 4 liters (500 mg liter), mix 100 gm of tylosin tartrate with 200 liters.
- Swine: to make a solution of 1 gram /4 liters (250 mg /liter), mix 100 gm of tylosin tartrate with 400 liters.

Duration of treatment:
- Chickens & Turkeys: Treat by way of the drinking water for 3 days at 2 mg / 4 litres (500 mg/liter) or 1 to 5 days depending on the severity of infection.
- Pigs: treat by way of the drinking water for 3 to 10 days at 1 gm/4 liters (250 mg/liter).

• In all species, if improvement is not observed within 5 days, the diagnosis should be reconfirmed.

Withdrawal time:
Meat
- Chickens: 2 days.
- Turkeys: 5 days.
- Pigs: 2 days.

Storage condition:
- Store at temperature not exceeding 30°C away from direct light & keep out of reach of children.
- It is used immediately after reconstitution.

Shelf-life: 3 years.

M. O. H. Reg. No.: 1528/2010
name: Tylosin Tartrate

description:
Composition:
Each single dose of the vaccine contains the rabies inactivated virus prepared on tissue culture cells.

Indications:
To protect dogs, cats and farm animals from infection of Rabies.

Uses and instructions:.
(1) In the case of prevention, do not vaccinate wild or frozen animals.
(2) The vaccine is safe in pregnant animals.
(3) The vaccine is kept away from sunlight and high temperatures.

Immunization programme:
» DOGS AND CATS: a 1 ml single dose is injected under the skin at the age of three months, and the vaccination is repeated annually.

» FARM ANIMALS
(a) In the case of prevention:
- Cattle & Equines: 3 ml
- Sheep & Goats 1.5 ml
- Camels 3 ml
• It is injected under the skin at the age of three months, and the vaccination is repeated annually.

(b) In the case of biting:
The previous doses are given as follows: a weekly dose for five consecutive weeks starting from the day of conception.

Side effects: none.

Package: 2 ml bottle.

Preservation:
The vaccine should be stored in the refrigerator at a temperature of 4-8 degrees Celsius, taking care not to freezing and keeping the vaccine away from sunlight and high temperatures.
name: Servac Rabies

description:
COMPOSITION
Active substance:
- Halofuginone (as lactate salt) 0.50 mg per ml

Excipients:
- Benzoic acid (E 210) 1.00 mg
- Lactic acid (E 270)
- Tartrazine (E 102) 0.03 mg
- Water, Purified

PHARMACEUTICAL FORM
Oral solution. Clear yellow solution.

Target species
Cattle (newborn calves).

INDICATIONS
In newborn calves:
- Prevention of diarrhoea due to diagnosed Cryptosporidium parvum, in farms with history of cryptosporidiosis: Administration should start in the first 24 to 48 hours of age.
- Reduction of diarrhoea due to diagnosed Cryptosporidium parvum: Administration should start within 24 hours after the onset of diarrhoea.
• In both cases, the reduction of oocysts excretion has been demonstrated.

CONTRAINDICATIONS
- Do not use on an empty stomach.
- Do not use in cases of diarrhoea established for more than 24 hours and in weak animals.
- Do not use in cases of hypersensitivity to the active substance or to any of the excipients.

PRECAUTIONS FOR ANIMALS
Administer after colostrum feeding, or after milk or milk replacer feeding only, using an appropriate device for oral administration. Do not use on an empty stomach. For treatment of anorexic calves, the product should be administered in half a litre of an electrolyte solution. The animals should receive enough colostrum according to good breeding practice.

PRECAUTIONS FOR THE PERSON
- People with known hypersensitivity to the active substance or any of the excipients should administer the veterinary medicinal product with caution.
- Repetitive contact with the product may lead to skin allergies.
- Avoid skin, eye or mucosal contact with the product.
- Wear protective gloves while handling the product.
- In case of skin and eye contact wash the exposed area thoroughly with clean water. If eye irritation persists, seek medical advice.
- Wash hands after use.

ADVERSE REACTIONS
• An increase in the level of diarrhoea has been observed in rare cases, in treated animals.
• The frequency of adverse reactions is defined using the following convention:
- Very common (more than 1 in 10 animals treated displaying adverse reactions)
- Common (more than 1 but less than 10 animals in 100 animals treated)
- Uncommon (more than 1 but less than 10 animals in 1,000 animals treated)
- Rare (more than 1 but less than 10 animals in 10,000 animals treated)
- Very rare (less than 1 animal in 10,000 animals treated, including isolated reports).

PREGNANCY, LACTATION OR LAY
Not applicable.

INTERACTIONS
None known.

DOSAGE AND ADMINISTRATION
- For oral use in calves after feeding.
- The dosage is: 100 μg of halofuginone / kg bw, once a day for 7 consecutive days; i.e. 2 ml of Kriptazen / 10 kg bw, once a day for 7 consecutive days.
- The consecutive treatment should be administered at the same time each day. Once the first calf has been treated, all the forthcoming new-born calves must be systematically treated as long as the risk for diarrhoea due to C. parvum persists.
- Bottle without a pump: To ensure a correct dosage, the use of either a syringe or any appropriate device for oral administration is necessary.
- Bottle with a pump: To ensure a correct dosage, the most appropriate metering pump should be selected, depending on the weight of the animals to be treated. In cases where the dosing pump is unsuitable for the weight of animals to be treated, either a syringe or any other appropriate device can be used.

4 ML PUMP
1- Choose the dip tube designed for the height of the bottle (the shorter one for the 490 ml bottle and the longer one for the 980 ml bottle) and insert it into the free hole located in the base of the pump cap.
2- Remove the cap of the bottle and protective seal from the bottle and screw the pump on.
3- Remove the protector cap from the tip of the nozzle of the pump.
4- Prime the pump by pressing the trigger gently, until a drop appears at the tip of the nozzle.
5- Restrain the calf and insert the nozzle of the metering pump into its mouth.
6- Pull the trigger of the metering pump completely for release of a dose that equals 4 ml of solution. Pull two or three times, respectively, for administration of the desired volume (8 ml for calves weighing more than 35 kg but less than or equal to 45 kg and 12 ml for calves weighing more than 45 kg but less than or equal to 60 kg). For lighter or heavier animals, a precise calculation should be performed (2 ml/10 kg bw).
7- Continue using until the bottle is empty. If product remains in the bottle, leave the pump attached until further use.
8- Always replace the cap on the tip of the nozzle after use.
9- Always replace the bottle in the box.

4 TO 12 ML PUMP
1- Choose the dip tube designed for the height of the bottle (the shorter one for the 490 ml bottle and the longer one for the 980 ml bottle) and insert it into the free hole located in the base of the pump cap.
2- Remove the cap of the bottle and protective seal from the bottle and screw the pump on.
3- Remove the protector cap from the tip of the nozzle of the pump.
4- To prime the pump, turn the dosage ring and select 60 kg (12 ml).
5- Press the trigger gradually with the cannula pointed up, until a drop appears at the tip of the nozzle.
6- Turn the ring, in order to select the weight of the calf to be treated.
7- Restrain the calf and insert the nozzle of the metering pump into its mouth.
8- Pull the trigger of the metering pump completely for release of the adequate dose.
9- Continue using until the bottle is empty. If product remains in the bottle, leave the pump attached until further use.
10- Always replace the cap on the tip of the nozzle after use.
11- Always replace the bottle in the box.

PHARMACODYNAMIC PROPERTIES
The active substance, halofuginone, is an antiprotozoal agent of the quinazolinone derivatives group (nitrogenous polyheterocycles). Halofuginone lactate is a salt whose antiprotozoal properties and efficacy against Cryptosporidium parvum have been demonstrated both in in vitro conditions and in artificial and natural infections. The compound has a cryptosporidiostatic effect on Cryptosporidium parvum. It is mainly active on the free stages of the parasite (sporozoïte, merozoïte). The concentrations to inhibit 50% and 90% of the parasites, in an in vitro test system, are IC50 < 0.1 μg/mland IC90 of 4.5 μg/ml, respectively.

PHARMACOKINETIC PARTICULARS
The bioavailability of the drug in the calf following single oral administration is about 80%. The time necessary to obtain the maximum concentration Tmax is 11 hours. The maximum concentration in plasma Cmax is 4 ng/ml. The apparent volume of distribution is 10 l/kg. The plasmatic concentrations of halofuginone after repeated oral administrations are comparable to the pharmacokinetic pattern after single oral treatment. Unchanged halofuginone is the major component in the tissues. Highest values have been found in the liver and the kidney. The product is mainly excreted in the urine. The terminal elimination half-life is 11.7 hours after IV administration and 30.84 hours after single oral administration.

OVERDOSE
As symptoms of toxicity may occur at twice the therapeutic dose, it is necessary to apply the recommended dosage strictly. Symptoms of toxicity include diarrhoea, visible blood in faeces, decline in milk consumption, dehydration, apathy and prostration. Should clinical signs of overdosing occur, the treatment must be stopped immediately and the animal fed unmedicated milk or milk replacer. Rehydration may be necessary.

WITHDRAWAL PERIOD(S)
- Meat and offal: 13 days.

INCOMPATIBILITIES
In the absence of compatibility studies, this veterinary medicinal product must not be mixed with other veterinary medicinal products.

SHELF LIFE
- As packaged for sale: 3 years.
- After first opening: 6 months.

STORAGE PRECAUTIONS
- Keep the bottle in the outer carton in order to protect from light.
- Store upright in the original packaging.

PACKAGING
- Cardboard box containing one 500 ml bottle (high-density polyethylene) containing 490 ml of solution or one 1000 ml bottle containing 980 ml of solution, sealed with a high density polyethylene cap, with or without a metering pump, with two different lengths dip tubes (22 and 24 cm) made of ethylene-vinyl acetate.

» Boxes with a metering pump:
• 4 ml pump: Each package also contains a plastic metering pump delivering 4 ml volumes and two dip tubes (one to fit a 500 ml bottle and one to fit a 1000 ml bottle).
• 4 to 12 ml pump: Each package also contains a plastic metering pump delivering 4 to 12 ml and two dip tubes (one to fit a 500 ml bottle and one to fit a 1000 ml bottle).
- Not all pack sizes may be marketed.

DISPOSAL PRECAUTIONS
- Any unused veterinary medicinal product or waste materials derived from such veterinary medicinal product should be disposed of in accordance with local requirements.
- The product should not enter watercourses as this may be dangerous for fish and other aquatic organisms.
name: Kriptazen

description:
Description
- Epakitin is a chitosan-based phosphate binder to help support normal function and health of the kidneys in dogs and cats.
- Managing phosphate has been shown to increase life expectancy of renal patients.
- Epakitin can be used with the patient’s normal diet or used in conjunction with renal diets for additional phosphate management.

Ingredients
Active Ingredients: Calcium carbonate 250 mg, chitosan 200 mg
Inactive Ingredients: Hydrolyzed soy protein, lactose

Directions for Use
- 1 g / 5 kg of body weight given orally in the morning and the evening.
- 60 g and 180 g jars: 1 level scoop (provided) contains 1 g of Epakitin.
- 300 g jar: 1 level scoop (provided) contains 2.5 g of Epakitin.

Cautions
- If animal’s condition worsens or does not improve, stop product administration and consult your veterinarian. Safe use in pregnant animals or animals intended for breeding has not been proven. Federal law prohibits the off-label use of this product in ruminants.
- Not for human consumption. Keep out of the reach of children and animals. In case of accidental overdose, contact a health professional immediately. Administer during or after the animal has eaten to reduce incidence of gastrointestinal upset.

How Packaged
Available in an oral powder in three jar sizes: 60 gm, 180 gm, 300 gm
name: Epakitin

description:
Ingredients
Active Ingredients:
- S. thermophilus (KB19)  5 x 109 CFU
- L. acidophilus (KB27)  5 x 109 CFU
- B. longum (KB31)  5 x 109 CFU

Inactive Ingredients:
Gellan Gum, Hypromellose, Magnesium Stearate, Psyllium Husk, Titanium Dioxide

Description
- Azodyl is the #1 veterinarian-recommended supplement for renal support in both cats and dogs.
- Azodyl can help support quality of life. It is a proprietary formulation of beneficial bacteria to help manage uremic toxins. With Azodyl, improvement in BUN and creatinine can be seen as early as four weeks!1,2
- Azodyl contains three, specifically selected strains of beneficial bacteria that thrive in a uremic environment: Streptococcus thermophilus KB19, Lactobacillus acidophilus KB27, and Bifidobacterium longum KB31.
- The acid-resistant capsule is designed to protect the bacteria until they reach the colon (large intestine).

Indications
For use in dogs and cats only. Azodyl is a supplement used to support normal kidney detoxification in cats and dogs. Azodyl can be used once azotemia is detected and can be given for the lifetime of the animal. Administration can be for the life of the animal.

Directions for Use
- Capsules should be administered whole and not opened or crushed. Administer on an empty stomach. Allow free access to fresh drinking water during administration.
- For animals weighing less than 5 lbs.: Give 1 capsule daily.
- For animals weighing 5-10 lbs.: Give 2 capsules daily (1 capsule a.m., 1 capsule p.m.)
- For animals weighing more than 10 lbs.: Give 3 capsules daily (2 capsules a.m., 1 capsule p.m.)

How Packaged
Azodyl is available in a small capsule form (90-count bottle) and is compatible with other renal therapies. Store in a refrigerator.

Cautions
If animal’s condition worsens or does not improve, stop product administration and consult your veterinarian. Safe use in pregnant animals or animals intended for breeding has not been proven.

WARNING:
FOR ANIMAL USE ONLY. KEEP OUT OF REACH OF CHILDREN AND ANIMALS. IN CASE OF ACCIDENTAL OVERDOSE, CONTACT A HEALTH PROFESSIONAL IMMEDIATELY.
name: Azodyl

Marboflaxacin is a synthetic, bactericidal antimicrobial, belonging to the fluoroquinolone group Which acts by inhibition of DNA gyrase. It has a broad-spectrum activity against Mycoplasma, Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria.

Indications:
Treatment of respiratory infections caused by sensitive strains of Pasteurella multocida, Mannheimia haemolytica and Histophilus somni.

Arab Company for Medical Products (Arabcomed) For First Pharma

description:
» HYALUTIDIN DC is a chondroprotector for dogs and cats composed by a high-quality hyaluronic acid and chondroitin sulfate combination (HC-Complex) that helps animals to improve mobility.
» HYALUTIDIN DC lubricates the articular cartilage increasing the viscosity of the synovial fluid and helps to reduce inflammatory condition.

Benefits:
- Liquid form and sweet.
- Good palatability and well-tolerated.
- Suitable for pets with gut sensitivities.
- Visible short-term results.
- Improves mobility at all stages of life and the osteoarthritic scale.
- No side effects.

HYALUTIDIN® DC helps in situations of: 
- Problems of mobility (osteoarthritis).
- Excessive body weight.
- Medium age or older.
- Large or giant breed.
- Process of growing.
- Orthopaedic surgery.

Why HYALUTIDIN® DC is unique?
- Liquid and palatable: Very easy to administer specially for cats.
- HC-Complex (Hyaluronic acid and Chondroitin sulfate): Unique composition.
- Hypoallergenic.
- Show visible improvements in 2-3 weeks.

Dosage and administration:
DOGS
- Small dogs  < 10 Kg (2 ml/day)
- Medium dogs  10 - 30 Kg (4 ml/day)
- Large dogs  30 - 50 Kg (6 ml/day)
- XXL dogs  > 50 Kg (8 ml/day)

CATS
- Small cats  < 5 Kg (1 ml/day)
- Medium cats  5 - 10 Kg (2 ml/day)
- Large cats  > 10 Kg (3 ml/day)

» Recommended period of application: for a minimum of 30 consecutive days. After 30 days, the dosage can be halved.

description:
Anthelmintic (Salicylanilide)

Composition:
- Closantel  50 gm / ml

Properties:
- Closantel is anti-parasitic salicylanilides that disrupting energy metabolism of the parasite.
- High safety margin up to 4x recommended doses.
- Almost there's no resistance was reported.

Dosage:

» Cattle & Sheep (over 200 kg): 0.5 - 1 ml / 10 kg bw.
» Cattle & Sheep (below 200 kg): 1 ml / 10 kg bw.
